reviews.review: Stunning Church in a Stunning location . We visited this church on our last day in Budapest. We had been living in the castle area for the visit and had seen the church from the outside on a number of occasions. Stunning building and equally as impressive inside with a very unique window and a great tour. It costs to go in but its definitely worth it.

Even if you're tired of visiting churches, add one more. Viewable from miles around because of the steeple, this is a must see in Budapest. Even if you only view the outside, you are ahead in the attractions department.

One of the most beautiful Churches in the world-MUST SEE. This church is located at the Buda city of Budapest, very near to the Fisherman's Bastion. It's a Gothic architecture and a Roman catholic church. It's stunning from the outside with decorated ceramic tiles on the roof tops and decorated sculptures on its buildings. On the inside you will admire the hand painted walls and ceilings. It has very beautiful stained glass windows. One has to see to admire this majestic building. This is a MUST SEE attraction and definitely worth a visit while at the BUDA side.
Amazing piece. This church is worth the visit. Very peculiar roof and great view on the city. Restaurants around are really touristic though I suggest that you don't eat on site.
Got to be seen! . The 200 steps are worth it for the views when you get to the top (even if your scaredy-cat friend is sobbing all the way!) Absolutely beautiful and worth every penny.
Beautiful. This has got to have one of the best interiors of any church anywhere. Beautiful colours and patterns, stunning.
Beautiful Church.. Very busy but worth going in to see.Many multi cultural group tours keep the place noisy. Don't forget that it's also a worship sight!
Beautiful church. This is a beautiful Gothic church with some unique features that is set in a tranquil square. There are many nice cafes around for travelers to have a coffee and relax.

Completely different interior. Worth visiting this church to view the hand painted walls and ceiling. Different from most of the other churches with its heavy oriental influence in the painting style. Beautiful stained glass windows fabulous ceramic tiled roof makes it a stand-out.

Beautiful Inside and Out. On our previous visit to Budapest, our tour stopped only for us to see the outside; this time we could go in. The roof tile patterns outside are stunning. Inside, in the Hungarian tradition of "more is more," practically every inch was decorated. One of my favorite places in Budapest.
Spectacular church . Beautiful architecture and we paid to enter, the frescos painted on the wall were beautiful. Worth a visit!
Beautiful church. It's the most beautiful church we've seen in Budapest with its unique decoration. The entry price is a bit too high though, but you should go there anyway.

Take the tower tour. Worth the money to climb up to the top of the bell tower. Great views of the city below. The guide was funny and informative and spoke numerous languages. Be prepared for a lot of stairs.
The inside of the church is also stunning.

Most Beautyfull Church that i have seen.. Its a amazing beatyfull church that i ever have seen , You should go there to see it , its little beat up from center of city But there is amazing view to city that u will not find in other places. If you will use free tour they will take you there and explain everything , or u can take funiclor and then walk little beat , or from center Elizabeth Fountain take a bus #16 that difinetly will take you over there.
Nice place. Best when viewed in the evening. though it takes longer to walk and get there... but worth going there to see this beauty

Incredible Matthias Church. This is an amazing and beautiful church. The walls are painted but look like they are covered in tapestries. Eleventh century Roman Catholic church built in a gothic style.

A fine church. We were impressed with the decoration and architecture of this church, which has been restored after torment of war. We did not go up the tower (head for heights again), but certainly worth a visit. Some fine vestments on display.

Stunning interior. The church looks great on the exterior, but what is even more stunning are the interiors. The entrance is 1500 HUF for adults, but the price is totally worth it for the level of art that you're going to get.

WOW! Beautiful inside and out!. The church is breathtaking from the colorful tiles on the roof and the detail on the outside towers to the colorful inside of this amazing church. I would certainly suggest that you do not miss going inside to enjoy what the interior offers. I don't think you would be disappointed. It ranks amongst my favorite churches I've toured.
Lovely walk and spectacular vantage point nearby!. Take a stroll up on castle hill and make sure you walk down and see this Church. Great place to take pictures and capture panoramic views of Pest.

Beautiful Church and Museum and Spectacular views from the Tower. The church was beautiful. It had tons of decor and was very colorful. It also featured somewhat of a museum with relics. The real treat was going in the tower and seeing breathtaking views of the city. This made all of the great views we saw the rest of the day seem average so I would save the best for last.
Wonderful church. The church is suggestive and emotional and the view from the tower is simply amazing! I truly suggest to visit it inside.

Must go inside . If you think the colored shingles on the exterior is enough to make you happy, you're wrong. Go inside and you'll see every surface handpainted in colorful geometric shapes. And to think that it was only done by 2 artists!! Also remember to go upstairs to the gallery through the king's stairs - it's included in the entrance ticket.

Beautful Gothic cathedral. On he Buda side of the river and way up on Castle Hill, this church was built between the 1200s and 1500s. It is awesome, and the bonus is that you just have to walk a few steps from the front door for a breathtaking panoramic view of the city and the Danube.

Magnificent Church. This is an enormous church and as you enter it has a huge foyer. The interior is highly decorated by colourful paintings and beautiful frescoes. This church was constructed in the 14th century but was reconstructed thoroughly in the 19th century. There are smaller areas that were constructed a lot earlier.This church requires some time to take in all the artwork.

Worth the visit and the photos. It looks smaller than it is on the inside. The colors on the roof and the gothic tower are something beautiful. The entrance fee is high (around 13 Euros), but its the one you should visit among the 3 attractions on the zone (tower and fishermen's bastion, the latter is free on the evenings)
Magnificent. Very beautiful and fascinating! It is in the Buda Castle District, surrounded by the Fisherman's Bastion and the Good Town. Amazing architecture and even more beautiful inside.

Iconic church on Castle Hill. Originally built in Romanesque style in 1015. The present building constructed in the floridlate GOthicstyle in the second half of the 14th century and extensively restored in the late 19th century under the orders of King Matthias, under whose name the church was thus named. It now housesthe Ecclesiastical Ar Museum, which begins in the medieval crypt and leads to the St.Stephen Chapel. . This gallery contains a number of sacred relics and medieval stone carvings, along with replicas of the Hungarian royal Crown and coronation jewels.
Beautiful Building. This is one of the most beautiful building in the city, though surrounded by many amazing building. Located in Buda Castle.
Great organ concert. We were hosted and the organizer was able to have a private concert for us. Add to this the fact that the church is splendid and you can immage the results.,

An Icon to see. The Matyas Church is an icon to be seen. Reaching it is easy after you have ascended to the Castle. You just have to take a short walk northwards and you will be there. You can actually see the top of the church from the castle itself, so you don't have to work very hard to find it.The building itself is fascinating!You can walk around it for hours and find new details all over all the time.If you like breathtakingly beautiful architecture, this is a place to visit
Great place. Great place to visit full of history and the area itself has a perfect view on the danube and the parliament

Grand Church. This is one great church and being built in only 1896, it is not that old. It is a grand church that is just full of recent history, including the 11 flags inside hanging from the pillars which have not been moved since the church was first opened in 1896!!!

Beautiful. We visited as part of a tour and the entrance tickets were included in the tour price but I would have paid to go in. It is extremely beautiful inside but was very busy and quite noisy the day we visited. Look for the coat of arms on the outside and the raven with a ring its beak.

Beautiful Church. Offering some stunning views of the Budapest area this church is well worth a visit. Can be accessed easily by foot on or by one of the many tours that access the site. We saw the site as part of the Conquer Budapest walking tour and loved it.
Nice church on the Buda side. Matthias church is the ending point of the walking tour. The church is in the heart of the Buda Castle District. The building is constructed in beautiful Gothic style

Budapest - Hungary - Matthias Church - Beautiful Structure. This wonderful and architecturally superb church stands overlooking Fisherman's Bastion and the River Danube below in the heart of Buda's Castle District. With origins from the eleventh century the mainly fifteenth century structure was massively refurbished in more recent years, 1950-1970's with some much needed work following damage during world war two. This Roman Catholic institution has fast become one of Budapest's most treasured sights and stands firmly on the must see list when visiting the city. I found it to be exquisite and alluring. It wasn't open for some reason the afternoon we visited but the beauty from the outside can clearly be seen. I love the roof. It is also clearly part of the Castle district skyline from the River Danube and cannot be missed when taking one of the many river cruises. A great part of this wonderful city.

Beautiful Church. While I enjoyed visiting St Stephen's Basilica, the Matthias Church is more impressive, though quite expensive. Combine it with the view from the Fisherman's Bastion and you'll have a great time.

Beautiful inside and outside. Matthias Church is beautiful inside and outside. It was crowded while we were there. The ticket line was long. It was worth the wait in line to see the beautiful aspects of the church. The church is very ornate.

No entrance:(. Sadly the church was closed for a wedding ceremony:( we couldn't get in even after the wedding because one of the guards there said there is two more weddings . The church is very beautiful from the outside though. What can I say? Bad luck :(

Take the time to visit all of the Castle area. We stayed in the Castle area and walked past the church, Fisherman's Bastion and the statue of St Stephen every day. What a beautiful place! We visited in October and noticed that there were LOTS of groups taken there as part of their tours, so we visited the church early. The inside is honestly breathtaking, very ornately decorated. There is a balcony are that you can visit too with only a few steps to manage. TIPS for visiting the Fisherman's Bastion - you will be charged if you visit in the daytime, but in the evenings the barrier (well, someone on a chair!) is removed and you can walk around the upstairs part free of charge. You lose any daytime shots looking over the river (towards Parliament) but the night time shots are just as stunning as all the monuments and bridges are lit up. While in the area it is easy to walk round and find the other nearby attractions (Hospital in the Rock/History Museum etc) Would choose to stay there again if we are lucky enough to visit again.
Stunning architecture!. Not generally interested in churches, but after climbing the stairs to fisherman's bastion I was amazed by this building. The roof alone was a masterpiece! Well worth a visit.

Open Mondays!. Well the point of the title is that all the state museums close on Monday. This stays open.It was good but 2 observations:1) the guidebook is poor value and the simple handout available inside for free is more use.2) morons with flash and holding iPhones start to detract from the enjoyment.Amazing the way people look at this as a historic church rather than a late 19th century creation rebuilt after ww2 and 1956.
Crowds Crowds Crowds. Beautiful church with an interesting history. But the crowds of tour groups is somewhat off putting. Go early in the morning or late in the afternoon.

Nice church near Fisherman's Bastion. After visiting the Bada Castle, we walked up to Matthias Church by the side Fisherman's Bastion. Renovations on the external part of the church had been completed with the removal of scaffoldings from outside and photo-takers would be more than happy to take more photos from outside. As we have to hurry to other tourist spots, we could not spare time to enter the church and hope that we could do so next time.

Unlike any church I've visited (and I've visited a lot). This was a complete, stunning surprise. I've seen many churches around the world and after awhile, you've kind of seen it all. Matthias Church however was a welcome change. The exterior is absolutely beautiful and I expected a soaring but austere interior. I was wrong. The entire interior was lavishly painted with both geometric designs and murals. It's one of those places you can wander around in for hours. I would suggest getting a booklet or guided tour. I felt like I missed out on a lot by going it alone.

Must see. With the renovations complete and all the scaffolding gone the church is an absolute treat to visit. The painting and frescoes have been cleaning and look wonderful Just remember this is still a functioning church so be sure to be respectful

Beautiful church. This church is beautiful inside and the architecture outside is amazing as well. There are fantastic photo opportunities all area the area, which is right next to Fisherman's Bastion. The ticket office doesn't seem to have its act together. There were four separate lines on the 90 degree day we were there, with lots of people waiting in lines. When it my turn to step up to the ticket window, she closed it in my face with no explanation. I and everyone in line behind me just stood there unsure what to do, eventually another ticket agent saw what happened and took care of us. But the ticket office is a shambles. But it is worth going through that to see this church...beautiful icons and colors, and the history inside is amazing.
Fantastic. It's a beautiful church and very well conservated and the area is fantastic, you must do this visit in Budapest
Beautiful. Definitely worth a visit. Getting there from the Pest side is easy.Visitors are allowed to take photos.

Beautiful Cathederial. Located next to Fisherman's Bastian. Gorgeous view looking over the ciy. It has an interesting history ... destroyed to its 13th century splendor.It was part of our Viking Tour, so not sure of the cost. It is a nice walk to the area from the bottom of the hill where we dropped off by our tour bus. Walking down we had free time and enjoyed shopping in a few shops, including a small little market.Definetly, worth a visit just for the view let alone the history. (The roof is also interesting.)
amazing attraction. Another attraction on Castle Heights which visually dominates and overlooks the beautiful Danube. Quite stunning exterior and interior

100% recommend tower stair climb. This is a beautiful place to visit and the stair climb is well worth it. They do get very narrow towards the end of the climb. Panoramic views and sunset from up here is so romantic.

A church that stands out. High on Castle Hill stands Matthias Church. It is very impressive with great decorations and stained glass windows. On the outside, it has a colourful tile roof (similar to Vienna's Cathedral). The view from the forecourt is fantastic looking over the Danube River and the Parliament House. It is a must-see in Budapest - even when it is raining as it was when we visited.

One of the most beautiful churches I've been to. The Church at the Fisherman's Bastion is beautiful and vibrant with beautiful detailing. With the regular entry ticket you can go to the second floor which is a bit museum like. For the tower you need the special ticket and you can only book a tour.
Amazing!. See this! Fabulous, amazing, a must see. Gorgeous patterns, pre WWII stained glass windows. Interesting history. Beautiful light.
Bell tower. If you are in shape to climb the bell tower, it is very worth your time. It has one of the best views of the city.
Just walking around it...... ... right at sunset, it is a gorgeous addition to your evening at the Fishermen's Bastion. We did not tour the inside.

Must visit. Really beautiful place. The building of the church is outstanding. We haven't seen the inside which was closed due to wedding, but the whole area was amazing. There's a nice view at the pets side, nice (but expensive) cafe houses

Go to see the interior. The exterior is clean and interesting to view, but the real charm is in the interior. After seeing more cathedrals and abbeys than I care to count, this one is entirely different. It owes this to the period when the Ottoman Empire took control and converted it into a mosque. When Christians returned, a great deal of the Moorish influence in the wall painting remained.Take a little extra time and take in the free museum. Worth the views from the second floor of the museum looking back into the cathedral.
Great history regarding this church. We ran out of time to go into this church. You have to pay to see it. The history of this church is amazing. If you like churches, a must see.
Great at night. this looks beautiful when seen at night all lit up. This along with a lot of other buildings adds to the nightscape.
Beautiful church!. Matthias church is stunning, located right on the Fishermans Bastion, it's unmissable! Both attractions well worth a visit!
Beautiful church!. This church has an amazing look on the outside and a very impressive art work in the inside. Take your time and walk through the rooms.
Very beautiful church. A wonderful church to visit and there are great views from Fisherman's Bastion. There are concerts in the church that would be well worth going to

Beautiful church, fabulous location and a steeple climb well worth taking.. We were in Europe for 14 days and I am not sure how many churches we visited. They were all fabulous in their own way but St. Mathias was a standout. The church itself is beautiful and almost impossible to describe. Our most memorable aspect was the steeple climb, all 200+ steps. The view from the steeple was amazing and there were information placards around the turret that showed you what you were seeing in the distance. Forget the Fisherman's Lookout and opt out for the steeple.

Beautiful, worth a visit. When the Catholics do churches, they dont go big or go home, they go big or even bigger. I am not talking about size here but the breathtaking finishes. Wow, wow, and wow. But, as always, I think what a shocking waste of resources that could have been put to better use.

Magnifcent Church with Spectacular Roof. We visited this church and square which is situated in Buda close to the Fisherman's Bastion. It was built in the latter half of the 13th century on the site of a church destroyed by the Mongols in 1241. The tiling on the roof is quite spectacular.It is a busy place set in a square and part of the old city of Buda which contains many very picturesque old buildings. There is much more to see here than just the church.The square also contains a Plague Monument typical of the period which was erected as thanks for the passing of the plague and in the hope that the plague would not return.

Amazing Church with Breathtaking Interior. This has to be one of the coolest churches. Because it has been both a church and a mosque, the building's interior had a unique flavor of both. The walls almost look like they are molded from tapestries, but in fact, it's amazingly detailed paint job. It was about $5 fee for the entrance to the 14th-century church, named for King Matthias. We just walked up and bought tickets for both the church and the Fisherman's Bastion, which is right next to it. The upstairs of the church houses a nifty little museum with details about the church and the restoration. We were also lucky to catch choir practice during our visit, which was really lovely.

Not really worth an inside visit.... As gothic or neo-gothic churches go, this is small and rather unremarkable. For any tourist who has visited the major cathedrals in Western Europe and especially in Britain, this smallish and much destroyed and much re-built church will appear as rather insignificant. even smallish parish churches in Britain have more undamaged history and atmosphere. On the whole, definitely not worth the entrance fee, there are no significant paintings or monuments inside - just walk around on the outside...
Beautiful roof. Gorgeous brightly coloured tile roof making this one of the prettiest churches in the city. Well worth a quick stop.

Woth the time. This was a good church to visit as it is so much a part of the history of Budapest. The church has been restored and is located on the Buda part of the city. Mount side the church along the wall are wonderful views of Pest on the other side of the Danube.
A Nice Castle...... Matthias Church sits on the Castle Hill next to the Fisherman's Bastion.the painting on the roof is unique and a nice part of Castle Hill. We viewed on the outside only,
Fantastic!!!. It's worth spending time on this church. The inside of the church is really abundant in a wonderful mixed style.

Beautiful Church. Church is located in Castle area near Fishermen's Bastion. Visit early in the day because it may be closed later in the day due to the many weddings that take place there. Nice area to spend a couple of hours.

Beautiful Landmark. This beautiful church sits on a hill on the Buda side of the river and is magnificent both outside and in. Well worth the visit to see and experience the history and beauty of this landmark. It is also co-located with the famous Fisherman's Bastion so there is lots to see and explore in the vicinity.

Can't miss if in Budapest. Although we could not enter the church due to 5 weddings at the time we were there, I highly suggest a visit. A magnificent church and breadth taking views of Budapest from Fisherman's Bastions surrounding the square and the nearby areas. Not to be missed.
Return to Budapest. This is a very ornate but attractive church, perched on the hill of Old Buda. we would have liked to go up the spire but the steps put us off.

Built by a King. Built by King Matthias, this church is actually dedicated to the Virgin Mary as a King could not be a Saint. It is very ornate inside, but very dark. Beauutiful in its own design. Also in a nice area for coffee shops nd local handicraft shops. No fee.
Beautiful Church. Situated in the area of Fisherman's Bastion this church is an impressive structure . We did not have the time to go inside, but wish we had .
Beautiful church,great location.. A beautiful church in a great location on Buda Castle Hill. Get there early it gets busy, go inside.
Trip to Budapest. Impressive church in the center of the Buda castle district. One of the famous monuments of Budapest. Next to "Fisherman's Bastion" and ancient district of Buda.

What a special view!!!. We took the big tower climb and it was the best view in the city!
The tour guid was so friendly and knowledgable. Overall one of the best parts of our trip:)
Church Visit. Well worth a visit. Beautiful interior decoration & lovely organ music. We added on after taking the Free Walking Tour.
Beautiful architecture. Worth the visit, although its quite doable in 30 min. The architecture of the church is really nice.

Not bad. Best to see at night when the lights are on. I'm not keen on churches but its a nice view.
It's close to the city bridge so you can't really miss it. You are mostly likely to be around some of the nice restaurants so give it a go and ha e a look. Its a very nice architectural building.

Excellent and unique church. Very fine construction, all detailed in a very interesting style. Matthias church is a must visit site when in Budapest. All the inside is so unique I have never seen something like that in my life. If I was to get married again, for sure it would be in this church.

Make sure to cover your shoulders. There was nothing spectacular about Matthias Church, other than local history. It's a nice church with beautiful chandeliers but nothing out of the ordinary. Ladies, make sure to cover your shoulders before entering the church!
Beautiful church . Beautiful church with rich history.....including being a mosque...restoration after the Turks.....bonus view of Pest accross the river.

Hard to find and a climb and walk to get to, but worth seeing. Colorful, different looking church interior. Buy tickets across the square; be sure to ask for discount if you are over 65 or a student. Photos are allowed, no problem, and advance ticketing not required.

Beautiful . The church is stunning both outside and in. There is no need to buy the booklet at the ticket office (1000huf) as we picked up a very helpful free leaflet inside which told us all we needed to know about the various parts of the church. Definitely worth a visit

Incredibly beautiful. The most beautiful church in Hungary both from inside and from outside. Don't miss it visiting from inside. There is mess in Latin every Sunday at 10.00 am with the partitipation of the choir and the orchestra.

Full of Grace!. Absolutely stunning interiors! And this is after the exterior which has 7 awesome towers. But the inside of the church still takes your breath away. The colours and designs are just one of a kind - never seen anything like it before.

Wow amazingly beautiful. Simply stunning. The walls, ceiling, domes, stained glass and sculptures are stunning. Very peaceful once inside. You can do a tour of the bell tower but this has to be booked. Worth a visit

Impressive and interesting. Very intresting. Unique interior and worth seeing. Do not miss the bell tower: 200 steps to climb but the spectacular view at the end of the climb is a worthy compensation to the effort.
Stunning. Detail in the architecture and roof beautiful. Lots of interesting buildings in the surrounding area.
Very welcoming dite. Great architecture and very well presented. Definitely a must see on the Buda side. Brochures and staff were very helpful. I would highly recommend a visit.

If you are in Budapest, this is another point of interest not missed.... When you go to Buda Castle, the Matyas Church is next to it. Beyond been maintained in excellent condition, the roof tile work is beautiful.
In the area you will find a cafe for a light meal and restrooms.

Wow don't miss this!. having just been to see cathedrals in Tuscany it would have been easy to skip this - BUT it is so very beautiful with the stencilling and the museums upstairs! well worth the ticket price
Nice interior. Very nice church interior looks great, we were not up in the tower but shuld probably have done so, thik it is 75 meters...

Very nice. We visited this church that is very close to the Fishermen's bastions and situated in a very nice square. It's a pleasant walk. The church has a very interesting story and is beautifully decorated from the inside. Worth visiting.
Awesome View!. So this is a part of the art that I would recommend to see. The ceiling is got this really russian-rumanic colouring and the builiding is just beautiful.

Very attractive church. Excellent little church in the nicest area of the city if you ask me. If you are into walking i suggest you wonder the hill and reach the church on foot, it really pays off with those beautiful surroundings.

Beautiful church on the Buda Hill. It was a sight to behold! Just like the St. Stephen's Basilica, the Matthias Church is also a beautiful church found near the Fisherman's Bastion in the Buda Castle grounds. It has a very distinctive features, with pointy towers, reminiscent of the Baroque-Gothic style.It was already closed when we reached there so I would suggest visiting earlier than 5 p.m. Or check the website for the correct timings of visitation.
Beautiful.. The outside is breathtakingly beautiful. Need to really focus on the details. Wish we had read up on the inside before we went in. Enjoyed it, but missed some details.

Special place. Exquisite building. Good vibes, outside and inside is simply beautiful! The roof should be mentioned as eyecandy part of the building. An organ concert is a unique experience here. You have to prepare that the Matthias Church is very popular among tourists. I recommend it to everyone!

A pearl in Budapest. It was the second time that i went to this church. Its' a pearl in Budapest. I went on Saturday and there where 5 weddings. You have to pay to get into the Church. Matthias is in the same are of Fishermen Bastions and very close to the Castle. If you are in Budapest you can't miss it.

Mass Schedule. What more is there to say about a truly unique and beautiful Catholic Church! A few notes: The Sunday mass schedule is available online, in English at Matyas Templom. High mass at 1000 is in Latin with Magyar readings. An orgaanist and choir accompany mass; the choir is very good, the organist and music choices a tad stolid. A Latin mass guide is available from the small books shop in the rear. After mass, no one rushed me to leave the church, allowing time for meditation and sightseeing.

Take time to visit this church. The church was closed the first time we came; I think there was a wedding. Came back the next day right after it opened so that we could take our time before too many other people came. Such a special place, so different from the usual large European church. The walls were covered with designs, just beautiful. Enjoy the picturesque outside but make a point to savor the inside.

A very different kind of ecclesiastical decor.... I was really annoyed that I'd left my camera back at the apartment not realising that we'd end up visiting this attraction. It's decorated in neo-gothic style which has a stunning effect. We spent about 45 minutes wandering around and came out feeling quite uplifted.

Simply Beautiful!. Be prepared to be blown away by how beautiful this church is. During night time it looks even more beautiful because of the lighting. Located just beside Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias church offers an excellent sightseeing spot.
Impressive and un expected. We didn't expect that beauty. It is very well maintained and the decoration is breathtaking. Visiting times are not flexible unfortunately
Matthias church. Our son owns the same name as this church so we had to visit this place. It has stunning decore and worth a visit while in Buda's Castle District.

wonderful sight. Great view from the top of Buda hill. we took the open bus tour around the town to end up at this sight. the view was breathtaking and the church architect was so beautiful. we had lunch at nearby cafe which was very reasonable and yumy.

Beautiful.. The Mathais Church was beautiful inside and out. The inside held many beautifully painted ceiling and walls, lots of beautifully done gold leaf and lovely spaces for the people who visit. I was surprised that the roof tiles are beautiful multicolored porcelain!

This is a stunning church. The outside of the church is striking with the colorful tile roof. The interior is even more so. The walls are heavily decorated in renaissance style and it is quite different from other chutches you will visit in this part of the world.

DOMINATING THE SKYLINE. The highly decorated roofs and its tall spire mark this church out for special mention. Worth a few moments of your time if you are heading for the nearby Fishermen’s’ Bastion.
STUNNING. This was our second visit to the Fisherman's Bastion area and this church is absolutely stunning, as is the whole area.
Love it! . Love it love it love it!! Paying the entrance if so worth it! The inside is beautiful like no other church I've been to! I just loved it!

2016 Summer Vacation. The Mattias Churche is oposite of the Fishermen's Bastion built in the 10th century AD. Very beautiful inside and if you are able you can take a tour to the Bell dome on top (Guided tour only) and although there are less steps compared to the Basilica, there are much narrower and steaper.
Excellent church. We wanted to enter the church, but they did not allow, claiming that they have private ceremony. It was very disappointing and strange. Shame
Must see!!!. From the gold alter to the magnificent dome this church is a must see. So take a moment enjoyed the stained glass windows, statues and presence of the church.

A Holy Moment. A had a moment here, with tourists bustling about I came across Jesus, tucked away in the corner, on the second floor.We shared a quiet moment, surrounded by relics, this bust of Jesus captured me. It only became more clear to me when I stood next to a woman who appeared to be pleading for answers or maybe a loved one.I hope she finds them, as I found some clarity for myself too.

Stunningly beautiful. We stumbled upon this church visiting the Fisherman's Bastion because they are right next to each other. We did not go inside but the outside is gorgeous gothic style with colorful ceramic tiled roof. Worth a visit.

Beautiful both during the day and at night!. It was a little expensive for entrance fee (Ticket counter is across the promenade) But the church is gorgeous!!!! It is part of the Fisherman's Bastion . Fisherman's Bastion is free but church will cost you. We didnt find any tours. It's relatively small inside but does have a mini museum and history on the 2nd floor. Really nice place.Don't miss the bust of Queen Cici on the second floor.

Beautiful Church. Not to be missed when you:re on Castle Hill. The interior of the church is lovely -- it seems to be such a fusion of styles that makes this church so lovely to explore. I went two times, once with a guided tour and the other time, solo. I enjoyed both visits very much and think having a guided tour is worth it.
Beautiful church. A must see if you travel to Budapest. This church is beautiful. But, you must see it during the day and night view.

Simply Stunning. You MUST see this church. This is one of the most historically fascinating buildings in Europe, and while it looks like yet another Gothic church on the outside, it is inside that is so amazing. The only church to survive the Turkish invasion and occupation, it was converted into a mosque, decorated with Islamic art and the Christian icons painted over. When Budapest regained its independence, some of the icons were restored and most of the Islamic art retained, so the Matthias Church is an everlasting monument to its history.Beautiful stained glass, incredible wall art, and a knockout location on the hill overlooking the Danube, this is one of the most stunning gothic churches you will ever visit.
Beautiful outside, small inside. It is astonishing from outside, but small inside. Also, you have to watch for the visiting hours. For christians, one can attend the mass with music.

Beautiful church. . This is a beautiful little church up on the hill near the castle. There are no audio guides or tours so be sure to have your guide book with you to identify all the highlights of the church. You can climb the bell tower but it was 200 steps and we decided not to do it. They charge for entry into the church, for the bell tower and for the fisherman's bastion. You can pay for each one separately. Plan on spending about 2 hours to take it all in. There is a very famous old cafe down the street from the church and I have attached a picture to the review. I would highly recommend a coffee and pastry here after visiting the church.

Beautiful . Beautiful church. We went for a free walking tour and this was one of the attractions. Saw a few wedding couples from the church, according to the tour guide, this church is popular for wedding. Nice environment and atmosphere.
Nice. worth visiting the Matthias church. if you are in Budapest you have to visit the church and fisherman bastion.

My favorite church. This church is on the Buda side, next to the Fisherman's Bastian. The interior is amazing: a blend of East meets West. Some Baroque, some Arabic designs. Great stories about its construction/ remodeling. Hidden statues. Round windows.
Lovely acoustics. We heard a boys choir from England here.
Beautiful!. We love the architect of the old churches in Europe. This one is beautiful in side and out. Don't miss it!

Stunning. It was a beautiful sunny day when I decided to go up to the Buda side of this incredible city and what a wonderful decision! Matthias Church is located nearby a small old city center, with stores and restaurants and the surroundings have wonderful views. The sun was shinning along with the spectacular ceiling of the church, colorful, bright, full of life and had a completely different feeling than other churches I saw before, it was completely stunning and full of life.

Go at night for a different perspective . The church is beautifully lit up at night. If you don't have to see the inside, just go in the evening especially during hot days. The church and the Fisherman's Bastion beside it looks different and are much quieter after sunset.
Very impresive. Very impresive building. Just next to the fisherman bustion. Has several nice colored windows. But the price to enter is abot 1500huf/5 euro.
Stunning. Right next to fisherman's bastion, what a simply stunning place straight out of a Disney film. Don't forget to bring your camera !!
The roof. Being from AZ, the design of the roof reminded me of native American designs. As amazing as many churches in Europe.
Beautiful Architecture. This church is in the Castle Hill area near Fisherman's Bastion. We didn't pay to go inside, but we walked around outside. It is absolutely beautiful!

Historical church, it's worth a visit.. A super beautiful church especially during sunny day. 1500Ft for an adult visit, but it really worth. This church was founded hundreds year ago then conquered by Turkish troop, changed to Muslim mosque. After that, it was changed back to Catholic church. The ancient building has 2nd floor and some exhibitions are displayed over there,including a statue of Sisi.

Beautiful painted walls and ceilings!. Well worth the walk up to the top for a fantastic view! Beautiful church (Ladies remember to cover your shoulders if wearing a vest shirt inside, I brought a scarf/ shawl). Amazing exterior as well, beautiful painted roof tiles!
Beautiful church. We liked this church better than the Basilica- it's a beautiful building and spotlessly clean. It was very busy with weddings the day we visited
Very interesting to visit. Beautiful on the inside. Don't miss it. Visit as part of a whole tour of the Buda side of town. You'll be glad you saw it.

It's a very good place to visit. It is n. Matthias church is in the surroundings of the Castle and it is worth to include in castle visit if you have time. It is in an area that belongs to the castle and can be visited coming from the castle or going directly there. It is not in routes of the circular tourism buses.

Very beautiful !!. It is a beautiful church , with colorful tiles on the roof. The buda hill can be reached by bus and from there you can easily explore the whole place on foot. Very beautiful building, a must visit place.
Great arhitecture. The church has great arhitecture, many detailes. To bad we could not see the inside becuse we arrived late at night. The panorama view from up there are excellent.
Lovely church. Superb architecture, the colourful tiled roofs standing out, and exquisite painting and stained glass inside.

grand building with a very interesting past.. This Church has a very colorful history and has been subjected to many uses in the past. It has a wonderful feel inside for a church that is very grand on the outside. The surrounds are clean. The Church was easily accessible and would be suitable for older tourists.
Love the roof tiles. The tiles on the roof are very colorful and are actually weather proof. Worth a visit just for the exterior of this building.

Amazing visit. One if the prettiest churches i have seen.
Stunning architecture.. Intricate detailed walls.. Each one slightly different from the other.
Magnificent.
Each section done uniquely.
Absolute must do
Just graceful . It is very beautiful church indeed! Very graceful and elegant both outside and inside. Could not stop admiring.

We had read so much about this church it was high on our must see list. Please don't miss seeing this church, it is a wonderful experience being someplace that was built so many years ago with so much history. Listen to your guide and try to imagine what it was like back in those days of yore, marvel at the engineering that went into this Gothic wonder and take the time to see all of the smaller chapels inside. See the mummified forearm of St. Stephen, the figures of the twelve apostles the dome and mosaics.

$ to get in. On the Buda side. We didn't want to pay the 7 euros to get in so we just admired the architecture outside. There is a lot to see around because it is where the Fisherman's Bastion is. Come around sunset and watch the lights turn on on the Pest side.

Beautiful Church. If you are at Castle hill then you must see St. Matthias Church. It is a conservative church and ladies are required to have their shoulder covered. They also provide paper shawl in case you don't have anything to cover yourself. If you are religious, check out the statue of Virgin Mary that perform miracle during the Turks war.

Beautiful interior.. Every corner of this church is painted. Photographs became extra beautiful because everything had gold-paint in it. Might be pricey for the entrance, but students can get good discounts. Really good place filled with history.

A Beautiful Church. I'm running out of superlatives for the beautiful buildings in Budapest. This is another beautiful church, perhaps second only to St Stephen's Basilica in Pest. I was particularly drawn to the colourful roof. Don't miss this and the Fisherman's Bastion if you are coming over to Buda to see the palace.
Beautiful church. Nice beautiful church. Nice area to walk around as well and a Starbucks just round the corner as well. Pleasant inside and didn't take up too much time
Interesting and beautiful. Must visit it: it doesn't cost much without the guide, that isn't necessary because of the free brochures that can be taken inside. Very beautiful and full of history.

Beautiful Interior. This church has a beautiful interior. The painted and gilded frescos are well worth a visit. On the outside be sure to look up at the spire with the Raven atop with a gold ring in its mouth, there is a story of why it is up there !

What Can I Say? I've Seen Better.. Well, yes, this is a very pretty church inside, but if I'm not mistaken, it's all been relatively recently restored and it looks it. I've seen much more evocative and stunning church/mosque interiors in other cities like Athens and Istanbul, so it left me unmoved. But maybe that's just me.

Beautiful church!. Matthias church is really beautiful and its architecure quite unique with the colorful tiles on the roof. The whole area around it is lovely and we spent every evening of our stay in this area since we were staying close to it. Looks even more beautiful when lit up at night. A must visit!

Matthias Church. The Church is not always open to the public but even seeing it up close from the outside is still worth it
The church is beautiful and has an amazing roof which is my favourite feature

Beautiful gothic style chruch. This church is very beautiful from outside. I did not have time to go inside but I bet it is even better from inside. If I ever come back to Budapest I definitely want to go inside.

Well worth a visit. The Gothic Matthias church on the Buda side is as beautiful on the outside as it is on the inside. The roof has colourful ceramic tiles. Although a little noisy when we visited it did not distract from the decorated ceilings and art work.For a small fee we climbed the 197 steps of the Bell tower and were rewarded with wonderful views of the Fisherman’s Bastion, the Danube and the buildings on the Pest side.

Incredible Views. I would definitely recommend paying for a ticket to go to the top of the Matthias church ( check when the tours are as you can only have a guided tour to the top of the tour) The views are incredible and you can see the entirety of Budapest such as Parliament, the Palace and St Stephens Basilica The tour guide is excellent too - just be prepared for a leg workout up the 200 stairs of the spiral staircase

Beautiful from outside. We went to the church on our segway tour to the castle hill and the church from outside is beautiful in all its glory with colors. Again it is said that the church looks much prettier in the dark when its lit but I was happy with the sunny day as well.Did not go inside though

Beautiful on outside. 1500Huff to enter. Beautiful grounds around it. The inside is 1500HUFF to enter (6US). We did not go in because we saw the St. Stephen's Basilica was free and let's face it, you've seen one ... you've seen them all (lightening strikes)

An amazing church used to be an Mosque. Beautiful building and extremely nice roof.This church used to be a mosque....... after a war it became a church.Is vampire a myth or for real?Cause our guide was telling us the story of how Vampire became “The Vampire”.He was kept [imprisoned] in the basement of the church.Even if you do not like churches, please just take a few seconds look…….. It is worth it!
Beautiful roof. Very cozy and beautiful church right in front of Fisherman bastion. I have not seen this kind of mosaic roof in other countries. Must see!!

Great views.. Visited this church whilst staying in Budapest and was well worth it as the views over the city from here are amazing.
The church itself was great as the level of detail in the build is something to behold.
Well worth a visit.

"Such a Marvellous Place of Worships". This church got what tourist want to see. Such an iconic place situated on Buda side of Hungary. Its has beautiful structures outside and have very nice altar and sculptures of saints. The place is surrounded by souvenirs shops and good restaurants as well as small castles around overlooking skyline and river as far as the eyes can see. A well preserved place that reminds ones of its historic past.

Very Nice. This church is well worth a visit because of it views overlooking Pest and so close to a town on the top of the hill. Also close to Hospital in the Rock. Its a pleasant "climb" from Chain Bridge.

Nice Church. We could not go inside the church as it was closed for a wedding. The outside of the church is pretty impressive and it is right next to the Fisherman's Bastion. The church itself is about 8-10 mins easy walk from the Buda Castle.
Beautiful church. Matthias Church is a beautiful church from the outside, it lies on a top in Buda and is not to be missed.

WoW cannot describe this beautiful Church. One of many beautiful churches located in Hungary a must visit ! Born in Hungary I revisit this spectacular church as many times I can with people who have never been there beautiful peaceful full of history!! Take the tour and learn the History behind this wonderful place you will not be disappointed !!
very ornate and interesting church. high on the tour group beaten track but a great place to visit and see the splendour of the church . Make sure you wear something covering your shoulders

Beautiful Church. Not to be missed. It sits on top of the hill in Buda overlooking the Danube. Make sure to combine this with Fisherman's Bastion and Castle Hill. Interior is beautiful but perhaps not as nice as St. Stevens.

Beautiful Gothic architecture . Even if you dont plan to visit the church from inside although it is recommended, the pictures taken outside the church are always wonderful.It a nice piece of gothic architecture

Impressive!. The colours of the roof tiles are splendid when the sun is shining.You should enter the church as well; unfortunately a coach full of Turkish visitors had just arrived and invaded the church, and they showed no respect at all for this Christian place of prayer, shouting and joking loudly. They didn't stay too long, thank God, and we were able to fully appreciate the atmosphere of this wonderful church.
Eow. We were just outside. You need to visit this church both at day and at night. And there is really just one word necessary to say about this site: Wow
Equally impressive inside and out!. Bring your camera! This church is so beautiful. It has so many interesting things to look at and photograph. Great in daylight and night time.

Roman Catholic Church with an interesting history. This very large Roman Catholic church has an interesting mix if architecture as a result of its history. It is the third church on this site. The first one was destroyed by the Huns. The second church was built in the 1400’s by King Matthias, whose statue is next to the church. The Turks replaced it with a mosque in 1541 but kept some of the stained glass windows. The church was rebuilt from the mosque in the 1800’s. It has many beautiful stained glass windows and has a distinct moorish influence.

What a beautiful Church.⛪️. While visiting Buda we walked past this beautiful Church with the most breathtaking roof we could not resist going inside. We were not disappointed. Quite busy at times but I have seen worse. An entrance fee but it is worth it.

A uniquely beautiful church. This 700 year old church is beautiful, outside and inside. We opted for a tour and for a modest amount it was an hour personal tour for my grandson and I. The history was fascinating and we were able to visit every corner of this religious gem.

View from the top!. This is a very neat church to visit, but if you are up to the challenge, you should pay extra to climb to the top of the bell tower. The climb is 197 steps up a tight spiral staircase, but is broken into two parts. Once reaching the top, you are rewarded with sweeping views of the city and a great place to take a few photos.

Must in Buda. The other side of the Danube, Buda is a more quieter than Pest,but equally beautiful, you have to visit and stroll the Fishermen's Bastion and see the Matthias Church, where concerts are held also

Beautiful church. This is a beautiful church located within the castle district. We didn't go into the church, but had a good time walking around, taking pictures and admiring the view. Very pretty during the day so I imagine it's stunning at night

Weddings are frequent here.. This old structure was destroyed many times. The most recent rehab project was funded by locals who bought pieces of the old roof to finance a new one. ThoseHungarians are very proud of this place. Pay the entrance fee and see the stained glass windows. This beautiful building was not destroyed by the Truks. They liked it so much they turned it into a mosque. This id the one place on Castle Hill where it is well worth the price of admission. Do not be surprised to see many locals and tourists here.

A church that has been a mosque and back again. The building from the outside is not that unusual with a mostly gothic design. The tile roof adds a little different touch. The inside is where this church shines.The interior is painted with floral and geometric designs leftover from it' time as a mosque. Rather than painting over these when it was changed back into a church, the Christian painting incorporated these designs beautifully. I have seen many churches all over Europe, but this one is unique.

Gothic and Neo-Baroque Style. Great place to visit in Budapest! The original church was destroyed in 1241 so a new church was built from 1255 to 1269. Much of this Gothic building remains, though it was Matyas Corvinus, after whom the church is named, who expanded it in the 15th century. The final phase of restoration took place from 1873 to 1896, when Frigyes Schulek redesigned it in the Neo-Baroque style.

Lovely both day and night. A beautiful cathedral work with a stunning interior and exterior and colorful tiled roof. Rebuilt after being destroyed in the Second World War it still maintains an air of being older. A side note, and this was also seen at several other sites, a bronze sculpture of the site and terrain around the site with Braille descriptors allows those with out full vision to still experience the church....Bravo!

MAGICAL. Quoting our English relatives this is the most magical church ever visited.Calming and pretty, quite and well organised, historically important yet so friendly send didn't to earth.Efficient online booking and a place NOT to miss!

Very noisy, doesn't seems like church . I came here on Sunday and participated in their holy mass. After mass, I visited this church. Remember, if you want to visit on Sunday, see the holy mass schedule because the church will close for public. When I visited the church, In the same time, there are group who came (around 30-40 people) and of course other visitors too. So, it's start with crowd. Normally event for the public, church is always quite. But here??? You can't imagine! It's like in normal public place. No sign "Silent, please" or something. Regarding the church, it's quite impressive. The decoration/painting is on all around the wall. They also have many relics, monstrance, many historical things with good maintenance and information. If you are the type of historical lovers, don't miss this place. But remember to see the holy mass schedule and I think the best time to visit is in the morning, when no group tourist come :)

very beautiful church.. Matthias church is a Roman Catholic church located in the heart of Buda's Castle District. The current building was constructed in the florid late Gothic style in the second half of the 14th century and was extensively restored in the late 19th century.

Interesting church with good interior views. The mosaic roof if memorable. Once inside you are able to go up in their museum which allows you to get close to the ceiling and up close with the details.

Definitely worth a visit!. Another gorgeous church worth touring. Upstairs in the "museum" part, you can get up close and personal with REPLICAS of the Crown Jewels (the real ones are on the tour in Parliament but you cannot get close to them).
Worth a visit. Worth a visit but not as grand as the basilica. Great view from the outside and a very unique roof. If you are up at the castle you should take some extra time to visit this as well.

Beautiful church. Located in front of Fisherman's Bastion, this church was the site of the coronation of the last two Hungarian Habsburg kings, Franz Joseph and Charles IV. Gothic style -- really spectacular.

Interesting church to visit. The exterior of this church is gorgeous to look at - very striking...in some ways more so than the interior. The interior is full of a lot of history. The church is named after a popular Renaissance king Matthias Corvinus. There are small chapels, some beautiful painted walls, gorgeous stained glass windows. Be sure to find where you can walk up a staircase to a gallery where you can look down on the altar area for some good views as well as see some exhibits about the church. It is my understanding that Corvinus (corvus) is Latin for "raven"...be sure to look for statues of ravens perched on the exterior roof of the church.

Very beautiful church up on castle hill. Unfortunately we arrived too late to visit the interior, but just looking from the outside is special. The roof tiling and other adornments are gorgeous, and it's photogenic from many different angles.
Very beautiful. Well worth queueing to get ticket to get in. Fabulous interior. A fun walk up from the Danube. Not expensive.
Beautiful church worth the visit. It is the Basilica district and it has the hand of St. Stephen, the founder of the Hungarian nation.
History and culture. This Church is a must to visit place. The ticket is very cheap and you get a wonderful unique church with its own history.
A must visit. Set up next to one of the many food squares, this place is really a beautiful architecture of European era and you will find every tourist coming here to click selfies.

Fabulous church ! Don't miss it . Do NOT miss this church
It's my favorite of all the churches visited in the past several weeks
Incredible
Go upstairs too !

Pity it is not original. The building is impressive from outside but mainly from inside. The painted interiors are awesome. Just a pity it is not original one from the 15th century but it does not make it less beautiful
Beautiful! . It was lovely! Perfect place for taking lots of pictures. It had a great of the Danube, chain bridge, basilica, parliament and all of Pest!

Late gothic architecture . Loved this church- built in the late 14th century, it is in the late florid /gothic style, the roof tiles are beautiful coloured patterns, have not been inside yet as we saw it at night but I'm sure it's worth going inside as well
very pretty. amazing architecture and an opulent interior. Doesn't matter where you view this building from it is impressive with an excellent viewpoint over the city

Can't miss it! at castle hill. If you are at castle hill, must go. Don't worry about the entrance fee, compared to what you get inside, it is worth it. Go up to 2nd level and look down. You get to see/feel the church in total new perspective.

beautiful church - do not use blitz when taking photos. An impressive church with so much history and architectural details. It costs money to get in, but it was plenty to see. Too bad that so many tourists kept using their blitz inside as there was many signs telling you not to - and it was disrespectful for those who came there to pray.

Stunning Church . A church with a very stunning interior and exterior, the roof is very unique as well. To enter there is an entrance fee a little bit but is for purpose of church donation but it is worth it to see.
A sight to behold. The outside of St. Mathias Church is absolutely beautiful. There was limited access to the interior. And you needed to buy an admission ticket. We did not buy the ticket.

Great View. We paid for the short tour that takes you up the bell tower for the panoramic view. Well worth it! As you go up the stairs there is a small exhibit with interesting artifacts from the church and past bell towers. Our guide was great and told us about the history and the building. The view from the top of the bell tower was great!

Lovely church & a special story about Loreto Chapel. Castle Hill has much to see and do and Matthias Church is lovely with some great history (it's real name isn't Matthias). If you love stories about Mary's fortitude, not miss this church!The cost is minimal and it was a welcomed refugee from the crowds and heat.

Very, very beautiful. Even though we didn't go inside, I absolutely loved the colours of the roof as well as the architecture of this church. Do beware of all of the tourists visiting this place, it can get very crowded.
Stunning!. Went to 6pm Sunday massThis church is Exceptionally Beautiful both inside and out The surrounding area and stunning views make this high on the to do listYou won't be disappointed

if you visit a church in Budapest it has to be in the top of your list. I take the hop on hop off buses during all my vacation to Budapest (i have only 2 days there)., with a valid ticket for 2 days (extra discount for students)i visit the church when i was visit the Buda hill. Is near.
Beautiful architecture and stunning interior. A beautiful church outside and in.There is a small enterance fee but its worth it the interior is stunning
Renovated Beauty. For those folks who love church architecture this a must visit when in the Castle district. Newly renovated this is a beautiful place of prayer

what a marvelous building. I love the architecture of this church. I went there during the day first so that I can visit the church. I also went there during the night. and had dinner at Fisherman's Bastion.
Near the Bastion. If you can make it to the Bastion, you've made it to Matthias Church. The architecture, the people, the story that surround the Cathedral are incredible. Visiting it is a must.

Stunning day and night. This is a wonderful church. The roof is stunning made of beautiful coloured ceramic tiles. The inside has wondeful stain glass windows. The inside is heavily decorated with fabulous colours. It's possible to go into the gallery where the King and Queen would sit and the views are lovely from the gallery. There's some great interactive displays providing close ups of the stain glass and information about the saints. The interactive displays are in multiple languages, all the exhibits are in English and Hungarian. You need to buy tickets to get into the church and the ticket office gets very busy mid morning and afternoon, so go early to get tickets. The ticket office is opposite the church. The church gets quite full by 11-12pm. At night the church is floodlit and the ceramic tiled roof looks amazing.

Magnificent interior. The inside of this church is completely covered in patterns of brown and gold in addition to many frescoes and statues. Some of the roof is covered with ceramic tiles and the views across the Danube are fantastic.
Quite majestic. Matthias church is a very beautiful building with many paintings and a lot of culture and history to read about. You also get a very nice panorams of the city from its location.
Nicest church in town. This is a church you shoud visit even if you have to pay. Rich oriental decoration inside. Nothing like this in town.

Lots of culture in one ticket.. An impresive church with spectacular aspect and awesome paintings. There are explanations available about every painting and also a museum. You can also see two church organs. The price is 1500 ft for adults and 1000 for students or seniors. Entrance is free for children under the age of six.

Best Church in Budapest. The interior of this church is by far the best in Budapest. It's just as richly decorated as the city's other grand buildings such as Parliament or the Opera House. You do have to pay to enter, but it's worth the small admission price to see the ornate side chapels, the famous Madonna statue, and even a replica of the Hungarian crown. This is by far the top sight on Castle Hill and a must-see in Budapest.
Interesting Church. Definitely worth a visit - unusual interior decoration and worth catching the concert at 4pm on Wednesdays
.... The most beautiful building I have seen! Definitely worth seeing on your trip to budapest! Very breath taking!

Beautiful Church. This is well worth a visit, a spectacular church. Ladies need to cover your shoulders on entry, if you do not have anything with you they give you a paper sheet to cover up. Very friendly staff & helpful. A beautiful building with stunning leaded lights in the Windows.
Lovely Architecture. Such a fantastic place to visit. It is a little crowded during midday but early morning is fantastic.

Another beautiful Budapest building.. Very pretty, beautiful on both the inside and out, with pretty roof made is ceramic tiles and in a beautiful spot, overlooking the Danube, with lovely views. A small museum witching the church.
Amazing. This is a beautiful building. Get there early to avoid the crowds and see it in the nice morning light.

Stunning. Wow, I've seen a lot of churches but this is up there with the best. The outside has just finished 10 years of cleaning and renovation. And it shows. The coloured roof is amazingly beautiful.
Breathtaking!!!!. Absolutely lovely!!!!! Views are spectacular and the hike up is hard but defiantely worth it. Lots of cute restaurants and coffee shops close by
The most beautiful church in Budapest. Not so big, but very elegant, after restoration. The prominent feature of Buda side, worth visiting. Popular for weddings.
Beautiful church with a fascinating history. We have seen many churches and are often "churched out". This church is worth a visit for both its beauty, location and story.

Fantastic concert. You can join some concert in this Church during the night. Especially, if they use the big pipe organ. Fantastic church and fantastic lighting. After concert you can sit in a café and look the beautşness of chursh from outside.

Great views from the top. The jewel behind the Bastion is honestly more spectacular from the top of the tower rather than inside. Even though the style is rather polished outdoors and indoors, St Stephen's is more memorable indoors.Two separate tickets for the tower and normal entry to the church; tours start from the corner on the right hand side of the exit, just be there 5-10 minutes earlier.The ticket to the guided tour to the tower is highly recommended then. Our guide spoke a decent English and entertained us with the basics of Hungarian history and mentioned lots of places to visit in Buda! Views from the top are breath-taking!

Beautiful Church with lots of History. Matthias Church, like many other European churches, have a lot of history. This one, for some reason, appealed to me in a way I could not explain. It should be because it is so beautiful or because of its top of the Buda hill location makes it so unique. Really enjoyed the tour and its history.
Disappointing. Maybe it was the Turks beheading the statues and painting over the frescoes, but we found this one a bore. St. Stephens is a much better choice.

Amazing guide!!. While going to the church dont get discouraged by the tower! One has to climb 200 steps but its worth it. I was lucky to meet an amazing guide, who was well versed with the history of the church and the world history, constantly parallels and helped us understand the culture better!

Beautiful Baroque . Matthias Catholic Church is a magnificent structure on the Buda side of Budapest. The beautifully decorated ceilings, side altars, statues, artwork and ornaments are definitely worth a visit. I realise the plethora of choice when it comes to visiting beautiful historic Churches in Europe, but this one is really lovely. There is a small entrance fee ( about €5 or €7 ). The surrounding area is also quite breathtaking and a treat for photo buffs.

a must see up close and from a distance. Yes there are large churches everywhere you turn along the Danube, but this one has to rank in the top three. It has presence and power, a symbol of hope even if no one attends. Of course, it;s baroque.

Extraordinary church. The Matthias church is no typical church. Because of its painted walls, high amount of ornaments and corridor in the second level it is a place you must visit. It was about 1500 florint (less than 5 euro) to enter and it is definitely worth the amount!

A very historic Church. I was a bit surprised to have to pay to visit this beautiful Church only to find out that there was an extra fee for a tour. However, the magnificent building has beautiful beautiful side altars, ceilings, main altar and glass windows. We learned that when the Turks took over the Church which was first built in 1255, they white washed the beautiful walls which were ornately decorated. A great deal of reconstruction has been done.There is not a charge to attend Sunday Mass.
Very Pretty. I'm not a huge fan of churches and cathedrals--maybe have seen too many--but, this one is quite pretty and worth visiting. Tons of history and the surrounding area is kind of neat, too.

Prettiest at night. Went on a tour to see this and it is one of the prettiest churches I have seen. I did not go inside the church. I wish I would have now that I am home. The church at night is worth it to see.

Matthias Church in Budapest. Matthias Church is on the Buda side of the city of Budapest. It is an imposing baroque style church which honers the contribution of King Matthias who is a legend in Budapest Hungarian history. The entire Matthias Church neighborhood is a lovely historic area with many lovely small restaurants and coffee shops, easily accessible by tram, subway or a bus. Public transport between the two parts of this lovely city is excellent, and Matthias Church is easily noticeable from one side or another because of its tall steeple.

More cultural importance than beauty. This church is of great importance in the city history. It's not bad looking but compared to St. Stephen's, it's lack in impressiveness. Need to buy a ticket to get in and a separate ticket for the bell tower. There's small exhibition on the first floor in the church. There are some interesting items and from the first floor corridor, overlooking the church surely provides another perspective. The tower could only be accessed with a guided tour. On top, it has a great view, quite funny looking down at the Fisherman's Bastion.

Beautiful inside and out!. The tiles on the roof of this church is the first thing you notice, I have never seen a roof like it. You have to pay a small fee to get into this church but it is worth it. You also need to make sure that you have your shoulders cover in this church. No matter where I went I always made sure I had a summer scarf with me to cover up.

Absolutly breathtaking church!. This Church is just amazing. One of the Most Beautiful churches i have seen (competing with Sacre Coeur in Paris). It costs about 5 euros to enter, Its worth it. Be there EARLY (i think they Open at 9 am Most weekdays) to get to see it without standing in Line or have to share it with hundreds of tourists. Already at 10-11 the Place is owercrowded. We had a Hotel Next door (hilton) so we went at 9.15. no lines and only a few other tourists. If you dont live nearby Take å taxi (Its doesnt cost much, maybe 5-8 euroes from down town) or take the bus nr 16 or 16A from the metrostation Széll Kálmán tér (Metroline 2). The busstop for the Church is "Szentháromság tér". Its amazing in the evening to, all lit up, but you cant enter inside then. Still magnificent to see at night!

Amazing church. A must see in Buda. Astonishing architecture, with a very spiritual feel inside, even in major tourist season. Ladies beware, if wearing strappy tops you will be asked to cover up with a large paper napkin!!

Breath taking as soon as you come round the corner . Matthias church is stunning, it has possible the most interesting architecture I have seen across Europe. I found the alternative colours that are found on the church are stunning. If you have time, definetly go in! It's worth the time.

must-see. Matthias church is located in one of the most beautiful parts of budapest. Its very busy and touristy but worth going to visit. Inside it hold artefacts and historical objects which are very interesting.
Amazing gothic church. I normally hate churches but couldn't help to get blown away by this gem. It really is worth a look inside as well as outside.

Matthia Church with ceramic Roof. On the Buda side of the city we visited the Matthias Church. Entry is on payment of approx £4.00 it's well worth the money as the interior is beautifully hand painted and the church hold 2 services per day. If you want to walk the castle wall to capture the fantastic views over the city there is a small entry charge but if you visit one of the cafes situated to the left, you can enjoy a nice cool beer and the views. Enjoy!
Spectacular church. Roman Catholic Church in front of Fisherman's Bastion. This church is located in the heart of the Buda's castle District .This is an example of of Gothic Revival Architecture.

Beautiful Gothic Church. Matthias Church or as it is formally known The Church of Our Lady (Nagyboldogasszony templom) was the first parish church in Buda many years ago.It has been rebuilt and renovated several times. Today little remains of the original church.It stands splendid and imposing Gothic style next to the Fisherman's Bastion. The inside is really beautiful with several side chapels as well as the huge main alter piece.If you want to visit the main bell tower there are organised, supervised groups. A couple of guides make sure you all get up and back down. It is a trek but the view from the top is magnificent.My Tips: Take the No 26 bus from Deák Ferenc tér M up to the church.When you go up Matthias Tower keep up a steady pace that you are happy with don’t try and rush, there are over 200 steps to go up and back down

must see. A Budapest's must-see. Beautiful as well on the outside and inside. You have to pay fee to go inside and I would recommend it if you're intrested in sacral architecure, it makes strong impression. It's colorful rooftop will look great on your holiday photos ;)
A striking building. A church with unique architecture, particularly the roof and spire. I would thoroughly recommend this as a photo opportunity.

At Fishermans baschen. Missed going in at regular hours, so took pictures at baschen like wat my mother had in her youth of my daughter and granddaughters. Had dinner at great restaurants close to the church. Then went back to the church at 7:30 for a free organ concept, it was great lasted for 1 hour.

Most beautiful church in Budapest. First and foremost this is a functioning church with a large and loyal congregation. Multiple Sunday masses are all full. Same with the 7 am mass on weekdays. Tourism is stopped at that time and no cameras are allowed. You need to attend mass or go later. Once inside you are in for a treat. Predominant colors inside are red, gold, and brown. Lots of gold leaf in huge wall paintings (directly on the walls) telling religious stories. 500 year old carvings on the southern entrance. Side altars beautifully decorated as is most of the left side of church. All effect is extraordinary neo-gothic building. Matthias was King and Saint. Church is stunning at night where blue tint invades a prominently yellow/white presence. Extraordinary
Stunning. Admittedly churches aren't really my thing but this place is beautiful. My girlfriend could have sat looking at it all day!

Excellent. It is in front of Fisherman's bastion. A roman catholic church with gothic design.it was originally built in 11th century but eas destroyed and the current building was built in later part of 13th century.

Beautiful inside and outside and the sorroundings are very romantic.. It's a really surprise this church and the complex in which it is located. A really amazing place, very romantic specially at night and during summer.

Simply one of the most beautiful churches you will ever visit. I wasn't keen on visiting the church as I've been to so many, that sometimes they all start to seem alike. Let me tell you, I was even amazed at the beauty of this church and I'm talking about just the inside...the outside is pretty nice, too. Make sure to buy a photo permit and you will be very happy that you did.

Beautiful Church. Matthias Church was beautiful to see and enjoy the history our tour guide shared We were able to sit and enjoy the beauty of the church. There is a scenic overlook area outside. The church is so pretty to see up on the hill from Budapest, especially at night.

Absolutely stunning interior. I agree with other reviewers that I personlly do not like to have to pay to visit a church. However, I did not think it was that expensive and someone has to pay for the upkeep. This is one church I would though urge visitors to enter and the fee is worth it. The interior really is both surprising and stunning. I am not keen on places of worship in general but the interior of this church is a sight to behold - virtually every inch of the interior is decorated with patterns and flowers painted (with stencils) directly onto the stone walls - I have never seen anything quite like it. I believe it is also possible to ascend the tower but having already been up the tower of St Stehpen's Basilica and onto the roof of the Castle art gallery I gave this one a miss especially as the view from the Fisherman's Bastian over to Pest was spectacular. There are only so many photograps of the view one can take!!! .

Great setting for an interesting building. It tends to be very crowded up by the Church and Fishermans Bastion but only to be expected as one of the main attractions of the City. If you climb up to the gallery inside the Church, for which there is no extra charge, it is very peaceful and you get a far better view of all the frescoes and stained glass windows. Buy a ticket to include the Fishermans Bastion and you get to visit the less crowded part of the ramparts rather than the more hectic free parts. However, the views are the same if you don't want to pay the extra. Discounts for EU pensioners apply.

Stunning. Amazing church located in the Buda castle, adjacent to the Fisherman's bastion. There is a entrance fee, but it's worth it.Inside is gorgeous, but the main feature of the building are the amazing tiles which cover the roof.Must see.
Entrance fee. Marvelous church but dont like the idea to pay money to see inside. Didnt pay for entrance in Notre Dame.
Pretty Church. Mattias Church is very nice old Church, the plaza and the surroundings are pretty as well, that make for a great afternoon after lunch

STUNNING. It never fails to amaze me how these absolutely gorgeous buildings/churches have survived over the centuries of change and war. Yes, there is a fee to go into it, but the costs to keep it going/renovations must be phenomenal. The interior décor is stunning and not to be missed.They allow you to take pictures inside.

Pay per view? Forget it!. I do not know how much is the fee, or how long is the line to get the ticket, but to pay to even enter a church is as bad as a hotel without WiFi. The interior of the church must be miraculous if you have to pay to get in, not for me, I'm not even praying. Go to St. Stephen's, even the mummified hand can be seen gratis. I hardly umderstand having to pay to see art, but that is understandable, even paying to climb stairs for a nice view. But to enter a house of prayer, that sounds shameful. To enter a church I understand donations, even a fee for a special place within the church itself. Not a religious person at all, I always visit churches for the art and architectural experience, and even for the feeling of thoughtfulness inside the temple's realms, which I can respect, regardless of the cult. The outside of the church is spectacular.

Beautiful church with extensive history. We decided to take the guided tour, which takes 1 hour at a cost of 2,550 HUF. This was a good decision as the guide was excellent and brought to life the long and often bloody life of the church and indeed Budapest itself. She was also able to point out the more interesting artefacts which we may otherwise have missed. Well worth the price.
