Still amazing!. Built in the 1500s, this old church stands as the main spire on the castle hill. Remodled over the years (adding the tile roof, for example) it still retains the structure from the original design. The interior as painted in the mid 1800s for the coronation of the Queen Erzsebet (Sisi), and it is just a massive job depicting symbols from the region and it really impressive. You will really enjoy the little side museums that are worth the stairs. Lots of treasures and some original manuscripts from a long lost era. The kids will like the armor. You must get a ticket to get in, but worth it!

Great site! . The Church's interior and external decorations are phenomenal. Great access to the history of the construction of the building throughout the various rooms and access to the various areas itself are great. Access to the church alone is 1500 HUF, with access to the panoramic view provided from the top of the bell-tower (if you're brave enough!) at 4,800m high is a further 1500 HUF. It is truly is a feast for the senses and a must see on any trip to the Buda side of the city !
Is not covered by the Budapest Card.. Tons of people make good pictures almost impossible. Even the lookout towers require tickets and the good view spots are taken by restaurants and cafes.
Use Budapest Card. Used Budapest card - included two city tours with plenty of information. It gave us free access to National Museum, St Lukacs Bath, free public transportation.

Majestic architecture at Matthias Church. Our tour of Budapest included Matthias Church, which has completely different interior architecture than I expected. The designs were Middle Eastern with colorful hues that are mindful of Morocco. The building is in the Castle District and is high on the hill of the Buda side. If you get the opportunity visit Matthias Church. It is much different than many of the church buildings you will see in Europe.

If you see the castle, don't miss the church. A beautiful church on top of Castle Hill next to the Fishermen's Bastion. The exterior is very ornate with superior old style workmanship. A very unique tiled roof. The interior is different from other churches in town. I cannot believe how many great churches there are in Europe.

Originally built in 1015AD. Matthais Church is located in front of Fisherman’s Bastion, and is in the heart of Buda Castle District. Church tradition suggests it was originally built in Romanesque style in 1015AD, though no archaeological remains exist. The current building was constructed in the florid late Gothic style in the second half of the 14th century and was extensively restored in the late 1800s. WWII brought the church to near ruin, and it was again restored. One of the most distinctive aspects is the colorful tile roof. The slender profile makes the building seem much taller. The admission fee is well worth the experience, but as with all iconic buildings in Budapest—especially those on Castle Hill—I recommend an early visit. Throngs of tourists populate Buda Hill making a peaceful visit difficult.

Amazing!. Located just a quick walk from the castle you find the grand Mattias church towering the castle hill. The white stone with beautiful decorations makes it truly majestic. If you want to you can pay an entrance fee in a ticket office located just next to the church and access a viewpoint in the tower which offers a fantastic view over the city. If you don't want to do that a look on the outside is just as good!

Beautiful. Another sight you have to pay to go in... we were too late and missed entrance for the day. Even so, its worth seeing even just the outside and the surrounding area. There's plenty of ice cream nearby. ;)
Beautiful. The city is full of beautiful buildings. Colorful and attractive. But please go and see this. It is beautiful

The most beautiful church!. The Mathias church is definitely one of the top attractions in Budapest - and totally worth it! There might be some line, the visit hours are limited, there is a ticket for the entrance (not expensive though) - trust me, you will be fascinated once you are inside. I would dare to consider it my favourite church!
Impressive. Impressive church and artwork if there is a nice concert in the evening it has wonderful acoustics and is worth a visit

Great Church. Situated in the old city of Buda, near the Fisherman's Bastion an the Imperial Castle, Mattyas Church is a very interesting place due its history. Part of Imperial castle the church were related with Imperial history

Beautiful active church. We attended mass there. Church was beautiful -inside and outside.
The mass was in Hungarian and Latin, but we were able to follow and enjoy it.

Amazing. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen, inside and out. We paid to go up the top of the church to get a view of the whole of Budapest. Our tour guide was amazing and very friendly. There are a lot of stairs which are numbered so you know how long you have left to go! But it is all worthwhile when you get to the top because the view is incredible!

Beautiful and Stunning Architecture!. I stayed at the Hilton Budapest in the Castle District, which is right next door to Matthias Church. I visited the Church during the day and the evening to take photos. The structure is so impressive and the detail is phenomenal. I did not get a chance to go inside, but it was amazing just to view the Church up close from the outside. I highly recommend stopping at the Church while you are visiting the many other attractions in the Castle District. Mark my words, you won’t be disappointed!

Gorgeous church next to the bastilion . Went into the church while visiting the bastilion. Paid 1400 florint to get in. The church inside was beautiful. So well maintained and pretty.Well worth a visit to.Some of the bits to see require steps to be walked up so not disabled accessible.
Beautiful. This is a lovely church and worth a visit. Go upstairs to the museum and a lovely view into the church below.
Beautiful church. Enjoyed the bell-tower tour - had the tour guide to ourselves and the views from the top where panoramic.
The Tower is a must-do extra. In my opinion one of the prettiest churches in Budapest - both inside and out - the tower tour is an optional extra but well worth it for the amazing views from the top.

BEAUTIFUL CHURCH AT THE CASTLE. This is the beautiful church on top of Castle Hill just down from Buda Castle Palace and next to the Fishermen's Bastion. Church exterior is very lavish with intricate workmanship, attractive steeple and a fancy tiled roof. The interior is equally beautiful with ornate fresco covered walls and lots of stone carvings and religious items.
Superbous!!. Fantastic pray place!! Magnifically maintained. I have not much words to describe the place, but one of the magnificant monuments I have ever visited.

Overrated. We visited as part of a tour group. Apparently individual entry fee is 1500 HUF. While the interior is impressive, the multitudes of tourists detracted from the spirit and beauty. I would not return.

Beautiful church and surrounding area. Visited during the day and at night - think maybe more stunning at night (as with the Bastion) option of going up the bell tower for views across Buda and Pest. Worth a visit.

Another Gem in Budapest--#4. Matthias Church, on the hill, above the Danube, on the Buda side of the city. Coupled with Fisherman's Bastion, and the Palace, it is a grand place to visit. Easy to reach, across the Chain Bridge, and up the funicular, from Pest.
Tom and Lisa
Broomfield, CO

Wonderful views of Budapest. A must see in Budapest.
Restaurants of many varieties, shops and boutique hotels.
Outstanding church and pleasant walks through the plazas.

Spectacular church, truly unique. What a unique and beautiful place, this church is! We didnt think much of it from the outside, but our tour guide recommended it to pay the extra money to see it, and we didnt regret it aT ALL. It is a truly unique expreience and recommended to everyone.

Stunning Byzantine architecture . A great rainy day activity and reason to pray and be awestruck. The church and its chapels were beautiful and immaculately kept.
They also play organ music to enhance the mood. It's not just a church, it's and experience not to be missed.

Just beautiful. we had a quick visi - it was nearly closing time. Th eticket booth is opposite the entarnce - small fee. Thi schurch is so beautiful from the outside and then inside... Well worth doing if you are in the area - and you really should visit the area for all sorts of reasons.

High Spot....!!. Sometimes biggest isn't always the best.....this is a stunning small church in the Buda district of the city. The interior is beautifully decorated and quite a masterpiece to take in. Worth spending perhaps about an hour or so and try to go out of the busy times of day to fully appreciate this architecture.If you only visit one church in Budapest.....make it this one!

Stunning Church and panoramic views over Bude, Pest and the Danube. We really enjoyed visiting the Matthias Church. We bought tickets in order to climb the tower and get a good view, but went into the church once we had finished and we were so glad that we had, as it was stunning. The work is so intricate and amazing - a lovely place.

Gorgeous Day and Night. We visited this church once to go inside and walk up the tower during the day and another to see it at night. The view from the top of the bell tower was absolutely rewarding after 197 steps (2 stops on the way). Being up close and personal to the bell is great as well. Church itself is gorgeous inside and out. I was surprised to learn that the current roof tiles were copied from one surviving tile from the original church (and they are beautiful). A must visit in Budapest.
very beautiful good to visit. I was please by this church because it is so beautiful. Plus you can enjoy visiting places arount it.

The location makes it worth it. The church it self is nice to look at, and you can get a couple of nice photos. Still, the church itself is not that spectacular. But, when you are on the Buda side of town, and go for the walk or take the cable car up Buda Hills, you must see this church. With the view over Pest from this side it is absolutely with it. You should stay until the sut sets to see the Parliament from this side, beautiful lit up in the dark. I didn't go inside, but there is possible to go to mass or concerts, but check the schedule beforehand as it is only a few hours every day.

Beautiful church.. Why the low stars, well i dont believe you should pay to visit a church, i dont mind donating but we entered around 16.30 got thrown out at 17.00. Shop shut at 16.45, had wanted to get a souvenir but once we had done our prayers and a quick walk around, it was closed. It is beautiful though. Dont know what the museum is like as they closed it early too.
Stunning - make sure you pay attention to the roof!. Absolutely beautiful. I didn't go inside but just for the colourful roof this building is worth a visit!

Fabulous church and spectacular views!. The church has recently been renovated and is beautiful inside-be sure and include it on your visit to Budapest. And the views from the ramparts are just spectacular. A great way to get an overview of the layout of Budapest!

Beautiful, beautiful church. This church is situated in Buda right next to the Fisherman's Bastion. The outside is stunning but wait until you get inside! It has some of the most beautiful wall and ceiling paintings I have ever seen in a building of this type. Definitely worth the charge to ente.

Tower tour. The tour up the tower of the Church was fantastic. 197 steps up the stone spiral staircase with 2 stops on the way up to hear about the Church. The view from the top is stunning & much better than the Fisherman's Bastion (so worth the extra few euros).

Matters Church is one of the most unique and beautiful churches I have seen.. The Church is basically in the Gothic style. As you enter there is a clean sweep to the High Altar unimpeded by structures in the middle seen is so many churches that in my opinion give them a cluttered look. All the columns, the ceiling and every inch of the church is painted in understated beautifully muted colors. There are Turkish, Art Nouveau and Hungarian motifs that all combine into a harmonious whole. Unlike the heavily gilded baroque churches that after a while begin to melt into one another you will not forget this Church as there are no others like it, at least not any I have seen.It is closed to visitors during religious services and there is a small fee for visitors when it is open. If you attend Mass you can enter for free. Concerts are often held in the church and we attended a beautiful Kodaly Mass on a Sunday in June. Viewing the church from the outside during the day is wonderful but magical at night.
Beautiful. The inside of the Church was a lot different inside than anything I had every seen. The walls were painted with a very distinct design that was quiet fascinating.

Church review. The church has several chapels and also a mini museum like a small exposition of different religious objects. The church has an interesting history and it is nice to visit it. It also has a pipe organ and someone is playing it. I bought a ticket to visit the church and the tower and it costed 3000 HUF per person.

Amazing Archiecture. If you love amazing architecture and history, you will love touring this cathedral. We took a walking tour through Viking River Cruise, and our guide and the tour were simply perfect.

Beautiful Church. Matthias Church is located within Buda Castle. Beautiful church especially at night as are most things in Budapest. It is one of the more prominent buildings that can be seen day and night from the Pest side. Located just a few steps from the top of the funicular. You must buy a ticket to tour the inside.

Beautiful church!. Beautiful church! You will see it when you visit the Fisherman Bastion. It's very tall, so if you want to take a goo photo, you'll need to stay pretty far from it. I am not sure if it worth to go inside though.

Beaitiful intetiot. Went inside and toured but did not go to the towers. Elaborate and ornate design. Offered student discounts which was worth it. Highly recommend going inside if you appreciate the architecture outside.
Impressive. Saw this stunning building from a Hop On/Hop Off tour bus and definitely next time I visit Budapest ( and I certainly will again) I want to have a closer inspection.

Stunning church with views just steps away of beautiful Pest. This church is magnificent -- the architecture is detailed and if you look to the top, you'll even spy a raven, the symbol of the ruling family once upon a time. The interior reminds one a bit of a mosque -- because it actually was one once upon a time -- for a period of time.The Hilton Hotel is right next door. Actually there are two in Budapest, but this one is so beautifully located it should be your choice. The square is filled with cafes and little shops, and the wall provides such beautiful vantage points to better view the church and the city. You could spend the better part of an entire day here.

Wonderful and Worth it!. The church has an extra ce fee. Well worth the fee. We did not purchase the added attraction of the tour and wish we did. We were pressed for time. Beside the main floor of the church, don't miss the side balconies and their special exhibits. Wished we had more tie to climb the tour. I bet that was be awesome, but the church itself was great.
Great interior . Lovely church with a gorgeous painted interior. £5 per adult to enter and some interesting artefacts inside. Extra charge to climb the tower. We didn't as it was another £5 each.
Lovely.. Matthias church is as beautiful from the outside as it is within and is right next to Fishermans' Bastion so you can do the two together.

Beautiful church next to the Hilton. The architecture of the building and roofline were magnificent. It was definitely in a prime location next to the Hilton, Fisherman's Bastion. We were able to enjoy a guided tour inside and we were awestruck at its beauty. It's unlike any Catholic Church in the USA. The cost of the tour was absorbed by Viking Cruise Line so I do not recall the admission fee. It also had a very a nice gift shop. Definitely a must see in Budapest with lots of other area attractions within easy walking distance.

Incredible architecture and history. A MUST SEE WHEN IN BUDAPEST!!! We did not enter the church, but we were in awe of the exterior architecture. There was a small ensemble of musicians performing which made the area that much more special.

Definitely worth visiting!. We toured the church and were even lucky enough to hear some organ music while we were there. Apparently someone was practicing during that time. The church is amazing. It is hard to imagine what the time and cost was to build something like that.

Great for arts, architecture and or God lovers.. A very interesting example of East and West. Magnificent wall paintings and excellent restorations work on damage done in World War Two. Warm welcome and great shop.

Pretty Church. We walked around inside Matthias Church for a little while. It's a very pretty church inside, but nothing overwhelming. If you are into churches, certainly worth a visit if you're up on the Buda side of the River.

Beautiful church. Matthias Church stands high on the Buda side of the river. It is beautiful both from the outside and within. Look out for the elegant spire and the colourful roof tiles. Inside there are lots of information points in English as well as Hungarian and there is an interesting museum detailing some important dates and events.Be careful to plan your visit as on our first attempt to view, there was a wedding going on and we had to return on a different day to see inside. Definitely one of the spectacular sites of Budapest.
Hill-top splendour. We walked up from the Chain Bridge [and back!] and it was well worth the effort. Take your i/d if you qualify for reduced entry charges
Beautiful. You don't want to miss the church and it's astonishing tiling on the roof. Just this make this church a must see of Budapest
Magnificent chrurch. This is a beautiful church in the Buda Castle. It is one the jewels of the castle. Check out the exterior and the interior, it is amazing! :-)

Budapest anniversary visit. Fantastic history and arhitecture but beware when buying entrance tickets!! The ticket office was selling entrance tickets to the public literally seconds before the church was closed to visitors!! Please check the visitor and service times before buying your tickets

I suppose you have to go here. It is one of the main tourist attractions, so you ought to visit this rebuilt church. There is a tower tour, which is extra. Buy tickets across the courtyard.Do go upstairs to see the exhibit of relics and get a decent look down into the body of the church itself. No extra charge for this.
Nice mosaic. It's one of the biggest attractions in the city. Unfortunately it was closed when I was there but I saw it from the outside. I like the mosaic of the church.

A decoration in front of Fisherman's Bastion. We arrived just after the sunset. The roof and the bell tower were shining, all building was shining. I think they brush it every day, to be visible from long distance. Magnificent.

Beautiful church. Had a wonderful evening at this beautiful church on the Buda side of the river in Budapest. It was very close to the castle area. Had an opportunity to listen to a wonderful concert that evening. Everything was great! Really worth a visit.

Worth for the views. Matthias Church is gorgeous inside and outside the building.
To get there, I would definitely recommend taking the funicular just before sunset, since the views of Pest are spectacular.
The outside architecture is amazing, with coloured tile in some parts of the roof.
Inside you will admire different catholic images worth the ticket.
Stunning Church. This is a magnificent Church with an intricately coloured roof. architecturally it stands out among the other buildings in Buda

Beautiful and unique. Please visit the inside.. This is a landmark of Budapest and a lovely one. It looks beautiful in the day time and at night when it is lit up. The inside has an unique decor and is worth visiting. Very unlike most church.

A historic church on the Buda Hill. This church was dedicated to Mary the patron saint of Hungary but named after the last great king Matthew Corvin whose emblem is the crow. During the second World War, the German troops used the church as a stable for their horses and it needed much reconstruction after the war. The roof is covered with colourful tiles from the Zsolnay factory in southern Hungary. There is an entrance fee for visitors mainly to help with maintenance but entrance is free for disabled visitors and church services (Mass). It is a Roman Catholic Church. The interior is richly painted reminiscent of an eastern style, almost like a mosque. During the Turkish invasion, there was a mosque and the statue of Mary was walled up. The wall collapsed during prayers and when the statue of Mary appeared the Turks fled. The church is a place of pilgrimage.

Too Expensive to go inside. The outside is beautiful as is the surrounding area. However 1500 Forints (around £5) or 1000ft for retirees is a bit steep when compared to the suggested 'donation' to enter St Stephen's. However it is still just about woth the entrance fee if you enjoy church interiors and is certainly very beautiful.
Beautiful church. Absolutely beautiful church, well worth a visit. There is some very interesting historical displays on the second floor.
Interesting. Interesting both from outside (nice architecture) and from inside (see the first floor on the left of the apse)

Lovely church inside and out but not worth HUF1500 entry!. A high price to pay for a nice but not outstanding church. Lots of people making a lot of noise. It was interesting but not worth the price they demand to go inside.
Beautiful . Beautiful church !! In a beautiful location i definitely recommend a visit you can get really good pictures and there is an amazing view nerby of the city

Not worth the price. I don't get why the entrance fee to St Stephen's Basilica can be 300 HUF and you get really beatiful views both from the outside and inside, whereas the tickets to St Matthew's Church are 1500 HUF... No comments. Luckily, the beautiful silhouette with marvellous colourful rooftiles can be seen free of charge.
Lovely Church. Lovely church and unique with spectacular artwork. Loved the way the walls were painted also the connection to Quenn Sissy.

........ nice building and motivation of those who regard architecture. I think it's not necessary to visit the inside of the church.The ticket price is 1500huf.the matthias church is near fishermans bastion

Stunning, breathtaking, eye candy so paying the entry fee was OK. I spent 1 hour inside this church because there was so much to admire, not only on the main floor of the church, but, also, upstairs for views looking into the apse area, for displays of copies of the crown and coronation jewels, and for the statue of Empress Elizabeth with her head carved so beautifully. The admission fee covered all interior areas. Note that on Sundays, paying visitors are allowed in at 1pm.I usually balk at paying an entry free to a church, but once inside I felt the fee was very worthwhile. Note that seniors pay a reduced entry fee. The booth for this payment was located on the side of the square and it saved time paying in HUF rather than by credit card. Attendants spoke English. The ticket was taken by gentlemen at entrance to the side door of the church so no sneaking in. The exit was at another side door of the church which also was "guarded". The first thing that I noticed when I entered the church was the use of painted or tiled colored patterns to cover every surface - the floor, the walls, the clustered columns, the rib vaulting and the ceiling spaces between the ribs. The 2 sections of benches in the nave were a solid brown, however, as was the carved and canopied pulpit. At first glance, the decor was rather overwhelming, but breathtaking at the same time. The patterns varied from swirls to naturalistic elements and reminded me of Moorish design, but were replicas of Hungarian design taken from a manuscript. The design emphasis it seemed was not religious figures or stories - that was the role of the stained glass windows done in a long rectangular Gothic shape and the gilded altars.I almost missed the Loretto Chapel at the very back of the church in a dark corner, because my attention was drawn to the apse and the nave decor. Again the chapel room was painted with much pattern - beautiful blue spaces between the rib vaulted ceiling - but the focus of attention was meant to be the Madonna statue which had been discovered hidden in the church's walls for protection from invading armies. When an explosion revealed the statue, the invading army felt defeated and retreated Buda. Unusual for a church was the side staircase that led to a balcony with a view over the apse with its altar, choir stalls, and an opportunity for very close up views of the stained glass windows placed around the apse. Another balcony offered closeup views of the vault ribbing decor and the nave below.Other narrow stairs led to rooms that held the replicas of the Hungarian crown and other coronation jewels, religious regalia, and my favorite, the sculpted statue showing the beautiful face of Empress Elizabeth. The church was also very beautiful from the outside with stone carvings over the 3 doors and on the main tower spire. I did see the raven sitting on a golden ring on one of the narrower spires, but it was the eye catching colored diamond pattern of the roof tiles that caught my eye. Not often is aqua used as an accent color in such tile work. The skilled carvings at the top of the spire on the main tower gave it a delicate filigreed effect. These details were hard to see from the square on which the church stood - use a zoom lens camera. Beside the church is the Fisherman's Bastion with its views of Pest, particularly the Parliament building which is directly across it. A stairway leads down to walking paths which lead the way down the hill/to other stairs to the town at its base. The church is located on a square that is about a 15 minute walk from the square where the funicular and Buda Castle/art gallery are located. It didn't matter to me that St. Matthias Church was newly renovated and that the interiors weren't original. St. Matthias Church was one of the most memorable churches on my Amsterdam to Budapest river cruise.
Have a beer in the park across. Nice church to visit. Walking distance from the castle. On a hot day in the park across take time to have a good local beer in the shade of the trees.
Great old church on the outside, absolutely beautiful on the inside.. Visit while on Castle Hill, and is next to the Fisherman Bastion. Beautiful architecture on the outside, ornate on the inside.

Coronation church. The church was recently completely renewed, it is now in its real splendour. You can't walk in, there is a ticket to buy. There are very good concerts too. This is the church, where the Hungarian kings got their crown. It is in late gothic style, built at the end of the 14th. century. Brilliant!

Great old church well worth the admission. Another gem in this city and well worth touring around. We did not pay for the tower climb here, which looks like it would be great, but it is really really high and a lot of steps.

Beatiful church. The church is one of the symbols of Buda due to its characteristic tower. The interior of the building has awesome wall paintings and tilings, most of them restorated in the past century. There's a nice gallery tour inside looking the tresaury and some balconees.

200 Steps to the Top. The ticket window close at 5 PM. I actually got on the last tour group to the top of the church. You can buy admission to three things at the ticket window, Fisherman's Bastion, top of the church and go inside where they were doing a small concert where you can sit a rest for a while if you are waiting to go up. I go to the highest place in a city I can find and this is it for Budapest. It's 200 steps to the top, no elevators like St. Stephens, so if you can't do steps, don't bother buying a ticket, but if you can, it's the greatest view of the city. You don't want to miss this place.

Beautiful church!. This church is a must visit while you are in Budapest. It is absolutely exquisite - both, on the outside, and on the inside! .. Take your time to walk around and admire its intricate architecture - you will be in awe of the Matthias Church's beauty!.. There is a museum inside which is very informative too.

Stunningly colorful, well maintained. Since I was on a cruise ship, I did not have time to study this before hand. I loved the colors and the lightness of the space. I'm sure there are stories behind everything and regret that I did not have time to explore them. Budapest really deserves a several day visit. One day is not enough.
Beautiful site. I loved the roof of this church. Since entrance was not free we just viewed it from outside .This is the highest point on the Buda site.

Great tour. We paid for a private tour of this church, and we are glad that we did. The man who gave us the tour was excellent, and I don't think we would have enjoyed it as much without a tour guide. After the tour with him, we took another guided tour up to the top of the bell tower. Again, the guide was superb!! The steps to the top of the bell tower are many and tiny!

Great Architecture. Lots of great Gothic architecture in Hungary, Matthias Church being among the top buildings. A lot of great features on the building and a great location. The road around the church is great for pedestrians and lots of small shops and restaurants in the area. It's on top of a hill with a view of the city.

Full of surprises. I have seen multitudes of beautiful churches and basilicas in Europe but this surprised me in it's uniqueness. The church is painted/stenciled designs and pictures on the stone walls and columns. Simply stunning inside and out.

A church visit which is a must in Budapest. I have visited a lot of churches around Europe, and Matthias Church is one of the absolutely loveliest! The present church in predominantly gothic style was built on the ruins of an older church in the mid 13 hundreds but was restored internally in a beautiful neo-baroque style with stunning interior paintings on the walls and the roof! The Hungarian kings were crowned here in earlier times including the Austrian-Hungarian emperor Fran Josef I.

Beautiful church. Beautiful church and surrounding by typical Hungarian houses. The village is great and nice to work inside. A perfect location to feel Hungarian spirit. Regret the high price that you have to pay to visit all the monuments.
Stunning. The Matthias Church is one of the most popular attractions in Budapest and it is easy to see why. It is stunning - it has a beautiful, vibrant tiled roof. And inside is beautiful.

A grand and magnificent church on top the hill!. A visit in Budapest would be incomplete if this place is not visited. We were here for a short and photo-stop visit after visiting Gellert Hill earlier on. And it was so crowded with visitors, both local and foreigners.This renowned Matthias Church is one of the oldest buildings in Budapest with more than 700 years of history and it's frescoes were done by famous Hungarian painters. Our guide gave us a detailed and interesting explanation of its history dating back centuries ago, its transformation and how it returned as a Catholic Church eventually!From the view afar, the church looks grand and magnificent. When we came closer, it was so massive and looked more beautiful and awesome. We were particularly impressed with the gothic with renaissance architectural designs and reminded of the ones we have seen in UK and France.Well, you need to buy a ticket to enter the church where you will have a chance to go up to the tower with a great paranomic view overseeing the city. There was already a long queue of visitors waiting to enter.As we did not have much time here because we were on a walking tour in the city, after staying here for a while (including a visit to the Fisherman's Bastion (which is just next to the church that also offers a bird eye's view on the entire city, which I will review it here separately and do stay tune) and Heroes Square etc, so it was with regret that we didn't have the chance to enter it.However, the feeling was great to see such lovely historical buildings and the city!Recommended.

Beautiful and you must visit the bell tower!. The views from the bell tower were amazing, though the climbing there was pretty scary for me since I have a fear of heights. The staff who took us up the bell tower were really funny and friendly. Church itself was beautiful as well.
Lovely church. Well worth a visit high on the hill in buds overlooking the Danube have to pay to enter but senior citizens reduced We walked from the Marriott got the funicular lLovely interior

Interesting History and Decor. We had a tour of this church and the Turkish influence was obvious in the decor. It was built to be a Roman Catholic church in the 14th century. When the Turks invaded Budapest it was turned into a mosque and the inside of the church changed accordingly. After the Turks were expelled from Budapest the church was eventually renovated and became a Catholic church again. The Turkish influence remains.
Beautiful. Must see! Whilst having great views just behind it this Church is one of my favourites. It's orange tiled roof has a certain charm that i just loved!

Absolutely stunning - rivals many more famous churches. It's been fairly recently cleaned and is pristine. The colours on the roof are simply amazing. If you can avoid tour groups definitely go inside too.

Really lovely in and out. An excellent visit - one of the places we most enjoyed in Budapest. I can't remember how much it was to go in but it was very reasonable and definitely worth it so don't miss it.
Beautiful and well preserved. Excellent place to begin a tour of Budapest with the stunning views across the Danube and parliament. The church shows its beauty both inside and out

Great looking Church. Since we had time in Budapest we were able to walk long distances and often got loss in the city. This church was stunning for beauty and covered only the outside. There was so much to see in Budapest, we had to limited time for going inside some structures.
Beautiful church. Beautiful church with spectacular view onto Budapest. Best way to get there is by funicular or public bus

A Beautiful Church, that hosts classical music recitals. A beautiful church set high over the city, we have been to Budapest before and attended a beautiful classical music recital. Well worth a visit.
Gloriously Beautiful Church. Lovely lovely church, great photo opportunities, great lunch places around and wonderful views.... Matthias Church has regular services which are wonderful.
Very unique, do go inside. I didn't have any expectations about the Cathedral. Something I usually tour in older cities. I was in total awe! Do go upstairs to the second level to see even more.
Beautiful church. I spent ages taking pictures from all angles. Does not disappoint. Only wish I'd had time to go inside.

Tops All Churches. I thought I done touring churches when yet another was part of our tour. This one took my breath when I entered. The colors inside and the roof on the outside are more unusual than others we have visited. You must view at night also. Be prepared, there are many tour groups visiting also.

Beautiful architecture . The church is beautiful and impressing! The colours in the ceiling and inside on the walls are calming and beautiful! From the outside the Church is breathtaking with the achitecture and artistic roof! It's a 'must' see when in Budapest

The only interesting monument in Budapest. The building is really worth a visit and can show t the visitor the past greatness of the city.
But I don't know which idiot allow Hilton to build s modern hotel with Subway sandwiches next to the curch?
Great church on top of Buda. This is next to the Fishermen Bastion and is a nice complement, lovely area to take a stroll and get a good view of Pest.

Amazing heritage. Beautiful classic church with rich history near the Bastion. Amazing views of the town and city from the Hill. Great restaurants too, lovely to walk and see around.
Just a tip, students get half price tickets for showing student IDs. Also, need to cover shoulders, they provide wraps.

Just lovely and surprisingly peaceful..... Hard to miss , on the hill near the castle and beside Fisherman's Bastion. Unusual brightly tiled roof, rebuilt post war.Excellent access when inside to angles and elevations of the church which let you appreciate the unusual painted interior.Several historic and unusual artifacts / treasures also to ponder over, Stayed longer than we had anticipated and enjoyed it very much. Did not pay to go up the tower, minimal cost of entry which was well worth it.

The Best Thing on Castle Hill. This church tells the story of Hungary in glorious color and architecture. I was awed by it, inside and out. It is a beautiful building from the outside, but do not stay outside. Inside, every inch is gloriously hand-decorated with stenciled designs. The stained glass windows are stunning. The history will bowl you over, from the first Christian king, to the Hapsburgs to the armies who dared to use it as a stable for animals. The way it looks today you would never guess the stable part, but it's just one chapter in an amazing tale. Do not miss this!!

A beautiful church. This brilliantly restored church shows just what amazing architecture and decoration Europeans are capable of. Rich in history, the stained glass alone is worth the visit. Women may be asked to cover up, so bring a scarf.
surprise concert. We just arrived that day and it was very fogy , the found out that at the Matthias Church that evening was a concert The Messia from Heandel, it was wonderful!

Beautiful, with an amazing view. The church is really pretty, with an interesting architectural history - we loved the roof and the inside the most. You can buy two separate tickets (bell tower and main church) at the booth to the right of the church, and you can also buy one for Fisherman's Bastion (a stone's throw away) at the same time. The bell tower gives an amazing view, and though there are stops along the way there is no lift, and it's a long climb up a narrow stair case. We had a great tour guide too, who gave us everything from the history of the building to restaurant recommendations!

not to miss. Very interesting, very different with all these walls and colomns peinted in these unusual colours and geometric patterns, make it mauresque and unique, I visited a lot of churches , nerver sawanything like this one Superb and Unique, a highlight in Budapest.

Beautiful Matthias church. On the Buda side lies the huge beautiful church of Matthias; this place reminds me of a fairytale, the winding steps, the architecture, the everlasting designs and colors...compared to the Sagrada, it has its own charm and a beautiful addition to Budapest.

St. Matthias Church. The inside of this church, like most churches in Europe, are breathtaking, but the photo shots from outside are amazing. The grounds are great for the photographer because of the surrounding monuments and Fishermans Basttion. We visited on a cold, windy cloudy day and returned on a sunny day and the blue sky with the clouds made for some wonderful photos.
Beautiful church. Well worth a visit, if only to admire the beautiful tiled roof. There are lots of places to eat and drink nearby, and there's a great view of Pest from the Bastion too!

pretty church. I feel that this church is almost the same like the basilica fourvière that located in Lyon. Because both of the church are located up in the hill and they show us a very good scenery of the city. If you want to go look for the scenery of the whole city, you can come to this church
Pretty but average. Nice to look around, there's a display upstairs, boards around give information about the history. Very pretty and worth a visit but do not think it is worth the money

Much better than expected. Like much of Budapest, the current structure dates to the late 19th century. That doesn't distract from the beauty of the fully painted interior. Go early to enjoy the lack of crowds and the atmospheric organ music.
Must go. What can i say? So beautiful. Will will never stop to taking pictures. It's not free and need to walk a lot

Love the roof top.. This church has quite the history and a story to tell. The lines are appealing to the eye and the tile roof is awesome. Unfortunately, I could not go inside as it is closed until late in the day on Sunday...

Beautiful, colourful church. Matthias Church is nearby Fisherman's Bastion which offers great views across Budapest. The church itself is beautiful - we didn't go inside, and reading these reviews now I wish we had - but the exterior is stunning also. The colourful roof makes this church a bit different from the norm. Definitely worth viewing in in the area,

In awe of its beauty. This church required a ticket, but it was only 1500HUF. There's an option to go to the top of the tower but it's on the hour and we didn't make it in time. It's a beautiful church and definitely worth it to pay to go inside. Ladies were made to cover their shoulders with a provided scarf free of charge.
Stunning. Matthias Church is beautiful, and unmissable. It's right in front of the Fishermans Bastion. Well worth a visit.

Good to see it from inside but tower is better . Mathias church is good but if you have seen many churches in Europe than there is nothing different. Better to do a guided tour of tower (only need to do 200 stairs but the views are worth it)

Beautiful Church. Visited St Matthias Church.A 14th century gothic romantic architecture catholic church in front of Fisherman Bastion in Buda District. There's a statue of St Stephen at the main entrance.Beautiful interior. Quiet peaceful place. Devotees praying. There's a shop selling rosary and religious items. Visitors required to pay a donation to the church before entering. Church maybe closed for religious function. About 20 minutes to complete.

Beautiful Church. I was stunned at the beauty of this church. The outside with its colored tile roof is stunning and then you walk inside......it took my breath away! Check when you are going, the church is not open for sightseeing all the time. When we went it was closing for the day and they only let me in because I asked if I could go in and pray quickly. I will be going back to take my time and see everything in the church. It is so pretty that I do want to see everything again.

Great View of the City. Even if you don't actually go in, the view from the hill is second to none! The church itself is beautiful but if you've seen one cathedral, this is just like the rest. Still, it's worth visiting.
Evening visit. We took the metro and a bus up to the hill. It was evening time. We could see the Parliament house and it´s lights. The Matthias Church we saw only from outside. It is worth of seeing.

Beautiful, walk along the hill and enjoy the view . The church is incredible and right near the Fishermen's Bastion, and Castle Hill. Make a morning of it. You can take wonderful shots of Budapest and the chain bridges if you come at night. A morning view is lovely too. Budapest is stunning anytime!

Do it. It's worth the money to visit. Impressive exterior and very cool
Interior.
To the left of the high alter is a museum that's included with the ticket price. Neat winding staircase and views
But your ticket across from church entrance (there's a discount if you want combined fisherman bastion ticket)

The most beautiful church! dating back to 1474. Beautiful Zsotnay multi colored roof, delicate spires in neo-gothic style. The interior has frescos, beautiful stain glass windows and highly decorated walls and ceilings. With the gold leaf trim, soring gothic ceiling and combination of patterns and colors it is really breath taking1

A piece of art. It was amazing to visit this church.
The wall painted with a special technic? Then the altar, the vitrals and the copy of the crown of the last king Stephen. It is in Pest.

So beautiful.... The Mathias Church has a very peculiar architecture, all colorful, very lively, which differentiates it from other churches. Also, it is next to the Fisherman's Bastion, another very important tourist spot that must be visited. The region is also full of good restaurants for all budgets.
One of my Favorites. I was very moved by one of the modern stained glass windows here. I'm very thankful to have gone inside. It's a stunning artistic church.

So beautiful . This was probably my favourite thing on the trip. The inside is as beautiful as the outside and it is in fabulous condition. Be sure to go upstairs where there is a lot of information and a replica of the Crown Jewels. You can get a guided tour but they all looked really busy so we wandered round by ourselves. There is a lot of information in English which was helpful. My husband went up the tower which he said was great.
Worth visiting. This church is relatively close to,the Castle and is well worth visiting, the roof is beautiful so remember to look up before you enter. The views from the church were excellent.
The Chapel on the Hill. Its roof covered with famous Zsolnay ceramic tiles, try photographing their reflections in the evening sunshine on the glass windows of the Hilton Hotel

Chocolate box chintz, with a hint of fakery...... All very pretty, charming, picturesque & photogenic, but....... apart from the odd brick & carving, the whole hilltop citadel is a movie set recreation of what some Central European dreamers imagined/hoped life was like back then. Great to visit, in that fairytale Disneyland castle kind of way. Lovely place, lovely people, lovely weather, lovely beer & fun, lovely, lovely, lovely, but empty.

Beautiful church. I wish I had time to go inside, as this church looked beautiful on the outside! Was right next to holy trinity column and fisherman's bastion. If you're really into your religious stuff and would like some nice souvenirs, there are shops just before you approach holy trinity column. However, keep in mind that they are quite pricey, so make sure you bring plenty of money with you if this is what you're interested in and would like some rosaries, crosses, plaques, etc. I regretted not buying anything from there as I couldn't find any other stores similar to the ones I found there.

The Gorgeous Matthias Church with beautiful views of the city and Danube!!. The Matthias Church is spectacular and the view from the hill is fabulous! I could stare at the beautiful tiles on the roof for hours!
Beautiful church. my husband climbed to the top, his pics were great, wish I had joined him instead of shopping for souvenirs

Highlight of Buda Hill. We thought this was the highlight of our visit to the Castle Hill. The church was beautiful inside and out and is well worth the visit. We visited it during the day as I wish we could have seen it lighted up at night. Nevertheless, we enjoyed it.

Matthias Church . Did not enter the church -unfortunately.. But - standing outside this majestic building left me speachless! It is so detailed and beautiful, words cant describe! Colored tiles on the roof, incredible tower, wonderful arches... A must-see!

Matthias Church. I froze on taking my first step into this astoundingly beautiful church - it is breathtakingly beautiful ! The gothic walls are all painted with frescoes, religious motifs and symbols and beautiful designs - definitely a must-see

Beautiful Working Church. Matthias Church performs a short mass everyday at 7am and 6pm. We are Christian but not Catholic and we attended the 7am Mass and thought it was wonderful. We have visited many churches in Eastern Europe that seem to now only be museums, it was wonderful to attend a beautiful, working church.

The church is beautiful inside and out.. I love the tiles on the roof. We climbed to the top of the tower and took great pictures of the city and the Danube. It was quite a climb but we're both 70 so just take your time.

Very Good. The church is again spectacular and you are allowed to take photographs inside the building. There is also a guided tour up the bell tower which is well worth going up as the sights from the top are spectacular

Famous church. Lovely church in the Buda castle district. Housed several coronations. Adjacent to it is the Fisherman's Bastion, which has great views of Pest, on the other side of the river, including the Chain Bridge and the Parliament building.
Lovely roof and interiors . This was one of the most beautiful church I had seen. Right from its lovely roof tiles to the interior design it's just beautiful. Definitely worth going inside.

Glorious, gorgeous, GO!. Without a doubt the most gorgeous church in Budapest. Plan to spend 3 hours on Castle Hill and see this beautiful church. So thankful we visited. No admission fee. Not to crowded. Weekday afternoon visit in the spring.

Fabulous but very busy. The Roman Catholic Matthias Church is one of the most visited buildings in Budapest so you need to be there early, late or for a service to see it with its intended ambiance. Lots of history for a site that has had a church there for over a thousand years. A guide will help but you may wish to just sit and soak up the wonderful design and decoration.Excellent public toilets near the access to the area (small fee payable in forints or euros).
STUNNING. up in the heart of Fishermans Bastion Beautiful church , one of my favourites.....take pictures from any angle and you won't be disappointed....
Beautiful. We went up the tower,as it affords you some magnificent views of Budapest.The church is gorgeous and a credit to the city.

Best Church in Budapest . Tours available every hour, we had a private tour with a guide and it was so worth it. We paid about $10usd/each for a tour in english. The tour was excellent!! Our guide pointed out specific details of the significance of paintings and told us stories about the restorations of the church. The stained glass is one of the most striking features of this church, the galleries contain very interesting exhibits (one is the replica of the crown jewels held at Parliament). The view overlooking the citty is fantastic and it also looks beautiful when lit up at night.

Most beautiful spot in Budapest. We spent many hours around Matthias church photographing the city during the day and at night. It is a lovely church, great architecture and beautiful views of the Danube and Pest.

Beautiful diamond shaped tiles. The slim and high tower of Matthias Church is visible from far and near as a spectacular landmark located on the Castle Hill.We only viewed from the outside during a late afternoon in very relaxed atmosphere. The church is beautiful but in my mind the most striking features are the diamond shaped tiles on the roof.Highly recommended along with the nearby Fishermen Bastion. Make sure to wear sensible shoes as most of the streets are cobbled.
Amazing. Is not only the church you must see but also the unique view of the city. I believe is more interesting to walk up there than take a bus or whatever...

Budapest's Sistine Chapel. We managed to participate in Mass here rather than a tourist visit however we were impressed with the fabulous decor and the windows and its ambience has to be experienced. The area around the church is worth a visit too. If on public transport take the no16 bus which stops yards or metres from the church. Spend some time here if you can.

Worth a visit.. We paid a small fee to enter this church. It was very noisy, not what we would have expected from visitors to a church. There were a number of tour guides who created much of the noise but it was an interesting place to visit, All of the walls are decorated which was an unusual feature. Definitely worth a visit.
Worth the visit. Matthias church is a very beautiful roman-catholic church. The visit takes around 30 minutes and I think worth a quick visit.

Must see! Get a tour! . I absolutely enjoyed my visit here! Gorgeous church with lots of history! I paid a little extra to get a tour, which ended up being just me with a guide. It was great. There's a lot of little, interesting features about the church you would easily miss without a tour. I recommend taking a tour!! And definitely stopping by!!

Stunning church!. My favourite place in Budapest, beautiful building both inside and out and set in the most stunning location. It's well worth paying for a tour up the 200 steps to the top of the tower for some stunning views all at a very reasonable price!

Several destructions over the centuries!!. This is a Roman Catholic Church founded by King Stephen around 1015. It was destroyed in wars, looted by invaders, converted to a Mosque and finally back to a church. During all these processes its style changed. Restored to near perfection it is really worth visiting.

Super church. Matyas Church was gorgeous!!! The painted walls and gold everywhere was beautiful. There is a really nice museum on the 1st floor as well which shows the history of the church. Also consider doing the tower tour as you get GREAT views of Buda and Pest!!!

Impressive both inside and out. This church looks equally amazing from near and far.There is an entrance charge payable at a booth opposite the entrance. The exterior is impressive and the location is lovely, right at the Fishermans Bastion. The interior features lovely painted wall patterns. There is a display on the second floor balcony, it gives a good perspective to the interior of the church.
A wonderful monument.. Mathias church is one of the most beautiful churches that I have seen. It is colourful from outside as well as from inside. It is very interesting slice of Hungarian history.

Bell tower. Take around 200 steps without elevator. You must be strong, but highly recommend cause we are very enjoy the Danube river view from the top of Bell tower of Matthias Church. The church had been renovated; therefore; painting is quite new and completed.

Lovely!. This church is soooo beautiful. I recommend you go to a Sunday service so you can also hear the choir singing. It is not a free attraction unless you go to mass or visit the church for praying. You just have to tell the guard at the entrance. If you can, I recommend you go up the hill to the fisherman's bastion on the funicular before the sun goes down to appreciate the view still during the day, then visit the church and the castle area when it's already dark and you get the panoramic view of the city at night as well.
Essential. One of the best sights up in the castle area with the breath of centuries and darkened interiors as well as half a thousand years or more old flags and carpets.
Interesting . The refurbishment of the church has been really successful. The stained glass is the most striking feature of this church and the galleries contain interesting exhibits.

Great View Awesome Church. Easily seen from the Danube in Pest but once over the bridge it seems like in another world with great views and history. The church itself is easily seen but the insides and outsides are an awesome sight.
Historic & Beautiful. Next to the Fisherman's Bastian, the church features the colorful ceramic tiles on the roof. The interior is also special - worth the admission fee.
Beautiful church. A wonderful cathedral size church elaborately painted inside. Certainly worth paying the small fee to get in .
Very unique church interior. A beautiful church with a unique interior. Well worth seeing.Unlike the interior of any church I've ever been in (and I've been in a lot).

Beautiful!. Couldn't go in because a wedding was going on. Would have loved to see the inside of this magnificent church. Great views of the Danube, and nice shops along the walk between it and Buda Castle.

Pretty church . A lovely church in a picturesque area. Small charge to get in of HUF1500, however we paid a further HUF1500 to go up the bell tower, 197 stairs up a tight spiral staircase with plenty of stops. Our guideExplained everything in an informative way. The views over the city were better than the views from St. Stephens basilica. The whole area here has a more relaxed feel. The street cafes and shops are quaint and this is an area we would probably stay in on a subsequent visit.

Amazing view from the tower. 800 years old church with 500 old tower. 1500 HUF for the entrance of the church and 1500 HUF for the tower. Worth every penny :) Beautiful vew from the top of the tower, be prapared for the 200 steps, but don't worry there are few stops on the way up. You can see the whole city and the tourguide is great, answering all questions, doesn't speak very load. The tour for the tower are every hour. Inside the church is very pretty. There are some treasures as well. Make sure you visit the Fisherman's bastion for only 800HUF, there is an amazing view towerds the church. The best confectionery is only 5 min from there: Ruszwurm.
The tiles are amazing on the roof. What an amazing church. The tiles on the roof just gleam with beautiful colours. Fishermans Bastion is next to the church.

Mixed beauty and more beauty. Each Church is a center of art in Budapest. And the Church of St. Matthias is not far behind. Beautiful construction whose towers seem to keep the main part of this beautiful temple.
Beautiful . Possibly the problem prettiest church I've ever seen, right in the heart of the castle district. The whole area around here is in fact stunning.

Beautiful, intricate church with a fun staircase. The outside of the church is beautiful but the inside is really stunning. It's very intricate and has a beautiful staircase to go up (a small one) to get up to a gallery area and balcony from where you can look out into the church. It felt a bit more intimate than the bigger churches, like St. Stephen's. It's definitely worth a visit while meandering around Fisherman's Bastion.

Well worth paying to go inside. This is a lovely monument to visit with lots of historical information inside. If purchased with the ticket to walk along the restricted area of Fisherman's Bastion it is slightly cheaper. It is interesting to compare the differences between Matthias & St Stephen's, neither more or less spectacular than the other but completely different.
What a beautiful church! Definitely worth the price of admission.. The interior reminds me a bit of La Sagrada Familia in Barcelona. Beautiful stone and stained glass.

Baroque on the Outside with a Turkish Interior. I've seen one too many churches in Europe and usually choose to admire from the outside if it isn't free, but this is one of those exceptions worth paying for. The interior colors and designs reminded me of the famous Hagia Sofia in Istanbul and sure enough it was once occupied by the Turks and used as a mosque. Completely unexpected from the Baroque architecture on the outside. This place is a photographer's delight from the colorful, modern interior design to the exterior appearance of castle in a fairy tale. This goes on my list of top churches to see!

A beautiful building, day & night. Came across this church as I was wandering around the area. It's a lovely building, with many ornate decorations and the roof is incredible. Look out for the birds with rings in their beaks. At night, it is illuminated and should new like a diamond. A lovely view across the Danube from this location too. Don't miss the Trinity column nearby
My favorite . A must see. One of my favorite churches/cathedrals in Western Europe. So intricate & breathtaking against a blue sky. Go see it up close.

Wonderful painting but medieval mentality concerning the dress code. I was very impressed by the Byzantine painting, that makes the church very colourful in comparison to other Catholic cathedrals. The outside is also very impressive, especially the contrast between the white rock and the coloured roof. However, I was extremely disappointed by the staff's attitude concerning the dress code. Outside, at the ticket office, there is no notice about any dress code. I went in wearing trousers and a decent top, with bare shoulders, and I was requested to put on a scraf (they had it there). There were a lot of people waiting to go in and, as I was surprised with the request, I did not say anything. However, I find this quite disturbing for an occidental country! I do not know if this is the policy or it was just some overzealous catholic member of the staff... It was the first time that anybody asked me to cover my shoulders in a church! Moreover, there was no mass at the time, so nobody praying could be disturbed by the bareness...By the way, earlier in the same day we entered Saint Stephen's Cathedral during the mass and nobody had any problem with the bare shoulders. After one week, I am still outraged by the request! I only met this kinds of requests in some monasteries in eastern Romania but, even there, they had a problem only with skirts that were too short, never with tops! I am very surprised to have found such a medieval approach to clothing in Europe!

Walking tour to St Matthias. Another amazing example of beautifully detailed architecture. The whole roof is made of different colored tiles. Simply beautiful! The interior of the church is entirely hand painted ! Beautiful! It is definitely worth a trip across the chain bridge to see this church ! We stayed behind and walked on our own. Loved it!

Very Interesting church. Beautiful and interesting both inside and out. You have to purchase a ticket outside. You can but a ticket for the Fisherman's Bastion there as well. The church can be viewed from all sides and each direction provides different scenes. The roof is unique. The inside has beautiful tombs, relics, and art. Well worth visiting. Beautiful views of it from Pest.
Great architecture. One of the most amazing sights in Budapest. Renovation recently finished. Recommended to walk up to the belltower.

Awesome monument architecture .. Great exterior design and very beautiful tiles on rooftop. One has to buy tickets (5euros per person) , seniors and kids less.But the church decor was amazing and well preserved .

Grand church . A church with great character and grandeur, a sight to be enjoyed with very impressive views across the entire site including the piazza and the spire. I recommend visiting here for the culture and spirituality. Superb.
Spirited Spire. The Steeple of this church soars through the sky and it is richly decorated. You can see it in combination with a visit to the Fisherman's Bastion.
A very beautiful church. The church is incredible the decoration is very impressive and beautiful and you must go up and visit the items on display above and take some pictures

Great visit. I personally didn't go in this Church but I think it is around 10€. For me the the building itself was enough and looks amazing during the day and night. It can get mega touristy but worth a visit while on castle hill on the buda side of the river!

A must visit in Historical Buda. This stunning Gothic edifice has been an integral part of Hungarian history and in consequence, has suffered the ups and downs of the nation as a whole. The current building was designed in the late 13th century, on the site of a previous church attributed to St. Stephen, the first king of Hungary. Over the centuries, and because of its proximity to the Royal Castle, the Church was the site of coronations, royal weddings and funerals. During the century and a half of Turkish occupation it became the principal mosque of the city, resulting in total destruction of the artwork inside (Islam prohibits representations of human-like figures, so all frescoes and sculptures were defaced or demolished). During WWII it was used by the German and later by the Russian troops and suffered serious damage as a result of such occupation and the subsequent battle of Budapest. Restored in the mid 1950s and again between 2006 and 2013, it stands today in all its glory. The clean restored exterior reminds us of the best of Gothic architecture; the interior still has extensive hand-painted decoration throughout the church. The Gothic Tryptich at the main altar is gorgeous, as is the sarcophagus of king Bela II and wife in a side chapel. It has a treasure/museum in the crypt and a fabulous organ, recently renovated. In addition to being a "working" church where mass is celebrated daily and weddings and other celebrations are frequently held, the church is the site of multiple concerts throughout the year. The acoustics are excellent the organ fills the nave with magnificent sound. WHile named after king Matyas (Matthias), the church is dedicated to the Virgin Mary.
A beautiful ornate church. A beautiful ornate church located close to the castle. A must place to visit. The roof has been made out of hand made tiles of numerous colours.

Rainy Day. My girlfriend and I left the guys behind and ventured out on a slightly rainy afternoon. The church is breathtaking. The adornments. After visiting the church we walked down a very bustling street and found the best shopping area of our trip Those interested in shoes will be especially happy. Reikert a very comfortable and rather expensive shoe in the US was a quarter of the price in the shopping area

Hungarian masterpiece. I have visited many many cities throughout Europe, but when it comes to architecture hungry really takes the cake in my opinion. This church is absolutely stunning to the eyes and the soul. Overlooking the Danube down into pest this remarkable architectural feat will not leave you disappointed.
Wow!. So beautiful!! We saw it during the day and were in awe by the grandeur of this amazing church. The pics of it at night are breathtaking.
Simple stunning. A stunning landmark from the outside and a stunning pained church on the inside. It's simply stunning. A must see for all visitors to Budapest

Very different interiors!. The inside of the church is painted all over with different colours and designs which make it unique. The ticket to the church and Fisherman's Bastion is available towards the left of the church.
Can't miss this church. Such amazing architecture and an interesting history. Go ahead and pay the (small) entrance fee if you're at all interested in either; it's well worth it!
Beautiful. Well worth a visit whilst in Budapest. Beautiful church, the colourful roof twinkles in the sunlight. Stunning views from the fisherman's bastion as well.

A Shining Jewel in Buda.. Decorated inside and out, the Matthias Church is stunning. Every surface is tiled or painted in patterns inside and the roof is a confection of colored tiles that are easily visible from the Pest side of the Danube. Well worth a walk around and through.

stunning. definitely have to see/walk pastthe bells sound amazingwhen we were there they were playing live music outside, was lovelyit is very busy with touristswe didnt go insidenot sure if its free or not

Stunning . Quite simply a stunningly beautiful building from any angle, close up or from a distance, even more so at night when it is lit fabulously as are so many of the historic buildings of Budapest. Purchase your tickets at the ticket office across the square, 1500huf (€5) for entrance to the church, very good value & for a further 1500huf you can join the guided tour of the tower as I did.
Very place to visit in Buda. Located in the top of Buda . Very interesting place related to the history of Buda . A lot of interesting sights around and a place that you will use a lot your camera !!
Impressive. Impressive on the outside, beautifully decorated on the inside. Do find time to enter the church. It is worth it.

Colorful tiled roof adorns this church. Impressive church which hosts the coronation of Hungarian Kings. The stained glass windows were lovely and the altar features a replica of the Hungarian crown. Definitely worth the admission.
Do go inside. Astonishing Art Nouveau decoration. And buy the guidebook to read the history of demolition and rebuilding.
Well worth a visit. Amazing church with lots to see. Lots of information given in English. Amazing decor inside. Buy ticket from ticket booth outside

Incredible!. This church is amazing. The architecture is stunning, however the interior decoration is unlike anything I have seen before.The entrance fee is 1500HUF which is very reasonable. Inside the church there are staircases leading up to balconies which also double up as a mini kind of museum with interesting historical facts about the church.Situated right next to the Bastion this area of Budapest was probably my favourite! Also, very beautiful at night!

A church with a view. Once you are up in the Castle District you will find no castle, but you will find this church which has been restored and now looks fantastic...and just behind it is a great view over the Danube across the rest of the city of Budapest
Awesome Spot. If you can only see one thing, this is it. The church is beautiful (notice the roof), surroundings are cool and the view off of the bastions is spectacular.
Beautiful. Once again the architecture and upkeep of this old church is impressive especially the roofs - beautifully tiled.

An important piece in a stunning jigsaw. An important piece in a stunning jigsaw of a cityscape. Really beautiful outside and in. It's well worth spending half a day strolling around this charming part of the city.
Do not miss!. This is gorgeous outside but nothing prepares you for the technicolour feast inside. Make sure you go upstairs too.

Magnificient. It's on the Buda side, on top of the hill, you won't miss it especially you are in the Castle district. The roof is beautiful similar to that of Vienna's St. Stephen's Cathedral.
There are many souvenir shops nearby. It's simply touristy.

Magnificent . Every time I visit Budapest I always make it to the Matthias Church, it's my personal favorite place of worship. While the exterior looks gorgeous, the interior is breathtaking. It feels intimate despite its large scale. Try visiting in the morning before hordes of noisy tourists invade it.
Best by night. I mostly enjoyed this church by night. Looking like a cinderella castle it sits next to the fishermans bastion on the Buda side of the city.

Breathtaking. I visited on a leisurely Wednesday afternoon, when it wasn't too crowded. I opted not to go on a tour, and instead read up on the church's history before entering. Even if you don't feel like paying the price of an entrance ticket, I suggest reading about its interesting background and admiring the facade anyway. Inside the building, the columns and stained glass are particularly beautiful. There's also a small exhibit upstairs, passing by a balcony which has a great view of the entire church. One of the staff members was quite helpful and even offered to take a picture for me, which I really appreciated.
Very pretty. I went inside and there is lots of pretty stained glassed windows, outside the building is very gothic looking
Magnificent. Words fail me, the beauty of this place, the spires, the elaborate tiled roof, the painted interior, just don't miss it...beautiful, beautiful, beautiful.

Ornate Inside and Out. This beautiful Catholic church, situated in Buda, overlooks the Pest part of the city and the lovely River Danube. From around the church the views of the city down to the river are breathtaking. The church is beautifully ornate inside with frescos, sculptures and carvings to delight and intrigue. Areas of the church have english language descriptions of the sights on view, very helpful! Outside, the roofs are covered in beautiful coloured tiles in a mosaic pattern that is unique in my travel experience. A magnificent building providing a wonderful introduction to the beautiful city of Budapest.

Beautiful church. Yes the church is beautiful -quite small but fully painted inside. Roof is fabulously tiled. I have visited before and I felt the same this time with having to queue for a long time to purchase a ticket from not very friendly sales people. You then have to negotiate a number of security people to get into the church (unable to just go in and pray!), make sure you go out of the correct exit door (otherwise told off!). Do go up to the museum part in several parts of the upper gallery which is included in the ticket price.
Amazing interior. Worth visiting because of the location and history. Inside is interestingly different. Good to go in the Morning before all the tourist groups are entering.

unforgettable experience. i went to the church for a mass at noon. it was much nicer then just go as an tourist. quet an exiting experience since i a lutherien not a cathlik. the church is nothing but gorgeus!!

Free Organ Concerts on a regular basis!. Matyas Church hosts regular organ and musical concerts. Many of them free. All, normally, listed at budapestfreeevents.com website. This season there are 3! series of free concerts featuring Jean Guillou and other renowned organists.This will take your experience of Matyas Church and Budapest to a totally different level. And all that for free :)NB voluntary donations are welcomed at the end of the concerts.

Gorgeous church but crowded.. We went as part of a Viking group tour. I think all the tour groups must go at the same time in the morning. It was too crowded to be enjoyable (Saturday morning in April).
One of the highlights. Rain or sunshine, make certain you visit this church. Far more worthwhile and better value than the synagogue
Nice & colourful chruch. This is a nice & colourful church just next to the fisherman's bastion, this is a nice church with colourful top… quite unusual yet very picturesque.
Spectacular Church. Wonderful architecture and unusual painted interior make this church worth visiting on the Buda Side. Lovely views across the river to the Pest Side.
a must see in Buapest. recently nicely renovetad, beautiful both at night and during the day, maybe the evening is even more splendid.a must see in the city of Budapest

Marvelous Church. Exterior of the church is very beautiful with colored roof tiles and amazing architecture, it is also said that the interior of the church is more beautiful. Unfortunately the day I visited, entry in to the church was not permitted for visitors due to some reason unknown to me.

Incredibly beautiful! . This lovely and colorful church sits on a hill on the Buda side of the Danube. The exterior is impressive, especially the colorful tiled roof. The view to the Pest side of the city is expansive and spectacular. I found the interior of this church more beautiful than many of the ornately gilded churches you see so often in Europe. Nearly every wall, ceiling, column and other architectural element was painted with a design or religious scene. There is a somewhat Moorish feel to some of the decorative painting. The stained glass is quite wonderful and the little side chapels and upstairs add extra interest to a church that will make a lasting impression on those who take the time to visit.

Absolutely beautiful church. It's hard to imagine how such a beautiful place was built with the tools available at the time it was built. Carvings, paintings and the tiled roof are stunning. If you only have a short time in Budapest - this is one stop you have to make.

Highlight. This church is stunning inside because of the painted stonework. I would have been disappointed to have missed this. I thought it was one of the highlights in Budapest, and set on the Fisherman's Bastion with such a spectacular view over the city, who could be disappointed?
To be seen at night. We walked all over the hill at night time, the ancient architecture with the lighting are just beautifull. The view of the city and bridges is romantic

A delightful and unexpected painted interior. Going into the church the impression of rich decoration is quite stunning. Very much of its time and reminicent of the English 'Art and Crafts' movement with Morris-like stecilled motifs and imagary covering the walls from floor to ceiling. A rather expensive enrtance fee but well worth a visit.

Amazing views both in the sanctuary and from the tower.. Well worth the time and relative crowds to see this amazing piece of inspirational architecture. Cathedrals of this time were designed to awe and this one does not disappoint. If you're up for the stairs, the views from atop the tower are breathtaking.
charming, beautiful. Definitely worth stopping by, the interior is beautiful, frescos are amazing. And the area is great to explore.
Beautiful piece of architecture. Beautiful piece of architecture with lots of history - a trip to the church is a must while visiting Budapest.
Such a beautiful building and a magnificnet roof.. Absolutely amazing architecture and a magnificent tiled roof makes this a MUST SEE place in beautiful Budapest.
Mixed media. Interesting mix of Moorish tiles, Byzantine painting and lovely stained glass, worth a visit albeit pricey for a church
Just as amazing inside as out!. Beautifully decorated, well worth a visit. Also, make sure you visit the gallery to get an upper level view of the church- FABULOUS!

Amazing Interior!. This is one of the more spectacular church interiors I've ever seen. Every inch of the walls and ceilings are covered in mideaval art. I don't mean Renaissance style paintings hanging on the walls or even Frescos imbedded into the plaster. I mean the walls and ceilings are painted in colorful designs--every square inch. It's an unbelievable site. They also have a treasury worth viewing that includes replicas of the crown jewels, which are easier to view than the real ones on display at the Parliament.
One of the beautiful churches in Budapest. This is a very beautiful church along the danube river. The church is classical gothic architecture.
Amazing architecture. The building breathes history. Amazing architecture. One of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest. Excellent restaurants around the Church.
Beautiful church. Fantastic church with beautiful ceramic roof, sparkling in the sunshine. Beautiful decorated inside and must visit the museum upstairs.

Beautiful Church . This is one of the most beautiful churches in have ever seen. Every single part of the wall is covered in the most amazing colours and golds. Definitely worth the money 1500HUF. It's huge and the detail is fascinating. It's so close to the fishermans bastion and two lovely chic cafes. It was fairly easy to get to by bus.

Stunning. This is one of the most incredible church interiors I have seen, the painted decoration is simply wonderful.The panorama from the top of the tower is worth the climb (200 steps) and cost (£5), but not for those who are claustrophobic as the staircase is quite narrow and steep.
