Another great sight. Walk around the entire old town area, take a tour as there is much to learn about, if your not already tired of Churches.

Great place!. This is one of the most fascinating places I have ever been . Budapesta has some amazing monuments and great food. Matthias Church is named after King Matthias and it was rebuilt in the 15th century. The location is really spectacular and you get a great view of the city, in particular of the Danube.

Lovely Church. This is a great church to visit when you are visiting Fisherman's Bastion. The church is beautiful. When I visited there was the most beautiful organ playing. I was able to visit and appreciate the beauty of the church. The church is not very large but it's definitely worth a visit. To buy tickets to enter the church there is building across from the entrance that sells tickets to the church and the top of Fisherman's Bastion. They do accept credit cards.

We did the steeple tour. Well worth it for the insight and the view at the top.. A great way to see Budapest from a very high vantage point at the top of Castle Hill. Do the church visit but make sure you do the steeple climb. Recently renovated and restored so a very entertaining tour.

The roof is unique. The restoration of the church was apparently recently finished when we visited the Matthias Church. The building has a great architecture with the awesome Budapest view. The roof has 250,000 colored tiles and it is breat taking. There is a Tourist Information office is also available across the street.
Beautiful Church. Really set apart from most other churches. Bring your camera and also try to make sure you can visit inside the church
Beautiful. The outside and inside are gorgeous. The inside walls are completely hand painted and the windows with stained glass. The small fee to visit is well worth it.

Better in the evening. One of the many panoramic views of the city. The locals seem to place these views in very high esteem. If you're staying at the Hilton you'll have an even better view!However, do not come here during the daytime as it is full of tourists. We walked up to this church from our hotel in the evening and had the square almost entirely to ourselves as we enjoyed the view beautifully lit up against the darkening sky.Do not pay extra to go up a tier for better views. The view is no better and free, from the square lower down.1500 Ft for entry into a church. Not quite Westminster (which costs more). You'll find the usual stuff here, religious statues and stained glass etc.
Scenic Church. Matthias Church is a must for any visitor to Budapest, its glorious architecture and design and stunning views
Very pretty. We stayed at Hilton Hotel and we had a view of this churche's roof. It is fascinating, so pretty, that i took more pictures of it than of any other highlight in entire Budapest :)

A very beautiful church. I will always remember this church for many reasons. First off it is over 700 years old. It is named after King Matthias who ruled from 1458-90. It is not a typical Roman Catholic Church. It is painted s beautiful palette of autumn like colors with patterns and motifs that make this church so unique. There are fabulous frescoes. The stained class is magnificent. In an alcove where a statue of Cici is, the stained glass flower type pattern is brilliant. We were blessed to have a docent sing to us in a small chapel that absolutely made our day. A gift from God.
Beautyful place, nice attraction if you're visiting Buda.... One of the main attractions if you're crossing the Danube to Buda. The interior is beautiful and well worth the time and ticket fee.
Dont miss it. Should get in and see all the details, and go over the 3 floors up. It deserve to be seen and in every detail. Impressionnate.
Gem of a Church. Visited with a friend. This is a lovely church and relatively inexpensive to visit. It is well worth going inside.

Pricey but beautiful. I did not rush to visit Matthias' Church as I was expecting yet another church. But it is truly beautiful, completely painted, I have never seen something like this. The ticket at 1500 huf is a little bit expensive, hence the 4 stars. I also climbed the tower and really enjoyed it, the group is kept small, I just regret the fact that there is no combination ticket or the possibility to come back later the same day, at night for instance.

Beautiful Church on Castle Hill. A neo gothic structure with colourful tiled roof Has been recently renovated so looks bright & clean Stained glass windows are a feature together with heavily frescoes walls

Enjoy night @Buda city. During stay at Budapest, we went to this building by taxi. This place is in the hill, so we can see the view of Pest area. Recommend to go in the evening when this church lightened up. We also can see the city in the other side of Danube river, so bright and exotic.
Matthias Church. This is an impressive looking and attractive building. Unfortunately we were unable to go in as we did not have enough time.

Small but stunning. I really loved the church! It's quite small compared to other churches but the exterior is stunning! It's full of small details and the roof is amazing with all different colours! I warmly recommend to go check this out :)

Unusual church with architecture from different periods. This is a"must" to visit; I am not qualified to describe the architecture however it is covered in stencil painting. One can only be amazed at the reconstruction after one has viewed the photos of the damage after the war.
Impressive church. I didn't have time to go inside the church, but it was already impressive from outside. It's locate just beside the Fisherman's Bastion. All area is pretty.

Magnificent. Do not miss visting this church. Make sure you check opening hours and allow yourself to sit, enjoy and observe. It is truly a magnificent masterpiece and a visit to the Castle Hill is not complete without it
Very Pretty. This and the Parliament for me were the best sites, didnt get a chance to go inside. Our tour ended here, impressive and colourful during the day and night.

Stunning painter interior. To pay you need to queue at the ticket office opposite the church entrance. It's not expensive. There are options to include 3 items. The church, the higher level of the Fishermans area and access to the bell tour. I think I overheard her say that last one was a guided tour at 14.00. Need to check. Also lots of steps. Stunning painter interior. We haven't seen many more picturesque churches. On the left hand side there is a "museum" section. That too was interesting and allowed you to get up to the upper galleries. Great for taking photos of the interior from high up.

Stunning Exterior. The exterior alone is enough to amaze one's eye. The interior is the icing on the cake. In an area full of beautiful churches, it isn't essential to enter the sanctuary. The exterior is enough.

Breathtakingly grand. I've seen a few churches and cathedrals in my travels, but this is definitely not 'just another one'. Absolutely grand design, unique fairy-tale gingerbread mosaic roof-tops, location on the top of a hill - a must see.

A must-see. The church is on top of the old fortress of Buda. There is a small entrance fee (kiosk outside across the square). The interior is stunning - definitely a wow-factor with its polychrome wall decorations and paintings. A bit like William Burgess meets William Morris in an explosion of geometric patterns and Gothic leaves and flowers. Inside (and up a flight of stairs) is a small museum of church plate and reliquaries, Do not miss this if only for the view of the church interior from above. The whole interior is outstanding even if it is mostly 19th century but restored in 1970.Don't miss the nearby Fisherman's Bastion (again not as old as you might think) with its Disneyesque appearance. Don't pay good money to climb up top for the view - just walk down to the left end and climb up for free and there's a terrace café there.

Most beautiful church . The interior of this church is absolutely beautiful. You have to pay a small fee but honestly it's worth it and it's not like any other church I've ever seen before. Its amazing!

Must visit. Church is church but construction is good , outside looking special and location at top of the hill and fantastic ... Just in front there is Fishermen Bastion and around 500 meters Castle located ... Must visit all...

A masterpiece inside and outside. We greatly appreciated the exterior of the handsome church building with its outstanding zsolnay tiles and although one has to pay an entry fee it is well worth the cost to view the interior. The wall paintings are magnificent and all in superb muted earthy tones. There are outstanding stained glass windows and a section of pillar from the original build in the 13th century. This whole area on the Buda side of the river is a delight to visit...it includes the Fisherman's Bastion, the President's Official Office and the huge Royal Palace. The use of the quaint funicular is an added bonus to reach the top of the Buda hill.
Its a big part of why Buda and Pest exist. Not big personally on Big old medieval cathedrals, but your there so take a few and walk through. You'll get a hand from the king for doin so...

Stunning. Stunning interior and exterior. Photos cannot do the colours justice (both inside and out). Tickets for entrance were really reasonably priced and the small museum inside was full of information.
Beautiful Church. It is a beautiful church; however, I am not sure I would pay to visit the inside again. Although interesting, I preferred just looking at the outside façade.

Beautiful. My fiancé and I visited Matthias church whilst on a break away in Budapest! Definitely pay to go inside..: it is well worth the money and the architecture is stunning! One of the most beautiful building in Budapest :)

beautiful church and beautiful music. As we were staying on Castle Hill on Sunday morning, we went to mass there. General visits (5 euro!) were not allowed until the afternoon due to services, but we just went in for mass.10am mass was 'with music' which was quite an understatement. Excellent organ, excellent choir aided by excellent acoustics. Very moving. And the interior of the church is also beautiful - my favorite of the many we visited.
Gorgeous. This is the most beautiful place in Budapest! I love old buildings and this church means a lot for me in my heart!

Amazing Inside and Outside. The outside of the church has interesting, colorful patterns on the roof but they are only a tiny hint of the colorful patterns everywhere inside the church. It is literally a riot of color and pattern. I was stunned by all of the patterns and enjoyed photographing them against the contours of the ceiling and the pillars. There is an interesting museum on three floors with balconies overlooking the nave. I would highly recommend visiting this church. I found it more interesting than most of the churches we visiting in Vienna or Prague or elsewhere in Budapest.

Another wonderful church. Another wonderful church, you can buy a ticket to go inside and another to go up the bell tower. Just 197 steps to go up, the steps are very small and you climb up in a twirl shape. It was fun.

Fantastic sight. A great warm-up if you climb to the bell tower (197 steps) :) Very friendly guides. Wonderful gothic architecture. Visit the gallery to learn about the history of the place and its restoration after WWII.

Not worth the money. It's quite a nice church. But the inside is far less interesting than the outside. Since you also have to pay 5 (!) Euros to go inside the church (!) I don't recommend it. I've seen other, much more beautiful churches around the world that didn't cost anything or only about 1 euro, which is reasonable.
Holiday. What a stunning church well worth the visit in a lovely location on the bus route but we walked and very cheap entry fee.

Stunning!. We didn't go inside here (purely because it was too nice a day outside!) but this beautiful church is just stunning - the roof tiles and little nooks, it is worth walking up the hill to see up close :)
Beautiful church on up on Castle hill on Buda side of the Danube. Beautiful church on nice square beside the Fisherman's bastion. Not open to visitors on Sunday morning.

Beautiful church . Very beautiful church outside and especially inside, amazing roof paintings and interior. It's worth to pay fees so you can go to inside and to tower. Spectacular views from tower and nice guide. It's about 200 narrow steps to tower!
Magnificent. A definite must visit. So much to take in and see and admire. A stunning and beautiful Church to visit! I would highly recommend.

Wonderful.. It is another must visit place. It is a really nice and beautiful church. The rooftop it makes this church unique. And the history of it, it makes it one of my favourite places in Budapest. I really enjoyed the visit thanks to the tourist guide who explained to me, everything about this lovely church.

Beautiful exterior, disappointing interior. The outside of this building is truly exquisite but there's not really much to see inside, so if you're limited for time, you can save some here. Wander around, marvel at the views from the Fisherman's Bastion and the statues. While you're here, nip down to the Hospital in the Rock which IS worth paying to enter.
Beautiful. Worth paying the entry fee because it is absolutely beautiful. The interior paint designs and floor tile is spectacular, so much to see!
Awesome architecture. Whilst being in the castle district, this is something you can't miss. Make sure you arrive there before 5pm otherwise you can't enter!

Take the tour to the top.... ...but don't expect a guide to actually guide you. Instead of just buying a ticket to enter, get one with the tour to the top for a great and different view of the city and mostly of the Fishermans bastion. Unlike what one would expect, the guide is just someone who leads the way and makes sure you don't linger too long at the top. The only extra you get is a short 1 minute "this bell weighs 4 tonne and was lifted in after the renovation" story. Absolutely no guidence in the church itself, silly.Try to go here on a day with good weather.

Beautiful, but.... This is undoubtably a beautiful sight. The roof of the church is so colourful and bright.But...Don't bother paying the 1500 Forints each to go inside. There's really not much to see. The inside is immaculately painted, and again very colourful, but other than a small museum with very little of interest in it (other than St John the Almsgiver's right foot - religion is weird) it really isn't worth the 'donation'.The climb to the top of the bell tower is equally not deserving of a 1500 Forint fee. You get such a great view from the Fisherman's Bastion for free anyway.Go see the church, wander around outside it, then wander back down the hill again. All for free.

Illuminating experience . Beautiful church with intricate spire and colourful roof. Difficult to frame close up because it is both long and high. Took a decent picture at night from the Pest bank using a long lens.
Original. It's beside the Fisherman's Bastion. And it have an original roof. But if it where somewhere else in the city. Probably I wouldn't have go.

Another Pretty Church. The outside design of the church is exquisite and pretty. However, it was similar to many cathedrals/ church in Europe. Would just recommend to pass by and take some photos of it.

Christmas trip. If you go to buds side you should see the Mattias church it is amazing place, and more important you should visit the tower that from it you can see a panoramic sight for Budapest... Really you will lose a lot if you don't visit it .
Outstanding. This is a truly beautiful church - absolutely stunning inside and out and worthwhile making a visit.

Gorgeous. First glance from the bus and I loved this building. It looks like it is straight out of a storybook with intricate work all over. There was a piano concert on the evening I was there - I think Sunday evenings around 7 PM typically. Worth spending some time inside

Stunning!. We have visited a lot of churches and cathedrals over the years - this one look our breath away it was simply stunning and we weren't expecting it to have such an effect on us! On par with St. Peter's in the Vatican for us, the detail was astounding. If you have to choose between this and st Stephens - go here!

Beauftiful church and location. We visited this by using the hop on/off bus when we also visited Fishermans Bastion. The location is beautiful and nice to visit as we stayed on the Pest side. We did not go inside the church but we walked around it and took some photos.

A jewel to see. The outside of the Church is already unique and breathtaking but the visit of the inside of the church brings even more beauty. I did it with my two children and they really enjoyed as there are interactive places with children dedicated sections which are fun and educational for them.
Church atop the hill. Although we did not go inside, the views overlooking Parliament and the rest of Pest are spectacular.
Lots to see and do here. Beautiful church and grounds next to Castle (on Castle Hill). Can take the inclined tram (charge) walk (climb) or escalator/elevator (free) to get there. Bring a camera.
Beautiful church. It's amazing inside. You can buy a ticket to go up the tower too, which has breathtaking views, but involved 197 stairs both ways so be warned!

Get the tower guided tour. We had a guided tour of the tower, and very glad we did. Our tour guide was a very bright and friendly young man - extremely knowledgeable on the history of the church and Budapest itself. This was among our absolute favorite activities while visiting Budapest.

A very different style of church and my experience about booking the guided tour. it's a very different church to those that we commonly see in terms of the graphics on the interior and also the roof on the outside of the church. Definitely worth going!!! Although it depends on personal taste of church architecture and style. I have attempted to join the guided tour of the church and sent two e-mails and got no reply. The staff told me that the guided tour is only in the tower, the inside of the church is not included. I did not ask about the availability but I know there were spaces (we visited the ticket office in the morning at around 11:00) as no one in our group is interested.

The most impressive church we saw when it comes to decoration.. Wow. The fact that all the walls were painted in a different pattern, you get a kind of psychedelic effect. Very beautiful and well restored. Worth a visit, not expensive at all
amazing goorgeous hungarian fothic church. lucky to have heard a pipe organ concert for about twenty minutes while admiring the interior stained glass windows and ceiling and wall designs.

Unique church- fantastic location. You can't visit Budapest and ignore this church. From across the river where we stayed it looked like an amazing castle on the hill, and it's just as stunning up close. The monuments outside and around it are fantastic. My family took the tour up the 197 stairs to the top of the tower- our best pictures of Budapest were taken from this vantage point. This is a must see. Oh but the stairs? Are no joke. It is lots of steps, in a tight little turret- not for the weak, or claustrophobic.

worthwhile a visit. it's a church nearby buda castle and literally next to fisherman bastion. so if you are around anyway, make sure you will visit. quite nice interior though I think the color of its roof is too funny to be used for a church. there is a small gallery inside the church, where you can have a taste of Austrian-Hungarian history. you can see holy cross and king's crown there, as well as a sculpture of a queen, whom I believe is Sissi Princess.

Pricey for tour. I just wrote a review for The Basilica and said it was pricey - but honestly, I got my churches mixed up. We saw so many! St. Stephen's Basilica was inexpensive - just 200 HUF per person to walk around and see the art. The ceiling there is gorgeous. This, St. Matthias at the Fisherman's Bastian was pricey to go inside and tour - about 2,500 HUF/person. But the interactive displays were good and there were many museum pieces and many rooms to look at.

Beautiful!!. Interesting history, definite must do. Take a camera, you will want many pictures. Take a climb to the top. The tour guide was fantastic, took group pictures of us at the top and was very knowledgeable. Great attitude!!!
Nice . This is a place to visit the painted walls and woods are just lovely and the stained glass windows are some of the best I have seen

“The church with the colourful roof”. We took the hop-on hop-off bus to Buda hill. Matthias Church is one of the famous attractions there located beside Buda Castle and Fisherman Bastion. We made a day trip there. The church was built in the Roman Catholic style. From afar you already can see the white bell tower and the colourful roof top that draws you to get closer. If you want to go in to explore, you have to get tickets at the booth across from the church.Happy Travelling!

Beautiful in and out. A must see for amazing restoration work. The architecture outside is spectacular and the glazed tiles are beautiful. When you go inside you see so much detail in the are coming of patterns throughout the church which must have taken so many man hours. The stained glass were absolutely fabulous.

Worth the price of admission.. We toured this church with a group from our Viking cruise. Outside it is quite beautiful and the striking roof and whimsical gargoyles are enchanting. Inside there is a warmth and quietude that is obvious. One can tour throughout the church walking up and down stairs and enjoying every nook and corner. The decor inside reveals its past use as a mosque as the usual Christian figures are mostly in sculpture and the walls and columns have a moorish look. Everywhere you look you will find a new and stunning viewpoint. I especially liked the Madonna room in the back corner.They do have a gift shop if you are so inclined.

Unexpected Interior. To get in you have to pay an entrance fee, which in my opinion is rather high, but once you are in, you won't regret the fee, because this church has besides its beauty a very special atmosphere. The interior is rather dark with a golden glow. You get a feeling of warmth and security. There is less noise than in other famous churches, so that you really can pray and find inner peace.

Exceptional Architecture. A stunning example of early architecture, the church is limestone, so it is very white, & the special coloured roof tiles create quite a picture. Set on top of the hill high above the river. Spectacular lit up at night.

I am Mesmerised By this Church. I love this Church. It has the most beautiful interior, including the walls, the windows and the ceiling. Allow 2 hours for this tour and make sure you visit every corner and balcony.

Peaceful respite. A beautiful church to sit and reflect in, opportunity to light a candle and look round the museum.I enjoyed the fact they had interactive information boards to tell you about parts of the building.You can also take photos in the church, the architecture and detail is stunning!
Absolutely Stunning. The building is stunning whether you are religious or not. The architecture is beautiful and the colours and overall effect were wonderful.

Fully restored Gothic Style church overlooking the river!. Scholars says Matthias Church rests on the site of an early Romanesque church which was built between the 11th and 13th century as The Church of Our Lady The current building was constructed of late Gothic style in the 14th century. Like many Christian churches, it also served as a mosque during the occupation of the Turks. It has had many renovations over the years and has been known by many different names. It was restored in the late 19th century and during that time period was renamed after King Matthias. The main altar in the church is decorated with a neo-Gothic Triptych. In the Loreto Chapel, beneath the South Tower, is the marble statue of the Baroque Madonna, I am not sure if this is the original or a replica of the original from the Italian village of Loreto. Either way, she is beautiful! Make sure you see both of these along with the sarcophagus of King Béla III and his wife Anne de Châtillon.There is an admission and you have to have a ticket, but it is worth a stop!

Beautiful . Lovely church ... Worth the visit and make sure you walk all around it You have to buy a ticket from the ticket office opposite. The monk will tell you off if you get get one ! Think you can go up to top of the tower, well the ticket suggests that's an option but it's all roped off .

Don't miss this place. Gorgeous church. Amazing wall paintings, colorful glasses and beautiful ceilings. This church is in a great state is conservation. You have to buy the tickets to get inside. 1500 F but it is worth. Try to go early in the morning to beat the crowds. You can also climb the tower for an extra 1500 F but I personally didn't think it was worth because your already have an amazing view from the Fisher's Bastion right outside the church. Not an easy walk uphill for the elderly. Certainly one of the highlights of Budapest, don't miss it.

Church in a rare gothic style for Budapest!. Matthias Church is located on the famous Buda Hill and is the tallest building there. Besides talking about churche's size, it is also important to mention that it is built in gothic style, which is quite uncommon for Budapest. When you will visit Buda Castle and Fisherman Bastion, you can't miss Matthias Church because it is located right next to other iconic sites of Budapest. Even if you won't be able to be on the Buda side, you can always see it form the bank of Danube on the Pest side of the city.

Most Beautiful Church in Budapeset. This church is absolutely amazing - inside and especially out. Note that the 33% discount to students applies to international students as well. Be sure to climb up to the balconies inside the church to see a small museum of artifacts and observe the church from up high.

More like a cathedral and beautify inside and out. Spend an enjoyable 2 hours here, looking at the friezes on the walls and stained glass windows. Also went up to the balcony and got a closer look at the ceiling, wonderful artwork.

Loved this place and the Buda side of the city. We started from Gellert Hill and statue and walked all the way to Matthias chuch and the Bastion...Great views, dozzens of photos so that memories are kept alive...The chuch was closed on that Sunday-27th of March as it was Easter for the Catholics...we just stayed in the area and took pics of the roof with the colourful tiles and the statue in fron of it...The Bastion provides you with great places for spectacular pics...don't miss entering because I have seen pictures of the church inside it and it is truly worth paying a visit!

Illuminated . The church is a real monument to the art. At night it is absolutely amazing once the lights are on and everything around is completely diminished compared to the magnificence of this church.

Gorgeous hand painted details. One of the most beautiful in Budapest, this church has many hand painted details from the floor to the walls. Some sacred relics can also be found here. This is something not to be missed.
Gorgeous roof! . Definitely worth a hike up the Buda side to get up close and personal with this church. Have to pay to go inside so we did not go in.

Great architectural features. I was lucky because we stayed in the Hilton next door and saw this church every day for a long weekend.If you have an eye for architecture this is a great place to walk around and look up at. It is splendidly lit at night and can be seen from across the city.

Super !!!!. Amazing colours, interesting architecture, great area around and the view is astonishing. You have to pay a ticket to get inside, at about 1000 HUF (aproximately 3 euros), but the inside is wonderfull!!! Fishermans Bastion is next by.

My highlight of Budapest. I love Gothic arcitecture, i dont what its about it. Its got somthing to do with age and with age comes beauty. This church is 1001 years old, although it has undergone 2 restorations you cant still feel the history from the inside to the outside. A visit inside is a must, as well as a walk up the 750 steps in the tower. The best views in Budapest i would have to say! Roughly £7 to visit the interior and the tower as a double ticket. You can make it a triple and also include the fishermans bastion ( They started charging an entrance fee from march 16th 2016) Enjoy your time in this beautiful area of Buda!

Amazing building.. This Church is simply beautiful. Look at the outside roof. Just splendid. By a ticket at the nearby counter and visit the insid of the Church. Amazing. It took +/- 2hours for the visit.

Simply marvellous!. This should be one of the top priorities visiting Budapest! Take your time to take in the complex asymmetrical architecture both inside and outside, pay attention to the artistic details and the history behind this landmark.

Perfect for history buffs. Very interesting history....it dates back to the 13th century and named after King Matyas. I would recommend this place for anyone into history. It was once a mosque when Budapest was ruled by the Turks. The detailed gargoyles are my personal fave keep your eyes open for them.
Very good building. The building is charming, and locqted in the top of the city where you can see the city from topnpoint, i didn't enter it i think there was a tickets

A China Silver ware design on a Church. Though I did not go into the church what caught my eye is the really colorful design of the roof pattern. It is like a intricate China design on a classic silverware. The walking tour starts here for the Buda side in the afternoon and it is a landmark that you will not miss.

A must see if in Budapest. Fantastic church with wonderful decorations it is well worth the money, add the Bell Tower to the ticket and you get to climb the 200 narrow steps to the top of the tower and have fantastic views all round. The climb is in 4 stages and not for anyone who is not fairly fit as once you start going up there is not much room and you can not simply turn around and go back down, there is also no hand rail. All that said if you can get up there then do it, you will be glad you did.
Beautiful . Beautiful church! Amazing to see the artwork inside. Beautiful! Useful plaques in English that explain history and what you are seeing on the walls

Absolute must to see. This cathedral is a must to visit when in Budapest, recently refurbished, looks like newly built on outside as on inside. It is cool to up on gallery! Entrance 5 Euro is worthed if you like churches...not expert on artwork but truly hope that they followed what needs to be in order to make authentic restoration! Great view on lower city from the cathedrals area!
Gorgeous building!!. So beautiful! looks very new and clean. Defiantly worth a visit up there, also nearby is the hospital in the rock which is also a great thing to see.

Historical church. Matthias church hosted so many nations and important figures during many centuries. Sometimes used as mosque, than converted to church. Inside so beautiful, full of sculptures and paintings. Every time full of tourists, need to pay a small amount to see that church.

A piece of history. Beautiful church in the heart of the castle district. If you have the chance attend one of the many music events they have there. Beautiful atmosphere with combined with nice music.
Amazing Church. Wonderful architecture and very close to the Fisherman's Bastion and Buda Castle. Lovely square just outside church.

love it. My grandparents live close by so we visit this church very often, and my mum always says.. ohhh it's so beautiful :D and yeah this one is definitely the best looking church especially at night

Stunning Matthias Church ...thru Centuries of resilience !. At the heart of Buda's Castle district, next to the Fisherman's Bastion, is the stunning church with centuries of resilience....the history of 'Mary wonder' is very moving....along with other endurance highlights throughout different era's over 800+ years..

Very nice to see. One of the things you have to do in Budapest is to visit Matias Church. The outside of the church is beautiful. It makes you feel small!! Also, visit the inside of the church. A really nice church with big history. You will find also a kind of museum in the church, which I found interesting.

Just Amazing!!. I was totally blown away by this utterly unique church. I have never seen such a combination of geographical patterns and colours on the walls and columns. The stained glass windows are beautiful too. As soon as I walked in my jaw literally dropped. I took heaps of photos and everytime I look at these I can't stop smiling! What a place... do not miss this experience!

Grand!. I did not get the chance to go inside and I'm so sad I missed it! The view of this church from outside is beautiful and makes you feel so small. My group only got a glimpse of it as we were pressed for time, but if you get the chance, go inside! It is even more impressive than it seems.
Beautiful Church!. Go there early in the morning (specially during the summer) because it is really crowded !! It is worth to visit !
Unusual church. Loved the roof tiles. So stunning. No problems with crowds mid-afternoon. Lovely coffee/tea house nearby
Buetiful Church with good museum. Worth doing the spire which is a t certain times so check at the ticket office cost of entry is about £7.00
Lovely church. Beautiful church, there is a fee but it is worth it, right next to fishermans bastion which is free. Great photo opertunities

Stunning at night.. We were here visiting Fisherman's Bastion and as Matthias Church is very close we thought we would visit the church also.The church is absolutely stunning with an unbelievably beautiful exterior that commands attention and the interior is just fabulous with super frescoes and details that show up at every turn.It's certainly very popular with tourists and on our visit there were hundreds of people milling around. Viewed at night and the church look's magical bathed in light.The views from the church are awesome looking down onto the mighty River Danube. A superb must go tourist attraction and destination and well worth checking out.
Beautiful Church. A stunning church. Sundays they have free concerts which are certainly worth the time to enjoy the acoustics and the architecture.

Beautiful place. Loved this church. It's so grand. I loved how everything and I ran EVERYTHING was painted in the lovely designs. I just wonder if it's actually used as a church now or just a tourist attraction. It would be a shame for it not to be used, however I didn't think to ask at the time.

Be sure to climb to the top of the steeple. This church is in front of Fisherman's Bastion, and a sight you will not want to miss. The architecture is beautiful, and the ceramic tile roof is picturesque. The climb to the steeple is 200 steps, and we took the guided sightseeing tour. Definitely worth it, since the view from the top overlooks the Danube, Margaret Island and the city.Would definitely recommend.

Very different to any church interior I have seen before. The Matthias Church is an impressive building from the outside but the interior has every wall decorated in a way that we believe UK churches were pre-reformation. Well worth a visit with only a small entrance fee.

Pretty Church. The Matthias church is most beautiful. Can see why it was once called the coronation church.Hard to believe it was in disrepair upto the 70s prior to The Hilton coming to castle hill and providing the funds to renovate as part of the deal for the land. The colourful roof tiles and steeple, are splendid. On the higher floors of the church you can see roof and floor tiles, and ceiling boarding close at hand.You buy tickets to enter across the square for 1500 each. Most descriptions are in English as well as Hungarian. You can then climb up the stairs to get to the Gallery and museum area. Look out for the mummified foot in its display case. Also church robs on display and close to look at behind glass cases.Great views from the second -and third- floor levels looking out on to the main interior.
so colourful. well what a church and so colourful never seen any thing like it before a must see I didn't climb the tower but you can do

Beautiful inside and out.. Beautiful roof tiles and steeple, as well as building, from the outside. You buy tickets to enter across the square for 1500 each. Inside the walls are colorfully decorated. I much prefer a lot of marble. I didn't notice any here. Most descriptions are in English as well as Hungarian. At the back right is the Loreto Chapel with a1515 statue of Mary and Jesus. At the front left side ground level, are several small ornate gilded silver pieces. You can then climb up the stairs to get to the Gallery and museum for some more exhibits as well as great views from the second -and third- floor levels looking out on to the main interior.

Beautiful. I didn't even go inside Matthias Church but I could have spent all day looking at the roof outside. Simply amazing. Totally and utterly beautiful. Well worth a visit and everything in that area is just wonderful!
Beautiful church. Very nice to see and took some lovely photos. Only saw the outside as personally not my thing to go around inside. Nice cafes nearby and views of pest.

unusual inside and out. The unusual roof tiles in different colours grab your attention from outside this church . Inside the walls and floors are highly decorated - well worth the small admission fee

Beautiful Church. It's a nice church, but not nearly as nice as St. Stephen's across the Danube. Furthermore, St. Stephen's does not charge for entrance and this one does, for an inferior experience at that. Worth the price of admission, still.

Ornate church with lovely stain glass. Named after King Matthias who was married twice in this church, Matthias Church is beautiful. With ornate stained glass decorating the insides, the entrance fee is well worth it. The church was redone in the past few years which is why everything looks new. The exterior has a beautiful tiled roof and a bell tower.
A magnificent church. Worth taking the time to have a good look through the church. Some stairs & narrow passages but overall accessible. History buffs will enjoy it.

Spectacular Exterior. The exterior is breathtaking with bell tower dominating the skyline when viewed from near the parliament in Pest. Interior less ornate than the exterior suggested it might be and 1500 HUF entrance fee.
Beautiful church !. Well worth paying to go in as it was very large and impressive. Lovely café for food and drinks as well but think it was very cheeky to charge customers for using toilet.

My favorite church ever!. I love to tour beautiful churches, and I have visited many all over Europe, but this one really blew my mind! The interior is truly one of a kind and it's simply massive with plenty to explore.
Quick . This tour and visit didn't take our family of 4 very long. We enjoyed the climb up the twisty stairs and the amazing views.

Small but impactful Church. Standing from 1060, this church as gone several renovations over the past 1000 years, but it last update leaves a stunning interior and frescoes that must be seen. Small nave with details all around the 5 euro entry gets you into the interactive museum and gallery that provide both history and details of the church. Worth the admission price.

Matthias Church is a must to see in Budapest. Here you feel all the beauty of the hungarian architecture and how this country was great in the histry of Europe. The roof design is particularly a masterpiece

This church was a lovely surprise. The cost was 1000 frts for seniors and 1500 frts regular entry. Inside the columns and walls were handpainted and very decorative. You could go up to the gallery and look down.
More beautiful, passionate architecture. We didn't go inside this church, but from the outside you can see the superb architecture and also take great photos
Beautiful church!. This is a gorgeous sight by day but also I took some stunning photographs at night time. Worth a visit!

Tourist must-see. Another breath-taking church in Budapest, highly recommend seeing it. There's an option to enter for around 5e or to do a tour of the tower. 5e entry gives you access to the main church and 2 levels above it, but not the tower.

Stunning decor inside. From the outside its an attractive church but doesnt really look anything special. Inside was a real surprise. The whole inside is beautifully painted, you have to see it to get the scale. Well worth the entrance fee. We spent a long time there.

Beautiful building. We were staying in a hotel near here, so this was the first thing we did in Budapest. It is well organised with ticket booth outside in the square (like Milan if you've been there) and they take credit cards unlike St Stephen's over in Pest. The building is very ornate with painted stonework inside and definitely worth a visit. It is one of the many floodlit buildings at night.

Beautiful building but it's still just a church.. I have been traveling extensively throughout Europe and have seen so many churches so I was not overly impressed. I personally did not go inside because you have to pay and if you ask me there are far nicer churches in Europe that are free. That being said, you need to walk around in this area so you should stop here for a photo.
Church like many others in europe's capitals. i . Church like many others in europe's capitals. It"s not worth to pay for entrance because in Budapest you will find many better tourist atractions
In Buda Hill. The Church is so rich in architecture..It is in Buda Hill . Though u have to pay for tickets , it wortha visit..there is a spl offer for students
Beautiful Church - must see!. Incredible inside and out - well worth paying to go inside! The history is great, walking around it is fantastic.

Magnificent Church . Yet another one if the magnificent churches you can find around Budapest. Intricate designs and carvings bear testament to the passion they had for dedication to design and the spiritual. What a rich culture and heritage.
Definitely. The idea of going to Budapest and not stopping here and at St Stephen's Cathedral seems completely foreign to me. This is a must see.
Stunning Architecture. This building knocked me off my feet. Quintessential Budapest with a beautiful colorful tiled roof. Right next to Fisherman's Bastion.

Stunning church!. I'm not religious and I normally find churches pretty dull places, but this one is an exception. From the moment I stepped inside I was blown away by how stunning it was. Definitely worth a visit!

One of the top attractions in the Buda Castle. Beautiful neo-gothic cathedral holding Hungary's beloved kings name and hosting several elegant weddings. Free for worshipers, but tourist pay a fee to see more.
Wow!. The structure is amazing that I was left speechless. The inside of the church was even more especially the decaying foot. Argh that was freaky!

Lovely on the outside and inside. The outside of this church is more impressive than the interior but it is still worth a visit inside as there is quite a lot to see with the exhibitions they have on inside. However one of the main things that we liked about this church was the beautiful roof with the glistening tiles.

Must see in Old Town.. Beautiful architecture inside and out. Well worth the equivalent of just under £5 to spend 30 mins looking around and getting some photos. Tickets purchased from the modern stone clad building on the opposite side of the church square. The church is in the same square as the Fisherman's bastion so you can easily combine the two.
Beauty of history. This church is a must see objective, so impresive, a building with a lot of lace on the walls showing to all of us its beauty

Outside much nicer than inside. The outside is lovely, butvthe inside is not that noteworthy. Certainly not after visiting the breathtaking St. Stephans Basilica. On top of that, this church charges an entrance fee which for me was not worth it.

Lovely, lovely, lovely. We had visited Budapest, and Matthias Church, many years ago and I must say that our visit this time was much more enjoyable. It is challenging to find detailed guides to sites in the city, but the information provided on the placards at Matthias Church was informative and interesting and the displays in the church museum added details for visitors who were curious.

One of the Oldest Churches in Hungary. This church is absolutely a must see. It was originally built by the first Christian King of Hungary. Destroyed and desecrated by the Muslims who occupied Hungary for 150 years it was rebuilt properly in in the late 1800's. I have attended many weddings of friends here, it is a special place. Go see it.

An impressive church. This church is impressive both inside and out. Positioned high above the Danube River this church can be seen from most of Budapest and has a panoramic view of the city. The inside of the church is stunning.

A beautiful church in the old city. This church is located next to the Fisherman`s bastion which makes it a natural sight to do while you visit the bastion. The architecture is amazing and the bells enjoyable. I think this is a nice sight to check out, especially since you can visit the fisherman`s bastion in the same go and also take a nice walk around the old city.

Beautifully restored. Matthias Church (Church of our Lady) like many churches in Europe, is full of rich history and has seen many restorations. While the exterior of the Church is impressive with the beautiful roof tiles and towers, it is well worth the small entrance fee to go inside. What you see is just amazing ...
Beautiful!. You'll probably only spend 1 hour max in this location but the church is beautiful! This was our favorite area to visit.

Beautiful during the day, stunning at night.. We visited this church during the day, then after visiting the Hospital in the Rock in the evening, we were surprised to come around the corner and see it all lit up. Bought tickets to see the inside and it was very nice. Cute little gift shop and some guy's mummified right foot is in one of the back rooms (if you're into that sort of thing).

Magnificent building with an impressive history. The Matthias church dates from the 1200's and has been enlarged and improved since then by many Hungarian rulers. The church plays an important part in Hungarian life because it is here that various kings were crowned, or as our guide said .."they were coronated". Inside the church it is simply stunning and with the high vaulted ceiling the echoing sound of singing voices is marvelous.There is a small charge for entry and it should be on everyone's to-do-list.

Lovely church with interesting museum exhibition. Perfectly situated on the top of Buda hill overlooking Danube this lovely church is equally interesting outside as inside... Intricate Gothic decoration on the facades, lovely stained glass, interesting museum exhibition inside... well surely worth a visit... and make sure that you take a walk along old Buda picturesque streets and enjoy lovely views from nearby Fisherman Bastion
Utterly Stunning!. Since it has been re-done the interior (and exterior) of this church will take your breath away! One of my highlights of my trip to Budapest!

A beautiful church, worth going inside!. I paid the small admission fee and had a look around the premises. Took some beautiful pictures which resemble some of the great churches you see in Rome. Parts of the church have also been turned into a mini museum, with some precious items. Worth checking out.
Amazing . This is a very beautiful building, if you are in Budapest you must go and get some great pictures. If you are in the centre you can get the bus no.16 from near the sofitel.
Climbing the Tower. The climb was well worth the view. Our guide was excellent with a good sense of humour and full of lots helpful information about other attractions

Best church on Budapest!. This is a must visit in Budapest. The building itself is impressive and sports some amazing features. The real jewel though is inside. It's simply breathtaking. Look for pictures and you'll know what I mean.
A grogeous gorgeous church. We did not go inside, however I believe you can! Absolutely gorgeous, such lovely architecture and I would recommend if sightseeing in Budapest.

Worth visiting. Beautiful painted interior. Lots of information boards in English so that is really helpful. Unusually you can go upstairs to the Royal box and galleries to get great views into the church.

Worth the climb!. We visited as part of the free walking tour. It's quite a climb up the hill in Buda - but well worth it for the architecture and magnificent views across the Danube
Def recommend

Stunning . Matthias church is simply beautiful. First glimpse of inside is absolutely breath taking the amount of detail in every single inch. Information on the history of the church is displayed all around and is very interesting read. There is also a gallery and a museum type area upstairs with some beautiful artefacts. There is a small admission price. But worth it.
Breathtaking . I enjoy visiting churches in different countries and this is by far the best I've seen. You will be amaze at its structure and height! A definite to do in Buda!

Nothing out of this world. I ve been there yesterday, it is a nice church, but if you are short of time, its not worth it at all. You have to pay to get in there (the basilica its for free and its way much better)

Hauntingly Beautiful !. Saw a heck of a lot of Churches, Cathedrals, Basilicas, Mosques, Chapels, Monasteries , Nunneries , etc, etc on our travels but this one ticked all the boxes ! A real pretty Church is the best way I can describe it and it complements the surrounding area ! The Church dates back to 1246 AD and has survived the Ottomans & many others and was the focal point of Buda for 770 years , and saw the last Hungarian King Charles IV coronation to name one !

This place is stunning.. Every nook and cranny in the church is covered with decorations, it actually becomes too much after a while, as you just can't take it all in. The Mary Gate is probably the oldest part of the church and there is an impressive Gothic carving depicting the assumption of Mary. The church is also known as the Church of Our Lady. If you wish to see the higher levels there are a lot of narrow steep stairs but it is definitely worth it.

Beautiful church with gorgeous details and roof. The roof is so unique and colourful! Each detail of the façade is so pretty and the overall is magical. A church for kings and queens, and the views from there combined with the Fishermen's bastion would make a perfect place for something like.. Proposing to your other half? No no I haven't been proposed there as I'm already happily married but for those thinking of a special place and happens to be in Budapest.. Why not? Super romantic!
Stunning. This chuch is next to Fishermans' Bastion. A stunning bulding you will admire as you walk through the slated streets.
Beautiful. We didn't go in as there was a mass. This is a fee paying building. Beautiful to look at especially lit up at night.
Amazing . This is some of the most amazing art work I have ever seen. Very pretty and full of lots of stunning colours. Would highly recommend.
Beautiful!. Great place to visit, no need for a guide since all the information is already available in the church. Make sure to also go upstairs and see the "museum"!

Best viewed late evening. As most things in Budapest it is magical at night. However, the church closes in the evening. Therefore it is best to visit the church in the evening and then have a coffee / muld wine at the cafe next door and then see the exterior at night. The view of the pest side is fantastic.
Stunning . Beautiful church from the outside and right next to the Fisherman's Bastion. When lit up at night it is amazing
stained glass windows. amazing church with lots of stained glass, inside is a must. lots of stairs but optional if you are handicapped.

Worth Visiting!. Matthias Church is beautiful and interesting inside. The price of admission (purchase tickets across the plaza from the righthand side of the church facing toward the river) includes exhibits in the treasury with good descriptions of the items in English.

197 steps to the top of the tower!!! WHAT A VIEW. We didn't visit the church, but climbed the tower. You walk up 197 spiral steps to reach the top, these narrow as you go high. It is very steep, but the view at the top is spectacular and worth every minute of the climb as you have a 360 view over the city.You get to fully appreciate the beautiful roof of the church. The guide was very knowledgeable and engaging, he climbs the tower 5 times a day so is able to go quite quickly!!

Beautiful church. We didn't bother with the inside of this church but indulged our eyes in feasting on the roof of the church which is stunning tile pattern in an array of colours. It is the most unique roof patter I have seen and the views from the church over the city are stunning.

Matthias Church. This church left me breathless, such a beautiful structure with interesting architecture, truly unique. It lies within the castle district, so it's near other attractions like Fisherman's Bastion and Castle Hill.
One of the most beautiful church in europe. Probably one of the most beautiful church iv ever seen in europe, the roof is similar mosaic tiles like st. Peters cathedral in vienna.

Beautoful. What a beautiful building! We stumbled upon this by chance en route to a wine tasting not far from this area. The detail of the architecture is stunning and the roof of the building is so colourful. We were luck to catch a view of this in the day light and at night, all lit up. You can climb a few steps for an even better view! Recommend for a visit.
beautiful places. wonderful venue. most of the night. quiet and peaceful. romantic. The most beautiful part of Budapest.Matthias Church a true work of art. wonderful country , wonderful building.

A very beautiful experience.. Visit this beautiful church at night and in the day. If you are lucky you may also be treated to a street music concert or a number of weddings. The interior is magnificent and loaded with things to see and awe. Be sure to see the beautiful roof that was rebuilt after WWII.

Spectacular Architecture. We spent most of the day in the castle area visiting the National Gallery and other places of interest and then headed for Matthias Church - the building is magnificent and the roof reminded us of the Hospices de Beaune in France. Unfortunately there was a concert taking place so we could not go inside but hope to return some time in the future. The church is in a fantastic setting with cloisters nearby with great views across the Danube.

An Art Nouveau triumph. Prepare yourself for an architectural treat. If you think the exterior is breathtaking, the interior will exceed all your expectations. I was almost moved to tears by the beauty of the Loreto Chapel in particular. Don’t miss this on your trip to Budapest.
Incredible Church. There are no shortages of incredible churches, but this is one of the oldest and most famous. Definitely do the interior tour.

Highly recommended!. One of the amazing destination in Budapest with wonderful views around.
Better to take local guiding service and get more information about its history!
Beautiful church. Before or after visiting, it is worth it to learn a bit more about Matthias history. Make sure to visit!
Great!. Amazing church, so much to see inside. Bring guide with you (at least book) :) Come in the morning so it is only you inside
Worth viewing. Beautiful outside but look inside its stunning, we spent the best part of an hour there the colours and atmosphere are amazing .

Night Matyas is splended!. Daytime matyas is good, too, but is particular again at night.As the cable car works until 10:00 p.m., please go on the hill of the royal palace after dark.I cannot observe the inside, but a church lighted up is splendid.We seem to have a tour at the night of the tourist and do it and are a little, but the basics are quiet.Recommended (^^)

Amazing. This is by far the most beautiful building in Budapest ! Sited in the hilly Buda side this is definitely a hike to get up there but well worth it . The church is spectacular and the sights and views you get of the city from up high are amazing ! Must recommend !

I have seen a zillion churches, this one is different.. I lived in Europe for years, and have been in so many churches I have lost count. This one is different and worth a tour. There is some really amazing painting on the walls that I haven't never seen in any other church I have been in. The outside has recently been refurbished and is really lovely - especially the roof. In addition, the walk to the castle district is really nice, over the Chain Bridge, and touring the Fisherman's Bastian and surrounding area is also pleasant...views across the river are really spectacular.
Church on the hill. Well worth the visit, although it costs a little to go in. A beautiful experience with a museum of ecclesiastical artifacts.
Magical.. A masterpiece of architecture.The views across the city are absolutely breath-taking.A word of warning though, eat, change money, buy your breakfast before you get there.

A little pricy for what it offers but great history. At an added cost you can have a guided tour and go up the Tower, we didnt do this and feel we may have missed out. However, there was plenty to see and read whilst in this Church and again was filled with plenty of history like many of the buildings in Budapest. Also make sure to appreciate the views down to the river and of the Pest side. Much worth a pitstop and photo oppurtunity.
Beautiful. Stunning church and very reasonable entry price. Only worth visiting for up to an hour, even if you get a guided tour, but still a nice filler to a day out.
Beautiful building. On castle hill with lots of other highlights of budapest close by.well worth a visit and spectacular views

Just plain beautiful. We were fortunate to be staying at the Buda Hilton. The window of our room looked out on the delightfully-decorative roof of this Budapest monument. We had taken a tour on a previous visit, so we elected instead to attend an organ mass on the Sunday we were there. What impressed us most was that this was a real church with real, everyday people attending services and expressing their devotion - in a magnificent surrounding. While we don't speak Magyar, we still found it enjoyable and enriching.

Amazing architecture . This is an amazing gothic cathedral. Unfortunately it was closed on the day we went to visit (came too late in the day), but the architecture is majestic on the outside and had a panoramic view from the castle mount.

Really nice church. This is one of the tourist hotspots in Budapest.And for a reason: the church is a real eyecatcher, especially at night (and then there are almost no people around). Unfortunately, you have to buy tickets to get inside. If you are on a tight budget, then just enjoy the outside en the view from the Fishermans Bastion, which is next to the church.
Ornate church. Super colorful and ornate. one of the cooler churches I've seen. There weren't crazy amounts of tourists around it either which was nice

Matthias Church. We enjoyed our visit to this beautiful church, we concluded that William Morris must have visited this church as the colours and designs are very similar, the atmospheric church is quite easy to access by using a hop on hop off bus and just a small walk up to the church.
Gorgeous inside!. We have visited churches throughout Europe. This one is unique and well worth the admission price. The "bonus" for us - the gorgeous Christmas trees at the alter.
Magnificent. The church truly is an amazing view. The entrance is worth the beautiful interior as well. I definitely recommend it. (there is a bit of a walk to get to it, good to know)
Well worth the line and ticket price. Beautiful church, amazing decoration and great history. Well worth a visit, even my teenagers loved it!
Okay as far as European churches go. This was nice, but I could have lived without it. It's an accessible size, not too big. I loved the stencilling decorations inside—surprisingly modern designs.

Not to be missed!. One of the most wonderful churches in Europe! Fully in Art Deco style from inside. At the first glance very overwhelming, but after a while you feel that the decoration inside is just perfect and fits amazingly well into the church. Very very nice place...

What a lovely, unusual building. The inside of this church is a real treat. Very unusual, very ornate, lots to see and - very important when its minus 11 outside! - lovely and warm. Allow at least one hour but you could happily spend a lot longer here
Serene. This beautiful church sits high up on the hills overlooking the 'Fisherman's Bastion' and all of Budapest. A bit of a walk from transport drop off but well worth a visit.
Brand new!. Recently restored the church looks as it used to be during Matthias Corvinus' days. Spectacular and beautifully decorated roof.

Exquisite Church located at a Beautiful Location offering Spectacular Views of Budapest. The church, located right next door to the Fisherman's Bastion, was spectacular with impressive structure and design. I fell in love with the vibrant color and detail of the tiles on the roof. The whole square surrounding the church was scenic and picturesque. From what I read prior to our visit, the church was built in the latter half of 13th century and is a spectacular Romanesque-styled church. There has been a church at this location since 1015, but, was destroyed by the Mongols in 1241. This church was the city's first parish church and had been around for centuries. During the Turkish occupation, Matthias Church was converted into a mosque in 1541. It remained a mosque for nearly 150 years until the Turks were ultimately expelled from Hungary. While the church was first constructed centuries prior, it suffered destruction after WWII, and, was significantly renovated after the war. The views of Budapest from right outside the church were majestic, especially with the sun setting behind the beautiful Hungarian parliament building at the time of our visit. The sky over the dome of the Parliament building was a light pinkish color. It was perhaps the best European city view I have yet had the pleasure of seeing. We were extremely lucky because the lighting was perfect. It was truly spectacular.

Almost missed it because of entry fee. Never keen to pay to go into churches, don't know why just the sense that when you've seen as many as I have they get a bit samey. Well this is worth every penny of the £4 it cost to get in. The colours inside are are fabulous and now one of my favourite churches. Memorable.

Wonderful interior, uniquely Hungarian. This is a must-visit even if you feel like you had enough of churches in Europe. The fusion of Christian and Hungarian elements is just wonderful. The colors are bursting but it is still solemn for prayer and worship.

Beautiful Interior. This cathedral is beautiful on the outside and even more impressive within. If you want to know what cathedrals would have actually looked like on the interior when they were built (frescos from floor to ceiling), you must visit this building. Also most of the exterior statues are in great shape due to the Turks covering them up during their occupation. All in all, it's not just another bloody church on the standard tour of historic sites.

Castle District Catholic Church with Black Madonna. The church is near the Fisherman's Bastion and the Hilton where we stayed. There is a fee to get in, but it is worth the money. The windows and painted walls are really different, and there is a chapel with the black Madonna in the very back. The tiles on the roof are very beautiful and unique. It is lovely when lit up at night. You cannot go in to take pictures when mass is going on, so we had to come back to see it, but worth the effort. Highly recommend this.

Amazing Views and Great History. Most expensive church we have been to in Europe but a beautiful inside nonetheless. Lots on nuances throughout the church that is worth having a good guide book to explain.The views from the hill are amazing as well.
Beautiful . We come across it accidentally as we were at Fisherman's Bastion. It is impressive! We were impressed by the detail on the roof and we're amazed by its location
Great Church. Awesome rooftop and amazing wall painting inside (a bit like the Spanish sinagogue in Prague). A must do while you're visiting Buda and free
Splendid interior. The church is another 19th century piece of madness and well worth a look. Murals, stained glass windows and not something you see every day.
Stunning . What a beautifull well maintained and renovated building. The roof is impressive and the whole square around it very nice and scenic.

Picturesque. Anyone visiting the Castle District will want to pop into the church.It sits in the main square of the area and is different to many other churches throughout Europe. Does not take long to visit but worth 20 minutes.

Absolutely beautiful. Absolutely beautiful church with the most stunning painted walls, tiled roof and stained glass windows, plus a small museum. The only thing you may need to bear in mind is that a lot of it was reconstructed in the 1950s after the war, so a lot is not original- its still very beautiful though!
Must see. The Church is beautiful. We didn't have time to go inside but from outside is stunning. I loved the roof... the coloures.

Beautiful. The only way to describe this church is beautiful. Must buy a ticket to get into the church but well worth it. The decor in the church is well worth admiring. Architecture of the church inside and out is admirable as well. must see for yourself!

Beautiful and Huge Catholic Church. This is a huge Catholic church with Gothic architecture. Trimmings are in gold and intricate designs. If you are an architecture student, you should see this structure. Arrive early to see everything inside the church.

A Very beautiful Church. We visited the Matthias Church on a blustery rainy day which made entering the Church a welcome interlude on our tour. Inside the Church is quite beautiful with many stained windows. Very peaceful despite the many tourists visiting. Walk up stairs to visit the museum displaying a variety of artifacts related to the Church history. Don't miss the small chapel near the back of the Church containing the Black Madonna.

Worth a visit. Beautiful architecture inside and out. It was good to get access upstairs, so you can appreciate the church from those positions too. Well worth a visit alongside all the other sights Castle Hill has to offer.
Magnificent. One of the most stunning churches I've ever been to. All the interior walls are painted beautifully and it has a wonderful atmosphere. The most unique church I've visited.

Worth a visit!. A beautiful church inside and out. Magnificent outer stone detail and inside you are able to climb the winding stairs to different parts of the church. One of our best visits whilst in Budapest

What a Sunday morning!. We were on a tour of Castle Hill on a Sunday morning, and we could not get into the church (opens only at 1 pm); However the bells began to peal and we followed parishoners into the church for the 10 am mass. The church was so spectacular, especially in the context of the worship service. The mosaics are phenomenal, one of the most beautiful sights in all of Hungary to us!
Stunning. Beautiful architecture. Inside is a work of art. So glad we took the time to visit, strongly recommend.
Completely restaurated and looks amazing. The diamond of the Castle area in Budapest on top of the Gellért hill. It was built in the 10th century.

Beautiful church. I'm not much of a churchgoer, but I can enjoy the beauty of a building like the Matthias Church. From outside it's stunning, especially in daylight, and the entrance fee is 1500 HUF for students and it is possible to pay with Visa Card. On the inside, the church is also gorgeous, with lots of paintings. It's also possible to access the upper floors, where different items are exhibited. I probably used about 20 minutes in the church, which is much more than I usually do.

Interesting outside and inside. Nice considering very little old in it as rebuilt in the 1960s. Some interesting history and nice interior. There is a charge to get in which is more costly than St Stephens the main Church

Right next to the Hilton hotel, beautiful view. The church is right next to the Hilton hotel, at the Buda side of the city. In the evening, the church is beautifully lit and a great spot for evening photography.

One of my favorite sites in Budapest. This Church was amazing and you need plenty of time to spend inside. The ticket line was very long but we traveled over Christmas Holiday. One of our favorite sites in Budapest!
Beautiful church. This beautiful church is located on the castle's hill. Very nice to visit inside as well...probably the most beautiful church in Budapest!
One of the oldest and most interesting Churches!. I have been in over 100 Churches all over Europe and this was still worth going to and paying for. Negative was the line to get tickets..

Fantastic. I love history and old places. This is so old church from the 11 century. I didnt get in. but from outsude u feel how it is great. the weather was very cold in Buda's hills in the time of the year so better u visit these lovely places in other seasons!

Not to be missed. The inside of this church is different from any that i have seen. It is breathtaking. Take the time to walk around inside then just sit and admire and contemplate what you are seeing.
Beautiful. Very beautiful exterior. Looks organically near Buda Castle, among these old times places. In new Year holidays it was even more beautiful!

Another 'Don't Miss this'!!. This absolutely amazing Cathedral is another 'Don't Miss' for this beautiful city filled with amazing architecture! It was nice to wander around the parameter where you can also get some nice views and some awesome pictures. Give yourself time to take it all in and see the inside as well as the outside.

Do not miss... Present very near to the fisherman's bastion.. the church has been renovated to its original shape after it was damaged in many wars.. on a clear day with blue sky the church looks beautiful.. also the view of the city from the front side of the church is beautiful..

My camera loved this church. Matthias Church is, in my opinion, the most interesting of all the structures in the Buda Castle complex – the other two notable ones being the Buda Castle itself and the Fisherman’s Bastion, the latter was built in late 19th century. As is the case with many historic building, both the Buda Castle and St Matthias Church have colourful and at times turbulent past – each has been burned, destroyed and resurrected again. Although the first stones of the church were reportedly laid down in the 11th century, the current building was extensively renovated in 19 century. I found the exterior of the Church – build in late Gothic style – more interesting than it’s parsimonious and yet colourful interior. The small museum inside the church provides useful information about the artistry, craftsmanship and history of the church itself and various periods in the Hungarian history. The small Loreto Chapel, houses an exquisite Madonna and Child (Madonna Loreatta) which attracts, captures and holds the visitors’ attention for a long period of time. There is an admission of 1,400 Hungarian Forints (roughly £3.50, $6, 5 euros).

More is MORE. We were very privileged
to go to mass their during Advent. The church is beyond words. The designs, that vary from wall to wall, never repeat themselves. As I was told More is MORE.

Go on the tower tour!. Getting into the interior is totally worth it. As many other reviewers have said - and pictures confirmed! - the inside of the church is totally painted in uniquely beautiful patterns and is very different from your regular Baroque interiors that are found in many other churches in Europe.If you can, try to go on a tower tour (1000 FT, around $3.50-$4). It's not really a tour but you will need a guide because the staircase is so narrow. There are 297 steps to the top. The staircase can only fit one person at a time, so no one can pass each other. Hence, the tour guide is necessary. The view from the top of the church is incredible - you will be able to see everything from Parliament, to St. Stephen's, to the various bridges. Most interestingly, you will see the tiled roof of Matthias Church. Worth it!

unexpectedly beautiful on the inside and the outside. I am not a fan of churches but you should see this church. It is very original and colourful and not too big. This church can compete with churches in Rome.

Beautiful church. This is a beautiful church and amazing at night. It has amazing architecture and an amazing rough. It is easy to get to and should be on anyones' list visiting Budapest. It is close to the Fisherman's Bastion so easy to tag onto other activities.

most beautiful church I have ever seen in my life. I am a church historian and have been inside many (many!) of Europe’s churches. This church ranks right up with Sagrada Familia for being most “unique”. It is gothic and completely symmetrical (not like Sagrada Familia), as the inside of St Matthias is COMPLETELY covered in paint and mosaics --- the floor, the walls, the pillars, the altar, the doors – the entire interior of this church is decorated. The history is fascinating (coronation site of Franz Josef Hapsburg in 1867 and the event for which Franz Liszt composed “Coronation Mass”). Liszt’s Coronation Mass was first played on this church’s massive organ. Due to the fact that the organ pipes are horizontal (not the usual vertical), the sound reverberates off the stone walls. (I would imagine it’s also a great place to hear a concert). Amazing history as a Mosque during the Ottoman Occupation, and thanks to the foresight of parishioners, the stained glass was saved during WWII by being put in storage in the basement. Quite possibly, the prettiest church I have ever entered. It also has a wonderful view, so if you’re not into church interiors, definitely go for the view!
Amazing!. Fishermans bastion is the area where Matthias Church is situated.Its a beuatiful church make sure you walk around it because there are so many colors and details you will be amazed!
Beautiful church. Beautiful church inside and out. Worth the price of admission to see inside (but beware of long queues!) Informative gallery up the stairs which is worth a look.

Stunning. Not only was this a stunning Church within the Budapest city limits, but I would certainly put its architectural splendor beauty right up there next to Florence's Duomo , and Venice's St. Mark's Basilica. Well worth an independent visit, but certainly if you're on Capital Hill - a must both interiorly and exteriorly!

Better than expected. We were expecting a fairly standard church experience, but inside is very decorative. Was well worth going into and cost virtually nothing to get in. Plenty to see once inside, several floors, much bigger than it appears from the outside. Well worth a visit if you are in the area.

Gorgeous Church!. We visited the church in December so they were playing Christmas music on the organ and it was an awesome experience! The Church is right behind the Fisherman's Bastion so you can see both easily together. The church has an amazing mosaic tiled roof and many tall towers. Must see!

A beautiful church fully restored. At long last, the restorations to Mátyás Templom (Mathias Church) are fully complete and we can see it in its complete splendor. The church is quite different to other churches and cathedrals seen in other cities in Europe. Catholic but a touch of the east in its decorations. The frescoes by the Hungarian painter Károly Lotz are particularly beautiful.The church is a must on any visit to Budapest, it is well worth the entry fee. In particular, make sure you ascend the stairs to the upper levels for a lovely view.

Beautifully restored. This church has been under restorative construction for many years. This has been concluded during my last visit and the whole area is enchanting in combination with the historical streets and the square connection the Matthias Church to the Fishermans Bastille.
Nice church, but more from the outside. I can't say it's not a nice place, but if you have just one day for visiting Budapest, I would definitely choose St. Stephens Basilica instead.

Impressive. We were very fortunate to have a personal guide on a tour through Budapest. He was very knowledgeable and gave us a lot more information in the church. The building itself is beautiful and the background organ music adds to a wonderful atmosphere. We saw all the different rooms, ground and upstairs and enjoyed learning about the history.
Wawow. Symbolic entering fee, beautiful, original. You can see some rooms and the view from the balcony on the second floor. Was very interesting.

Beautiful church with great history. Has a Latin mass on Sunday. We visited and attended beautiful High Mass in Latin. The have them each Sunday. The church is a beautiful architectural sample of the period. Great history of the church as it was also used as a Mosque during the ottoman empire occupation then reconverted to Christian.

Beautiful church. The church is very beautiful and different from any other church I visited until now. The decorations are different from the normal catolic churches.The tickets are overpriced. I bought a ticket only for the church. The ticket costs 1400 HUF for an adult and 1000 HUF for students. The prices for the towel were similar.

Impressive church. Impressive church. Gothic and neogothic architecture. A nice place to visit and just enjoy the view. If there's a drawback, is the amount of tourist in the area, but I guess it's normal.

Stunning church!. Located right at the Fisherman's Bastion, the church has just a much beauty as the Parliament building and Fisherman's Bastion. There is a fee to go inside to look around, but it was worth it.

Owww My God !. When you visit Budapest the maps don't even show this place. Go there at night and snowing if possible. It's truly magical. We stumbled across it trying to find Buda castle. It's so much better than the castle. Go at night and the views are fantastic. Don't miss it it's awesome.

mind-blowing. this cathedral is amazing outside, but when i got in is was even better! there is no room without a grat decorations! the predominant colors are blue, red and gold.
