If you get in, you'll not realize how much time you are spending cause you'll be too busy starring at the roof and at the columns!

An Iconic European Catherdral. I would have given this 5 stars except for the fact it's a bit dark inside. The decoration is magnificent as befits its standing in this European Capital. There are concerts many evenings.

Beautifully renovated church – excellent classical music performance. On 30 December 2015 we visited the Matthias church, listening to the programme of the Hungarian Virtuosi Chamber Orchestra and violinist Miklós Szenthelyi, playing works by Bach, Vivaldi, Franck, Händel, Cherubini, Schubert, and Liszt. The concert and the atmosphere in the church were excellent. We would be glad to return to Budapest and listen to the spring concerts in the beautiful Matthias Church.
Fabulous!. A really popular place to visit by tourists. In the hart of Buda on a lovely viewpoint you can find this church with a rich history.
REMARKABLE ART DECO CHURCH. This church is beautifully situated but the critical thing is the world class art deco interior. It is certainly well worth a visit.

A stunningly Hungarian church. Its unique atmosphere, the painted columns and interior, the mysterious lights and the organ music make this church the most individual one among the many churches of Budapest. You wouldn't believe that the present form is a late 19th century design. The cover tiles are very colorful and made in the famos Hungarian ceramic factory in Pécs, southern Hungary.

Amazing!. On the Buda castle hill, next to the fisherman's bastion lies this magnificent church. In the daytime you can see the marveloua tile work. In the nicht it is nicely lit. Take lots of pictures!
The most beautiful church in Budapest. In my opinion Matthias Church is the most beautiful church in Budapest. I definitely recommend visiting!

Classic Gem...through and through!. Actually, I have been in this particular site for the last ten years and without fail I find something new and beautiful about it. A beautifully built church inside and out conveys deep heritage and reflects Christian Hungary. Located in heart of the Castle complex in Budapest, surrounded by numerous historic buildings, it is seen by countless of tourist during summer... easily accessible. Do spend the whole day to visit the area...IT'S WORTH IT!

Simply the most beautiful church I have seen in my life. Unique, beautiful, royal and mysterious are words that perfectly define the Matthias Church. It's impressive architecture and interior where every single corner, every single inch of the walls, floors, roof and furniture have a rather unique and detailed design are completely in concordance to the fact that the most popular king of Hungary was crowned in this very same place. I fell in love with this church and it will be very hard for other temples to beat this position. We couldn't get to see the museum because we arrived late, but only getting in was enough for me. A TOTAL MUST!!
Beautiful location!. The church has a unique looking roof and the interior is unique as well, like a combination of Western and Eastern European style.
Breathtaking. The architecture on the church is breathtaking and as it is set by Buda castle and st Stephen's monument it is well worth a visit up the hill.
Beautiful . One of the many beautiful churches in this amazing city. You really must take the time to go into this place of worship to see all of the lovely detail and design

Wow!!!!. This place is gorgeous, by day you can take in the beauty of the work that has gone into the building, the tiles on the roof are an amazing addition. By night, the several sets of floodlights light the church up like magic and it would be a very romantic location to take your loved one on a nice night out. Definitely do not miss this one!!!
A must see. This was such a beautiful church with an amazing exterior. The roof of the church is wonderfully decorated, such lovely colours. A total must see.

Clean, white and beautiful. I was impressed with the the fact that it was showing its original stone colour on the outside, and such marvellous colours on the interiors, would fully recommend it for a visit.

Definitely a must! . Definitely worth visiting for the architect aspect of the building. The queue for the tickets is big, waiting time 10 minutes average. Also around the church you are able to see the whole city.

Gothic church with unique interiors. The unique aspect of this church is its interiors and you probably won't get to see such interiors elsewhere. The entire wall and ceiling are covered with design and if you look closely you'll see that the right side is different from the left. This is because one side is inspired by Ottoman motifs who ruled this city for 150 years and the other side is a more regular church design, biblical stories on the stained glass for example. There's an entrance fee to visit the inside and in my opinion it is money well spent.
Beautiful inside and out. Definitely worth going inside, as the ceilings and frescos are stunning.Outside is just as spectacular with the wonderful rook and spire

Gorgeous place. Absolutely amazing and beautiful church to admire. Take your time once you are inside (1200HUF to enter; extra to go on the tower) and admire the history this church represents. Absolutely stunning place in the misty day and sun setting time (yes, we visited this place twice during our stay), looking over the Fisherman's Bastion and the panoramic view of the Buda city is a must. You wont regret it.
Stunning. With so many churches to see in Europe they can become 'just another church'. Matthias is one that is well worth visiting.
Outstanding. The building is absolutely gorgeous. The region around it is very nice to take a walk at night or during the. I actually recommend to do both!

Great. A great place to visit and a must do.
The church is a historic building, with a very high tower.
The tower is a must do also ,200 stairs to reach the panoramic view, but it's worth it :).
Fabulous architecture. Rounded a bend in the road and came across this exquisite church with such a pretty roof. A concert was underway inside so we didn't go in.

Fight the doorman to get to holy mass . After the hassle of getting in past the doorkeeper!!
The church is lovely and a very prayerful Christmas mass with organ!!
Large, beautiful church. Took two days to get in the first time then went in three times in six hours, Large beautiful organ which we were lucky enough to hear played by a very talented woman.

Nice. Beautiful and big i just say this
All in walking distance all the nice places from historian budapest
Beautiful
Onee point not given because it's very touristic and pretty pricey ( little rip off for all tourists). My advice thake lots coins with you because the toilets are not free and thake some water with u.

Amazing building and grounds. this is an amazing piece of architecture - wonderful place for a wedding - it is right beside the Hilton hotel and there are little shops for souvenirs or a hot dog there as well - you can see all down the valley from here
Beautifil. Very nice place around the church, the church is beautiful, Recommends to get inside to have a look.

Beautiful exterior . This church is situated in the picturesque castle district by the fishermans bastion. The roof is beautiful and really different and there are great views across the Danube from here. At night it is lit up so try and see this (and the bastion) in the night as well as the day if you have time.

A picture..A painting even.. I'm no church expert but Matthias church had something I hadn't seen too much in churches...then it dawned on me what it was. The walls are painted, not with whitewash or stone seal but with pictures paying homage to some figure of yor, or depicting a relevant religous or historical story. An ornate circular stained glass window also took my eye that has a spiral surround, best not viewed with a hangover. The area that the church is situated is extremely pleasant and worth taking time to walk around, avoid hawkers although they are not overly persistent, a firm no, suffices.

Fascinantno. Really big building in the very centre of Budapest. It is really an object full of history, which they built a long 55 years, inside is like a fairy tale. If you visit during the winter months, the obligatory Hat out of my head

The church and complex a must!. Also save time to roam the steets in front of the church. Actually the guide from our tour did not include information about the inside of the church. As I, you have probably seen many churches and Cathedrals in your European travels, however I found the decorations inside this one as somewhat unique. It's ceilings and walls were covered with beautiful (? Frescos) or patterned painting. The alter is a combination of the old and the new. You need to purchase a ticket to enter in the ticket booth across from the side entrance of the church. Above the side plaza of the church is a raised patio and refreshment stand, a nice place to rest and take in the scene.

Amazing architecture!. Matthias Church is situated right next to Fisherman's Bastion in a very picturesque square. The church itself is very beautiful and stands out for its unique rooftop. We did not enter the church but just enjoyed its beauty from the outside.I would definitely recommend visiting the square where the church is located where you can also get a great view of Budapest and the Danube river.

Ornate Interior and Extraordinary Exterior. This church is a must see for anyone traveling to Budapest. Plenty of beautiful architecture and interior designs along with lots of historical presence. Also a small museum attached!

Better Church's to visit. St. Matthias Church is drark and dank. There are other churchs from the medival times that are more impressive. We visited and did not hang around as there are other things to do in the area that are more impressive.

Beautiful Church. We were amazed by the inside of this church. the walls are covered in designs. It was a cloudy day so it was darker in the church but our pictures made an impression when we got home.
Must stop!. The church is beautiful inside and out. Behind the church are spectacular views of Pest and the Danube.

A Special Church in Budapest!. Our Viking River Cruise land tour took us to the Buda side of Budapest for a tour of the area. The guide gave some great history on the area and the church. It was a rainy Sunday mass was just starting so we went in to attend the mass. The church is beautiful outside and most unique in the décor inside. It was special being able to attend a service. The décor on the outside has unique tile on the roof. Sorry we were not able to get pictures inside.

Beautiful. Came straight down from Buda Castle. The interior decorations of the church are amazing, and the visiting route is designed well. you can pay extra 1000HUF to go up the tower, but it was a bit dull. Overall worth a visit
Impressive structure and tourist friendly.. An ornate church with various photo opportunities. Several unique artifacts (stone, vessels, crosses and statues) available for viewing.

A beautiful interior. This is a really beautiful interior with intricate painted patterns on the stonework inside. Well worth a visit, although it was very busy when we were there; a popular venue for tourists.

Wonderful, Inside and Out. If you are in this part of the world, you are going to see a LOT of churches. Most are remarkable, and it is really hard to tire of the experience. Outside, this looks like another remarkable Gothic style church. But go inside and it reveals a much more "Eastern" flavor than the churches of Vienna, Prague, etc... Very ornate and colorful. A must see on your Castle Hill jaunt.

Beautiful church, inside and out. Impressively situated atop castle hill, and surrounded by an attrractive pedestrian area. Amazing carved stonework and ornate tiled roof, inside has most beautfiul decor.

An imposing monument. Restored neo-Romanesque towers, colonnades and embrasures and many excellent statues are the hallmarks of Matthias Church. Open Mon-Fri, 9am-5pm, Sat 9am-1pm, Sun 1pm-5pm. Entry HuF1000 for Church and Museum of Ecclesiastical Art.
Must see in Budapest. The Mattias Church is a gorgeous building on the Buda side of the city that is a must see. It is full of history an stories.

Impressive Building and Incredible Views from Fisherman's Bastion. The castle district is like a whole other world compared to the hustle and bustle on the other side of the Danube. Loved walking up the quaint, cobbled streets. Felt very relaxed up here and really liked this Church. Like all of the historical building's in Budapest it's architecture was well thought out and looks impressive. Didn't get to go inside unfortunately as we thought it was maybe closed. Very pretty building from the outside though and of course you've got Fisherman's bastion bang on the Church's door step with those breathtaking views across the river so prepare to have your camera glued to your hand for some serious photo taking!
Really special church. The beauty of the outside doesn't prepare you for the spectacular interior. Such a special place, highly recommended.

Nice. It's nice to see it during day time but also during the night when the lights are on. Together with the Fisherman's bastion nearby it makes it worth it to have a nice stroll around that area. You can either walk to it or catch a bus or funicular to get you up the hill. The tiled roof is very nice and special, otherwise the gothic architecture is the same as for all churches of its type.

Imposing structure with an equally impressive view of Budapest.. This large church is located at the top of a hill on the "Buda" (western) bank of the Danube River, and is part of the small "Old Town" area found here. I did not actually enter the church, because I was on a tour, but I would have enjoyed doing so. There is a marvelous fountain located immediately to the west of the church.
AMAZING. Breath taking beautiful beautiful building although we didn't go inside the exterior is like nothing I have seen before fabulous workmanship gone into this church

Beautiful inside and fabulous views from up here. Really worth taking a trip up to the Castle District and going into the church to explore the stunning interior. Inside is beautiful and worth sitting down to take in the atmosphere. It's easy to get up to it either by using the funicular or by bus if you don't fancy the walk up although the steps are easy enough to do if you're reasonably fit. From our hotel in Buda it was a short walk across a park and then up some steps to reach the top, easy enough and I'm no Spring chicken! Plenty of other things to explore when up there, nice restaurants, lovely architecture and stunning views over the Danube.
Spectacular inside. It is worth to pay the entrance to visit the church. The painting on the walls, the environment, the architecture,... everything is nice
Just beautiful!. As you are up there pay a visit to this amazing piece of art as i like to say. You are not going to regret it.

This place really has the wow factor. Both outside and inside this church is quite beautiful. The roof tile design is something I've never seen before, and the whole interior is hand painted and totally unique. Well worth the entry price and we must have spent about an hour here. If you go to Budapest go here.

Not your average church. The church has very beautifully decorated interiors. The colours & patterns throughout the church are sublime. For me it rates up with the most beautiful churches in the world & is quite different to any others I have seen. Don't miss it.
A must see!. I have seen a lot of churches and cathedrals in my tour through Europe but this one was special! A view from the outside will not suffice, must go inside!

beautiful full color church. This to me is the nicest church in Budapest. It has much of its color and style from the late middle ages when churches were a riot of color and you get a feel for how that was.This a little unsual in that most times they charge to enter but if you go for mass or to the bookstore to buy something they let you in but even paying it is worth the fee.

A Grand church with magnificent architecture. Mattias Church definately has a wow factor and a must visit when in Budapest. The church on the outside and inside has grand architecture and beautiful relics within. Great value for money and well worth a visit

Very good view on any given day. Visited twice, once when it was sunny and once when it was gloomy dark. The views on both the days were good. Lot of tourists around and for a fee you can also visit the 3D movies on Hungarian history
Cool Roof!. The exterior was lovely to see and photograph, especially when the sun was out on the colorful roof tiles. Inside was nice, but not worth the price.
Amazing decoration. The interior is hand painted in a symphony of colour and detail. It has been restored in painstaking detail and is definitely worth a visit. Combine it with Fisherman's Bastion.

Always looking up. Approaching the church you should notice the amazing roof tiles. Unusual and very attractive.
Inside the views up above are also spectacular.
On balance, if history and churches are your thing then this should be on your agenda but for others simply looking to step in out of the bitter cold, it is just another church.

in the top of Budapest. I did a free tour in Budapest and the last atraction was this curch. Is a renovated place which offers a spectacular view of the city. You can reach here if you take the bus 16, this bus start from Deak Ferencz platza, cross the river and go up to the church.

Not worth it. 1400 HUF/ £3.75 per person to visit a bland church in comparison to the basilica which had no admission fee. Warning - The steps up to the museum section are tight and narrow, there is a rail nut it's steep. The exit steps are the same but there's no guard rail, one trip and you'd break your neck, it's a long way down. There not much in the museum apart from a few priest garments and some scrolls.
A stunning interior to a beautiful church.. Free to visit this beautiful church has an unusual interior. Very ornate walls and roof. Not busy this time of year.
Beautiful. I don't think it's necessarily worth the price (pay to go into a church? hmmmm...), but it is beautiful inside. The walls are painted in such fine detail. Check out the roof tiles!

Beautifull place. It is one of most beautiful locations in Budapest. Both interior and external panorama are breathtaking. It is very goo starting point to see this side of Buda. One advice, try to book your ticket in advance, as often you can face quite long queue.
Well worth a tour of the inside. On out previous visit to Budapest we only saw the outside. The inside has beautiful paintings, glass, and mosaic and it well worth a tour.
Not to miss. The experience of visiting the church was extremely enriching, there is a small museum as well in it which is worth visiting also.. The church is magnificent inside and outside!
Something special, not only a church. Take a guide! Our said a lot of stories and legends during our visit, and by that the wals os the church came alive. Do not miss the museum

Beautiful Church with Unique Interior. The Matthias Church was a beautiful church to visit. The exterior is stunning (with the multi-color roof), and the interior was special as well with the brightly colored walls. If you enjoy visiting churches, this is one you should see in Budapest. I enjoyed it more than St. Peter's, though both were lovely.
Worth a visit. This church is stunning, especially the pretty tiled roof. It's worth a look if you're in the castle district
DO NOT miss this!. If there's only one place to visit in the whole of Budapest, make it this one. Astonishing. A good job we no longer have to pay for camera film.
A beautiful church. This church is pretty beautiful. And there is very good market outside where you can spend lot of quality time with friends.

A Must See Church in the Castle District. The Church is names after King Matthias Corvinus who was married twice in this church. Franz Joseph and Elisabeth, the Austrian imperial couple, were crowned in this church making them King and Queen of Hungary. A very imposing church marking the highest point in the Castle District. The visit was a little expensive otherwise I would have given it an Excellent score.

Just perfect!. Amazing church and perfect view to the other side of the city! Higlhy recommend. If you are tired to go up until this hill, you can take a bus from a station near the chain bridge in both sides, buda and pest.
Evening vantage point. Beautiful church floodlit & amazing views over the river & towards Pest. We got the tram, then the bus ( nos 16) up to Castle Hill & had a meal.

Amazing. You can't miss the beautiful church either in the day or in the night when it is lit. The whole inside of the church is painted with amazing patterns and pictures. It is impossible to describe the visual impact of this amazing building.

Awesome Structure!. We took a cab (Uber) up to this place, and were pleasantly surprised that there was an opera/symphony concert going on. This place is grand on the inside and worthy of a stop. My suggestion is to go at night!

Don't go in the morning. Tourists think this is the "ancient cathedral of Budapest". Actually it is neither ancient nor a cathedral and is of mild interest. in the morning, there are mobs of tour groups jostling through it, go late in the afternoon if you must go.

Definite stop. Matthias Church on Castle Hill is as good as it gets. We visited St. Stephen's Basilica and Matthias Church in the same day. The latter is by far the better of the two. Although there's an entrance fee, it is easily worth the price of admission. So much history. There are also tours on a regular basis in various languages.

Gorgeous Exterior!. Loved the gorgeous Gothic architecture of the exterior! This church was built in the 14th century. During WWII, the church was badly damaged. It was used as a camp by the Germans and Soviets in 1944-1945 during the Soviet occupation of Hungary. The church was largely renovated between 1950 -1970. Based on the exterior, I rated this a five. I was somewhat disappointed with the interior, however it is still a must see in my book. Nearby restaurant with scrumptious food is Edeni Vegen Etterem, at ground level about a twenty minute walk from Matthias Church.

Beautiful church with lots of history. An established stop on the tourist path in the Castle District the church which has also been a mosque during the Ottoman occupation of Buda is well worth a visit. Its startlingly painted interior is a refreshing example of what churches must have been like in Northern Europe before the reformation. There are an assortment of relics, exhibits and church vestments on display and the stands on which there are explanations of what’s on display both exhibits, frescoes and statuary etc are informative if you are not on a booked guided tour. The ticket office is opposite the entrance. The place has a lot of history on display but it is also a functioning church and is closed to tourists when Mass is being celebrated. There are occasional concerts which are well attended which are very enjoyable and very moving. There’s nothing quite like listening to a composition like Kodály’s Missa Brevis in such beautiful ecclesiastical surroundings. Access is either by taxi, bus number 16 from Deák Ferenc tér, via the funicular or by using the escalator in the Royal Gardens and then a 10 minute walk.
Day trip. It doesn't take long to walk up the long hill and it really worth it. The building is really nice and you can take some really cool pictures of the whole cityWorth a visit
sightseeing must. beautiful church, beautiful location, with the most amazing views of the Danube and Pest from outside it

Astonishing!. A wonderful cathedral in late Gothic style. It has been extensively restored over a longer period of time and is in my mind special because of very extensive interior paints and frescos. The entrance fee is well worth spend of money (They have a rebate for senior visitors!). An interesting fact: the sell old original roof-tiles at the small tourist shop so you can take a small piece of the cathedral home with you!
Amazing Church and surrounding. It is worth saying that the Buda part is much nicer than Pest. The Matthias church area is amazing, beautiful, peaceful and inspiring.

Night Stroll. I only saw this church in the evening, as my group got into Budapest late. It was really really cool from the outside and had the additional creepy feeling as you were walking around at night!

Wonderful to Behold. Matthias Church is at an elevated location on the Buda side of the Danube. It is spectacular from the outside and ornate on the inside. While we visited, children prepared for a Christmas play. Our timing was perfect.
Passing through Budapest. Same day with many astonishing monuments. We were very impressed by the architecture from the Hungarian history.

Has to be seen. Matthias church is perched up on the hill and can be seen all over the city,it has a very distinct tiling on its roof.it costs just under €5 to enter and I think maybe more if you want to go up very high.the tickets can be purchased directly across from the entrance to the church.

Best by night. This cathedral lights up the Buda side by night
It is a most impressive cathedral the slate work in n the roof is something to behold

Best for colourful roof tiles and interior detailing. The architecture and colourful roof tiles of this church was enhanced by a deep blue November sky - a stunning sight! While the interior is noteworthy for its walls painted in Art Nouveau style.

Magnificent both inside and out. Off all the churches I've ever seen, this is the best. The striking architecture and its position on top of the hill in Buda make it stand out from the crowd. However, it's interior is breathtaking. The moment you walk in you are stunned by the decoration of all the walls and columns. Additionally, the individual chapels are beautiful and unique. There are incredible views both up and down the Danube and across to Pest.

Magnificient. This is another beautiful, imposing, structure overlooking the Danube River on the Buda side. Located near the Fisherman's Bastion.Plan to spend at least an hour viewing the inside and outside of this impressive structure.

Stunning building inside and out. From the outside this is a really lovely looking building. Interesting shape, and the coloured roof is beautiful.But inside is just amazing. As well as several stained glass windows, the decoration inside is never ending. Walls and ceilings and floors are almost completely covered in decorative painted patterns. My boyfriend reckons it's the best church he's ever been in, and we've been I some impressive ones including St Peter's Basilica in Rome, and the Duomo in Florence.If you've the time to go inside we highly recommend it. There is a fee, currently 1,400.For an extra 1,400 you can go up the tower. Tours are on the hour with limited places. If you love views,then the one at the top is lovely, and the boyfriend says the 200ish uneven winding steps were worth it. If you don't like narrow walled spiral staircases with no handrails, you might not agree!

Beautiful site in Buda. A great church with a view of Parliament and the Pest side of the Danube. The area is lighted at night which makes the area breathtaking. One of the most enchanting sites I seen. Church is filled with artwork and religious artifacts. A great place during the day, but the views at night are unbelieveable.
Just like a dream. I'm pretty sure this is one of the most beautiful churches I've ever seen. Outside and in, it's pure history and art. You cannot go to Budapest and miss this!

Incredible detail. I was most impressed with the unsparing detail on display at this church. From the incredibly detailed spires to the faultless colourful tiling. Within the walls of the Fishermans Bastion this is again a must see attraction!
Magnificent. What a beautiful, peaceful church even with visitors wandering through. The painted patterning on the walls must have been painstakingly created. A special place

Beautiful building. A 10 minute walk (uphill) from the Buda side of "Chain Bridge" brings you to the Fisherman's Bastion where the Mattais Church is situated. Be sure to buy a ticket from the ticket office opposite the church (inexpensive) its defiantly worth it to see the amazingly decorated interior.

Amazing.. What an amazing place. It is a definite visit if you come to Budapest. The views are amazing day and night. Even on a wet late afternoon. The church is stunning. And we'll worth a look around the interior. Stop and have a drink in the Fisherman's Bastion too.

Amazing example of Budapest's beauty and history.. There is no picture that will do this place justice, and no words, either. If you are a fan of architecture and churches, get up the hill and check this place out. Entry is questionable, and I believe limited.
So beautiful. I arrived at Hilton to find this stunning church is next door. What a beautiful site when lit at night. Great first impression of Budapest.
STUNNING HISTORY. This Church is up in the Castle Hill district (Buda). Well worth paying the money to go inside and have a good look. Fascination history attached to this Church.

A beautiful church in a beautiful surrounding.. You can take a tram, the big bus or just walk across the Danube and take the elevator that takes you on top. The aria is worth spending a afternoon just strolling around. The church is defenately worth paying to get in. It offers an overall view of Hungarian history when Church and kings worked hand in hand. Have a nice visit.

Not that old but beautiful. We didn't spend allot of time here, but the church is well worth the time we did spend. We were visiting on a cruise/tour, so we didn't have much time and were pushed. The views from outside this point is of the River and much of the other side (Pest) of the river.
an other historical site. I am from Budapest but it is always a nice site to see based on the settings in the Castle district and right by Fisherman Bastion.
Beautiful church . We came in the afternoon, and couldn't enter. Visiting hours were 9.00-14.00. Just walked around, beautiful place with panoramic view from Upper Buda.

Beautiful restored. An amazing church that has been beautifully restored - be sure to go up to the second level as you exit the church and see it all again from above and see the internal structure of the building on the way out - interesting history having been a catholic church and then a mosque under the Ottoman Empire, damaged in WW2 and restored to its previous glory since teh war
Interesting church.. I find the architecture of this church a bit gaudy, personally. However, the unique design and historical value cannot be denied. Worth a visit while you are on the castle hill.
Eye Catcher. This is worth a visit to see a church that is decorated from floor to ceiling with wonderful patterns. You need to buy a ticket from the ticket office opposite the church.
Night time visit.. What a super place to visit at night time the lighting make it such a dramatic place to see, do not miss when in Budapest

Astounding craftsmanship in such a beautiful building. So glad we were able to visit this beautiful building. We spent some wonderful hours exploring this building and the wonderful museum upstairs, to the wonderful wall mosaic style wall paintings, the vestments, etc. etc. Beautiful

Was ok... It ia the first time in a country that we pay money to enter in the church.the price was 1400ft juat to see a church..it was ok nice but a church that in rome we visit churge huge amd fantastic free such as sanpietro in vaticano.not something special

View it outside. Located on the Buda side of the Danube, with beautiful spires and tiled roofing, this is a beautiful building from the outside. Unless you have time to kill, I didn't feel the inside matched the drama of this magnificent structure. Compared with many other cathedrals we have seen, it was dark and colorless inside. If you do decide to step inside, you will need to purchase your ticket to get in; note that we were told that one could not buy a ticket with Euros, only HUF currency. But they accepted Visa.

One of my favorite churches in Europe. This church is one of my favorite churches that I have visited in Europe. It was recently renovated, based on the original decorations, and is absolutely beautiful. That being said, it is quite simple and not over powering or too busy and distracting. For me, this felt more genuine than many other churches. In addition, they provide you with a lot of information on the history of the church throughout the building. This is one church that is not only stunning from the outside, but definitely worth the price of going inside too! I would highly recommend a visit.

My favourite memory. This is by far my favourite memory of Budapest. It is absolutely stunning on the inside and you will not see anything like it anywhere else. It is so decorative and warm I could've sat there for hours! Definitely worth a visit.
STUNNING. This is on the same side of Castle HIll, its stunning, beautiful buidling, square outside and the roof, you must go to see the roof alone.
Lovely at night. We went to an evening organ concert here. It was a lovel way to experience the church. It's also beautiful up there at night!
Renovated church. The church was renovated few years ago and interior was quite new. The entrance ticket allows you to visit the upper areas as well as the tower. Worth visiting.
Beautiful Inside & Out. Perched on the Buda hillside overlooking Pest adjacent to Fisherman’s Bastion, this is a beautiful church to visit. Find the back stairs for a beautiful picture spot.

One of My Favorite Churches in Europe. Look, this is one of those churches you have to pay to get in. It's not the most cheap experience you'll do, but it is absolutely worthwhile. The church is painted head to toe with interesting design, and it's breathtaking. Upstairs, you can tour some old armory and learn about Hungary's history. If you are visiting Budapest, even for a day, this should be considered a must!

Well worth the visit! This church is a work of art.. I spent an hour trying to see all the beautiful and intricate details. When I walked in the door I felt like I'd stepped into a place of magic. I could have stayed longer!!
Magnificent. We toured the Mathias Church as part of our Castle Walking Tour. It is one of the most beautiful churches we've ever seen. Don't miss seeing this!
Worth going in!. Stunning church from the outside. We initial didn't pay to go in but decided to do so on a following day and it was well worth it
Another Budapest delight. A beautiful Neo Gothic building, adds to the experience of visiting the Castle Hill district. Beautifully lit up at night too.

Beautifully decorated church. The interior of this church is highly decorated with what looked like 'stencilling'. All very attractive. We took a tour up to the top of the 260ft. tower which gave us an amazing view over the city. The roof of this church is brightly coloured and worth a look.
A must place to see. It was peaceful and tranquil with great arcitecture. A place to go for reflection and to think about things

Stunning. Although the commercial ticket booth in the square outside feels all wrong for a church, it is undeniably worth the money. Located in the square alongside the Fisherman's Bastion, a short walk from the castle in Buda, this church is unrivalled in its beauty both inside and out. Not an inch of plaster inside is left unpainted (Google some pictures for an idea!) and there are impressive 13th century carvings as well as tombs and stained glass windows. It was busy, even at 4pm on a gloomy October evening when other places had been pretty empty. Worth a visit.

Architectural Wonder. This 13th Century church has a fabulously photogenic exterior. The Neo-Gothic style has many spires reaching to the sky. The multi-colored roof tiles are stunning when mixed with the spires. The inside decorations are also colorful. It's beautifully painted with many stained glass windows. Expect large crowds, as most river boat cruise ships include this church in their shore tour.

One of the most beautiful churches I've ever seen!. Extremely beautiful church with it's precious architecture and surprising construction. Unfortunately had not the opportunity to step inside, but it was enough charm even outside. Strongly recommended.

Beautiful Church. It is near to the Fisherman's Bastion. It is a very beautiful and stunning building. I did not enter as there were too many places (Buda Hill, Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion etc) to cover in one day.

Extremly rude staff . I was literally shocked by how rude the staff were in the church. The lady working there screamed at us and wanted us to leave because we were next to the 'exit'.I gave her a proper lesson and told her that I didn't pay a ticket for a 5-min tour and I leave whenever I decide.The interior is nice and the church is beautiful but Hungarians are extremely rude in general. They can't handle tourists and have no idea what customer service is. No wonder it's a poor country.

A photographers dream!. So much to see and photograph both inside and out of the 13th Century church which has recently been refurbished. For those in decent shape try the walk up the bell tower which has 197 steps to Heaven! I may be a little dicey for those who are clostriphbic as the cicular staircase is extremely narrow. Once at the top you'll find literally dozens of #10 photo subject matter looking out over the city.

Stunning. Having walked across the rest of the Buda Castle Quarter, parallel to the Danube river and through a quaint little town, we arrived at Matthias Church. The church is beautiful, with a brilliantly coloured roof, which looked stunning against the backdrop of the blue sky.
only visited the outside - good bulding. If in the castle district, you can't miss this church. Although I didn't go in, it was a good visit.
Beautiful church from every angle!. So beautiful - the Matthias Church is right by Buda Castle on the hill, and it's impressive from nearly every angle! Such rich detail

Surprisingly beautiful. After visit most importante churchs in Europe, we were happily surprised by how beautiful Matthias Chruch is. The ceiling decorations and the external architecture are a must seeing!

Beautiful Church of Saint Matthias. This church is a must to visit, exquisitely maintained and easily accessible place. Especially for those who profess the Catholic faith you can see in detail its beautifully built interior, its history and architectures.

One of the highlights of Budapest. Beautiful both inside and outside. On the outside there is a cute little replica of the church which I find interesting. Its very close proximity to Fisherman's Bastion makes the outside setting of this church even more dramatic. Inside decor is equally as amazing. What I like about this church is that despite the high number of visitors, a spiritual atmosphere is maintained. Make sure you have a look upstairs as well, from where you will be treated to a beautiful view of the church. It is also worth noting that there's free wifi available at the park just opposite the church.
Astonishing architecture. To see this church from outside is not enough. One has to see the special and perfectly restaured inside of Matthias Church
A ,magnificant church. This is one of the best churches we have been in. You even get to walk along the balcony which is now part of a museum.

Beautiful Inside and Out!. We almost didn't get to view the inside of this Church as it was a Saturday and didn't realize the church was closing at 12 noon for a wedding for the rest of our (last) day in Budapest. We got on the last tour to view the interior and so glad we did! Built on the site between the 13th-15th centuries, this church is named after Kind Matyas Corninus, one of the greatest Hungarian rulers. The church survived Ottoman rule, destructions and fires, and is an excellent example of Neo-Gothic style. The view of the main altar, the rose window, stained glass windows, the Baroque Madonna and views from the 2nd floor offer the best angles of the church.

A delightful surprise. After seeing so many churches on a recent trip to Europe, I really enjoyed this one. It was very colorful and seemed much more organic (uniquely Hungarian?) than many of the others we went into. Don't miss the church's small treasury -- and the staircase that leads to views from the second and third floors. That's where you will find lots of interactive exhibits, which I hadn't left a lot of time to see. If you enjoy seeing churches of this era, plan to spend a couple hours here.
renovated. Visit this unique church for the unusual colorful decoration, historical paintings, small museum and climb the tower also!

Exquisite church inside and out. I first visited this church in June 2015 when I was completing a tour. I went again in Oct 2015 at the end of another vacation. It was so fascinating that I wanted to see it again .The church is very old and I was expecting to see it in poor condition after all it had gone through. I was amazed to see how well it had been restored. It was damaged during WWII. The history of this church is fascinating. It changed hands and denominations through the different invaders' occupations. It was a mosque at one time and when it was converted again to Catholic Church the painted walls were preserved. The feeling you get as you walk inside is awe and peacefulness. One of the towers can be climbed for a spectacular view of the city. There is a minimum entrance fee which is worth it. No trip to Budapest should be complete without a visit to a Castle Hill and this church.
An impressive building in a glorious part of Buda.. This area is a must when visiting Budapest. Link with The Palace, The Funicular, Fisherman's Bastion and the local market. The 16 bus goes here.
Beautiful. Mathias church, Fisherman's Bastion, are all in the same place...its a nice area to walk around in & check out the scenery, monuments etc...

Great view. Located in a blocked area and next to the first Hungarian Hilton is this church. Its worth seeing but the Fisherman's Bastion next door is where tourists flock. Not much to say except its a nice church.
Just walk outside the church is ok for me. I don't know what's inside but the church appearance is excellent. Walking around for photo shooting is enough for me.
Outstanding . The colorful roof is extremely outstanding against the white wall. If u look closer then the roof is in hexagon. Good to combine the trip with buda castle and fisherman's bastion.

A magical place. I have visited hundreds of churches and cathedrals around the world. The Mathias and the surrounding area is a magical place. The Church is unique in design inside and out, the area offers some of the best views of the magnificent city of Budapest
this is a very beautiful church!. this is a stunning church. the decoration and detail of the building is amazing. you can get lovely photos but you need to pay if you want in,

Magnificent Church. Went as a part of my city tour. Although we did not go inside but the guide was kind enough to explain things from outside in detail. Located in castle area right next to Fisherman's bastion. Can be planned as a city tour as that would cover everything. Interior of the church is very pretty and royal. The place has a special model made specially for the blind which was very thoughtful.

Historically Significant Restored Church. Integrally connected to Hungary's history (especially its monarchy) and important for its national expression, this church has been restored and rebuilt numerous times. It is a beautiful expression of Gothic architecture.

magnificent church. We visited this church 2 times. In second visit, we could visit inside the church too. It was very beautiful but not more than other famous churches in Europe. before visiting the church, a guide told us we can go up in one of its tower and we can visit a panorama of the city but it was closed.The area around the church is better to visit.
Matthias Church. Situated almost at the foot of the buda castle, the mighty Mattias Church. Great place to hang out in a sunny day.
Amazing . This place was stunning, the attention to detail was fantastic. Great little trek up to the church as well and the area offers spectacular views. Defiantly worth a visit if in Budapest.
Very impressive. This is a beautiful church however the exit from the tower is very steep and there is no hand rail, so not for the faint hearted

Stunning. Colourful church, every inch of the church is painted in such bright colours. You don't expect to see what you do when you walk in. It's really close to the Royal Palace and Fisherman's Bastion. Worth the entrance fee.

Peaceful. The glorious atmosphere of the church touches you in its own way.
You can embrace the peaceful feeling and once inside.

Breathtaking views and a beautiful square. We visited on a sunny day which made the beautiful white church stand out against a vibrant blue sky. The square is not overcrowded and the whole are has a calm ambience.

Fasinating. My wife and I I have traveled quite a lot over the last few years and during that time visited lots of Churches in various countries. Matthias Church was surprisingly different, the architecture was amazing in its details, the internal painting/decoration was unusual and interesting but most surprising was the museum/exhibition that was also available. Along with many interesting exhibits it took you up into the church gallery where you got to see the church from a different perspective and one that don't often get the opportunity to see. Well worth it,.

A sanctuary of solace.... A warm strange peace envelopes you as you enter the Matthias Church... Even an unbeliever feels a unique connection with his creator...A Roman Catholic church located in Budapest, Hungary, in front of the Fisherman's Bastion at the heart of Buda's Castle District... Is a must visit whenever and every time you come to Budapest...It's amazing how the authorities have managed to keep it so perfect...kudos to them...

Beautiful church with excellent location. Matthias Church is located on Castle Hill, near the Fisherman's Bastion. The interior is breathtaking, with art and artifacts on display from its storied past. A 'must see' on the hill.

Amazingly beautiful inside and out. This was an unexpected delight. The delicately carved structure, topped with colourful tiled roofs. And inside, every surface beautifully painted. At 1,500 HUF it is not expensive to visit and well worth it. We were blown away by the inside. It is on Castle Hill next to the Fisherman's Wharf and so easy to reach on tram 16 which comes up and across the hill, stopping right outside.

High Mass. Sang High Mass 10:00 am Sunday with a choir from England. Terrific organ, state of the art, 7,000+ pipes. Lovely acoustics and staff. Packed congregation gave an ovation after the Hallelujah Chorus at the end.
Must see. A very beautiful building especially on a sunny day. Gorgeous views over to Pest and right next to Fishermans Bastion

Location, location...... The location of the Matthias Church is a treat in itself. Cobbled streets wind up the hill to a view from the Fisherman’s Bastion of the Danube and Budapest below. The famous tiled roof of the church is memorable, as is the beautiful church interior.

Amazing.... Very colorful on the inside, almost fairy tale like. You can go upstairs to get an overview of the church from the second floor balcony. The spiral-like window near the gift shop is interesting. There's option to buy the church ticket with the Bastion but if you are staying on the Buda side, you can visit the Bastion for free after hours. Go early or linger later in the day to avoid bus loads of tourists.

Stunning, even for the non religious. This church is an incredible building. Outside it is amazing to look at and built high on the Castle Hill. Inside it is even better, just stunning architecture, decoration and raw opulence. Well worth the entrance fee.
Stunning!. What a stunning architecture. A Catholic Church in the Fisherman's Bastion area on the Buda side. Included as part of our group tour. Very interesting interior.
wonderful church to visit. This is a most attractive church made more so by the colored tiles on the roof. The interior uses many of the same colors to produce a very harmonizing effect.
Very pretty!!. Nice Church, You can go up and have a look down to all the painting and great architecture of the Church. Definetely it is worth it to visit it.

Another piece of history. In the changing architecture of this building, re-done over the ages, one can see influences of several religions in one building. Even the spires on the roofline aren't alike.
Well Worth The Time. Stunning architecture with a beautiful interior. Matthias Church is a must see on the Buda side of Budapest!

Should be on your top 10 list for Budapest. Stunning church , limited info in English many tour groups visit which can make it hard to really see the interior , make sure you go upstairs to the balcony over looking the lower floor ,great pictures from here.

Must See Matthias. You must visit the finally finished (restored) Matthias Church. Combine it with your stops at the Castle and the Bastion. You may be in luck if there is choir practice or practice for an upcoming recital. Or better, check to see when a special event is scheduled. In any event, this thousand-year-old venue is a treasure all by itself and worth a visit- even on a rainy day.
beautiful at night. Pass by in the night to enjoy the lit building, there are restaurants on the square for a drink or a meal, there is some street life...

Take a Moment to Look Inside!. Many tour groups visit the Castle District, but not everyone takes the time or buys a ticket to enter the church. I encourage you to take the short amount of time, you'll be rewarded! Directly across the plaza from the church's front doors is a ticketbooth to buy either just a visitor's ticket, or a guided tour. Our short stopfrom our tour only allowed us to do a quickie visit. Our tickets cost HUF 1400per person (inexpensive..at this time HUF is exchanging at .0036 HUF per USdollar. So, the HUF 1,400 is about $5.07). You can take unlimited time withinthe church for that entry fee. It really is a fantastic example of Baroquearchitecture. Recommend!

Amazing place. The church is decorated in a sort of Hungarian art nouveau style. Words cannot to justice to it but I recommend a visit. also of great interest is footage in the "museum" of the coronation of the Emperor in December 1916. Loads of horses, men in opulent uniforms. A world about to vanish totally and forever.

Wow! Amazingly decorated interior! Do not miss this church!. Buy your entry ticket at the kiosk across from the church, take a deep breath and enter the magnificent Matthias Church. Splendid frescoes, stained glass, painted, gilded, stone carvings - every inch of the interior is decorated. When you find yourself overcome by this amazing interior, turn around and watch the entrance as visitors enter and drop their jaws in surprise at this wonderful church.

Buda’s First Parish Church. Matthias Church, built in 1255, was Buda’s first parish church and is located along Trinity Square in the middle of the Castle District. However, most of the church’s structure changed over time where only the foundations, columns and some walls dating back to the 13th century can be found in the north tower. The church was named for King Matthias who ruled from 1458-90, but it is also known as Church of Our Lady. The exterior of the church is quite beautiful. Unfortunately, we were unable to view the interior because Mass was being held. If you visit, try not to go on a Sunday because the admittance is limited to when mass is held. I have read a must see inside is the double sarcophagus of King Béla III and his wife Anne de Châtillon in the Trinity Chapel.On one of the spires of Matthias Church, you will see a raven with a golden ring in its peak. Matthias adopted the bird as his heraldic emblem. Legend has it that at the wedding of King Matthias a Corvinus crow flew into the church and stole the ring. Matthias caught the bird and killed her.

Former royal church of the Austro-Hungary empire. This former royal church is the site of several inaugurations and weddings for members of the Austro Hungary empire. It is located on Castle Hill in medieval Buda district adjacent to the Fisherman's Bastion. A short walk from the Buda Castle.
A must. Again took Hop on Hop off and went inside, you can take a tour but is not advised, elevator to the roof

Historic Building. The building has intricate detail and is stunning both inside and out. Worth seeing! The church is located alongside many other standout tourist stops (Fisherman's Bastion, Castle and many more) so is worth looking at locations and maps making a day of it and seeing them together.
Nice church . Beautiful architecture and some interesting history behind it to learn. Plenty of other sights around as well so worth a visit
Great Architecture. The Church is beautiful with rich history, I enjoyed my time while there. I would definitely visit this place again.

Breathtaking. We went inside during the day, the exquisite interior and church choir rehearsal inside made for a memorable visit, there are several levels to go up and see, though the ground level is worth the small entrance fee alone. Beautiful by night, brightly lit and very peaceful to walk around.

Beautiful Church on a Beautiful Site. We visited as part of our tour. The outside of the church is amazing, particularly the roof. The inside contained many beautiful vaulted ceilings, stained glass windows, along with an outstanding ambo and pulpit.

Stunning. Do take a guided tour inside this gorgeous church. It isn't expensive and well worth it for the passion and knowledge of the guides. It made our day. The external tiling is exquisite. If you have time, take the funicular half way up and walk the rest of the way. The views are spectacular. Allow plenty of time to explore the whole area and then walk back to town.
Amazing Church and views.. This church is amazing the architecture is very unique and the views from this setting are amazing. It is worth a visit.
Best Roof!. This is a beautiful church but the part I like best is the colorful roof! Lots of history related to this church. Worth reading about it before your visit. Worth a visit, for sure.
Church with intricate roof design. The church is located on top of Buda hill. The climb was exhausting but worth it. I really was amazed by the intricate design of the roof. Truly a work of art.

Coronation church. Quality late nineteenth century architecture but disappointingly lacking in atmosphere considering it is the nation's coronation church. Felt more like an overdone gothic revival High Church Anglican parish church in an affluent London suburb.
CHURCH ON THE BUDA HILL. This church is located on the Buda hill on the Buda side when you go up to the Buda castle district, the church has beautiful architecture. Worth the visit

Pretty, Interesting but not Spiritual. The church is highly decorated inside and outside and there are some very interesting aspects to view inside. You can take the tour right inside to see the museum artefacts and inside the roof structure, but I just didn't feel the atmosphere inside was very spiritual- a personal view I know, but if you are interested in Architecture it is still well worth a visit.
Worth a Visit. This church is very historic and played a major role in the nation's history -- especially its conversion to Christianity. Make sure this landmark is part of any city tour you take

Wedding cake icing at top of hill. I went here for a concert. The interior decoration is stunning. Outside was dark but well lit - highest point in the city. I walked up from the Chain Bridge. Hundreds of steps - what a nightmare! Found that Bus 16 went to the top and caught this to return to Deak Ferenc Station.The Saturday concert was OK but in contrast to the Friday one in the Basilica was poor. Organ sounded muffled.

A Must See on Buda Hill!!!. I have seen and been inside many many churches in Europe and I think they are all lovely! But this one takes the lead easily! King Saint Stephen first founded a church here in 1015. It's all history from there. This is a Romanesque Basilica and the colors in this church are amazing! We also climbed the dome to the church bells at the top. Also a good photo op. You definitely need to see this church and climb the dome!

Uniquely designed both inside and out. This is a very uniquely designed church and worth the few hundred Forints entrance fee. Lots of history here and beautiful Pontificate items are on display. There is so much to do on the Hill, just work it into the rest of your activities. Recommend going at the end of your day as the crowds dissipate (note on Sunday it is only open between 1 p.m. and 5 p.m.) Plan for a 30 minute visit.

Religious and proud. Great European architecture with a great history to go with it. Known as Coronation church for royalties. It was occupied by turkish muslims and now neo gothic in design. Every one can love this one and its free

Amazing. I really loved this church. So bright and white from the outside, but gold and warm inside, with lot's of paintings and beautiful art. Very nice atmosphere, even if there's many tourists here. A big surprise, as I didn't expect it to be this beautiful :)
beautiful interior. My husband and I sat here for a good hour, just taking in the beauty of the walls, the altar and ceiling. A definite reason to plan a day in Buda when visiting Budapest.
Stunning church. This is unmissable...internally and externally the architecture is simply stunning. It is in the castle district and well worth the short walk to get to.

Budapest city tour - Viking Romantic Danube excursion. We visited St Matthias Church & Fisherman’s Bastion, as an excursion from the Viking Romantic Danube River cruise. It was part of the Budapest City Tour excursion provided by Viking. Our tour guide, Josef, did an excellent job and was very knowledgeable regarding history of the area, as well as the church. The church is so beautiful, both inside and out. We didn’t do the 197 steps to the top of the tower, as we didn’t have time.

Must see church on the Buda side!. Be sure to be around the church at 12 noon when the bells ring. Fabulous panoramic views from the surrounding area of this church. Church acoustics are fabulous. Try to see an organ concert here. Check schedule online.

One of the most stunning church in Europe. On a cliff overlooking the Danube on the Buda side of Budapest, is this stunning church which is also beside the beautiful Fishermen Bastion. The roof is made of multicolored mosaic tiles. Gorgeous view inside and outside.

Beautiful, historic church. This is a beautiful, historic church. It was used for the coronation of Hungarian kings for centuries. Make sure you walk the perimeter and climb the walls behind the church as there are some fantastic views over Budapest.
Historical Church with interesting story. We visited this church as part of a tour group. Plenty of time to explore and understand the stories from the guide. Amazing colours and stained glass.

Church with beautiful colorful roof. This church is good to see during the day and night. During the day we can see its is beautiful red roof. When darkness comes the church becomes luminous. The view is amazingly beautiful from the Danube.

Amazing Interior!. While called a "church", the Matthias Church is cathedral-sized, equaling many others found across Europe. Sitting atop Castle Hill on the Buda side of Budapest, it dominates the landscape of that side of the river. Badly damaged during WWII, it was restored from 1950 -1970, and has more recently completed another 8-year restoration in 2013. From the outside, you'll see many interesting architectural features, including the beautiful roof tiles, and you can purchase a ticket to climb the tower for an incredible view of all of Budapest and the surrounding area. The real treat, though, is to visit the interior of the church, for which you will also need to purchase a ticket. Long the site of the coronation of Hungarian kings, the church has beautiful stained-glass windows. The most interesting feature, though, is the painted walls, filled with decorative designs, unlike any church or cathedral I've previously visited. Very unusual and worth the price of admission!Highly Recommended!

Beautiful tiled roof church. Located next to Fisherman's Bastion, you cannot miss this. We went on a Monday and the funicular was closed. There was a street on the left of the funicular office box to walk up which took us up one side of Castle Hill (we came down the stairs located (on the right of the tunnel). It was an easy walk up and took about 10 minutes even with us stopping to take pictures and look at things along the way. After walking through the castle, we followed signs to the Fisherman's Bastion. You walk through a cute little street which has cafes and stores. We you come up to the church, you breath is taken away because it is so beautiful. Make sure to get some pictures of it as you wander around the Fisherman's Bastion ramparts.

Interesting History, great location. Walk around the Fishermas Bastion and then visit the Church, near it is a bronze model, and it is explained in Braille for the blind, very considerate. Inside the church is wallpapered with gilded pages from Hungarian history books. Its official name is Church of our lady, but everyone calls it Matthias for the popular renaissance King Matthias who was married here twice.

Worth a visit. The church is stunning inside, how they painted the walls I have no idea!!You need to spend some time just to appreciate the architecture and skill involved in building something like this!

Second Church that is remarkable. Budapest has so many churches that can be visited. Some on the Buda side and the Pest side . Matthias is on the Buda side and on the top of the hill. It cost to get in but well worth it. Lots to see and many beautiful painting's, statues, walls columns and floors. If you would like to view the city there is a balcony in the upper structure that you can see the whole city from.

The roof tiles!. It is a beautiful gothic style Catholic Church but the colorful tiles is what drew my attention. The colorful tiles are not unique to this building you see them in other churches and museum. There are two crows on the roof and one is holding a ring. They are very easy to spot. The interior is also very interesting and vibrant.

Get there early. We were put out after 20 mins after paying to visit. Rosie and I visited at about 4.30 pm and within 20 mins of entering we were out. They were holding a Mass for an Italian group and the cjhurch was emptied, without warning. Check with the ticket booth. Not fair.

Beautiful Architecture. This was worth the visit. You can view the outsideof the church but you will have to pay a fee to go inside or to walk up to the tower top (197 steps!). You can get some spectacular shots of the city from here and you will be knocked out senseless if you love to climb the stairways outside! It is worth walking around the surrounding neighborhood to look at the buildings, statuary and flowers.

Have seen hundreds of churches but this one is different.. We included this in our tour of the Buda Castle Hill and it was a highlight! Lots of information but we did have to pay to get in. Lovely painted church walls, information on tile roof. Did not do a tour but purchased a guidebook.

Visited outside only. I just went outside this, but it was pretty cool looking. I was there in July, and it was pretty hot, but I had a good time walking around Castle Hill. I highly recommend the Hospital in the Rock if you're there.

Such beauty. I thought Matthias church was amazing. It I had to choose, St Stephens was more beautiful. But that doesn't take away form the beauty of Matthias. So much to see here. A great picture taking adventure!

Beautiful Architecture. There are many cathedrals to see in Europe and the archetecture is the main draw. It is hard to imagine ouw these structures were designed and built without the aid of today's modern power tools. The church is beautiful on the outside. i found teh interior to be very dark and foreboding, reflective of midevil times. The interior of St Steven's was much more impressive.

Majestic building...look up to splendid roof. The ticket sellers were the only miserable hungarian we came across, but church was,like any other church, very ornate with impressive decor,also nice and warm on a cold day.I thought it was more spectacular from the outside.
Unique roof of the Matthias Church. Beautiful church from outside. It's located on top of the hill and surrounded by the "Fisherman's Bastion". Did not go in.

Beautiful church and area, day and night.. Easy access with lots of tours, and a good walk for those that want the exercise. The funicular up the hill with help! Did not appear that entrance to the church itself was available, but the area around it is worth the visit.
Absolutely stunning. Absolutely stunning inside or outside. Beautifully restored. Worth a visit. The outside is clean and well kept.
Matthias Church. One of the more unusual churches I have had the opportunity to see. Very beautifully decorated inside and out. Just renovated.

Stunningly beautiful. Recently restored and truly stunningly beautiful inside and out.
The view also worth it.
It has a long, interesting history. I would see this church over any other in Budapest.

Matthias Church. This church, on top of a hill in Buda, is beautiful. It is also very different from other churches we had seen in Europe. The architecture is more Byzantine than Gothic. The church is surrounded by great vantage points of the city.

Matthias Church is impressive at night!. A lot of history in this church. Beautiful on the outside and very impressive to see the outside lit up at night. I don't think tickets should be sold to be able to visit this church though.

Matthias Church. I didn't get to go inside but the outside is just such an outstanding sight, at night it looks so majestic. I would recommend a good walk around the whole area where the church is based, fantastic.

Paint, paint pait.. Probably the 2nd best thing we saw. Right next to the Fishermans Bastion and a lovely Square. Such beautiful decoration over the whole of the inside plus we walked up all the circular stairs for even higher views over the City.
Superb Pest experience. Beautiful. We attended and evening organ recital. It was good, especially the Bach tocata and fugue in d minor. Superb Budapest experience.

Must see.Views are terrific. The walk up is worth the effort.. In the daytime the panoramic view unfolds before you. Be there at sunrise and see the Danube and cathedrals come twinkling to life as a new day unfolds. Great place for breakfast as well as lunch. For lunch you will be serenaded with live music, adding to the experiance.
st mattias. Beautiful church, go early to avoid crowds. Avoid tourist traps that are in the area. Great views from the hill

Beautiful church. I must say that we were pleasantly surprised by the internal beauty of most of the churches we saw in this part of the world. Matthias church was no exception. The church also has some history with a couple of coronations and a couple of royal weddings held here. There are 3 paid activities around this area, one must surely visit the church; the tower and the fisherman's bastion can be optional.
Beautiful Church. Highlight of a visit to the Buda side of Budapest. Magnificient architecture and very photogenic. Quite crowded on a weekend.
Must see. A really interesting church as it went through a phase of being a mosque under Turkish occupation. That makes the decoration unique.

Nice church. Unfortunately didn't go Inside but very nice building.
Love the overall shape and style.
Would recommend everybody to go check it out! !
Go Inside, It is Not Just Another Church. The interior of the church is unique, with every inch covered with painted stencils. Quite a difference from what you'd expect from the outside.

Surprising and amazing. Named after good Kind Matyar this church dominates the Castle Hill area of Budapest. There are some 13C remains but the interest lies in the richly decorated interior. When your eyes get accustomed to the subdued light you appreciate that there isn't a surface which does not depict scenes and geometric patterns, reflecting the resulting meeting of east/west in Budapest. The gingerbread roof adds to the playful nature of it all. Unless you are on a tour group (which does not include more than the church interior) you should climb the spiral stairs up galleries (we did it easily and we are 75!). You will find a series of rooms displaying artefacts from the church, e.g. beautiful copes one richly embroidered in the 17-18C with design similar to English Jacobean...exquisite, the weather vane, a bell, view of the interior of the roof etc. You exit into the street by another spiral staircase, so do this last in your visit. We paid 2000fl for 2 seniors.
A Budapest 'Must see'.. Fascinating, highly decorated church, but very popular so it was very crowded with tour groups when we visited.

Must visit hill top architectural marvel in Buda within easy walk from the Chain Bridge. Gorgeous building. Beautiful roof. Near many good restaurants and other important historical locations. Great views across the Danube to Pest
See a concert there if you can. Beautiful cathedral and acoustics are fantastic! Located at Fisherman's Bastion, this entire area is a must-see in Budapest.

Peaceful desination. Beautiful church in fantastic surrounding. We stopped off here as one part of the City Tour Bus stops, as I think it would be quite a hike to get up to the church, but plenty to see and do whilst there, including the Hospital in the Rock.

Beautiful Tiles!. Beautiful diamond pattern roof tiles that haven't seemed to lose any of their colour. Beautiful Gothic church and adjacent to the stunning Fisherman's Bastion - great to see both at the same time!
good view spl at night. located in the heart of the city. easy to find out. looks great at night from the river cruise. can reach there easily.

Beautifully Ornate Interior.. Beautifully ornate Church internally, and has a photogenic exterior too. Tickets must be obtained from a ticket opposite, expect long queues at the more popular times. Also note this can close during the day for weddings and other events. Best to plan your trip rather than drop by on the off chance. Small charge, but worth it.

Church from a fairy tale. In my opinion, Matyas Templom is one of very few Gothic-style Churches across the world that is bright and shining, I believe it irradiates a very positive, light energy, and makes you feel like you are in a fairy tale. If you have enough time, visit the Ecclesiastical Art museum which is located inside the church. The museum contains several of sacred relics and medieval stone carvings.
Budapest's best. This is just a wonderful place. Take your time and explore the temple at your leisure. Do not forget to climb the tower!

You've got to see this. Every bit of this church is covered with painted decoration. It's the church where Mathias was married on 2 occasions, and it's named after him, not St Matthew. Get a guide if available, you'll get more of the history as well as the stunning interior. There's good food available nearby - we used the self-service restaurant which was good and reasonably priced.

Matthias Church & Tower (& tips for a full Castle Hill visit). Beautiful church, inside and outside (roof covered with Zsolnay ceramic tiles).At the square in front of the church, tickets are sold. You can buy a ticket to visit the church tower (1400 HUF). This is advertised as a "guided visit" (only because somebody accompanies you up). The views from the tower are splendid, we are happy we did it, but beware: it's a long, steep climb (many of us were dead and buried when we arrived). The church visit also costs 1400 HUF - guided tours are available too.If you plan to visit the upper part of the Fisherman's Bastion, you will want to buy tickets for that at the same time.TIP for if you plan to visit Castle Hill entirely:Get up to Castle Hill using the funicular ("Sikló"). The white building on the right is the presidential palace, Sándor Palace. The guards put up a show now and again. Continue past the National Dance Theatre, via Dísz tér square to the Holy Trinity monument, in front of the Matthias Church and next to Fisherman's Bastion. Get your tickets at the boot on the square, climb up the Matthias Church tower and visit the Church inside. Take a break before visiting Fisherman's Bastion: walk down Szentháromság utca some 200 meters and have a coffee (and pastry) at Cafe Miró. Head back to Fisherman's Bastion. It can get overcrowded, but the views and the building make it worthwhile. You can get a ticket to visit a small part of it that is not freely accessible. We visited and it's not really worth the fee.Next, walk a few dozen metres into Országház u. and visit the House of Hungarian Wines (Magyar Borok Háza): there's wine tasting and some snacks included.Continue on Táncsics Mihály utca past the Hilton (former Dominican cloister). Continue on this street and you arrive at the Vienna Gate, a small church and the beautiful large building of the National Archives. Turn into Nándor utca and arrive almost instantly at the Magdalena tower. You can go up the stairs (free of charge).If you next go down Nándor utca, and take the first little street on the right (Lant utca), you arrive at a chill walking promenade (Tóth Árpád sétány). It will bring you to the Royal Palace, where you can admire the Matthias well and the large courtyards. If you choose so, you can visit the Hungarian National Gallery, or the Budapest History Museum in the palace.Take the funicular back down, or just walk down to Clark Ádám tér square through the gardens (easy walk).Congratulations, you've had a great time! Count on 4-7 hours, depending on if you visit the museums and climb the towers.

The scene of several coronations, this highly decorated church is well worth visiting. St Matthias Church is unashamedly Hungarian in its decoration. Dating back to the 13th century, it was subsequently expanded and for a while acted as a mosque, when it lost its decoration. The church was restored and redesigned in the late 19th century with its lavish painted decoration and the multi-coloured roof was added after the Second World War in which the original roof was destroyed. The church has been the scene of many coronations, including that of Charles IV in 1916 (the last Habsburg king) and contains two Reiger organs, said to be the best in Hungary. There is a well-design Treasury and, often missed as visitors leave, a staircase leads up to a gallery floor which looks down on the church and houses an exhibition about the church, its decoration and recent restoration.There is an admission charge, and can be combined with a ticket for the Fishermen's Bastion, which is well worth it for the views across the river.
Holiday. Very nice church rich in archeticture many tourist very popular attraction good view and location. Plenty things to see many tourist taking photos.

Art Deco Church. The church is different from other churches that I have seen (and I saw a lot!) because the decoration is unusual for a church.It looks like a fancy Art Deco house inside with beautiful patterns, all in warm colours.

Worth a visit. Have a look up the hill at night as this is quite spectacular. Lovely church and worth a visit, we got a taxi but think a bus is available. Maybe use the hop-on-hop-off bus Always a good option in most cities these days

Fantastic. Matthias Church is one of the beautiful church whatever I hve seen. Every time when I am in Budapest I visit it. Beautiful color glass windows with religions stories. Also, we were twice on organ music concert and enjoyed wonderful music
Matthias. One of the big monument of the city.Very close to fishermen's bastion.The biggest beautition is on the distance to go there and around.

Lovely building. The church was a beautiful building with lots of history and interesting facts. You had to pay to do a tower tour and I was a bit disappointed because I would have liked to go up there on my own without a guide. Definitely a must-see though!
nice place. Very impressive building to visit and the area is very interesting - wonderful view to watch pest and Ruszwurm nearby has the famous cakes.

A must see. A lovely church both inside and out. We had to pay to go in but it was well worth it. The inside was colourfully decorated throughout. Apart from the interior of the church there are several areas of church museum in the galleries. These areas contained lots of interesting artefacts and information.

Gorgeous Church!. My mum & I came here with our Cosmos group and had a guided tour with our local guide. Would recommend a guided tour for all visitors since you won’t understand the relevance and rich history of the church without it. The church is very beautiful from the outside and even more from the inside. The historic church is over 700 years old. It was converted to a mosque during the Ottoman Empire. The walls were whitewashed and covered with carpets. After the Turkish occupation, it was restored in the Baroque style – spectacular architecture! The surrounding grounds on the top of the hill are gorgeous with amazing views to the Danube River, Chain Bridge and the Parliament Building.
Stunning. The Church is located in Castle Hill and of Romanesque style. Unfortunately I was not able to enter the Church and merely viewed from the outside. Stunning architecture

Well worth the visit. A delightful, warm church interior. The decoration of the walls and pillars is a feast for the eyes. The exterior is a materpiece - especially the roof and the ornate embellishments.If you have the time and opportunity, return at night to see the chuirch (and surrounding area) floodlit - wonderful photo opportunities when the crowds are not present.Easy to reach by the number 16 bus from the Pest side of ther chain bridge.There's a small fee to enter and an additional fee if you want a guided tour. I believe it is possible to climb the tower - we didn't do that, but the views must be amazing from the top.
St Mathias. Beautiful church and surrounding area. Well worth a visit. The tour bus stops right beside it. . Lovely cafes to stop for a refreshment

A Beautiful Church. Beautiful Church - steeped in History on the grounds of Buda Castle. We enjoyed the architecture as well as the restoration of this structure as well as the art inside the building. We were there in September 2014 when we stayed in Budapest for three days.
