A stunnning church. On a very wet day we had a taxi from our hotel to the Castle District. The church is amazing both inside and out. One always wonders how all those years ago and without the tools we have today how they managed to paint and decorate such an enormous church with its vaulted ceilings etc. Lots of history with notices pointing out different points of interest. Well worth a visit.

Stunning place. Yes, there are beautiful churches and cathedrals all over Europe - but if you are in Budapest this is certainly one to see. It's beautiful, stunning, awesome. Well worth a visit although I would not go to Budapest just to see this place.
Under renovation. The church is beautiful from outside and inside, but the renovations is not over in the inside, so if you have to pay to go inside you should considre to pass on that.
A Church worth visiting. A cathedral like no other. Quite unusual painting on the walls I haven't seen anything like it anywhere else in Europe.

At night with the lights on.... wow!.... Another nice historical church in the middle of Budapest... we didnt get to go inside, but even just sitting outside with view of this building was really nice!...

Another Beautiful Church on a hill with a view. This is a fourteenth-century Gothic-style Roman Catholic church located on Buda Hill near the Fisherman's Bastion. The building is beautiful and the interior exquisite. The view of the city and Danube from the nearby Fisherman's Bastion is a bonus while visiting the church. If one visit's the bastion, you should also visit the church.

Highlight of Budapest. As you walk up to this church you can tell it's going to be beautiful. The roof alone is amazing. It's just as beautiful inside. The history is interesting and the whole grounds and surrounding area is stunning. Well worth a visit.
A very special building. Lovely church which we enjoyed to maximum by going to a chamber music concert in the evening. The evening lighting is particularly impressive.

Extremely beautiful but not so interesting without a guide. The church is very beautiful from the outside, and even more from the inside, as it used to be a mosque, so it's very colorful and has a unique style. Nevertheless, there is absolutely no information available to visitors who don't pay for a guided tour.
Historical Church visit.. Interesting history and beautiful inside. Maintained very well not a large church but worth the visit.

Mozart Requiem. What a privilege to listen to the Mozart Requiem in this magnificent church! We lucked out with a free concert last Sunday evening. Look out for similar events if you can while in Budapest.

More impressed with the outside. The outside was more impressive than the inside.The surrounding grounds on the top of the hill is gorgeous with amazing views to to Danube and the Parliament. Walk the walls. The section to the far end is free up to the coffee shop at the top. The section above the restaurants near the piazza has a fee to go up.

Great Views!. Located alongside Fishermans Bastion on Castle Hill, a must visit area when in Budapest! A beautiful building from the outside and in. And the views from the Bell Tower (only 197 steps to the top) are fantastic!

Great church, nice location and beautiful insides.. We visited this church in September 2015, you have to purchase a ticket to enter, but once inside it is a beautiful piece of architecture. Amazing stained glass windows and ceiling art.
Stunning!. Very cheap to get in. The decor is simply breath taking, colourful and beautiful. Would definitely go back.
Wonderful. Fabulous example of a Gothic church and exhibits. Even if you arent religious just to go for the architecture and history is enough

An interesting Mid 13th century church. We happened to visit when the choir were practising and the acoustics were amazing . A beautiful church with a collection of art, carvings and relics-well worth a visit .
Later afternoon and evening is best.. Go later afternoon if you can and stay till dark...it is beautiful at night and gives you a great view point from which to see Budapest at night.

Too busy. I queued for aged to get a ticket and was only allowed in the church for 20 mins as the church was closing at 12 for a wedding. It was very pretty inside but there were so many tourists they just kept getting in the way.

Possibly the most beautiful church. Yep, possibly the most beautiful I've ever visited. Really ornate inside and absolutely beautiful. You have to pay to get in, but all church is accessible. A must-see attraction and some history inside about the battles Hungary had against the Turks. Good to combine with the national gallery and we did the military museum too.

Worth a look inside!!. This church is certainly beautiful on the outside, but it's worth purchasing a ticket to see the inside, too!! It's relatively inexpensive, and doesn't take too long either, to appreciate the magnificence inside.
Amazing! outside and inside. a fantastic architectural monument. I've been inside also for a String orchestra concert and the inside is awesome painted.

Magnificent Church. This is truly one of the most beautiful Catholic churches I have ever been in. I attended mass on the Sunday we were in Budapest. We had seen the outside of the church on the day before (the roof tiles are exquisite) and going inside was even better!

Beautiful church. A beautiful church right beside the Fisherman's Bastion. Different from other churches with a colourful roof. We did not go inside just viewed from the outside in our visit to the Bastion..
Beautiful and great views. The Matthias Church is absolutely stunning and the views of Budapest from next to it are phenomenal. It is beautiful inside and well worth the visit.

A pretty church. This is a beautiful church with a lot of history. There are many tourists here so come early and take the funicula up the hill. Take time to walk around and go upstairs for another view and exhibits. I love the area around the church, the square.

Stunningly beautiful and a must on the bucket list.. Beautiful church and surrounding areas, definitely worth the visit, but try to do so on a dry day and otherwise you will miss a lot. The grounds are spectacular and have amazing views over Budapest. If I have a complaint it was that the best views are taken up by restaurants and you have to pay to take a walk over the bastion, which is a bit mean when you consider the amount that tourists spend around the place.

awesome views and church. the church is gorgeous one of the nicest I have seen. the view from the top is awesome. they charge tickets during peak hours to go on the outside walls but just wait and you can walk up free.

Beautiful church, right next to Fisherman's Bastion. The church' stowed is also nice.. I really liked the exterior of the church, especially its roof tiles. The church itself is beautiful. I also went on the "tower tour", in which you can climb the church' tower (about 200 stairs) and enjoy the panoramic view. Climbing the tower is available only in organized groups that meet next to the tickets' cashiers. In order to visit the church, tickets must be bought there, and additional tickets are needed in order to go on the tower-tour. A lovely sight in the old town on the Buda bank.
Spendid experience. Very nice building with good guides and amazing view from the belltower. The architecture is very interesting.
Work of Art. This is one amazing church. Its roof had my attention from day one, and when I saw it up close I was not disappointed. Stunning!

Beautiful Church. Absolutely beautiful church located in the middle of the Castle Fisherman's Bastion area. The detail inside and out is spectacular. Visiting these grand old European churches almost takes your breath away. They are that beautiful and Matthias Church is no exception.
Be sure to visit when in the Castle area.

Next to Fisherman's Bastion. This is the church that is all part of the area of Fisherman's bastion and I would recommend a day's visit to this side of Budapest. In this area you can buy three tickets ( one to go up The tower - although it's a 200 step climb with very small steps) one to see inside the church & one to walk along the turrets. The turret walk was very short as there was a wedding on and further along there was a part you can get into free. The church is beautiful and colourful inside and if you feel energetic more steps to climb up so u can see the church from up high. Tower was worth it but be warned, you'll be puffing at the end. Our guides said they climb up seven times a day so no gym work out required for them. There are occasional concerts here and when we visited the orchestra was tuning up. A tour inside includes access to the upper parts of the church where there is a small museum.
beautiful. Not to be missed! It is set on the top of a hill with amazing views. The inside is beautiful. walk around the area to enjoy the views.

Matyas Templon. A beautiful building in day time and night time. It is a fort there, where you can walk steps up and down, or you can just enjoy the beautiful view over Pest side. You can easy find nice restaurants around the church.
The interior colors are amazing.. This is by far the most impressive church I have visited in many years. The art work is outstanding.

Looks good. Very colourfully decorated church with a small but interesting museum. Also has an unusual window at the west end; looks like a spiral but it’s actually concentric circles. Worth visiting as a senior (HUF1000/pers), but maybe give it a miss if paying full ticket price (visiting tower is extra); it's nice to look at from the outside anyway.

Fisherman's Bastion. An iconic landmark in Budapest. Illuminated at night, it's like a fairytale castle. By day its a beautiful church full of murals and iconography. The climb to the top is well worth the effort. Separate charges for admission to the church and the Bastion are a bit much though.
Beautiful. Obviously one of the must-see on your sightseeing list. I believe if you're going to the Castle hill, you cannot miss the church.
Beautiful church with a great history next to Castle. This church is unusual in its interior wall painting. It is a reddish color design. It is beautifully designed. Well worth the visit.

Stunning architecture. You can't miss the beautiful church either in the day or in the night when it is lit, looks breathtaking! The roof is quite unique, colorful with the ceramic tiles & the oriental pattern. A must see in Budapest.

Truly amazing building. For a church that had been severely bombed during WW11 this is an amazing building, the exterior is so striking and grand it took my breath away when first sighting it, it's exterior is so clean looking none of the grotty image here and it's roof is just outstanding, weren't as impressed with the interior but is still very good

Beautiful. You don't need to be religious to appreciate this church. The building is lovely and fortunately the day we visited, people were quiet and respectful. Don't miss the small chapel in the left front corner.
Absolutely beautiful Church. If ever in Budapest this is a MUST see in your trip. The architecture is absolutely stunning, breathtaking!
You can't miss it!!. You need to visit!! incredibly beautiful inside and out. You can't miss the paintings inside the church.
Beautiful church.. Beautiful and cool on a red hot summer's day! Stunning architecture and windows inside the church. Music playing in the background added atmosphere.
Beautiful . What church in Europe isn't though. Right next to Fisherman's Basin so worth the side trip. Cute souvenir shops near by as well. Nice views.
Ornate. The Hungarians like to deck out their cathedrals and this is no exception. Very intricately designed and decorated to great effect. The roof uses fancy ceramic tiles.

Absolutely Stunning. Matthias Church was one of the highlights of our six weeks in Europe. It looks impressive from the outside but the inside is absolutely amazing. The whole inside of the church is painted with amazing patterns and pictures. It is impossible to describe the visual impact of this amazing building.
If you are in Budapest it's a must to see.

Located at Fisherman's Bastion. I would have loved to have made a visit to the church, but we were here on a Sunday morning while Mass was going on and visitors were not allowed. But even from the outside, the church is beautiful, and especially loved the colorful and ornate roof.

Do not miss this one.... This church is distinctive as it has the most elaborate and immaculate roof, many colours and patterns. Inside the church is beautifully decorated in a style that could be described as East meets West. It is not too be missed. Spectacular location and views.
A beautiful church. Make sure you visit this beautiful church on your visit to the castle hill area. The ticket office is located across the courtyard from the church.
Well worth a visit. Well worth a visit. Make sure you go upstairs and take in the views of the inside of the church. Plenty of things to see and information easily provided

An imposing and majestic church. Matthias church is situated near to the castle and Fishermans Bastion in the Buda district of the city. It is a very impressive and ornate church to see and is beautiful when lit up at night. We didn't go inside as there is a charge and we are cultural peasants, admiring the exterior was enough for us! This is part of the Unesco World heritage site and really is a site to be seen with fantastic views over the city from nearby. However be warned foods and drinks can be more expensive here than in other parts of the city

Most attractive church with elaborate interior and restored exterior. The church is placed in the square on top Castle Hill and is definitely an attractive (and still functioning) place of worship, though it attracts masses of tourist groups from April through to the end of September. At night, especially, it is particularly impressive (and look out for the bats that fly around the steeple on warm, clear evenings). Concerts are held there on a regular basis, with a high quality of playing (though at considerably high prices that match concerts in any city in West or North West Europe. Mainly nineteenth century (though with remnants dating back 500 years).
Gorgeous. If you like architecture, you'll wanna see this. Beautiful church. Worth your visit and time. Even for non religious people of course
Magnificent Matyas Church. An awesome experience. A mixture of Gothic, Rococco and Eastern design. The roof is a masterpiece. If in Budapest don't miss it

Adventure Budapest. Gorgeous location the views inside and out are fabulous. They can handle wheelchairs at this site. The use of mixed ethnic designs to show the different cultures that controlled this facility are ingenious. Absolutely must see.

Beautiful on the inside and out!. The church is beautiful on the inside and outside. Signs are set up in many areas in several languages (including English) which describe what you are seeing. We paid extra to climb to the top of the tower. It was well worth it for the spectacular views.
Mattias Church. Very beautiful Church inside & out and amazing archietture!Good place to visit!! You can go there by walking and enjoying the amazing view!
Spectacular view of Pest from across the river. The view was spectacular. The church's interior and exterior in Hungarian Style (no surprise there).

Church on Castle Hill. Beautiful church on castle hill. One of mant attractions there. Lovely stained glass, gold and marble. The line for tickets can be long so watch for a lull. In the meantime stroll around the fisherman's Bastion
Check out the roof!. Beautiful, especially at night - but we were cheap and didn't go in as it cost. Worth a look, just be prepared for the walk!

beautiful inside and out...don't miss the chance to climb up into the upper level. Yet another church...and again different from those we have seen before. This one is a testament to the courage and perseverance of the Hungarians, as it has been taken over and destroyed at various times during the country's history. It is still very beautiful...in a neo-gothic way. Don't miss the opportunity to climb up to the upper levels and see historic relics, pictures and artefacts from the church's history. Even if you are tired of visiting churches, make the time to see this one.
Spectacular views. Gorgeous at night and day. The Budapest neogothic is enchanting. - there are throngs and hoards of tourists in this area but the views of the city are amazing.
Another " don't miss " landmark. Incredible structure, fantastic history, superb view of the city, with many, many shops and cafes nearby.

This magnificent church is worth a visit. Very close to the beautiful Fisherman's Bastion.. Matthias Church is a Roman Catholic church located in front of the Fisherman's Bastion at the heart of Buda's Castle District. It was originally built in Romanesque style in 1015 but the current building was constructed in the late Gothic style in the second half of the 14th century and was extensively restored in the late 19th century. The place is beautiful and worth a long visit. On site you can visit an underground gallery that contains sacred relics and medieval stone carvings and replicas of the Hungarian royal crown and coronation jewels. To go there: one can go by bus (for example the number 33) from the city center to the Castle District.

Unusual interior worth seeing. The interior of this church reflects the site's role as a mosque for about 150yrs during the Ottoman occupation of Buda. All walls & columns are decorated with painted patterns as a mosque is. The Treasury display upstairs in the church is worth a look, with the bonus view of the interior from one of the balconies.

Another Beautiful Church. A good example of the opulence of Budapest life. Very ornate interior with a well maintain exterior. The cost to enter was fairly expensive, so you may want to think twice...

Matthias Church for any lover of beautiful churches.. The Church is simply breathtaking and a must see. The beautiful Gothic Stained glass windows, the intricate work, the painted ceiling, incredible.
Beautiful. Well worth a visit. Beautifully decorated church with loads to see and small shop. It's also pretty big! Do make sure you also see the upper galleries when following the exit signs.

beautiful old church. There are three ticket choices at Matthias Church: the church, the steeple, and the view from the Fisherman's Bastion. We decided to not climb the steeple, and since the Bastion ticket was unnecessary (as the view it offers is free from the ground underneath the Bastion), we only purchased an entry ticket to the Church. It was beautiful and ornate, and it's coloring was truly remarkable. Worth your money and time (30 minutes).

Nice view, impressive building. Definitely worth the trip up to view the Church and the Fishermen's Bastion. The roof of the church is worth the trip on its own. Sadly, the ticket sales to come into the church a disaster (organizational) so we skipped to go into the church and instead enjoyed the view.

Historical and great scenes . We visited on September 14 as part of the shore walk of a Viking River cruise. Very beautiful with many historical pieces.A great area to and walk around. There are many small shops and local restaurants. Highly recommended
Worth a look inside. Definitely worth a look inside if you have time. Smaller church. Close to other sites to combine with this church.
Really nice. it is absolutely gorgeous - the neighbourhood is so lovely . if planning a trip should really think of getting an hotel in that neighbourhood
Lovely. Mattais Church is just gorgeous from the outside. I had never seen a church with such a colorful roof. You have to pay to go inside.
Quiet, peaceful, delicate colors, pleasing to the sensses. Listen to a concert here one evening. We purchased same day seats on our way into the church for a tour.

A Special Hungarian Church Interior with Oriental Colors, and Art Nouveau features. Matthias Church in Budapest is well worth the visit! Named after the King who built the bell tower, it is located on Buda's Castle Hill. The reconstructed interiors are different than most churches, the colors and patterns are historic, but there is an art nouveau look with oriental colors. Very elaborate, intricate and interesting. An interesting side altar to Emperor Charles. Upstairs you get a beautiful visual of the entire church, additionally there are historical displays of architectural and historical interest pertaining to the church.
Well worth the ticket price.. Visited this beauty as part of a get-on-get-off bus tour. We were not disappointed. The exterior is spectacular and the inside is glorious.
Lovely church.. Shame there is a charge to visit a church. It should be free, with the option of a donation (which most people gave at the Basilica).
Must see in Budapest amazing church. one of the most beautiful churches I saw, vitrages wall decoration and architecture you can spend much time enjoying it
Sightseeing. Place to visit especially since it is alongside Fisherman's bastions. Excellent structure and building styles.

Beautiful church. We enjoyed a tour of the area including entry in the church. A kings was very knowledgable and informative.
Decor inside is magnificent.
Highly recommend.
Beautiful Church. This church is worth a visit. It was crowded when we arrived but the crowd slowly dispersed. I would definitely recommend a visit while in Budapest.

Wow - what a beautiful Gothic style church. This magnificent Roman Catholic church is located in the front of Fisherman's Bastion. It is named after King Matthias in the 19th century.  On the day we visited, there was a wedding ceremony taking place and so we did not enter the church.From the outside, the church looks magnificent. It is Gothic in style although it was originally built in the Romanesque style. An extensive restoration and refurbishment programme was completed in 2013. It contains the Ecclesiastical Art Museum. The number 16 bus takes you from the Pest side to the Buda side where this church is located.

What architecture. The church is beautiful on the outside. It’s unique feature is a splash of brown colored “top part” that I haven’t seen at other churches. Unfortunately, the english guided tour was at a time that did’t work for us, but I would strongly recommend taking one. I am sure it is beautiful on the inside and the history would be fantastic.
Nice from the outside,.... Pay to see the inside. Didn't do that, because I don't believe in paying entry into the house of God. The sight is great though and a beautiful view over Budapest.

Lovely roof. Wonderful building inside and out. Situated near to the Fishermen's Bastion and restored by the same architect in the late 19th century. The roof is particularly spectacular, made up of vibrant multi-coloured tiles. Small fee to go in. Masses to do in the same general area - try the Ruszwurm café.
Beautiful Church!!. Beautiful church in idyllic surroundings. The architecture in truly amazing, we would highly recommend a visit due to it being one of Budapest's landmarks.

Stunning inside and out. They just don't build like this anymore. All the detail plus the roof tiles make this church so beautiful from the outside and then you step inside..... its worth sitting down for half an hour (something I do in all churches I visit) and just absorbing it. Put the camera down and just look around, imprint it on your memory.
A fascinating insight - with more to explore immediately nearby. Especially interesting with the early generations of important Hungarians. Well located with frequent hop-on, hop-off services.

A must see in Budapest. Do not miss the lovely church near the fishermen's bastion. Even if there are large groups from the river boats inside, they are usually sitting to hear their guides give the history, so if you are on your own, just do a little reading before you go and you can see it all without feeling crowded.
Beautiful Matthias Church. A beautifull church with a nice view from Fisherman Bastion, you can visit a small exhibition on the first floor

A must see in Budapest.. Matthias Church, recently restored, is truly beautiful. Inside it is painted in lovely swirling patterns of pink and cream and mauve like old fashioned endpapers in a book. The columns curve toward the soaring ceiling and it truly is gorgeous. The situation outside is amazing with Fishermen's Bastion like an elongated castle with ramparts affording fabulous views up and down the Danube and over to Pest. The surrounding area is fascinating with lovely restored buildings and well worth a stroll around.

Stanning Church, inside-out!. You cannot miss this Church when in Budapest... do visit the inside...it's worth the waiting and money! Magnificent altogether, especially if you visit the treasure museum and the catacomb underneath. Make sure to see it from a distance when its lit at night!

Worth the visit...be sure to go up into the tower.. Decided to visit on our last day in Budapest. It is on the hilly more beautiful side of the city (Buda). We were surprised there was admission fee to visit a church but we weren't disappointed. You can climb way up and see the original wooden rafters. The church was destroyed in the war and the renovation is quite beautiful.
beautiful church on Castle hill. Next to the Castle and Hilton hotel this is a lovely large church peaceful,made me realise what Christianity once was and wished it could still could be
beautiful. its a beautiful church with beautiful ceiling.the views from fisherman bastion are wonderful.you can see the denube with all the monuments from there

Stunning Church. Matthais Church will stun you at night. Its really awesome to see the cuts on the wall of the church. Don't miss to see the church from outside at night, where it looks completely unimaginable.
Matthias. The gothic architecture is a delight for art lovers.The colours on the roof are beautiful and bright.Stunning church.

Brave the wait - it's stunning !. We adored this church and the walk up the steeple is worth paying extra for. The church interior is muted but so ornate and so many details to marvel over. The steeple has a commanding view and is a little taxing but all doable for even those with very average fitness. The Fishermans bastion ticket is nit really necessary as there is a similar free view around the corner. There are two ATMs for the local currency which is best to have to pay for any food/drinks at the little cafes along the wall. Well worth putting as number 1 or 2 on your list of things to do in Budapest.

Don't miss the gallery . This is one of the best chucked I have seen. Not sure of cost as was on a tour. We were given 25 minutes in there, we thought that was quite a lot, but we wanted more! To be allowed upto the gallery and then up to the museum is well worth the effort. The museum has only a few relics, but to see the wooden roof truces was amazing. A must visit in my opinion.

Beautiful building. I saw the church every day from the front of my hotel so I had to check it out. It's a little hilly to get there so if you have walking issues then take a cab. The grounds are beautiful and the church itself is gorgeous. A definite must see in Buda.

My favourite sight in Budapest. This church is absolutely stunning, both inside and out. You can see the spire from miles around, and the brightly patterned tile roof is wonderfully beautiful, especially in the early evening sunshine. Right across from the church is the fisherman's bastion, offering beautiful views back across the chain bridge to Pest. Inside the church is spectacular - every inch of it is painted in bright colours and gold. Don't miss the little museum on the way out, which leads you upstairs and gives you great views of the inside of the church from a higher level.

Very nice expereince. If in Budapest, a river trip is a must. at night even better. If you get the 2 day hop-on hop-off bust a free trip is included with 3 stops. but check the dates as they don't do them out of season. the boat was busy so get a good window seat as we did. separate boat trips are also there to take separately but not sure of the cost since this came free with our ticket. it was a nice breezy night and to see all the buildings lit up while travelling in the water was beautiful truly. compared to how large the Danube is in Vienna this is the narrowest and shallowest point. worth checking other decks there to see a less busy trip or even a meal on one of the travelling boats, maybe we'll do that next time

Wow!! The Beauty is Stunning/. We visited Matthias Church on a Sunday and could not view the interior due to mass, but it was worth the trip to see the exterior. The architecture is just fabulous and the views of the Pest side of the city was amazing. This is one of the most beautiful churches I've seen, and it should not be missed. It was crowded, so be prepared that the peacefulness of the place can be somewhat compromised.

Unusual and beautiful Church. The interior of the church was a surprise. The church was redone after it was terribly damaged and the colors are beautiful. The exterior is also lovely with a crow that has a great legend behind it.
fame welll deserved. it’s incredible the restoration work they did there. To see the pictures is almost as impressive as the church itself. The fame of the church is well deserved.
Must visit. It's difficult of finding a more beautiful Church. The architechture is just gordious. Well worth a visit and please look at the details. Lovely area with lot's of gordious views.
external viewing.. Another architectural gem. Great views over the river. it is surrounded by what looks like new strucures which detract from the impact.

Stunning. Stunning in the dark and some people even mistake it for the castle!
The church is next to Fisherman's Bastion and a short distance from the Castle

Beautiful church from outside. Next to fisherman bastion. . Nice towering church of Mattius. Next to the fisherman's bastion. Outside looks lovely.
Unfortunately it was closed that day and had a street market with shops and book fair reading of some sort
A gorgeous church!. this church is really huge and very affluent! Worth getting there! The price may be high for tourists!

Book all 3!. Would highly recommend the ticket that allows you entrance to the church, the bastion and the tower. It is worth the price which isn't very expensive to begin with!
The Church is stunning from both the outside and inside.

A ‘must’ if you visit Budapest.. If you only have little time to spend in Budapest this is definitively a ‘must’ to visit. This is one of the most beautiful churches in Europe. It’s also unique because of the wall decoration from different centuries and styles. You can easily spend an hour sitting there and looking around. Around midday is a good time for a visit. Than all the groups are gone for lunch…Another important tip I can give you is that once you start the visit on the first level floor there is a possibility to take around 65 steps to go up again to see an extra exhibition.Once you have arrived on that level you cannot go back and you have to leave the church. You go straight to the exit!

Palatial Interior-a must in Budapest. We visited this exquisite church in Buda and went to the top for an incredible view over Pest .The location on Caslte Hill is fabulous as is the whole of Budapest-one of the best Capital cities in Europe!
Beautiful. A very beautiful building which may not be very old but very accurately builded to impact as if it was antique.
Amazing detail. Beautiful church, the hand paintings instead were amazing. Pay the extra money to go up in the tower, there are 175 steps, but the views are spectacular.

One of Budapest's Great Treasures!. Matthias Church is a must see when in Budapest. Located in the castle district of Buda, the church is rich in history, the site of numerous coronations of Hungary's kings. It has been restored to the highest standard. The tiled roof outside is most impressive especially when seen in the sunlight. The interior is beautiful. This place will be of great interest to those into art, religion, and history. It's not as large as St. Stephen's Basilica (another beautiful church), but the Matthias Church's smaller, more intimate size has an appeal all of its own.

The church is closed every second Monday.. A absolutely stunning Church. Not to be missed!! We could not believe the art in this Church. The first time we tried to visit there were a few weddings and it was closed, so if you go on the weekend be prepared.

From the outside the church is beautiful.The roof is spectacular.We didn't manage to go inside.Area is fun & interesti. Spectacular views from the plaza outside... Hospital in the Rock was nearby - very interesting. Fun restaurants, cafes, shops for tourists.

Worth a look, check times online. Historic building, check times online or you will be disappointed. Church closes very promptly! Recommend having a cover for your bare shoulders, but they have some to borrow.

Week in Budapest. FREE and beautiful. I would recommend seeing this church if you are in the area. There are a lot of people so maybe get there early to try and get pics with less people. It is beautiful though!

Beautiful . One of the most beautiful church's I have seen. The drawings and details are breathtaking.
It's located inside the Buda castle.
Spectacular church. Magnificent inside and out. The view from the grounds overlooking the city is one to behold and should not be missed.

Beautiful roofing tiles!. Beautiful church, just by the Fisherman's Bastion (which has the most amazing views from Peste and the Danube). The roofing tile is the most interesting detail. Vivid colours, which makes the monument come alive!

There Are Churches. But This Is A CHURCH!. In our travels we have visited numerous churches. But this one outdoes them on so many levels. It is amazing what a history is captured here. You need to take your time and take it all in. Many Hungarian Kings were coronated here. It was built in 1255. You can even let a hawk rest of your arm in the square. This tour should not be missed on a visit to Budapest.

Located atop castle hill a magical and historic experience. Another key attraction of Budapest. Not to be missed. We visited in summer and there were two large wedding parties celebrating at the completion of their ceremonies. Great landmark with surrounding area full of coffee shops and ice cream parlors. Parking can be difficult so chose public or guide assisted travel.

Amazing photo ops. We were fortunate to stay in hotel next door looking out at patchwork rook on church. We also took the tour thru and saw the amazing beauty inside and the fabulous stained glass windows.
Amazing. Amazing church with spectacular painting and carvings. Well worth visit. Great historic site. amazing history.
Beautiful. Beautiful, painted walls inside are amazing, teh church is a delight and views from upper gallery to inside church are just lovely

A treasure of Hungarian history. St. Mattias Church [Mátyás-templom] is located in the Castle Disctrict on the Budda side of Budapest. The church is a beautiful landmark, and a treasure of Hungarian history. The outside roof is a wonder of architectural design, and the interior has been lovingly restored. Check out the design of the roof tiles...they really are fantastic! The history of the church is fascinating, and it’s worth reading the history before you visit so that you get a sense of what has happened here in the past.The statues, the stained glass, and the frescoes are world-class. Upstairs is the Ecclesiastical Art Museum, where you’ll find many artifacts and replicas of the Crown jewels. This church is well worth a visit!

Must-See Church. Gorgeous church! The tower is an absolute must-see, but for those with knee issues or that don't like enclosed spaces, I would definitely skip it. Also, it's within walking distance to a lot of other sites. If you don't take the funicular, walking up to the top is a trek.

A must see church. Beautiful building from the outside. This is a fabulous church to visit - admission fee - as the inside is covered in stencilled paintwork from Hungarian folk art. We did not go on the 'tower tour'. We did listen to the 70 minute Duma Chamber ensemble playing a selection of popular classics here one night.
Worth a trip inside. Nice roof outside, best viewed from fisherman's bastion. Inside is unique, all pillars painted, very unusual.
Buda Church. Incredible and very beautiful church. Well worth the visit and the views from outside are fabulous. Great little neighborhood

Epic views from the tower. Would definitely recommend climbing to the top of the tower- our guide was very knowledgeable and, as it was our first day of the trip, it was a good way to get to know the geography of Budapest landmarks
What a view. Must see! Incredible view of Budapest from the Castle area and lovely buildongs all around. Really hard to describe all the beauty off this place.
Matthias at night. I have seen it both on day and night. Lighted view is the best. did not go near the church but viewed from distance

A must-see. This is a must see. It is a 13th century church filled with history and Hungarian religious sentiment. Exceptional are the stained-glass windows, frescoes, carved stone figures and wall decorations by Hungarian Romantic painters. It is a Budapest landmark well worth the price of admission. It is a place of worship, so wear modest clothes and, gentlemen, take off your hat. Don't forget the rest of the neighborhood and do stop for a pastry at a nearby cafe.
Lovely church. In the castle district. Beautiful outside and in. Well worth admission price. Take the time to visit the mini museum upstairs.

Not Huge, Not As Ornate As Some, But Beautiful None-the-Less. The exterior is very appealing with a very tall spire relative to the rest of the building. The roof has beautiful weatherproof tiles that shine. It is gorgeous at night when the exterior is brightly illuminated (like many things in this city.) The inside is not as ornate as I expect of many old churches. That may be due to the "tortured" history of Budapest over the centuries. It is also not a large church. But it is pleasing to look at and is adjacent to Fisherman's Bastion, another good attraction. There is an admission price to go inside, but I was part of a tour group, so I don't know if it is a good value.
Worth to see it. One of the beautiful historic churches, will recommend to see it once you are in budapest. It's not necessary to go there via lift , you can also go there via bus.

Like a Museum. It was colorful, rich and very well maintained. I was first not happy to pay entrance fees to visit a Church. Nevertheless, it was full of history and through the three floors we visited we forgot that we are in a Church but rather in a Museum. It is located in the castle district.
Very beautiful and different!. Very beautiful and different! All the interior is painted, from the walls up to the ceiling. Must see the view from the second floor.

Beautiful Church. After visiting the Fisherman`s Bastion built by Schulek, i came down the steps to admire his other creation the Matthais church located just opposite to it..This hundreds years old church had been damaged many times with the major destruction being in the 15th century by the Turks.Schulek restored the church to its original splendor by adding beautiful diamond patterned roof tiles & gargoyles to it.You enter the church through the exquisite Gothic relief Mary portal reconstructed from the original damaged pieces decorated with colorful patterns,motifs & frescoes on the walls with beautiful stained glass window pans.Beneath the south tower of the church is the Boroque Madonna.The church also has relics & treasures including the Matthais chalice & the Hungarian Royal crown.

One of the best things to see. The roof has a peculiar decoration and inside the church is impressive.You can feel the greatness of the Austro Hungarian empire.Surrounded by other important buildings, and a nice square.
Must see in Budapest. This church sits beside the Fishermans Bastiona nd overlooks the Danube. It si worth seeing as the decorative influences come from many cultures.

Gorgeous Gothic Cathedral. This church isn't like any other around - it is a gorgeous gothic cathedral rich with history and meticulously stenciled and painted within. We took the additional tour up to the bell tower and had 20 minutes of 360 degree views! Warning that the tower climb is for reasonably healthy travelers without claustrophobia issues.
Beautiful!. Buy tickets to go in, do the tower and the ramparts, a guide will give you information and the views are fabulous.

Stunning place. You just can't imagine how beautiful it is! All these details and sculptures are truly amazing! The interior is just so stunning like the exterior. It is one of the must visited places in Budapest!

Impressive Matthias Church of Budapest. Originally erected between the 13th and 15th century, the Church of the Virgin Mary in Budapest is now commonly referred to as the Matthias Church. It was extensively reconstructed during the reign of King Matthias who added the impressive tower and the oratory. A unique feature of the Bale tower of the Matthias Church is the glazed ceramic tiles covering the roof. The inside of the church is of eth Neo-Gothic architecture, and is quite beautiful. the church is adjacent to the Fisherman Bastion which provide another unique attraction when visiting the Matthias Church. Quite a long walk on foot, but manageable. Better to have a means of transportation to get there. Don't miss this attraction.

Meticulous artwork!. Of all the churches seen on our trip, this is one which has special interior with it fresco paintings, gorgeous statutes and ornately designed altars. You can spend a day just admiring the paintings. The art work is meticulous and skillful. Historians and artists alike must this place. Truly a don't miss church of the many in Europe.
Best view. The roof is incredible. The whole place just beautiful. The viwe over Budapest from there is wonderful.
Must See From Every Viewpoint. The church is a remarkable must see on both inside and out. Of course while you are up there you get to see the vista of everything else!

Church with a view.. This church was totally repainted and renovated in 2012 and is absolutely lovely. It is worth visiting it, just to walk through the Fisherman's Bastian and view the Danube from this elevation. Remember to wear a top that covers your shoulders or you will be given a shawl to wear inside and in Summer this can be a little unpleasant.
Wonderful. It's in the Buda castle. It's an architectural masterprice. I've never seen like this before. I recommend it for everyone!

Don't Miss It. This Cathedral was breathtaking inside. There was a small fee to get in, just a couple Euros, and was well worth the visit. Go inside and see this place! They allow pictures and occasionally have symphonies and other things going on in the evenings. Great place to visit!

A must see. Simply amazing. It is one of the most amazing churches I've seen. Enjoy standing by the door and hear everyone that comes in gasp with "oh my god", "holy" or "wow"! I almost guarantee you will too.

Unexpectedly Stunning Art and Architecture!. From the exterior is clearly a beautiful building but the art work all over the arches in the wonderfully tall building will completely amaze you! The are so many truly creative moments in this church - it is really a pleasant surprise!

You can find treasures in the Church's museum. This Catholic Church is next to Fisherman's Bastion. If your tour do not cover it, you can just buy the ticket to get inside, it is not expensive. After take a look around, don't forget to go upstairs to take a look at the church's museum. You will be surprised to find what they have.

Much to be seen in this area.... The Matthias Church and the area nearby are extraordinary buildings with more that a historical feel, but a wonderful nearly 360° view of the Fisherman's Bastion and the river below. So much to stroll around and see. Take the bus if you're not fond of 1,000 stairs!

Don't miss it. It's only a hundred yards from Fisherman's Bastion so don't miss it along your trek to the fantastic view.
It's quiet elegance offers a view of years long lost .....
Magnificent. Fantastic view at night. Take an easy stroll across the castle yards and enjoy the spectacular view over Pest.
Impresive. Quite spectacular,the tiles on the roof have all these amazing colours, I think it features in most every ones snap shots,a wonderful degree of architecture.

Beautifully restored church. This church originally built in the 10th century has been through numerous renovations, changes (even serving as a Mosque at one point). The restorations and architecture were beautiful...
As a bonus, the staff did not prevent me from using my tripod for photos!
Amazing.... The place is incredible as well as the area...one of those places that you don't want to miss when you are in Budapest.

Ornate Overlook. My rating of 4 stars has more to do with not getting in the church because of all the weddings, than it is a reflection of the church overall because the outside is fabulous. Up on castle hill sits this beautifully ornate church with the column to commemorate the Plague victims/survivors in front and the Fisherman's Bastion in its rear. And the glazed tiles on top cap the church marvelously.But just viewing the church isn't enough. It has such an eclectic composition, that one needs to hear its story of its growth and evolution and reclamation from all the different challenges that it has faced, necessitating its different remodels.

History, Relics and Art. Seeing the sites on Castle Hill is a must when in Budapest. I found that there were three options to get there. There is a funicular from Chain Bridge for a fee, numerous rather steep footpaths or the public bus system specifically bus No. 16 (Var Busz). A fee of1400 HUF gets you into the Matthias Church. This fee also entitles you to the entrance to the Museum of Ecclesiastical Art. where you can see sacred relics, medieval stone carvings, the Matthias Chalice and replicas of the Hungarian royal crown and coronation jewels. The Budapest Card will get you a 10% discount. If you wish to see the interior of the church without paying a fee, the sacred chapel is open all day for prayer. The original Romanesque church built at this site dates to 1015 but there are no remains of this church. This church was founded by St. Stephen, the first King of Hungary, his statue is outside the church. King Bela IV founded the present day church in 1212. He and his wife Anne de Chatillon are laid to rest in a sarcophagus in the Trinity Chapel. The Mongols destroyed it in 1241-42 Matthias rebuilt it in 1255 only to have it captured by the Turks in 1541 and converted to a mosque. The Turks white washed the walls and removed all traces of it's Christian heritage. Under the direction of architect Frigyes Sculek (1873-96) the church was restored to it's Christian roots.This church was the site of Charles IV coronation in 1916, as well as, the coronation of Franz Joseph in 1867 establishing the Austro-Hungarian Empire. Matthias's two weddings also took place in this church. In 1991 Pope John Paul the II visited this church.

Impressive!. this is an impressive architectural building in the Castle District. It's small inside and vibrant and very pretty. Beautiful inside and wonderfully lit at night. We enjoyed this church thoroughly

Well worth paying to go in!. Magnificent church to look around. Once inside you can take pictures, plus there is a museum on the upper floor with lots of interesting information about the history and lots of artifacts. The ticket to go inside is good value and it's well worth paying for it!

Worth Going In. We were originally in two minds about going in to Matthias Church due to the entry fee but were pleased that we did in the end as the inside is beautifully patterned. There was restoration going on while we were inside which was pretty interesting to observe and there was also an organ practice so all round pretty epic.

Only saw it from the outside. Even I didn`t enter the church I had a look through the door and as every churches which are very popular, it`s rich and beautiful from the outside. But the reason that made me not enter was the fact you have to pay and according to a local friend, it didn`t worth the money.
Worth going inside. This church, like many in Budapest, is uniquely and beautifully decorated. Definitely worth the extra fee.
Beautiful but very busy!. Very beautifully preserved and a huge tourist attraction. Intricate stairways and little rooms with historic alcoves bordering on little musems.
Choral song. Loved it, we went in and a choir were singing, the building is beautiful, you can climb up to the top but we went at night so seemed a little pointless
Matthias Church. Well worth the visit. Went there during daytime. View from up there magnifficent. Beautiful from the outside.

A church to remember. This is a beautiful church. With white towers rising over the colorful Zsolnay tiled roof. It stands near the Fisherman's Bastion on the Castle Hill in it's full glory. This church has seen it's share of history and destruction. It was built by the first King of Hungary in 1015, then destroyed by the Mongols. It was rebuilt and redone many times after that. It became a mosque during the Turkish rule. Most of the royal coronations, weddings and funerals used to be held in this church. The architect Frigyes Schulek tried to restore it to it's former glory taking great care that the buildings surrounding it would not clash with it. His efforts were wasted because during the Second World War the Soviet snd German troops camped here and badly damaged it. Finally, Schulek's son re-restored it in 2013.

Ok Church for Europe. Not the best church to tour in Europe or Budapest, but nice enough. Poor service in ticket sales not explaining the options to make sure you could go all up in the tower which I think would have given a great view of the city.
Must see if you go to Budapest!. I cannot compete with your guidebook and so I'll only say it is a one of the (religious) landmarks of Budapest and you should check it out!

Unexpected awe. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside is just incredible. I think the entrance fee is justified given the restoration work that has gone into what is an unexpectedly magnificent interior. The style and colours are unlike those of any church I have visited. Would definitely recommend the visit!
A must see sight in Budapest. The unique painted interior in preraphaelite style is absolutely worth the visit! Note the trompe l'oeil window in the upper right corner of the back of the facade.
Nice church. Nice place, but entierely rebuild and repainted. As most of hbudapest museum, the entrance is a little bit expensive

Just another church, if churches are boring. But some say not.... Just another church, if churches in Europe are boring. A very beautiful building, inside out, if you amaze at the beauty of these structures, how each one makes a point in it's own individual character.
Amazing. The church is so ornate and decorated, it's worth doing a proper tour to learn all about the different meanings of the paintings/carvings/furnishings etc
Stunning. What a stunning church. Magnificently restored. So beautiful inside and out. Fabulous views looking over the Danube.

Stunning!. The cathedral totally amazed me.
It was the most beautiful place I have visited in Budapest.
The interior is really nice, but the exterior is even better.
And moreover, there is a great view from there. You can see the parliament across the river.

Really amazing. We only saw the exterior but we were very satisfied only with that. The details in the architecture are captivating. The colors in the on roof tiles look like on fire when the sun goes down.

Must see . Simply you must see it - very unique
The tower tour is a completion of the sight view of the city
Very spectacular panorama

The other must see church. This is a beautiful church on the Buda side. It is breath taking in how it was built. Lots of things to se allowing you to get up close.
The tower is worth climbing.
Matthias Church. A beautiful old church within easy walking distance of many hotels.. The organ music is wonderful if you happen to catch a concert.
Must visit Cathedral. Beautiful Cathedral. Must see if you visit Budapest. I would recommend hop on and off bus.. The roof tiles are glazed. You see that in more places.

Beautiful Gothic Church. Situated on the Buda side on top of the Castle Hill near the Fisherman's Bastion. It is a beautiful Gothic church with colourful pattern roof top. There is an entrance charge. Early visit is recommended as it gets crowded. One of Budapest popular churches. Not to be missed.

Stunning!. Magnificent representation of christian religosity at its most exquisite.It shows a different era of the church receiving "everything" while the poor starved. Amazing artistry and craftsmanship from all angles which can be appreciated in their context. .

a must see. you need to see it on summer time, because it's marble everywhere and it's like glowing
fisherman bastion behind the church

Dazzling Beauty Overwhelms its Visitors. We joined a short line one afternoon to visit this centuries old Roman catholic church. Its dramatic location is on the Buda side of the city in the square near the castle and fortified walls that overlook the Danube River. We walked inside and caught our breath. This is a mind blowing work ;of architecture and art. Paintings and mosaics adorn the walls, stained glass windows are everywhere and high Romanesque and Gothic arches are part of the original design and of later restorations. When the church was renovated in the 19th century a new roof of diamond design tiles and several gargoyles were added to the exterior. There is an art collection of sacred relics in the basement of the church. This is a major site of Budapest, so allow time to take it all in and wander throughout its spaces.
Well worth a visit. Beautiful building and very impressive. The architecture commands respect and quiet visitors are appreciated.

Special place. Indeed this is a very beautiful place and special also. Try to visit the church in a guided tour – you will find out a lot of interesting things about the construction, the history and some legends related to the church. The interior decoration is very beautiful and, somehow, out of the usual standards. I would like to be back!
architecture simply stunning. beautiful especially at night. bats flying round the spire. good views over danube, great photo opportunities

Beautiful. It takes a little effort, but climbing the tower is a must! The view is amazing. I also went on the first tower tour, at 10 am, and there was only one other visitor for two guides. So I basically got a personal guide, who was very friendly and knowledgeable.

Great part of Buda. As mentioned before I am not a fan of ecclesiastic prowess, but this church is worth a visit. Add the gorgeous surroundings, and you have a great place. Be sure that there a lots of tourists.
Spectacular. Beautiful church is one of Budapest's important destinations. Stunning views - interior of the church is wonderful.

Stunning!. This is a stunning church with a view of Budapest that is well worth the trip up the hill. We did not have time to go inside, but I would love to return and do a tour. Just seeing the outside was wonderful. There is a fee to go inside the church, but it is free to walk the grounds.

An abolute must see. I really wish that I could give this building a "double Excellent " score . The plaza by the church has various vendors who sell beverages and snacks. so while you wait to go into the church, grab a refreshment. ticket lines are long. and move very slowly.

Historic church in Castle District. When visiting Budapest, one must visit the Castle District and this magnificent church. While living in Budapest several years back, we attended Sunday services and concerts.

Absolutely stunning. This was probably my favourite sight in Budapest and it's not short of wonderful sights! The church is just amazing, the paintwork is so unusual - it is not the usual heavy baroque style, more art nouveau style. We absolutely loved it.

Beautiful church. Beautiful inside and out and well restored. Good place to pray. Among other things, this church was used to crown the kings and queens of Hungary.
The Church is in an excellent location for viewing Budapest. It is on the Buda side of the Danube River.
Magnificiant church. If you are in the Castle hill area, in the middle you will find this great church. There is an entrance fee, but it worth it!

Spectacular inside and outside. The interior is even more impressive than the exterior, beautiful decorations and play of light through stained glass windows. One can go up several levels of stairs, to get various angles of view of the interior. On the uppermost level is a display of sumptuous reliquaries and religious vestments; and a view into the roof space. Worth the entry charge, especially as it's half price for pensioners (age 65+).

They had me with the roof. Wonderful architecture inside and out including the roof!Not the most ornate church inside, but nicely done and full of history. If you're interested in such things, there is a very interesting video of the last coronation of the last king of Hungary that took place in 1916 in the middle of WWI

Splendid architecture. Didn't get the opportunity to tour inside, timing of visits is around services etc which is perfectly acceptable. Splendid architecture and a beautiful coloured roof creates a "must have" photo day and night for your holiday album

Beautiful Tile Work and View. Matthias Church was closed when we went to visit but we still enjoyed the view from there and the beauty of the outside workmanship. It is also close to many other sights on Castle Hill.
Beautful church with an amazing view!!. Beautiful church. I love the Hungarian ceramic tile roof. View of Parliament building from the back is also really great.
Church. Interesting example quite commercial though. Be prepared to pay to go in although it is supposed to be free.
Lovely. Really nice, beautiful from the outside and even more from the inside. If you are visiting Budapest, you definitely need to go.

amazing view, especially at night. It is restored to its former glory and looks absolutely stunning at night. It is definitely worth reading about its history before making a visit as this makes it more alive

Beautiful interior. Really beautiful church with a unique roof. Beautiful inside with a exhibition upstairs that is very informative about Hungarian history. Great interiors and not too expensive if you don't go up the tower.

Breathtaking. If you visit one church in Hungary it should be this one. From the tile work outside to the breathtaking interior visitors will be in awe of this church. How fortunate we all are to have this church restored to see it in it's glory. A must see.
Breathtaking church. This is a beautiful and interesting church with stained glass windows which really catch the light. I found it more interesting than St Stephen's basilica.

Serene Church. We were in Budapest during 2015 Easter period and on the second day we planned to visit this after seeing Chain bridge and then zero point. We took Bus no 16 from the zero point, just crossing the chain bridge towards Buda side. However the bus originates from Deák Ferenc tér near the yellow line metro station and going to Donáti utca.There is a funicular service available from that point for going to top of the castle hill area, however that appeared too costly for us as the fare was 1400HUK for return where as the bus fare was 300HUK(as we took a block of 10 tickets)It took 15 mins to reach the top of the hill, stoppage named Dish Ter. This is one of the top choices in Castle hill area. Matthias Church is 700 years old and have beautiful architectural. It was used for King Matthias’s wedding. There was an entry fee for going inside.We took lots of photos from that area of river Danube, chain bridge, Parliament and then proceeded to other attractions.

Beautiful church. I have had the pleasure to follow the re-build of the church as I have been traveling to Budapest 5 times over the last seven years. I even stayed at the Hilton Hotel next på the church. It's a very beautiful church and you should visit it when you are in town

Quick English summary at 12 PM Sunday Mass. After touring many churches I loved Matthias (he was no saint :o) because it was a little smaller and intimate. We attend the 12 PM Mass and were pleasantly surprised that after the homily a deacon read the Gospel in English and did a short summary of the readings of the day. The pipe organ is majestic, as well.
Amazing architecture. By far my favorite church in Hungary. The textures on the walls are amazing. It took my breath away.

Beautiful from the outside.... The building is beautiful, no questions about that, and everything was restored from the WW2, which makes this place one of the most amazing sites on the city, no questions about that either.
But, the fact that they charge a simple visit inside, and it's very expensive by the way, ruins it for me. That is why I'm giving 3/5.
visiul overload. Buda side of the river, this is a must see. On Sundays, it doesn't open until 1 PM. Buy your ticket first at window opposite church.

Magnificent church. A very beautiful church. Only problem was the queue for getting tickets. Though a very long queue only 2 ticket booth were open. Prepare for a long waiting time.
Ticket was 3500 HUF for a family. This included the church and a small museum upstairs. Not suitable wheelchairs.

Fabulous church to see and enjoy the music. The church is very beautiful at day and even more amazing at night! A lot of concerts happen here almost every evening, so you can enjoy the beauty of the church and the music at once.

Beautiful. From the outside you just cannot tell.
Once inside it really is wow! So much to look at and it really is beautiful.
It has wonderful artefacts too, although it's not clearly labelled where you should be going.
lovely decor. beautifully decorated and other treasures in the museum section to interest; very popular and you have to pay to get in.

Beautiful!. Didn't miss out on this during this visit. A beautiful iconic Catholic Church. Architecturally jaw-dropping and stands inside the Fisherman's Bastion overlooking the beautiful city of Budapest and the Danube River. Definitely worth a visit for lovers of churches.
Wonderful Church!!. I absolutely love the ceramic tiled roof. Incredible church and is a must visit if you're in Budapest. You won't regret it.

Spectacular interior!. Yet another church that has an admission charge, but it was worth it. I have travelled Europe and not seem a church so full of frescoes from ceiling to floor. As always you are better doing a guided tour of the church if you have time to learn about its history.

Well worth a visit.. This is the top attraction in Budapest and well worth a visit. The decoration of the walls is a contrast to prominent features in many other churches. It's great to see the different ways in which Christians in different places glorify God.

Stunning church, but bit too expensive. This church is very beatuiful inside, but actually I find it too expensive - typically a tourist sight.
However inside you can find legends and writings about the history, which can be very interesting.
Not for people with limited walking abilities. Good view from outside, but we could t go in due to the huge number of stairs. We could not have carried the baby up on our own.

Did not agree to pay almost 15€ for entering a church. I'm aware that monuments are visited for a fee, but to pay for entering the church and then pay again for entering the fischerman's bastion I believe it's too much for just a panoramic view and a prayer

Small, Cosy and Amazing. Beautiful & Magnificent.
The colors and the way it is built.
Worth the visit special that it is right next to the Bastion and a 10 minutes walk from the castle.

To admire from the Pest-Side to explore in Buda. Beautyfull location in Buda, Unique rooftop, entrance fee, Nice museum with view inside the church from first and second level
With supplement also the tower
A church with a life in various periods

Gothic church. Must see! Beutiful church with Gothic architecture. We were lucky as they had just reopened after restoring it. There were men there with eagles. For a small fee, they will glove you so you can have one perched on your arm and have your picture taken. Great views up there.

Another interesting church on the Buda side of Budapest. Mattias church is one of many interesting churches in Budapest. This churches history is interesting. It honors a Hungarian hero. But our tour guide noted that there is no saint before his name because he was a womanizer.
Love at first sight. My favourite building in Europe. After my first time in Budapest (as a tourist) I knew that I would be back, even if only to see this beautiful church again.

BEAUTIFUL CHURCH IN A BEAUTIFUL AREA. We visited on a very hot day in July, the place was teaming with tourists.
The church is magnificent both inside and outside, buy the ticket its well worth a visit.

Beautiful inside and out!. Incredibly beautiful! Step inside and you will be glad that you made this a stop on your visit to Budapest. Take a look at the unique roof tiles and the way the church reflects in the windows of the building next door.

A jewel of a church. Do not miss this church on your Budapest itinerary. Once you enter it takes your breath away it is so beautiful. Small and perfect, wonderful designs and colours on the columns and every inch is decorated.
By the way, Seniors get can enter at a reduced rate.

Beautiful historical church. The church stand out once you reach the hill top. You were not miss it and it is such a stunning building with more than 700 years of history. Great for photo taking. We were here on a hot July summer day and wish can spend more time to explore and take more photos. There were lots of tourists in the area.

Beautiful church. After seeing few bigger and more amazing churches, it was bit of a disappointment, but still worth the ticket. It is beautiful, and there are few interesting things to see. My wife liked that mummified foot relic.
Must visit. Probably the most beautiful church in Budapest, not to be missed. By the way, it's more than 700 years old.The entrance is free. Include the visit in the daily visit to Castle Hill.

Great for pictures. We didn't get a chance to visit inside the church but outside it is beautiful and ornate. You can't miss it if you visit Fisherman's Bastion. It's worth a pause to take some photos and admire the architecture.

An impressive church, beautifully decorated. One of the more impressive churches I have visited. If you wish, you can get the tower-tour for an additional cost, or just visit the church. There is also a small museum inside the church
Outstanding . Excellent monument. Well worth a trip up to see it. There is an entrance fee. Spectacular roof. Modern hilton hotel next door spoils it though.
History and modern. I visit this church twice when I travelled to Budapest this Feburary and July. The beauty of it is itself and the location of it.

A stunning church. This church is like a work of art in itself, with the most unusual architecture I have ever seen. Its spire and roof is stunning! It is in a busy and beautiful area of Budapest, up on the hills on the Buda side, right across from Fisherman's Bastion and overlooking the wonderful views over the river. This is a must-see in itself!

Go inside (even if you're sick of churches already). If you're traveling in Europe, it's easy to get tired of churches. Plus, you have to wait in a tedious line to buy tickets to get inside this one. It's worth it -- do it. We did it, our friends didn't and regretted it later. The inside isn't like any other church you've seen -- fantastic wall murals and painted details.

Beauitiful!. Church is next door to the hotel and very popular tourist attraction and wedding location. Witnessed several weddings on Saturday as well as receptions held outside at Fisherman's Bastion.

Unique and beautiful!. If you're a fan of architecture, you will be overpleased by this gothic work of art, with a unique tile design to its roof.If you're not necessarily a fan of architecture, I would still recommend you go there, since it is well located at the top of Castle Hill, near other great attractions.

Not so impressive!. To be honest I was expecting a more impressive church especially inside.Church is located in a very nice place close to the walls that you can have a very nice view for Danube and for Pest.Take a note that in order to enter the church you need to pay a ticket for 1400 HUF (St. Stephens church is free and if you want you can pay a donation of 200 HUF).Thus if you are planning to enter a church in Budapest then recommended from my side the St. Stephens basilica instead of Matthias church.

Lovely church with Incredible History!. This is a beautiful church with incredible views! We recommend taking the church and tower tour. The 192 steps aren't easy, but the views at the top are worth it!
A work of art.. This church is one of the many beautiful attractions in the Buda hillsides. Don't miss the wonderful roof tiles. Well worth a visit.

Great Architecture. as you approach the church you can see how it stands out even among the impressive structures all around it. Well worth walking around admiring the craftsmanship and decoration - great views from the hill also.
Beautiful!. Really nice church! Went here for a Hungarian wedding which was a treat. The church is in great shape and really looks impressive both from the outside and the inside.
Beautiful church with a gorgeous interior!. A beautiful church with a fairly unique and beautiful interior. Definitely worth a visit when you are at the Fishermans Bastion.
A gorgeous church. Beautifully decorated with stencilling and stunning stain glass windows, would recommend a visit! The outside of the church is wonderful and provides stunning views of Budapest.
Beautiful. Really beautiful. peaceful and calm atmosphere. Must see if you are staying in Hungary. Better to visit nearby attractions on the same day so you will need less time.

Beasutiful both inside and outside. This was the third vacation we took in the past four years (Trafalgar Tours, Viking River Cruises, and Insight Vacations) which included Budapest. Each time we visited this architectural gem.

Interesting story. This church has been the place where many Hungarian legends have been crowned kings. The most famous of kings was Matthias, who was not crowned in this church but was married twice there, hence its name
Special and wonderful. Special and wonderful amalgamation of the eastern in the western style church that brings hope and future.
Great Church to visit. A serene sanctuary to gawk at the architecture and interior sacredreligious decor and to reflect and meditate.

Beautiful outside but a fee to enter. It has been more than a decade since I last visited and I was shocked that you must now pay to enter the church. It is beautiful from outside and worth going to see, I do not even know how much it cost to go in since the lines were so long, it was not worth waiting to see.

Stunning exterior. Absolutely a must see. The church and surrounding are amazing So picturesque. The inside of this church is beautiful too There are cafes shops and fisherman a bastion and wall which are perfect for amazing views and photographs.
Gem of Budapest. A must for first time visitor to Budapest. Both the exterior and the interior of this church is stunning! Definitely worth a visit.
Crowded monument. While worth seeing, this church was clogged with tours, tour buses and hard to move around in. Go off season.
Beautiful church and stained glass windows . One of our first stops on the Viking Legend's Danube Waltz cruise in June. Historical church with decorative chapel, stained glass and scenic views.

A Rather Unique Church. A bit smaller than the other churches I visited on this last tour to Poland, Czech Republic, Austria and Hungary, it was quite unique in that the frescoes and the walls were quite different and reflective of a somewhat different culture than the other churches I saw. Take lots of pictures when you are there. It is quite the beautiful church dedicated to an adored King of days long gone.
Awesome. One of the most beautiful churches I have ever visited both inside and outside. The roof is stunning colours and the interior is very ornate with wonderful stain glass windows.
Outstanding Church. The outside as beautiful as the inside, hence more time to see all.The view of Pest alone is worth a visit to the area
Gorgeous and with great views. The church is gorgeous inside and out. It has great views of the Danube. We highly recommend going to it.

Great church in the beautiful framework of castle hill. Matthias Church is a great church in the beautiful framework of castle hill - there are a lot of stories about Matthias Church. Even for non religious people it is a place with lots of learnings and new ideas.
Beautiful Church. Pay to go inside, it's worth it, if only to take a pew in the cool interior on a hot day.But the interior is very beautiful with the ceiling and stained glass windows.

Beautiful church (especially the inside) on Castle Hill district of Buda side. This church sits atop in Castle Hill district next to Fisherman's Bastion with beautiful view of Pest across Danube river. The interior is unusual with geometric paints all around and has a fairy tale quality if not for altar & religious relics. It's easily reachable via Bus#16 from Pest side which runs till very late at night.HINT: During summer, there are classical concerts at the church in the evening. It's CHEAP and you get to see & enjoy the interior of the church while listening to beautiful music. We did on our last day and it was the highlight of Budapest visit. Google "Concerts at Matthias Church" for more info.
Breath taking views. The church was not available for viewing but there are some breathtaking views and I would recommend spending 30 min there.

Wonderful building. There is nothing to dislike about Matthias Church. It is simply beautiful and must be visited when in Budapest. It is also very good to compare it to the neighbouring Hilton Hotel and see all the beauty of the old architecture.

Great buiding. One of the must sees of Budapest and it doeant disappoint, located in the castle districe it is surrounded by great views and great photo opportunities. This bulding looks amazing form the pest side of the city at night it really stands out.
Amazing Church. An amazing and historic church with an incredible tiled roof. The inside is worth seeing for a small cost and it's worth seeing the painted walls. A place for reflection

Beautiful Church. A small charge is required to go and look inside the church, which is a beautiful serene holy site, giving a history of what befell Budapest during its conflicts. The stained glass windows and the murals are a joy. Well worth seeing. For those who have walking difficulties, take the hop on hop off bus.
the church to see. the church to see,one of the best churches i have seen in my life ,a must for everyone who visits budapest

highly recommend. It was a very interesting incursion in the past; a better understanding of Hungarian kings with Romanian origin. We could not find materials about the legends about the ring found by the Corvus.

Very lovely, external viewing only. Although one can pay to visit the interior, I chose to wander the exterior, viewing the Danube River and city, plus the lovely Church exterior. The temperature was extreme, so staying in the shade was my preference. To the right in the back, one can also pay to go to a second floor viewpoint, however if one continues to the left and walks a few minutes more, one can climb a similar staircase and get access to a free viewpoint (also a restaurant/cafe, but one does not have to buy anything). This Church is too beautiful to miss. You will not be disappointed. Also walking to the Church is along a picturesque street with lots of shops and restaurants.
10 am mass. went there for the high mass, and was impressed greatly by the fact that gthe kings of Hungary were crowned there,
Simply beautiful. The sight of the church was just simply beautiful. We were just admiring the architectual outside the building and didnt have a chance to go inside.

Amazing church inside and out. This was one of my favorite churches because it wasn't overdone inside, not all that gilding and show. However it was just as impressive as any church that I visited on my trip from Amsterdam to Budapest. I loved it for it's simple beauty that was just as overwhelming as the totally guilded churches and I could almost feel the artisans who must have labored with love to build and paint the interior.Outside the church is even more impressive with it's roof made of pyrogranite in an array of colors.Even if you think you're tired of going in churches don't miss this one, it's amazing.

A beautiful and vibrant church.... My mum and I recently visited here whilst on holiday in Budapest. Naturally it was very busy and a tourist hotspot, but it really is a beautiful church, it is so vibrant and colourful, you really get a sense of the history of cultures that have occupied the region. From the roof tiles to the stained glass windows, everything is so picturesque and vibrant, and as it is on the top of a hill, there are great views over the river...I really would recommend a visit.

Worth buying a ticket to see inside. The interior of this church is very different to most that you will ever see so it's definitely worth buying a ticket for. Women need to have their shoulders covered but shawls are provided if you aren't. Be prepared to queue opposite the church to buy your entry ticket. The signs are very clear. Someone, however, needs to tell the staff to be A LOT more efficient at selling them. The woman in our queue was incredibly slow and we had to wait another minute when we got to the front while she very obviously checked her Facebook messages. When you're standing in full sunshine in 35 degrees, one would appreciate more efficient service. It's the only reason I didn't give 5/5.
Unusual church. The inside of this church is very unusual. Definitely worth a visit to see the wonderful decoration.
Amazing church with lots of interesting history. we visited the Church before a wedding it was amazing it has souvenir shops entrance is around 3 euro worth to visit and take pictures..

Stunning both inside and out. The church is one of the most prominent landmarks in Budapest, and it was one of the highlights of our trip. It's beautiful on the outside and offers amazing views of the river and the city, but don't miss the chance to wander around inside.
