You have to pay, and we were tired and almost didn't go in, but we were so glad we did. The inside is absolutely unique--unlike any other church we've seen on this trip (and we've seen at least a dozen major European churches thus far). It has an almost mosque-like feel to it, with nearly every surface covered in beautiful designs.

Beautiful old church.. I didn't go in but the church stands as a beacon in the Castle area. Outstanding architecture. Fee to enter. Large square with monument by the church is a good meeting and resting point.
Matthias Church. We enjoyed our tour of beautiful Matthias Church. The museum seemed to go on forever ending with a walk down a small stone spiral stairway. Be prepared for the walk down!

Love the tile roof. Pretty church in Castle District. Light stonework contrasts with the colorfully patterned roof tiles. One really tall spire gives it a unique look. Nice stained glass and frescoes inside, too. Plus there's a legend about a statue of Mary appearing out of the walls during a war. A Christian miracle that scared away the occupying Turks,

One of the Most Unique and Beautiful Churches I've Seen. This church is one of the most beautiful churches I have seen. The colors and the roof tiles, and the way it glimmers in the sun will take your breath away. When you first happen upon it, as you walk up the hill toward the town, and the views from the hill...you will be stunned. Pictures don't even do it justice. Just another part of what makes Budapest a magical place to visit!

part of a tour. Loved the beauty/architecture of this church. I wish I had a chance to go inside, but was part of a tour which only gave limited time. There are a some other places to see in this area (fishermans bastion), so could spend a few hours

Old church but more beautiful than ever. Years ago, still during the restoration of this old coronation church, we were lucky enough to get in, when it was closed to the public. A friend took us in, and gave us a very expert guided tour about the building, their work with the restoration and the wonderful interior of ” Mátyás templom”.Matthias church was founded by Saint Stephen, king of Hungary in 1015, and after shared the fate of many European buildings, because of the countless wars, sieges, captures and recaptures. It was more or less damaged, destroyed, and after rebuilt and renovated. What we can adore now, praises the genius of Schulek Frigyes, who mostly rebuilt this temple, as it looked like in the 13th century.There are so many treasures inside and out of this elegant medieval church that is very hard not to miss something.The whole building looks vibrant, mostly because of the mixing styles and the wonderful, colourful majolica roofing, (made by the famous Zsolnay porcelain factory). Just look at the contrast in between the Romanesque and Gothic forms on the east façade and examine the countless different towers.When you step inside- presumably because of the coloration of the columns and arches- my impression was that it has an oriental mood, what made this very Catholic Church even more interesting. The decoration of the interior rivals some famous Italian churches.Many wonderful frescoes and stained windows are praising the handwork of Székely Bertalan, Lotz Károly and Zichy Mihály.Don’t miss the two stained windows, the St. Elizabeth on the west, and the St. Margaret on the east, and the beautiful frescoes of the St. Ladislas chapel. The most magnificent is the Trinity chapel with the double sarcophagus of Béla III, and his wife, but I still prefer the Loretto chapel with its more intimate spirit.The enumeration of the sights is endless, you have to go and discover it yourself.My only advice is, don’t go on a very hot day, especially if your nose is sensitive. When I visited the church, it was during the peak of a heatwave and obviously the Matthias church has very poor ventilation. Because of many sweating bodies around me, the stench was overwhelming. It ruined a bit the experience. Then, and there I understood the real usefulness of the myrrh.

A wonderful architecture. Before ı visited, ı was a little bit cautious about this church but when ı saw the magnificient architecture of the building, all of my worries past away.The church is one of the most important places to visit in Budapest.It is located in the castle and has a great view of Budapest.

One of the most beautiful churches. A must see in Budapest. Beautiful from the inside and outside. The tiled roof and architecture of the church are unique. It is a very nice part of the Buda side of Budapest tour (together with Buda Castle, Fishermen's Bastion and Old Town Buda).
Stunning. Quite unlike any other church I've been inside. Stunning interior all be it a little tricky trying to find out when one could go in.
Historic church. We went up into the surrounding steeples to view the church. It seems steeples are everywhere. The interior is what you would expect from a church.

Pole position and pointing up to heaven. What an outward appearance especially at night when it is all floodlit. But go inside and gaze in wonder at the awesome interior. Badly damaged in the second world war during the siege of Hungary but thankfully fully restored since so future genearations can appreciate its glorious splendour.
A must visit at Budapest. the church is such a amazing piece of architecture. Is so peaceful yet you can feel a lot of things happened here before.

One of the most beautiful churches in Budapest and not only!. Matthias Church is a marvelously beautiful church by the Fishermen's Bastion that is a fairy tale site itself; We happened to attend the children's gospel choir rehearsal and that was another key reason we did not want to leave the church; Matthias church is beautiful from inside and outside; Rich, colorful, peaceful, with positive aura; An absolute must-see for any true traveler visiting amazing Budapest;
Amazing. Out of all the churches I've seen I think this is my number 2 favorite (after Sagrada Familia). It is the outside that is so amazing to me. Inside is cool too.
Great inside and out. Have to pay to enter, but it is lovely inside. The position is fabulous, the tiled roof lovely, thew whole area well worth visiting - at least half a day needed.

Beautiful church by the castle. This is a wonderful place to visit while in Budapest. It is on the Buda side of the river up by the castle. The church is outstanding both on the inside and outside. Try to attend a program of some kind. They offer concerts, etc. plus the regular services.
Worth the entry fee. Beautiful from the outside - first time we have paid to go inside and it was well worth it. Not too crowded - most tourists seem to stay outside.
Stunning Cathedral. This is a really beautiful cathedral. Definitely worth a visit when you are in Budapest. We didn't get chance to see inside.

A must see!. This building is absolutely stunning inside and out! The gothic architecture and the mosaic Tile roofing was beautiful and every inch of the inside is decorated and painted. A must see!
The surrounding area is beautiful too with the fisherman's battalion and the castle near!
Different architecture and beautiful. The decor was very different from churches in Germany and area. It had a Moorish flavour. Well worth the trip to see it

great synthesis. It is such a great synthesis of the western church and the eastern Turkish mosque. From color, pattern in decoration and some architecture style, the Turkish influence is very apparent.
Beautiful roof tiles!. The roof is absolutely amazing, especially on a sunny day. That was definitely the main attraction of the bastion!
beautifully unusual. One of the prettiest sites we saw in Budapest. It's beautiful unusual colours are well worth seeing.

One of my favorite churches in Eastern Europe. I absolutely loved this church. My wife and I sat on the first pew of the church, nearest the alter. To simply think about the kings who were crowned, the princesses who were married, the princes who were baptized. It is an inspiring place.There was a lot of people (buses of tourists) who seemed to be very disorganized and aimlessly walking around the church. They didn't seem to know what to do, what to look at or where to go. It was a bit distracting, especially if you are trying to pray, meditate or just contemplate the past. I would recommend going early in the morning.

Better viewed from across the river than from inside. If you have time to visit only one church in Budapest, make it St. Stephen's Basilica instead of this one. Mattias Church is gorgeous from outside, well lit at night, makes for a great skyline when seen from across the river. If you are a student of art history or church history, you may like it, but it inside it is modest, muted, not extremely impressing. Do make sure to visit the Fisherman's Bastion outside, though.
Wonderful. We were lucky enough to see a wedding party exiting the church and listened to the bells pealing. The tile roof is amazing as is the rest of the structure. So beautiful at night!

Great architecture in a prime location. The Matthias Church looks now probably better then it ever did in its entire history. It provides a stunning focal point for the entire castle hill and great opportunities for taking some holiday photographs. The Hungarians are maintaining this memorial place of their nation in an immaculate condition, the church looks like it has bee built just yesterday.
Eye catching. The Matthias Church is definitely a center piece of the Castle District. Even on a rainy day it was surrounded by tourists.

Incredible architecture!. Visited outside this church as part of the free budapest tours...it has the most fascinating roof i've ever seen on a church! There were lots of activites happening around the square outside including live music by the restaurant and a fabulous view of the city
Spectacular. Just breath taking. You don't have to be religious to appreciate the beauty of this building. Take time to appreciate the view in the area and try and spot Woody Harrelson ;)

Beautiful. I wish I could have seen Matthias Church at night. The photos of it lit up are simply beautiful. It's very beautiful during the day as well. It's worth paying the small fee for a tour. I was amazed at the walls...the detail is amazing. We didn't go to the tower in this one though. I imagine it has great views.
One of the Best Christmas Markets . Try to go during the winter just for the Christmas Markets. This was one of the Best that I encountered while in Budapest. The church was very pretty too.

Exquisite stained glass windows. You cannot fail to see Matthias church if you are exploring the Castle Hill area of Buda with it's delicate spire and multi-coloured tiled roof. It is well worth paying the small entrance fee to see inside too. It is not the biggest or most ornate church, especially when compared with St Stephen's Basilica in Pest, but has some truly exquisite stained glass windows. We were lucky enough to visit while a choir were practising for a concert that evening and it was captivating.Historically, all monarchs were crowned at Matthias church.Common to other significant buildings in the city, it is beautifully lit up at night and visible from across the river. Well worth a visit.

Fairyland!!. I am a staunch "Budapestholic". On my second visit in May this year I was even more anamoured (if that were possible).This church is stunning by day and stunning by night. It has this beautiful steeple, and a cute little turret, with the most exquisite art work, and the iconic ceramic rooftop. Directly out of fairyland! Pensioners (of any nationality) are allowed reduced price ticket to see the church. Don't miss it. The little terre (square) outside is also wonderful, and during the day there are buskers in the bandstand sort of opening.We came back at night and couldn't stop marvelling at the church and the whole of Castle Hill. The whole location is absolutely beautiful and so atmospheric. Breathtaking views of Budapest lit up so magically! This city has so very much to offer! just go and enjoy!
Got to sing there. My choir was able to sing for Mass and a concert afterward. Great sound. I would say that there are too many patterns to be visually pleasing, but over all a very beautiful place

Beautiful church. We visited the church one evening to listen to a concert. After the concert we had the opportunity to wander around the church and look at the carvings and stained glass windows. Highly recommended.
Beautiful. It's really beautiful from the outside and definitely worth paying the small fee to go inside and see all the features in there as well.

Lovely Day or Night!. This church is wonderful to visit. From the wonderful exterior with its colorful roof, to the beautiful interior, it is terrific. If you are up on the hill in the evening, it is lit beautifully, just as about everything which surrounds it. A must-do in Budapest!
Nice church. Beautiful church- make sure to go upstairs and see the museum. You do have to pay for entrance but it is worth seeing the history.
Surprising polychrome patterns inside. This 19th century church was designed to look medieval. The polychrome patterns inside are magnificent. The view from the gallery upstairs is not to be missed.

wonderful multi colored roof. We visited on a Sunday and services were on so we couldn't get into the church. But from the outside this is a great looking church with a multi colored tile roof. Great views also of Budapest and the Danube

A work of art in a holy place. A work of art in a holy place. The interior is striking and deserves a very slow, deliberate visit.If you plan to take photos, bring a small tripod. The light is very muted making it difficult to take photos.

Large. The main attraction of the castle hill district in my opinion, they have images of what the church looked like back during the war as the soviets used the area for their artillery, amazing how it overall remains original with minor restoration. It was closed from entering when we went however judging but the sure size and hand carved details in the stone and glass on the outside id imagine the inside is just us mezzmorizing

Church. Beautiful Church. It's a Church in the Gothic form. Spires rising to the sky, when standing underneath, it seems to go forever. It was under some renovation, according to locals, there is always something going on.

Worth a visit. This is a beautiful church. They were doing some renovating when we were there but it did not impact the visit. There is a charge to go inside. If you are there, go inside. If you visit at night the outside lighting is striking.

Very beautiful & worth visiting. This church is beautiful on the inside & on the outside. it is highly decorated everywhere & the stained glass windows & paintings are lovely. Buy tickets from the cashier in the kiosk opposite. Ladies with bare shoulders can borrow a shawl at the church entrance.

Beautiful Church. A stunning church located in the Castle District. We bought a ticked allowing us entry, a tour up the tower and onto Fisherman's Bastion. This was definitely worth the money.
The Church is very beautiful and is not to be missed. There are some spectacular views of the city from the top of the tower.

Definitely worth a visit.. Before our trip we read some reviews that suggested this wasn't worth going inside but we were so pleased we ignored those bits of opinion. True it is not a glitzy as St. Stephens but it is still beautiful and captivating in its own way. In my opinion worth the entry fee.

Matthias holds unexpected relics. Church is informally named after King Matthias, who is not actually a saint, but this church is to his honor. Real name of the Church of Our Lady Buda because many believed that the Virgin Mary protected Buda from additional attacks and wars. When St. Stephen was king, he built the original church here, which has been the site of 7 coronations--all depicted on frescoes inside. Priestly vestments worn at the coronations are housed upstairs in the galleries. There is also a relic room that holds a splinter from the cross on which Christ was crucified. Gold leaf detail on all the walls and pillars is breathtaking. Views from the upstairs overlooking the sanctuary and altar are worth the easy climb up the stairs. Wonderful bust sculpture of St. Elisabeth of Hungary on the way up. (Don't sit on the bench on this landing too long though as the docents want you to keep moving.) Outside structure and architectural detail quite majestic.
Fairy-tale splendor. Visited Matthias Church a tour of Budapest. Well worth the visit! Beautiful interior and wonderful views of the city from the plaza.
Beautiful church. Awesome views from around the church. The roof is very cool looking and shines from far away. We did not go inside.

Magnificent Interior. The interior of this church is, simply, stunning. Despite having been built, destroyed, then re-built and destroyed again, and again., it remains a fine example of Central European Church Architecture. The guide book is one of the best that I have ever seen and is very informative, as are several small displays in the upper galleries.

Tower Tour. Didn't want to pay to visit the church & figured the tower tour would have the best views. 200 steps up a narrow stairway. If you are the least claustrophobic or scared of heights avoid this tour. If you aren't - go for this one. About 40 mins. Our 2 guides were excellent- even told us the bus & tram #'s to get back to Pest side. Fantastic views. Highlight of the day!

Matthias church . Nice church. Matthias church . Nice church. Looks even better when lit up at night. But there are similar good hcurches all over Budapest. Try to see the ones in Siafok which is 2 hours south of Budapest by train.

Beautiful and unusual church.. The outside of this church is very pretty, especially with the gorgeous roof. You need to pay to go inside, and if you don't have a Budapest Card it isn't especially cheap, so we had second thoughts about bothering with it. But we were REALLY glad we did, as the inside is just as stunning as the outside. I have never seen a church quite like it, with all the walls painted with stunning designs. It is very colourful. You can also walk upstairs to a little museum, which has some objects on display, and allows you some nice views of the church from higher up. A must-see!

History. Take a tour. We didn't. We saw the church and walked though it but a lot was lost because we were not aware of the history behind the building. I read about it in a brochure later in our hotel room.
Not to miss. This is a must see place to visit and to go into the church and soak up the atmosphere inside it is a spectacular building with such history
Tiled roof. This neo-gothic building is equally beautiful from outside and inside. There is a fee to enter the church.
Matthias Church. Marvelous Church, rich in history great guides available. Very knowledgable. Take your time. Learn as much as possible this is a beautiful site.

Beautiful Church. I adore the colorful roof of this church, i was also able to visit the inside of the church and it was splendid! The altar was very beautiful, it also has gallery that shows the donation from the king and the queen to the church. It was a lovely church and for me it is a must visit when in Budapest

Incredible architecture. Beautiful cathedral. Time your visit to enjoy the indoor tour and the chiming of the bells. You will have lots of company with other tourists, but most are courteous to those taking photos. Absolutely lovely to hear the bells. If you like them stay at the nearby Hilton.

Make sure you go inside. The imposing exterior which is one of the landmarks on the Buda side of the river, is equally interesting inside. Highly decorated, and with informative information throughout.

Matyas Templom. Actually it is an old church but restorated and now it has a cahrming face. There are many tourists all over it. Near the Fisherman's Bastion and Buda Castle by walking. Dont forget your Photog. Machine ;)

Lovely. The fact that it's still a functioning church is awesome! They had coronations, concerts and masses here. The swirly windows in the back are cool and the window displays and the history behind them are amazing and truly beautiful

Lovely exterior. The exterior was lovely and we enjoyed the colorful roof. It was closed when we were in the area, however, so visitors are encouraged to check the times it is open. It was near other attractions so not a large loss to just see the outside. I saw other churches in Budapest with the beautiful roofs also, one right along the river, while I was running the river path.
Spectacular church. Matthias Church (Matyas Templom) is a historical landmark of Budapest. Not to visit this site..is not to have visited the city.
Fantastic Inside and Out. This was one of the loveliest churches we've ever visited. Not too big, but every surface was beautifully covered with details.

Beautiful church. The painting on the walls and ceiling of the church were stunning. There were no masterpiece paintings, but the designs were amazing. I was a little annoyed about the cost instead of just a donation, but understand the reason. The views from the Fisherman Bastion next to the church were lovely.

Fantastic. We came upon this castle in May 2015 at night and the picture depicts the outside as beautiful as it looks. The glowing lights in the night made it seem surreal. We got tickets and if you love churches this is one that delighted me. I have been to Spain and Italy and every church is different and enjoyed the architecture.

Unique!. After viewing many beautiful Churches on our river cruise down the Danube, it was a surprise to see this interior. Our guide was very informative, and the history of this Church is interesting. The interior space is filled with colorful decorative painting. It is a unique experience and one that should be part of your day.

Fascinating. This is one of the most interesting churches we have visited in Europe with its eclectic decoration and design. We spent a long time viewing and interpreting the designs and the stained glass is wonderful. It is well worth climbing to the highest level to look down on the nave below. We attended a splendid concert performed by a string orchestra and were very impressed by the quality of the performance and the atmosphere.

Surprisingly colourful church. As we all know there are tons of churches in this world, but this one is quite special. The baroque style is combined with colourful roof tiles, which gives a nice special effect. Must see! :-)

Stunning view at the top of the tower. The interior is nicely decorated. However, the highlight for me is on the top of the tower which you have to buy an extra ticket to climb almost 200 stairs to the top.

Interesting and Crowded. Liked: Stained glass windows of the saints, the foot relic, the history of the churchDisliked: Very crowded (every tour must come through here it seems,. And women who wear tank tops - be aware that the men at the door may give you a white nylon "shawl" to cover your shoulders -this was not evenly enforced, so it's easy to feel a bit "picked on" but I'm sure they are doing the best they can.

Just another church? Think not!. Ok so you have seen one you have seen them all. Like us on a 5 week trek you can get inundated on churches, but this one is stunning. the work outside and in is magnificent. The stained glass windows and immense gold leaf will leave you wanting more. I highly recommend a quick visit!

See the Outside !. I hate to sound blasé about this beautiful church because it is beautiful but not as opulent as many many many of the other churches in Europe and quite pricey to enter. Gone are the days of being able to enter churches for free. I feel like we could have read about the church and admired the architecture from outside and wouldn't have missed much if we hadn't gone in. I enjoyed St.Stephen's Basilica (Szent Istvan Bazilika) more on the inside. If you are trying to save some money and want to be choosier about which sights you pay for - I would say visit and read about this church from the exterior. If money is abundant, then by all means - visit the whole church.

Stunning!. Both day and night this church stands out on the Buda side, and is very beautiful with a colorful tile roof. This church is a rebuilt version of the original - the original was mostly destroyed in WWII. It's also very pretty lit up at night - nice views from the Danube looking up, or else take the bus (if you are not staying in the castle area) to see it close-up at night.

Beautiful and different again. Make sure you go to the upstairs museum and look at the church interior from the balcony. We were lucky enough to be there for a choir rehearsal which filled the building with wonderful accoustics

Absolutely stunning. The roof and walls of this church are so intricate and stunning - like no other church I have visited. It helped hat it was a sunny day and the bright colours were even more striking. It is close to the Fisherman's Bastion and the public realm works were being improved to make it a lovely pedestrian area. Inside the church is equally impressive, seemingly no space is left unadorned! Would definitely recommend a visit - it was one of my highlights of my holiday.
Church . An amazing Church where do you look up down around so beautiful. The stained glass windows are something to see. A beautiful feeling when you are in there. A must on a visit to Budapest

Excellent site of majolica roof tiles.. Emperor Franz Joseph was crowned king of Hungary here in the 19th century and the lavish neo-Gothic altar was added at the end of 19th and beginning of 20th century

Tribute to the resilience of the Hungarian people. This visit became more than just a look at architecture. It is a testament to how much the Hungarian people have endured: Austrian occupation, Turkish invasion, Communism. Yet they have survived and this church shows all that history. Amazing!
Beautiful interior. We felt peace and tranquility in this church. The exterior roof is beautiful, covered in fire ceramic tile.
Beautiful church in the heart of the castle district. Beautiful building which also hosts very reasonably priced atmospheric concerts (about 1.5 hours duration). Worth a visit.
Fabulous Church. The luxury interior is a feast for the eyes. Be prepared to be amazed. Venue for Coronations it is easy to see why. Small entrance charge but not to be missed.

Don't miss the Interior. Perhaps the most wonderful way to savor the intricate interior decoration of this church is to attend a concert here. Afterwards, enjoying the city lights as you walk down the hill and across the bridge completes a near perfect evening in Budapest.

Beautiful church . This is located on castle hill along with other great sights. We were lucky enough to witness not only the beauty of the church but also the importance of it to today's citizens as there were not one but two weddings taking place the day we visited.

Lots of churches in Budapest - but don't miss this one. If your visit to any foreign city usually includes at least one church or cathedral make sure the Matthias Church is the one you see in Budapest!Set in the heart of the Castle district this beautiful 19th century church is decorated in a unique way - no gold or baroque curls here the walls are covered with gothic stencilled designs. Colour is the key word for this decoration - older parts of the church are displayed too as well as a stained glass chapel for Empress Elisabeth, a small museum and a nice gift shop. Tours of the tower are available for a supplement to the small entrance fee.

A very beautiful and interesting church. It has seldom taken me two hours to visit one church - this time it did. The Matthias church is an intersting architecttual mixture of medival times, national romanticisim and art deco. INside are very many interesting features and details to study and you get to know a lot of the history of Hungary as well. Do not forget to take the stares up and visit the museum as well.

Gorgeaus Church at Buda's Castle Hill. My recommendation is to take one of your days in Budapest to visit the whole Buda's Castle Hill, enjoy the Castle, Fisherman Bastion and of course this beautiful little church that you can alternate with taking some breathtaking pictures of Pest, like most of Budapest's destinations, it is full of historic significance.
WooooooW. Everything in the church is done with detail and that what makes it such na interesting attraction. The visit is well oriented, so you don't need a guided tour.

Impressive, Different. very Impressive in a lively area full of tourists...and the paraphernalia...loved the lemonade stalls around. The Church has a long history, was used for several purposes by soldiers in World War and has been restored superbly. Three highlights, Spire ofcourse, Mathias's Raven and a very impressive roof with colorful design made from exclusive ceramic roof tiles exclusively made locally.

A place of inspiration!. Visited in November 2012. Beautiful church which is free of charge with just a recommended tip to help raising funds in order to preserve it. The ceiling is stunning. There are also music events which I find a nice touch and initiative. The fact that a fee is not charged and that is open to everybody despite people's wallets is great and would visit again. A place of inspiration!

Lots of history to absorb in this handsome Gothic church. This unmissable church with the colourful geometrically-patterned roof is located in a prominent location on Castle Hill, directly facing the Fisherman's Bastion. If traditional accounts are to be believed, the church has a history lasting over a thousand years. But some parts do exist from as early as the 13th century while most of the building dates back to the 14th to 15th centuries. Also known as the Church of Our Lady, it takes its name from King Matthias Corvinus who was responsible for expanding the church and adding the high tower (the self-named Matthias Tower).Inside the church, it seems surprisingly compact. While it doesn't possess the opulence of St Stephen's Basilica across the river, it makes up for this with walls decorated with colourful designs. The main altar has a somewhat Eastern European look, being in the form of a triptych. Other highlights that should not be missed include replicas of the crown and other emblems of Hungarian royalty, the Loreto Chapel whose Madonna statue had a hand in the recapture of Buda from Turkish invaders, and the Pela Chapel which contains the tombs of the 12th-century King Bela III and his second wife, Queen Anne.The church is still an active parish and maintains regular opening hours to visitors, closing at 5.00 pm daily. However, on Sundays, note that it opens to visitors only at 1.00 pm instead of the usual 9.00 am.

Gorgeous looking church. What draws & attracts people to this church is the colourful tiled roof ,up on the castle hill ,it's spire & roof are visible from a distance .when you are at the castle hill after the fisherman's bastion you see it up close .we haven't been inside but one can go & take a look.
worth a visit. Looks impressive from afar, and is certainly an imposing building close up, there are other attractions in the area so plenty to keep you busy

Terrific attraction altogether. The interior of the church is beautiful and well marked. The museum is also well displayed with the artifacts spread out along the galleries. The tower climb was fun. It is well spaced out with several stops to let those who are not fit, rest and catch their breath. The guides are very knowledgeable. The square around the church is also attractive. Toilets are clean but one must pay.

A Most Beautiful Church, Day or Night. Our Viking tour of the city covered this church during the day. Going inside I loved how beautiful it is with the stained glass windows and architectural design. You can also go upstairs to look from the observation deck.Church roof has the most beautiful colored tiles arranged in patterns. Glistening under the sunlight they were stunning.Coming back in the evening, I watched the church lights turn on, bathing it in a beautiful light display. I took so many pictures of this beautiful church day and night.Ensure you check the church's hours if you wish to go inside. Church information - http://visitbudapest.travel/guide/budapest-attractions/matthias-church/

Visit to see those beautiful tiled roofs!. Yet another gorgeous church that is a significant part of the Budapest skyline, on the Buda side. A mere 10 minute walk from the Budapest Palace, it can be visited in conjunction with the Fisherman's bastion. Entrance costs HUF 1400 per adult, and extra to visit the church tower- which, in my opinion, can be skipped. It has uniquely tiled roofs are nothing like I have seen across Europe! Also, don't forget to visit the Ruszwurm Cafe, just a block away from the Church.
Wonderful old church. Well worth a visit,you can also see a small museum and the gift shop had a few nice items too.Not open every day so check opening hours.

Lovely church . A blend of Eastern and Western architecture.. I loved the church. It's near the fisherman's bastion, the place with the best city view.Around the church, there are many cafe shops. It's nice to sit down and relax , enjoy the view, and the people in flux.

Amazing church worth a visit. As part of our tour we stopped at Matthias Church. This one of the most unusual churches we have visited. The interior décor is very different from what you might expect, and the patterns of tile on the roof are fascinating. Most visitors to Buda will go to Castle Hill, and a visit to Matthias Church should be a must.

Simply Stunning Church. A stunning church with impressive ceilings, stain glassed windows, and excellent views all in beautiful golds and yellows. There is an exhibiiton inside and a huge climb down a massive spiral staircase, which I wouldnt want to be running up every day!

A must see. This is a must see during your stay in Budapest. The roof is so unique. Get there early to get great pictures and to enjoy the scenery when its quiet. You have a great view of the river Danube from here.

Beatiful Inside. Awesome church very detailed and beautiful. I saw a mass here and that was special. You can also take a walk up to the top which offers some spectacular views. A must-see in the area.

Amazing Church. Matthias Church (Matyas Templom) With its architecture and mosaics is a must to see.
Highly recommended
BEAUTIFUL CHURCH. Well worth a visit. The church sits in a fairytale style square along with the Fisherman Bastion. It is very unusual inside, with coloured brickwork and beams.

Amazing decor. Thought this church was really pretty and unusual as all of the interior walls are painted with stencilled patterns, the floor is a colourful mosaic and the roof is all different coloured ceramic tiles!
Excellent monument. Great architecture outside, worth to visit its interior. Its roofs made of multicoloured bricks give a multicultural sensation of the monument!

Stunning. Located next to the Hilton; there were always lines, but we opted to attend a Sunday Service and even though the service was in Hungarian, we knew what was happening. It was a morning to remember. The designs in the church are incredible!
Beautiful church. This church is stunning inside and out. We were lucky enough to visit when the choir were singing which only added to the atmosphere. Well worth the entrance fee
Colourful and Inspiring. A beautiful church with every inch of wall painted in ways we can only dream of in Britain, we forget that churches were meant to be mind blowing.
Excellent view. Magnificent church with excellent view towards Danube river. The church is wonderful from outside and also very charming from inside. Not to be missed in Budapest.

A charming church with exquisite lighting at night.... don't miss it..... We visited this church several times while in Budapest..... the guided tour definitely helped us enjoy it..... as with many locations in Budapest it is beautifully lit up at night... don't miss it....

Beautiful Church!. I love visiting churches when traveling in Europe and this one is no exception. Not as large as some but truly beautiful. Worth the visit. Also many good cafes and stores around the church. There is also a great view of Budapest from the wall around the church. Small fee to get it.
Magnificent. So beautiful. Go to the very top to see the inside of the roof and construction. Giant beams held in place for hundreds of years. Quite a photographic church, inside and out

Beautiful church converted from a mosque. The modest entry fee is well worth it. This is arguable the most beautiful church in Budapest. Our original tour didn't include an interior visit, but one of our guides suggested that it would be well worth a special visit. And it was. We visited many baroque and gothic cathedrals during our 21 days in Europe, and this was the best example of gothic architecture (and a gothic conversion from a mosque, no less).

Gob smacking!. You enter into a different world in this glorious church. It is uplifting and mesmerising. And if the organ is playing then you can really believe that there is a superior being who inspires humans!
Magnificent. Truly an amazing church and structure. The detail and history are definitely worth seeing- words cannot say the true splendor.

Visit it!. I think Matthias Church is the most beautiful church in Budapest even if the most beautiful thing of the church is the roof with the particular position of the shingles that you can see outside.
Fantastic roof. What a beautiful church, fantastic. It dominates the skyline looking across from Pest to Buda. Tickets for this are available from the booth outside.

Definitely worth it. Even though we couldn't get in, that was my favourite church in Budapest. We saw it at dusk, and the orange light of sunset was breath-taking. Also, there's plenty of room around the church, so it can be admired (and photographed) from various angles. Enjoy going around it a couple of times.

pastiche at best. of huge cultural significance but architectural and artistic pastiche, over rated, over exploited, don't bother - same applies to all of area, just walk about ignoring the commercial activities, take in the views and restored old streets and then head for National Gallery

Nice Church but Average. It is a nice church, but it is important for Hungarians. Matthias Church is a Roman Catholic church located in Budapest, Hungary, in front of the Fisherman's Bastion at the heart of Buda's Castle District. Interesting but we just spend 30 minutes to visit it.
Beautiful but could not go inside. Beautiful church right next to the Hilton Hotel. We wanted to go inside but it was never open. So it is just part of the beautiful scenery of the quaint area.

BEAUTIFUL. The Matyas Temple with its multi-coloured roof & beautiful colourful interior, columns & pulpit is not to be missed. It is located on the Buda side of the Danube near the Fisherman's Bastion from where you have an excellent view of the Pest side of the city. Close by is the St. Stephens statue and a small flea market. You will be able to spend a leisurely time touring the surrounding old city. This should definitely be on your must visit list.
Fantastic church. We have never come across a church so beautifully decorated as this one. It is over the river on the 'Buda' side in the old castle area. A must see!

Another Jewel of Buda-pest. Its is gorgeous both in and out and has a rich history. It also sits on top of a hill on the Buda side of the Danube that overlooks the spires of the landmarks on the Pest side.

One of Europe's classic churches. This church is a limestone masterpiece on Castle Hill. Disappointed that you can not enter for free (it is a split ticket with Fishermans Bastion), but since the exchange rate is so good, it is a painless price. Museum on the second floor is neat, and the giews are astounding from the top.
Nothing compares to it.. The building is amazing!!!Very differently decorated compared to anything else!!You do need tickets to visit inside.

The things people have done for their faith. I love the Christian heritage of Budapest and of Europe in general. This church is magnificent and ornate. It is indescribable. Kings and bishops are buried here and I was surprised at how open the artifacts are for people to not only get close to but may also touch. Flash photography is not restricted, which I think is a mistake. This church is beautiful and the views from right outside which happens to be the Fisherman's Bastion is magnificent of the Parliament building and of the Pest side.

Beautiful church. Beautiful church with a fascinating history. Really worth going up at night. You might not be able to go into the building, but the roof lit up at night is spectacular and the view over to Pest is not bad either.

Interesting place to go. Matthias church was quite an interesting place to visit. The external architecture is striking, and internally the décor, if that's the right word, suggests a Middle Eastern flavour, although the travel guide description I read says that it's always been a church.

A m a z i n g ! !. I saw that amazing church and all I said was wowowowowow!! Beautiful, increadible building! We took a lots of photos and we sat on a bench for a lot of hour just to stare at it! Unfortunately we went in the afternoon and the church was closed to go inside.

Amazing Church, Amazing History. This Church is just beautiful inside and out. The history behind Matyas Templom is amazing. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matthias_Church In the old days there the entrance used to be free, now they charge. Take in a Mass, and see the inside for free. If you are into Classical music, check out a concert here. Worth the price of admission. The sound is here is phenomenal. The building is beyond beautiful.

Gorgeous. This church was absolutely gorgeous. The detailed designs on the walls and unique stained glass sets it apart from many other "over the top" churches. And the fact that you step out of the church you ha a fantastic vies of the city.

Just gorgeous. The outside of this church is stunning with its beautiful towers and roof but the inside is incredible. Fantastic colours and patterns using the space so well. Was so taken with this visit. Well worth it.

Wow!. This is one of those places that you see and must take photo...then you walk a few steps and even better view of building, then yup around a corner a jaw drops once more. This is not a huge gothic cathedral, it is simply a work of art from every angle.
A lovely visit. One of the places we were taken to on our tour. Lovely but very hilly terrain in Buda. Many churches and cathedrals in Budapest which one should endeavour to see.
Colourful eastern church. If you're a church buff and love visiting places of worship you'll love this one. Plus the info on the side panels is top.

Echo. took part in a concert in this beautiful Church. During dress rehearsal, hundreds of visitors walked through the Church. A 3-4 second echo made singing more difficult. Surroundings unusual and very impressive.
Beautiful inside and out. You want to visit this church when you can enter the church. Watch the hours. While the outside of the church is stunning, so is the inside.
Gorgeous church. Right near Fisherman's Bastion is Matthias Church - a beautiful church, well preserved and worth seeing.
Amazing architecture. If you will pay it a visit you will be impressed by it's beauty and it's late Gothic style. Being located in the Castle District it is easy to access by buses or by foot.

Not to be missed!. Perhaps the most beautiful church we have ever seen! There has been a Church on this site for over a thousand years.
Invaders keep on destroying it and the people keep rebuilding!

More beautiful on the outside than inside. This Roman Catholic Church is located in front of the Fishermans Bastion in the Castle district of Buda. It's location is great. Since the area is elevated over The Pest side it can easily be distinguished from over there. The architecture is baroque and the outside is one of the most beautiful designs I've ever seen. The inside is very nice not really the best part of a visit. While your inside take the time to see the upstairs view. It's well worth it.

Another church! But what a church.... Europe...castles and cathedrals. I guess that's what we're here for, right?This is beautiful, the tile work is gorgeous, and it is very striking. It is also right there in the same square as the Fisherman's Bastion so what the heck, make a day of it. It is lovely.
THe roof is perfect. Didn't get inside but it was a very beautiful building, especially the roof which reminds of a puzzle. In the middle of The Fishermans' Bastion.

Avoid concerts - poor quality and a complete rip off. Beautiful church, I booked a VIP (sic) concert ticket on the internet through the DKN Musical Agency for the ' Duna String Orchestra ' through which cost around £30. When I got to the church I discovered that the seats were not only unreserved but roughly a quarter of the VIP seats had their view obstructed by pillars! The 'orchestra' was in fact a small string ensemble and the playing was substandard to say the least. I left halfway through the 70 minute performance.A complete rip off - shouldn't be allowed in such a beautiful venue

Dont pay to go in!!!. This church looks great on the outside. Very unique. And that is how you should appreciate it. The inside is overrated. All the decorations are painted on and is rather underwhelming. If you've been to the many other churches in Europe this will definitely dissapoint. Especially with such a high entrance fee. St Steven's basilica is free and much much much more impressive inside and out. And it's free too, so there's no reason to go inside Matthias.

So beautiful!!. After enjoying the beautiful exterior and by the time we got to the ticket office, we were told that we only had about 15 minutes left until the closing time. We were offered 1000 forint pp instead of the normal fee of 1200F, so we proceeded thinking that we'd just take a look inside since we might not have another chance to come back. It was definitely worth the visit inside as the interior was just so fabulously decorated. It was quite annoying when the guard wouldn't let us go upstairs even though we still had 5 minutes left saying that we wouldn't be able to tour the museum in that short of time and that they needed to close all the doors in preparation of the closing. We just wanted to go upstairs to take in the whole place but the guard was very adamant. Several visitors, including myself, complained about it but to no avail. It was a big disappointment, but I suppose we should've been more prepared to know their operating hours. However, all in all it was worth a visit even for 10 minutes^^

An Interesting Church. The outside is worth savouring, a feast for the eye. The interior is fussy and usually crowded with tourists but worth an hour of your time if you're up in Buda. There is a reasonable charge and you buy your ticket at a booth on the opposite side of the square, look for the queues. Make sure you go upstairs for the interior view of the fine workmanship, mostly 20th century.
Wow. We love this church such an impressive roof with colourful tiles and a great focal point on the buda hilltop.

A Beautiful church in a must visit area. St. Stephen's is bigger but not more beautiful. Near statue of St. Stephen's and Fishermans' Bastion with it's outstanding views of the Danube and Pest side of the city. Lots of souvenir shopping nearby.

A wonderful church to visit. We have seen this church many times, but each time it is worth buying a ticket and taking in the grand workmanship inside. I would go back every time we are on that part of the Castle Hill. It is just worth seeing again.

A really good experience, a must see church. The Matyas Templom is a must see, it is a fantastic, beatiful, painted interior, a simly must see.
Have been there several times and have followed the restoration of the church during the years.

Another must visit churches in Budapest. This church in old Buda is breathtaking. It has a blend of Christian and Islamic influence and the ceiling and style of the church are amazing. While in the church, make sure you take the full walk through the museum which gives some elevated viewing points of the interior of the church and the surrounding square. By the way, another must-do church is St Stephens on the Pest side of Budapest
in fairyland. the church has a beautiful outer appearance.colourful tiles.absolutely stunning.there is a fee for inside visit which we did not take. but the outside look makes up for it.radha aiyar.

Outstanding. After a river cruise down the Danube and a steady diet of Baroque churches, Matthias Church iis a wonderful change of pace. Majestically sited on the Buda heights, it is as beautiful in the night as in the day. Topped by an extraordinary ceramic roof, it is a highlight of any trip to Budapest. The interior isn't quite as imposing. The lack of a clerestory and the massive amount of stained glass makes the interior a bit dark. But access is free. The historical buildings in the Castle District are compact and easily walked. Access from the Pest side is easy using public transportation.Hint: Look for the crow on the roof.

Breathtaking. One of the most beautiful churches and with one of the most amazing surrounding views. I first walked to the castle and the art museum and then 5 minutes along to here (and the Bastion). Really worth it, though fairly busy (the weather was great though), and then stopped for lunch in a nearby restaurant.
Gorgeous Church, Inside and Out. Beautiful interior, definitely worth a visit! Be sure to check when the church is open before going as it does not have the same hours every day.

Beautiful church. St Matthias's Church is high on a hill in Buda, and can be seen from afar. It has a very attractive profile, with its tall spire. Closer you see the image of the raven, but that's another story! The interior is quite breath-taking. Every square inch is decorated, but in a restrained way with designs and frescos. I also enjoyed the church museum with its display of ecclesiastical garments, and insights into the varied history of this church. At the front of the church is an interesting statue, and nearby a metal model of the church and it's near surrounds. This is a fascinating church to visit.
Pretty church up in the beautiful view. Lovely and relaxing place to spend some time and appreciate the architecture and beautiful views of Budapest! Breathtaking to look at!
Peaceful. Lovely place to visit. Even more spectacular lit up at evening.Admission to church reasonable, student prices available.
Stunning!. This church is well worth the trip up to Buda hill. Not a square centimetre is left undecorated and the museum in the gallery gives brilliant views of the church below.
Beautiful. An amazing piece of architecture in a beautiful part of the city. Do go inside if you can and have a look around. It's not free but it's worth the small fee.

gorgeous and much symbolism. We had hired a tour guide and she was instrumental in explaining all the details of the church and how it was built by the people, not royalty. The nominal entrance fee is well worth it.

Galaxy of incredible colour and design. It's an exceptional church, decorated in extreme way, that leaves not even one centimeter of wall unpainted. The original name is Buda Castle Church of Our Lady. Built in 1242 in Romanesque style, it had several changes throughout the centuries. After 1541 it became a mosque, during the Ottoman occupation. All its treasures went to Pressburg (Bratislava now). A statue of Virgin Mary of 15th c was covered with a wall to be protected. But in 1686 the Mary-wonder happened. During a prayer a gunpowder explosion destroyed the wall and the statue was revealed. Bad omen for the Muslims who left that very day without fighting! This statue is now in the Loreto Chapel. In 19th c. Hungary's king Matthias Corvinus, an art lover, gave his own name to the church and changed the style into a Rennaissance one. He chose this church for both his 2 weddings (his first wife died). But the great restoration happened during 1873-1896. The architect Frigues Schulek put the church in its previous glory, using Neo-Gothic elements. During WWII Matthias Church was badly damaged. Fortunately the son of Schulek made the new restoration following the plans of his father. The colourful diamond shape Zsolnay roof tiles are an inspiration of Schulek too. The frescoes and the stained glass windows were made by historical painters Károly Lotz, Bertalan Székely & Mihály Zichy. There are various chapels. In the Trinity Chapel you find the tombs of King Béla III and Anne de Châtillon.Their remains were brought from Székesfehérvár Cathedral in 1860. The organ was built by the Rieger Kloss factory in the Czech Republic in 1909 from a donation of Emperor Franz Joseph. The wonderful bust of his wife Elisabeth (Sissy) is near the exit. Upstairs it's the Ecclesiastical Art Museum with replicas of the Hungarian regalia but mostly for an uninterrupted view towards the nave. The Church is usually packed with crowds of tourists, so from upstairs you have the chance for better photos and a closer look at thousands of details. Matthias Church belongs to the Unesco Heritage sites since 1987.
Stunning. The outside of the church is stunning. Located next to the Fishermans Bastion. The inside is pretty typical of other churches. Nice area to walk around, and take pictures.

Wonderful place without equal!. Don't be put off by the small entry charge, it is worth every Forint! I have never seen a church interior so completely covered in painted designs. It is like the church is addicted to tattoos! A wonderful place to wander around and just beautiful.
Magnificent, take time to soak in the place. Set in amazing square with great views, peaceful, calm & breathtaking! Definitely worth the climb up the hill!

Nothing like it in the US. The best part of all these historic old cities in Europe is that we do not have anything like it in the US. Everywhere you look it's like it's a scene from a fairytale book. Beautiful city and lovely church. The fountain is very pretty too.
Pretty. We did not go inside the Church but it looks stunning from the outside. It is next to Fishermans Bastion and has great views

A beautiful church. We had a wonderful, self-guided, visit to this beautiful and historic church. It was not crowded on a week-day morning in April. Many interesting shops and restaurants in the area.
Original church. The inside of this church is unique, with reddish colors and illustrations, this is a must see while in Budapest! Well worth the fee you pay to enter this amazing church...

Beautiful coloured tiles on the roof.. A lovely part of Bude to walk round with the church being the centre of attraction. Visible from everywhere in Pest, it's a real landmark to visit. The roof looks amazing with it's coloured tiles.

Beautiful church both inside and out. Well worth going in and paying the admission price if you are walking round Buda, especially for the glorious frescoes and other wall decoration and stained glass windows.
greart area. This is a great area to visit, the roof of this church is mind blowing and look for the raven on the roof - its from the coat of arms

Beautiful inside and outside!. This 1000 year old church is not very big but it is very pretty inside and the roof has wonderful coloured panels. I visited at the beginning of January and there were lots of people during the day but very quiet in the evening. II recommend coming early in the morning to be alone and to take in the view or late at night, when the lights are turned on and it makes for a beautiful sight.It's located right next to the fisherman's bastion and to next to the Hilton.
1000 years of bostory. Can't believe that the church is a 1000 years old. It's been so well maintained and looked after. The architecture and it's interior design are absolutely amazing.
Best Churches ive been to. We attended a wedding in this church and it was magnificent... the atmosphere and the wedding service was beautiful and we loved it.

Perfectly prepared for tourists. In normal church, you can enter into, stay in the main lobby and then leave. In this church, you will pay entry fee, go into it and you will spend there a lot of time. Accessible area of church is quite impressive. They will let you go upstairs and then upper and upper, until you will see the roof from inside and you can open windows and enjoy the view from top of the church. All paintings are very nice and you can see there replicas of crown jewellery and much more.

Spectacular. Sitting up in the Fisherman's Bastion area of Castle Hill this church is a wonderful sight. The bells started ringing when I was there which added a touch of magic to my morning. Unfortunately I was not able to go inside, it looked like a wedding was going on, it was still such a lovely architectural masterpiece to behold. There is a park right across from it which provides such a delightful respite. Take a moment and marvel at all the intricate details of the building. A joy to behold.
Overpriced. Expensive, as are several attractions in this city. Even with the little museum. Should come with a tour.
Great site in Budapest.. Great spot in Budapest, with good architecture that it just adds to the city's beauty.Recommended for everybody.

Nice church. This is a beautiful church no doubt. The exterior is pretty as much of the roof is patterned with coloured tiles.
However, it's nothing extraordinary.

An Amazing Place to Worship or Relax!. Simply an amazing tourist site in one of the most beautiful cities in Europe. The redone roof is simply stunning. I remember this from 32 years ago when Trip Advisor did not exist. Glad I finally got a chance to comment.
nice church. the entrance looks great, but further on this is just an average good looking church, not more ado or say about it

Stretching my legs. This was the Church that had previously been used by the Royalty of Hungary over the past couple of centuries. You can get tickets opposite the entrance when entering the "Castle District". I would advise getting there early as there are many tour coaches that arrive. Like many of the old churches in Budapest it is very ornate inside, you can stand on the balcony where the Royal family would sit for the services. It is worth at least half a day to not only visit the church but the many others buildings that are on the hill, i walked up and got the cable car back down.
Great patchwork design for a roof. Did not venture into the Church - the view from the outside was majestic enough to make up for whatever lay within. Great looking roof!

Beauty Unlike Any Other. Stepping into a church for the first time is a moment to be savoured as years of history, art and beauty flood your senses. Every now and then you step into one that just takes your breath away and you find yourself needing to sit a moment to take it all in. This was my reaction walking into Matthias Church on Castle Hill in Budapest. Every inch deserved exploring and appreciating - I haven't seen one like it yet. If your coming here allow yourself the time to wander :) this is not a site to be just glimpsed...it's one to be explored and absorbed. Enjoy!

Beautiful church, great location. This is my third visit to Budapest and the Matthias church. My memories of previous visits wer. That it was dark and dull inside. Not this time. It was full of light and riotous colour. I think it must have been cleaned. Don't miss the visit to the galleries and the treasures being kept up there. I've neverseen them before and it gavemeanewperspective on the church itself.the highlight of myosin however was a performance on the organ. OfBach's Toccata. It was spine Tingling! Just loved it. According to one of the attendants we were very lucky because normally he only plays for masses. We had literally (I tripped into the pews)and figuratively stumbled onto a free organ recital. Wow!

Spectacular Architecture and City Views. Matthias Church, also referred to as the Coronation Church, sits high up on the hill in Buda's Castle district. The current building apparently dates back to the 14th century with extensive restoration occurring in the late 19th century. It has been the site of several coronations, including that of Charles IV, the last Habsburg king. The church is absolutely beautiful from the outside, and the views from Fisherman's Bastion, right in front of the church, give a beautiful view to the Pest part of Budapest. Not to be missed.

Favourite spot in the city. I loved the church and the area so much that I spent almost a day there just people watching and taking photos. It's so peaceful and the view from the hill is stunning. I enjoyed watchng newly married couples outside the church posing for photos and kissing to the chearing crowd :) A happy place full of love and romance which you must see.

Breath-taking and Expected Inside. We toured Matthias Church with a Viking River Cruise tour guide, and then had free time to explore inside and outside afterwards. The colorful tile roof is spectacular. Don't miss the raven with the golden ring in its mouth above a spire just above where you enter. Inside the painting on the walls and columns looked more "Moorish" than traditional marble or even faux-marble I have seen in many other large Catholic churches and cathedrals. Its spectacular and even more dramatic because of its position on the hill so far above the Danube and the rest of the city.
Beautiful church in a stunning location. Loved this church. Overlooks the Danube and a great view of Parliament. Went back at night and it was even more magical!

Stunning church. The Matthias Church is one of the amazing structures on Castle Hill. The architecture is stunning and the setting makes it even more special. We visited it in late April and the crowds were low.
What a magnificent church.. What a magnificent church. The X terrier of the church and the ceramic tile roof are just breathtaking. And the surrounding grounds and monuments are worth the trip.

Eye catching. This church architecture is stunning, a photo opportunity for sure, however you cna buy a ticket to go inside and on this occasion we opted not to having seen some photo's. Inside is very ornate but nothing compares to the Basilica Church that homes St Stephens 1000 year old hand, its by the Bhuda castle so worth a visit, optional going in. Buses run frequently so a good walk there and a bus trek bakc to Pest.

A church with a different roof. When we first saw the church the roof was so bright and colourful. Inside was quite dark but when we went upstairs we saw it from a different view, again there was lots to see.

Stunning. This Church is incredibly beautiful. Worth buying a ticket to view interior. Heavily painted inside, including stonework - and in a side chapel, a Black Madonna, you understand why the Kings of Hungary were crowned here. Easy access for anyone disabled.

Very ornate. Next door to the Hilton hotel. The exterior is beautifully ornate while the interior walls are almost completely covered in painted decoration. Very impressive for what is basically a parish church.

stunning church. magnificent coloured tiled roofs which can be seen from miles around.highly decorated interior with a large pulpit. lovely stained glass windows.also high level balconies to walk around and where artifacts are on show. well worth a visit.

Tiny details count. This church is a rather unique one, for me the most beautiful parts are the mosaic-like intricate ornaments which create a very homely, warm feeling. Unfortunately you can't enter free, only if you go to a ceremony, but in my opinion it's worth it.

Golden Glory. Even though this is a functioning Catholic church...you have to pay to enter. Buy the tickets at the ticket center to the right of the church. The church is beautiful inside and out. Interestingly, the interior is colorfully adorned with Eastern motifs. There's also a duplicate of the Hungarian crown jewels if you didn't make it inside the Hungarian Parliament building to see the originals.
A unique church...a must see!. This is well worth the ticket for entry. I've seen a lot of churches across Europe and this is one that you will definitely remember.

Great History. This is a historic church, in need of repairs. Some of them are being done. It was founded by St. Steven, who lead Hungary to conversion and was King of the Holy Roman Empire about 1000A.D, Several of the Hapsburg king were coronated here, including the last one, King Charles. Combine with trip to Fisherman's Bastion. Great views.

Tourist groups intrude on worship.. Whilst this church is well worth a visit there were many tourist groups taking a conducted tour with commentary during a church mass which was invasive and offensive. Interesting history and a museum of religious art.

A Must-See While in Budadpest. The historic Matthias Church (Mátyás-templom) is over 700 years old. I love European churches and have seen dozens, this is one of my top 10. It is absolutely gorgeous inside and out.Opening Hours:Mon-Fri: 9.00-17.00Sat: 9.00-12.00Sun: 13.00-17.00Entrance Fees:adult: 750 HUFstudents, pensioners: 500 HUFchildren (up to 6 years of age): freefamily ticket: (1-2 adults +children): 1250 HUF
Beautiful Church. Beautiful church with stunning arts.. We can only enjoy the exterior because dont have enough time to go inside. Must see when you go to Fisherman Bastion.

Colorful polychrome church with unusual details of form and color.. Beautiful church and lovely views from area. Filled with history and unusual designs and patterns. Every surface is filled with color unlike any church we have visited in Europe.

Magnificent church. A must see. This church has a stunning baroque interior, and magnificent stained glass windows. Take your camera for the interior and exterior. Also take the time to enjoy the views down to the river and across to the Pest side of the river

A very beautiful church. The beauty of this church lies for me in its spires and roofscape as it is adorned with multi-coloured tiles that glisten in the sun. It is an historic church worth a short visit to appreciate the interior and that history.
A Catholic Church. Beautiful structure. Imposing relief against the southern Buda skyline from the Danube. Inside is typical church. More modern in design than most, but outside facade quite baroque.

Beautiful Baroque interior.. I was stunned at this beautiful church. It was amazingly preserved and the fact that it is still used today made it come to life for me. The paintings on the walls looks like wall paper but is all hand painted which must have taken years to complete. There are little chapels off of the main church area and you can light a candle for a loved one for 400 HUF. There were a lot of people around but every body was respectful of each other and the church was still a quiet peaceful place in my opinion. Seeing is believing..

Beautiful Restored Church. The church is a mixture of Roman Catholic with walls painted to reflect Ottoman periods. They are just finishing the restoration which has given this church a glorious interior.

Pretty. We happened to visit the church on Easter Sunday and while it was busy it was not overly busy. The doors opened in the early afternoon after mass concluded. The queue was long but moved quickly. A small donation is requested for each guest. The building is very pretty both inside and out. Being in the Castle District and next to Fisherman's Bastion adds to the atmosphere. Take time to enjoy the beauty of the church and the historic and scenic neighborhood.

Very busy with tour groups. Once agin very few signs telling you what to do or where to go - but, purchase a ticket at the booth to the right, avoid the tour groups and make your way in. The church is beautiful, but so busy and full or people that it is hard to sit and reflect on the history. Your ticket also gives you access to the fisher and bastion.
magnifique. if you are visiting Buda Castle, please enter the Church!. it has wonderfully painted columns, statues and paintings.impressive!

This is a more than wow church. The architectural and the design of this is church is impressive. One of the best amongst the churches we have visited. It was a but crowded in April and I could imagine how crowded this becomes in summer. worth the small penny u pay to enter though
Beautiful!. St. Matthias Church has a wonderful history and is breathtakingly beautiful inside and out. Be sure and check out the off-center circular stained glass window.
Great gothic church. Beatiful architectural insides and also outsides,the colours of the tiles and the paintings,amazing.

Exceptional church. Unfortunately the St Mary's door is under restoration, but the church worth to be seen, but you have to have a guide with you as the documentation provided is very mean, if not useless. Good moment, to be seen with the surroundings which are splendid...

AMAZING. Its beautiful outside and infinitely more beautiful on the inside, every inch painted with beautiful designs, definitely an area to go to between this and the Fishermans Baston it is an absolute MUST if you are anywhere near. I was traveling through europe and it was one of my highlights !! There is also a really interesting exhibition upstairs on how they restored all the

There was 5 minutes before the wedding started.... Wow, a church with a difference. The painted walls,ceilings were breathtaking. We only had 5 minutes to look thru the church but we loved what we saw.Why do plump brides like strapless fou fou dresses

Beautiful INside and Out. We really enjoyed this church! It was beautiful on the inside and the outside was beautiful as well. It was well kept around the grounds as well. I was surprised that there was no fee to go up and look down.

''Beautiful''. This church is Breath-taking on both the outside and inside. The tile work is beautiful, I recommend you view this if possible on a sunny day the colours just dance. Well worth the small charge to get in.
Beautiful church. Even our normally reticent teenage boys were impressed by the beautiful painted interior of this church.

The most beautiful church in town. Magnificent renaissance church in the historical Buda Castle district. The roof is covered by the famous Zsolnay porcelain. If you are downtown you can catch the local bus from the Deak square to get there. Bus16 takes you to the church from the heart of the city.

Wonderful, colourful tile-work !. To be honest I didn't get the chance to get in the church, even so, you cannot avoid admiring this unique church with the beautiful, eye-catching tile-work that attracts your attention. I strongly recommend you go there in broad daylight as the colours will show in all splendour (tiles on the outside and stained glass windows in the interior). Thank the architect, Frigyes Schulek, who reconstructed the church and designed/built Fisherman's bastion in for making it possible for us to admire such works of art today.

Wow!. "An another church?" was my thought and it also has a fee. I still decided to check it and my impression was "wow!". If you have been to Neuschwanstein Castle in Germany you notice the art deco fairy-tale style it has. Check for _professional_ pictures for the interior.

Matthias Church: The Church of the Virgin Mary. This church is, by far, one of the most beautiful churches I have ever visited in my worldly travels.In my opinion one of the most striking details of the church is the Matthias tower in the south end of the church. The northern tower is covered with glazed titles and the main western facade faces the Holy Trinity Square. The large Gothic structure is a faithful reconstruction of the rose-window bricked up during the Baroque period. During your visit be sure to observe the outstanding massive organ and the statue of the Madonna in the Loretto Chapel

I would recommend checking opening times too. We were there during the Easter holidays and it was a Saturday when the church was closed. So we only took photos of the exterior which was amazing and beautiful. It was sad we couldn't make it into the church having come a long way from the UK to see it. :(
Check opening times. Every surface inside is painted. This is a nice quick visit if you are up at Buda. Stained glass windows lovely

Spectacular Multicolored Tile Roof on Matthias's ("he was no saint") church. We visited on Easter Sunday, when we were able to enter the crowded landmark of historical interest. We went by it on our city tour on Easter Monday, but entrance was not permitted then unless participating in the service. Beautiful, especially outside, and good to see in different lighting and with the guide's commentary, more attractive close up and during daylight.

Wonderful interior and roof. This church was begun in the 14th century in late Gothic style. The Ottomans used it as a mosque - and during the 1686 siege by the Hapsburgs, an interior wall collapsed revealing a statue of the Madonna to the praying Muslims - who, perhaps seeing this as an omen, surrendered the city of Buda that day....The church was extensively restored in the late 19th Century (1873 - 1896), and the interior was painted - no doubt to represent what a medieval church might have looked like - only this looks much more like Jugendstil/Art Nouveau. It is magnificent! The church was again badly damaged in the fighting in 1945, and has been restored again.Buy your ticket across the square - and if you are an old codger like me, ask for a Senior's reduction!. Look at the magnificent roof tiles first, then go in and be dazzled and amazed.Some of the artwork is Hungarian nationalism, with saints and kings we are less familiar with, but the multichromatic naturistic decoration is truly awe-inspiring. Blew my socks off, and nearly used all the space on my camera memory.

Worth a Visit. The interior is quite pretty, and its history is interesting (including pillars painted over by the Turks when they held the city). The view over the Danube from the property is also fantastic and worth going for.

Fantastic old church in Buda. Lovely Catholic Church originally built in the 1300'sWe were lucky enough to be here for Easter so went to a service which was lovely amazing singing And atmosphere it was packedTourists can pay to go in when it is not open for mass or other services

Magnificent outside, even better inside!. Fantastic renovated church on the Buda side. In fact, the outside walkways were being redone when I was visiting. Spectacular views of the Danube and the entire Pest side, a sight that cannot be missed. Get your tickets outside and to the right of the church before going in. Lots of nice and casual restaurants around, and even an outdoor market with various artisan objects and local foods and clothes.

What a wonderful place to see. The inside of this Church was decorated from top to bottom and it took ages to see all the things on display, tended to get crowded but well worth the visit while in the area
Beautiful. Small but precious place! If you are a fan of Sissi, here you can find a beautiful statue of her! Many good restaurants around it!
Truly Beautiful. One of the most stunning and interesting churches we have been in. The influence of the orient is interesting as are the artefacts on show.

Beautiful church inside and out. The church is a landmark in Budapest and can be seen easily as its high on the buda side. The square/ area it's in is busy with tourists in the day time I think a lot of people stay on the pest side as at night buda seemed quiet.We went in to the church and found the interior to be as beautiful as the exterior. There were some restoration works taking place which meant that you couldn't see everything although these were on a small scale and didn't take much away.At night the church is lit up and looks beautiful. It's really worth wondering around this area at night for the church and the other views. It is quiet though as the pest side has most of the hotels and restaurants.

Beautiful and Peaceful. This church is in the same square as the Fisherman's Bastion. It is definitely a must see if in the area. My children - ages 2 and 3 - were mesmerized with what it had to offer. It was peaceful and intriguing.

Completely Refurbished. Beautifully & lovingly refurbished since the last time I visited. They now allow you to climb the stairs to an upstairs gallery. The entire grounds have been cleaned and restored as well. Don't miss this completely frescoed church!
Well worth a visit. Beautiful - absolutely stunning church. would recommend all visitors go and have a look. Really worth it.

Stunning!!. Without doubt this was the best church we visited with beautiful stained glass. It knocked the socks off the rest including the Basilica; even the roof tiles are amazing!
Well worth a visit but one must buy a ticket at the ticket booth opposite the front entrance first.

The interior was a nice surprise. From the outside it lookes like an ordinary and beautiful church - but the inside is a surprise. The walls and roof are heavily decorated - some are frescos, but a lot is painted patterns in quite an unusual style. Seemed to me a bit maurish. I really liked it a lot even though I wish there had been a bit more information in english about the history of the building.You can climb up a spiral staircase to the gallerie which I found rather fascinating. Upstairs everything seemed quite small and kind of ureal - it reminded me of the castle in Sintra or Neuschwanstein castle... I really do recommend visiting here, even though there's a fee to enter.
Wow. Even better than St Stephens and in a lovely tranquil setting, so colourful inside a beautiful piece of architecture. Then go to Ruszwuum for cake and coffee, perfect!
Must see !. Really beautiful church with colored roof tiles and fine interior decor and painted glass windows. Located within Fisherman's Bastion.

one of the most beautiful churches in the world.. This has to be one of the most beautiful churches in the world and when the renovation of this wonderful looking church is completed will be truely breathtaking. Located in the castle district very close to FISHERMANS BASTION (HALASZBADTYA ),the exterior looks amazing, the very colourful multi coloured roof just look's superb.As you walk inside you are immediately impressed by the jaw dropping use of colour,the massive arches, the high alter which is outstanding,the colourful columns, the stained glass windows and the amazing tiled floor.The stunning use of colour is a masterpiece in itself, you cannot fail to be impressed. A former mosque it was damaged during the siege of Budapest by the Russian attack on the city during WW2.The renovation taking place at the moment will certainly make this one of the best churches in the world,with some of the best view of the river,great for taking fantastic photographs. Opening hour's are; Monday to Friday, 9am till 5pm. Saturday, 9am till 1pm.
