Sunday, 1pm till 5pm Very easy to locate VARBUSZ service from MOSZKVA TER brings you right up here,nice pleasant short journey. This is a must go destination when in Budapest, well worth a visit.

Art Nouveau is stunning.Must visit. One of the highlights of our visit. Go early to avoid the crowds. Great to watch the craftsmen doing maintenance and conservation of the interiors. Art Nouveau is stunning on the pillars vaults and ceiling. Sit down for a while to take it all in.

Lovely. As with so many European churches, the feeling inside is chilly but inspiring. Visually, there are many more impressive churches in Europe, but this church is undergoing restoration. Once it's been returned to its former glory, it should be stunning.
Beautiful church. Close to the Hilton hotel and well worth a visit. Stunning views over the Danube. Beautifully preserved and the paintings inside are stunning.

A LARGISH CHURCH WITH A FULL SIZED SPIRE - AND THE MOST COLORFUL ROOF IN THE CHURCH WORLD.. Not only is the roof orange, green and white, called Diamond Patterned, so too are some of the smaller spires. Then inside I have never seen a church so colorful, color everywhere, columns red, green and orange -- but overall it really works; even the floor tiles. One would be tempted to think that Hungarians like color. The church 'became' a mosque until the Turks were 'ejected' in 1686, -- and a camp for the Germans, - then the Russians, during WW 2; and was also damaged.Presently it is still undergoing a major restoration, commenced in 2006, and like all restorations, it is 'doing' overtime. It should have been completed in 2013. Brian, from Perth W. Australia.

A Mist See. The Matyas Templom is one of Budapest's must see attractions and, besides the castle itself, the greatest highlight of the castle quarter. Its exterior having been recently cleaned, the roof tiles replaced and other works completed, it's a magnificent structure with so much history.

Coat of many colours!. What a surprise awaits inside this amazing Church! It is difficult to spot a surface that is not painted. Unlike other Churches and Cathedrals that use carved and gilded surfaces with acres of polished marble, this one has a more natural beauty.
A Lovely Church. The roof is an amazing design, and the interior is very ornate and so different to British Churches.

You Can't Miss it.. A gorgeous cathedral still under restoration. You get a perspective view if you go up the stairs. Many kings of Hungary have been crowned here, many of whom are buried here too. Renovations are on but a visitor can still enjoy the many beautiful frescoes, the stained glass windows, the gothic triptych of high altar, a multicolor statue of Christ dating back from 18th century. Directions: In the Castle District, next to Fisherman's Bastion. 'Varbusz' service from Moszkva ter metro to Szentharomsag ter or bus #16 from Deak F. ter to Disz ter.Phone: (+36 1) 489-0717
Worth a visit. amazing to look at from the outside and even more stunning inside. There is quite a lot of restoration work going on at the moment but this does not detract too much.

Amazing. Ok so I have been inside many churches in my life. But this one is something else. The Matyas Templom is wonderful in so many ways, so difficult to talk about or even describe it. The colors and the compositions are incredible, seems like they thought through every corner so carefully in a way that it makes you stop and admire for a long precious time. It's wonderful, very impressive. The roof outside, you just can't get over how beautiful it is, and then you go inside and think "wow" so many times that you get even confused. Please go there when you go to Budapest.

Beautiful church! go inside!. The church is beautiful both from outside and inside. it worth buying the ticket and enter. The decoration is very nice, all the way to the ceiling all the walls are fully decorated. The vitrage are simply gorgeous and the stories about the restoration work are fascinating.
Nice Church. Another nice church in the heart of Budapest. Not one of the best buildings we saw over the course of the weekend but worth a walk by all the same.

Colorful Gothic. details are unbelievable, very lovely style, colorful roof, you will love every small detail, the Gothic architecture is clear in this old church which dates to 1300 and king Matyas coronized here and Empress Elisabeth wedding to Franz Jozeph was here also

Great work of the restorers. Matthias Church used to be under restoration for years. Now, when interiors are ready, go there for sure:). Don't miss the museum upstairs, it's included in the price of entry ticket.

Quiet something!. From the outside this place is rather impressive but just wait till you get inside. The church is currently being restored and the colours and patterns are just amazing. There is also a small exhibition upstairs about the restoration project which is worth seeing.

They don't make them like they used to!. Paid to get in, but discounted with the Budapest card. It's currently undergoing refurbishment so one of the side chapels and the 2nd story of the musem wasn't open. However, it is a gorgeous cathedral and I found the restoration going on interesting as I walked past those working on cleaning (with dental tools) the stones, those painting with tiny hair brushes the gold leafing details around the cleaned columns and really saw what pride they took in their work. Be sure to go up the stairs into the balconies. It gives a perspective on just how grand the building is - and a more up close and personal view of some of the gorgeous angels and artwork on the walls.
stunning. Unfortunately on Sunday,we could not get access to go inside,although we could see some people going in.Shame as we would have loved to go inside.IT is stunning from the outside

Beautiful with quite the history. In order to buy tickets, go near the statue and you will see ticket booths. I believe the price is 1,200 for adults and 800 for students.The ornate church has been rebuilt several times during the last 800 years. The most recent restoration was after World War II. Matthias was a popular Renaissance king. Don't miss the Lorento Chapel located in the rear of the church. There is a 1515 statue of Mary and baby Jesus. The Hungarians anticipated the Ottomans looting, so they walled over this statue. When the Ottomans came, they used this church as their mosque. Later, gunpowder detonated and the wall came down showing Mary and baby Jesus which scared the Ottomans.
Spiritual and welcoming. An unusual and beautiful building. Still very much a place of worship. The staff were kind and welcoming. Some very interesting artifacts in the gallery.

The most stunning location in Budapest. This church occupies perhaps the most stunning location in Budapest,being built on the highest point of Castle Hill,and adjacent to Fishermans Bastion.The church is named after the king who built the bell-tower(King Matthias).It is a neo-gothic gem.The inside produces an incredible sense of size and space;and the whole church is awash with colour,from the multi-coloured roof tiles to the myriad of colours inside produced by the amazing stained-glass windows.A truly stunning church,it is now a national shrine of Hungary,containing many national treasures.

Nice!. We have visited a lot of churches in our travels, and this one was just another one. Nothing really stood out except, the colorful and intricate roof tiles. I am not a religious person, so visiting this was a bit pricey -- I think it was about 8 euros per person. If this is your first time in Europe, then you may want to make the special trip, but otherwise I would not go out of my way. My husband, however, enjoyed it more than me as he is an architect.

Beautiful. I didn't go inside but really a stunning building by day and night. Got some fantastic photos. The gothic architecture is really striking as well as the mosaic roof. Well worth making the trip to see.

So Beautiful and Peaceful. I've visited a lot of churches and cathedrals in my travels, but Matyas Templom is easily one of the most beautiful. I really enjoyed looking at the frescoed walls, and was lucky enough to visit early in the morning before the large tour groups swarmed in. For me, it was worth it to climb up to the museum level to read the exhibits on the restoration efforts (there are good English explanations on each card.) It greatly increased my interest and appreciation for the work of the restorers (who were working during my visit.) This is a beautiful and peaceful church, absolutely worth the price of admission.

unusual interior. I was pleased that i saw this as the inside is intricately painted and very pleasing to the eye.I cannot describe it well but it is very decorative and unlike any other church or cathedral that I have been in.It does seem to be a tourist destination more than a church but it feels well loved.
Stunning interior!. Probably one of the most beautiful interiors I've ever seen in a church! The location and the view is also stunning!
stunning. Absolutely beautiful, if you like your architecture then this is a must see. The outside is astonishing but then you walk inside and it's breathtaking.

Medieval History. Extraordinary examples of architecture and Hungarian art abound in this church. Great stories contained within these walls about past royalty, heroes, tragic deaths and surviving religious artifacts. Beautiful statuary (one that even frightened their Ottoman enemies into leaving!) and extraordinary restorations on display in an upper art gallery. Worth the hike!!
Gorgeous Colorful Tiled Roof. I couldn't stop taking photos of this beautiful church. The colorful tiled roof is typically Hungarian and a sight you'll remember for a long time.

Beautiful inside and out. Several reviewers made the mistake of not going into this marvelous church. As lovely as the outside is, the interior is even better. Plan to spend a long time absorbing all the details here.

Stunning.. This church is a must see.
It is absolutely stunning inside with lots of history. Parts of it are being renovated/cleaned at the moment but this does not take away its beauty.
Beautiful structure. The church is nice made with authentic Hungarian architecture.. there are detailed carvings all over... It reminded me of some churches in France which were grand...
Cool. I did not go inside, but really enjoyed looking at it, it has beautiful details and th Hungarian style-roof that I am very fond of. There is also a very nice view of the city from up here.

I couldn't get over how beautiful the roof is!!. I couldn't get over how beautiful the roof is!! It's a stunning building just next to the fishermens bastion. Well worth a visit. The architecture of Budapest is so beautiful and this is a perfect example of this!

An fantastic looking Church. As our hotel was next to the church we could choose when to look round as it was a very busy stop for the tourist buses from early morning till quite late a night. A stunning building.

stunning. The exterior is so beautifully kept, with a distinctive roof and wonderful carving. The interior almost defies description...all I'll say is that every surface is exquisitely painted...discover it yourself!

A royal Church. Worth a visit, don't skip it when visiting Fisherman's Fortress. It was a quite astonishing experience, because of youn students doing restoration of some artistic pieces, and its wonderful museum on high floor.

my favorite church in prague. The word Beautiful can't even begin to describe this church. I spent about an hour and a half there with my family, and we saw three other churches that day. But this was the most colorful and impressive one that day. There are a lot of motorist influences and it use to be a mosque as well. We had a private tour guide that was recommended by Rick steeves. Her name is Andrea and she was fantastic. Told us all of the history of matthias church. Couldn't have seen budapest without her. But definitely make sure you go to this church. You won't be dissapointed.

Beautiful. I have never been to a church that made me feel this in awe but very comfortable as well! Renovation started in 2006 and is continuing. The warmth of the colours and designs painted onto the stone work is simply stunning and really took my breath away. I would not hesitate to go back for longer and can thoroughly recommend anyone to pay the small entrance fee to visit it. One of the biggest highlights from our trip indeed.

I'm not a big church person.... When in Europe, I need to limit myself to one or two churches per visit...not that they aren't all beautiful, but because they all seem to blend into one another after a while. Matthia Church was worthy of my single church visit in Budapest. The Moorish influences, and the stain glassed windows saved during WW II are unique and well worth the visit.

Very nice. We liked it, in spite of crowd around us. I understand that this place is one of tourist attractions of Budapest and that each and every visitor want to see it, but come one people, did anyone enjoyed it at the end. Que in front and behind you, pushing around, my little boy was almost ran over by a group of women wanted to take photos in the mid of Church so they did not see 4-years old boy behind them...poor...shame...

Look at the Roof. I was in Budapest when the roof tiling was being redone. Its is spectacular. This is next to Fisherman's Bastion in the Castle Hill area. So you would visit these all at the same time.
realy as I imagined. I sow the church when I was a little child, but still had a beautifull memory, now the church is cleaned up: splendid!Whenyou are in Buda: you may not miss this!

What can I say? It leaves you speechless.. This is a must see when your exploring the Buda Castle. You do need to get a ticket to get in and hope that there is not a wedding going on when you get there. There are some beautiful restaurants of all price ranges if you want to have lunch or dinner nearby. Take the day and explore the Castle and Buda. Plenty of museums to see and tons of places to walk around.

Beautiful Church!! Stunning Roof!. The outside of this roof is visible all over the town. It is absolutely stunning! The brilliance of the colored tiles is incredible. The inside of the chruch is also very nice. Beautiful stained glasses! Doesn't take very long to walk through and visit! Don't miss this!

Spectacular. This church is fantastic from top to bottom, both inside and outside. Even the roof is interesting. There's stained glass, innumerable carvings, arches galore, an extraordinary pulpit, paintings, Be sure to climb the stairs to visit the small museum with its replicas of Hungary's crown, orb, and scepter.

Vote not for the site . Is it possible to pay a ticket in order to enter this temple?
You don't pay in order to visit the Notre Dame in Paris either the Saint Stephan in Vienna....
Shame on you ....

Stunning Building. Located on the Buda side, we walked to the Church and Fisherman's Bastion after riding the Funicular. The Church is absolutely stunning, it was a shame that we couldn't see inside on the day, but for the view of the church and the view from the walls of the Fisherman's Bastion it was well worth the walk!
View over pest!. The views from the top were fantastic. We sat in a small bar on the walls and watched the lights turn on down in the city below. Well worth the climb up the steps!
Stunning. So beautiful and intresting. Church is amazing! We were not inside but it's worth to see outside too. When you are looking it other side of Danube it's like a fairytale.

Gothic beauty. Stunning building, located on the Buda side. The having a restoration works now on the big part of the cathedral, but you can still see the beauty and the magnificence of the building. The entrance fee is reasonable and they give student discount. Worth a visit!

Stunning. This chuch is simple stunning. From Pest it dominates the skyline like a fairy tale castle. Close up it is wonderful, so detailed, you can sit and look at it for hours. Inside is just as beautiful and so interesting. I like the fact you can visit various levels and look at the church from different viewpoints. The walk over the bridge and up the hill to the church is well worth it. Stunning

St. Matthias--stunningly renovated!. This church, on Caste Hill, was being renovated for what seemed like 8 years. I don't think it really took that long, but the results were worth the wait. The church has been beautifully restored. Definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful. Quite expensive to get in, in comparison to other things. But it is well worth a look. Beautiful inside. Make sure you up the stairs as you leave to see the church from the upper levels, it could be missed as it's not that clearly marked.

Worth a look. Interesting church. Worth a visit but we did not view the museum upstairs. The walls have painted designs rather than mosaics or paintings which was very different to other churches we have seen,
Amazing view. The church is really pretty with its unique design. Moreover you get a spectacular view of the city from the stairs next to it.

One of the most elegant Gothic churches in Europe. This is not the biggest medieval Gothic church in Europe, but definitely one of the most elegant and beautiful ones. The beauty is not given only by the construction itself, but also by the surrounding area with great other historical and architectural attractions, like the monumental statues and the Fisherman's Bastion. Inside, in contrast with the white stones, but in tone with the roof, you will discover a sea of colours from the murals, stained glasses and decorative objects. The entrance fee is a little under 5 Euro per person (with a deductions for students and families with children).If you are passionate about medieval religious buildings you will spend a lot of time finding not that obvious details of the structure and admiring statues and stone sculptures.

Beautiful. We walked up to ithe church on the 2.5hr free walking tour from Deák Ferenc tér. We didn't go inside (no idea whether you can or not) however it's a beautiful church and the roof is fantastic, covered in coloured ceramic tiles. You also get to see some great views back over the Pest side of the Danube. Well worth walking up to it or taking a bus from Buda (number 16 I think from Deák Ferenc tér).
Must see. If you are in Budapest for even just 1 day, you should see this. This is a major component to the city of Budapest. Very beautiful.

Richly decorated slice of history. For a modest fee, you can be privileged to see inside a beautiful church with stunning stained glass and elaborately decorated pillars and walls. There are examples of gothic and neo gothic architecture and if the glittering roof tiles catch your eye and imagination they are bettered by what is inside; chapels, stonework, tombs and, if you are lucky, the sound of music filling the vast space. Entrance fee includes access to exhibitions, incorporating, among other things, a replica of the crown of Hungary which was made in the 1960s when the real crown was being held in America, so the Hungarian people had to make do with this copy of their own history.
Budapest at it's best!. This is the most beautiful place I have been in Budapest!You need to put some effort to climb the stairs, but after the hard work, there is a beautiful view.
worth the time to visit. Not a typical "Big Church", very unique in design and history. We spent more time in this place of worship that we usually do. Absolute treasure of Budapest.
Awesome building. I loved this building - absolutely stunning, with great views across the Danube. I disliked nothing about this part of the city.
Beautiful church. The location of this church at the top of Buda hill is stunning enough but the architecture takes it to another level. Well worth the stroll up from Buda Hill.

WHAT A VISTA!. Forget the buses, shun the taxis and try Shank's pony and use your legs to scale the heights! Cross the Chain Bridge and climb...the views are spectacular and the mulled wine at the summit is divine!Treat yourself!

What a great spot. This church sits high on the Hill on the Buda side of the city. It can be seen from many spots on both sides. The walk up the hill is a challenge but worth it - the building is stunning both outside and inside.Most of the interior painting which is original and would have been much more spectacular when new is everywhere inside - you are left imagining the amount of effort that has gone into this church.Unlike many we were able to wander upstairs where there is a small museum (a few rooms) and a different perspective of the main section of the interior.The restoration of the altar did spoil our visit a little and we were also put off by the cost.The view of the city from the nearby area makes the trip up the hill worthwhile
Nice different church. The interior is as entertaiing as the tiles on the roof. Full pattern painted walls and a gallery high around the inside. Worth to visit inside.
Stunning. Highly decorative, very beautiful and with an upper gallery walkway that contained areas that could not be seen from lower down and museum info - interesting and worth a visit

Magnificient. This church has such a history dating back to the 13th century. It was totally destroyed and rebuilt, damaged again in 1723 and restored in 1723. The roof is covered in multicoloured glazed tiles

Beautiful church. If you visit the Castle in Buda you really must pop along and see this beauty. There is an entry fee but its not expensive and, if of an age, you can ask for the pension rate. There are on-going restoration works to the main alter currently. However, large photo's showing the full glory are hung for you to see.

Make sure to stop in if you are on Castle Hill. We managed to get into the church right before it closed for the day. Very ornately decorated and colorful interior. At night, the photos inside and outside of the church near the Fisherman's Bastion become very dazzling

Nice church. A nice church situated on the Castle hill (Buda side) and next to the Fisherman's bastion. We only had time to see it from outside. The roof is amazing and is all covered by colored ceramic. Amazing!
must see in Buda. gorgeous church, Almost every surface of the interior is painted, walls ,ceilings ,pillars. wonderful historic site
Lovely church. While we were there, there weren't any large queues to get tickets. The church was very peaceful and was a nice place to see.

Very pretty but under refurbishment. Mayas church is very pleasing on the eye, quite small but very intricate. There is an entrance fee and it will not take you long to look around but it was probably just about worth it. While we were there there was quite a lot of internal refurbishment taking place which was a minor distraction but nothing too bad.

The focal point of the district. Matthias Church rises high on the hill overlooking the Danube and the western side of the city (Buda). The church is a very well maintained religious site that has had tremendous amounts of preservation work done to it over the last several years. You must understand that the "State" doesn't pay for these renovations and the small "donation" that you contribute is very meaningful for all that appreciate both inside and outside. All summer long the area around the church is active with plays, many tents with venders, carriage rides, excellent hotels and restaurants. There are very nice shops within walking distance selling antiques, art, and clothing. Visiting this distrct is a great way to spend a morning and a coffee or an evening with a Hungarian vintage and good company.

You need to buy a ticket to enter. Not thrilled by the compulsory entrance fee, but guess church is a business like any other.... If you don't want to pay to go inside, the exterior is still very impressive. The roof tiles in particular are very striking.

A Church which charges visitors money!!!. I was a bit miffed at first but the place was well worth the couple of pounds we paid. The place inside was simply stunning and in fantastic condition. Whilst we were there quite a few students from the fine Arts of the University were there renovating the frescos and windows. Fascinating to watch.

East meets West. Beautiful inside and outside....internal architecture and decoration fuses east and west with spectacular results. Genuinely beautiful church with a very modest entrance fee, with restoration ongoing in one corner inside.
Twas under renovation when we came to visit. Dislike: you have to pay for the ticket to get in. I thought church is for free???The reconstruction of the artifacts were impressive.

Fantastic architecture. Although we did not go in Matthias Church we appreciated its beauty from the outside. This stunning building has the most intriguing details including a brightly coloured tiled roof.. Equally as beautiful in the day as at night.

Mosque then church. old but new !. Special church with long story. go up in 2nd floor to take a panorama of church.amazing Madonna Loretta and story of its Miracle.Nice painting on the walls and some secret on the capitals of the columns.Try to explore carefully this nice church near Fisherman's bastion.Highly recommended.It has entrance fee around 5 euros PP.

Beautiful. Didn't get time to go inside the church this time around, but definitely will next time I'm in the city. It's in a beautiful intriguing setting, and the church itself is gorgeous, with the lovely multi-coloured tiled roof. Very eye catching.
Greatest view. Beautiful church with meaning for the local people. It's a great idea to take a guided tour. The most amazing view for Danube and Pest side from this church!

Gorgeous and heartwarming no matter who you are. Romantic, Ottoman-impact, floral motifs. Unusual how warm and full of heart for a Catolic church, a must see. And the view is stunning. Cafes and restaurants might be too touristy in the Castle district. But everything else is like a fairy tale. Best thing to do is to arrive by bus to one end of the district and have a long walk around, then down on one of the stairways (in front of Fisherman's Bastion for example). Choose late afternoon and watch as the city lights get switched on.

A wonderful church to pray!. This church is a pure example of why Budapest is so breath taking! Its multi-colored ceramic tile roof is so unusual and is something that I don't think I have ever seen before. It is so different from most European Gothic churches. The amazing thing I thought was that you felt that you could actually have time to reflect and think!! A magical experience!

A church that the western meets the eastern. The first thing of Matthias Church impressed me is its multi-colored ceramic tile roof, which is so different from most European Gothic churches. The rich Eastern influence immediately is surround you when you stepped in the interior with Turkish paintings. This beautiful church is really reflected the culture of Budapest. The first church was built in the 13th century and Hungarian kings were crowned here. The Turkish invasion converted the cathedral into the central mosque. The cathedral was liberated in 1686.

Frustrated. I was surprised to see that this church charges for entry! I've been all over the world and have seen great churches (Notre Dame in Paris and Luxembourg, The Vatican, etc.) and I've never had to pay to get in the front door. I decided to pass on going in because of this. I did a quick peek when the priest stopped me and it looked nice, I guess. The outside is beautiful and free at least. It is also part of the Castle Hill area.

Simply mesmerizing . The architecture in Budapest is so breathtaking, it's like an open air museum, everywhere you are you see history, amazing buildings, it's simply breathtaking. A tip: don't go there too late Cuz everything in Budapest closes very early before 6pm.

Nice historical church. One can feel Eastern influence in the interior, really beautiful church. Well worthy visiting. Although not outside of season, there was lot of ongoing construction work and unbearable noise for the organ fine-tuning...
Interesting. This is well worth a visit. There is a lot of interesting history to the place and some beautiful things to see.

Nice interior and amazing exterior. This church is close to Fisherman's Bastion (Halaszbastya).I went there by bus from Szell Kalman (from this station you will need to take stairs to the top road where bus with sign of Buda Castle is put there).The exterior of this church is very good but it is typically the same with other churches in Europe.What make it different is the interior of the church.I never saw that kind of tile in other churches in Europe.It is amazing indeed.

amazing architecture. on the Buda side near the hill overlooking the city, the architecture is incredible and detailed. A great photograph opportunity and surrounded by cafes/ restaurants so can have a pit stop at leisure.

We're biased - we married here in 1987!. A lovely cathedral in what is known locally as 'The Castle" located on the Buda side of the river with the Fishermans Bastion adjacent - you can go up on the cog railway just across from the roundabout in Adam Clark Square before the tunnel or taxi. No private cars are allowed.

an enchanting place. Here some kings and princess were crowned. The medieval building was replaced in the 16th century thanks of the King Matthia Corvinus who decided to enlarge and embellish.At the end of the 19th century the church was restored and transformed in a neo-gothic style.

Impressing Budapest's gem. The Matthias Church is located on top of the Buda hill, adjacent to the Fisherman Bastion; according to legend (no remains exist), it has been built at the beginning of XI century in Romanesque style. Its present late-Gothic style is dated XIV century, but its last restoring is due to Magyar architect Frigyes Schulek and has been performed in the second half of XIX century.Its view from outside is really breath-taking, with its bell tower reaching towards the sky and its multi-colored roof covered by Zsolnay fine ceramic tiles.Access to the church visit costs 1200 Ft per adult (something less than 4.00 Euro); the ticket counter is located just in front of south facade (lateral) entry.Once inside the church, we’ve been amazed by the wonderful interior; it seemed that no one square centimeter of wall has been left unpainted. Fresco paintings, including some masterpieces of Karl Lotz, are alternate to symbolic Turkish paintings (they were denying human images representation), consequence of said people’s 150 years occupation of the Country, during which the church became the main city mosque.Many remarkable gems can be seen at different church positions: the oldest column heads and the adjacent round window with its particular shape, located at the bottom of Béla tower, the Karl Lotz noon bell fresco, the Loreto and St. Imre chapels, the tomb of King Béla III and his wife, the central church hall and the banners, the oratory and the altars at the bottom. Masterpieces that will surely impress any eye.The church was very crowded, as it almost always is, and this was not easing a quiet contemplation of such rich interior décor; nevertheless, the visit left in our soul a deep feeling of admiration for people, even of different religions, that contributed to create such Budapest treasure.

Simply beautiful. The Matyas Templom is one of the best religion architecture I visited. From the outside you can already appreciate its shapes and the very nice walls that face to the Danube. But the surprise is inside. When you see the warm colors of the decorations, mostly in red, with flowers growing to the top where it becomes blue like the sky. A guide showed us around and it was really interesting to know the story behind the church. This is a MUST if you visit Budapest.
Beautiful. Right next to the fisherman´s bastion, this church creates a beautiful backround for great picures. The entire courtyard is a must visit area and a great vantage point for seeing the city.
Unique church. This church is unique in Budapest and reveals an original Hungarian style. I was deeply impressed by it and I would really visit it again if in Budapest. A must-visit in the city !

One of the prettiest cathedrals I've seen. St. Matyas is a unique blend of East meets West--Neo gothic architecture seamlessly blended with Eastern colors and charm. It is well worth the entrance fee, which allows you to wander the church, both upstairs and downstairs.Note: There did not appear to be wheelchair/stroller access to the upper level of the church, which is reached via a typical narrow winding staircase.
Lovely . A piece of art by all means! There's a queue to go inside and a small fee but totally worth it! The architecture is simply magnificent!

Great Concert!. Great concert in a great venue! Purchasing tickets online was stressful and unfruitful, and the poor, freezing girls selling tickets onsite were a bit unorganized, but then again I would be too after standing in freezing temps for an hour.The concert was great and the venue was comfortable and warm. Would definitely recommend.
Beautiful. If you go to budapest, it's a must see church. You do have to pay to go inside but it's only about $5 USD.
Impressive!. WIde, colorful and quiet, despite of the crowd of the last day of the year! ih the late afternoon, the view from the bastions was amazing and very romantic ....

Lovely. we queued for some time to get a ticket to the church (the ticket desk is opposite the churches entrance). It was reasonably priced and worth it. the church interior was almost as lovely as its exterior. right beside fisherman's bastion, so perfect to kill two birds with one stone and visit them both while you're here.

A JEWEL....simply Magnificent! !. I love Budapest...& this architectural+design+art+Treasure Chest of sensory delights left me truly amazed & inspired beyond belief! The creative genius displayed here is TOPS...the mixture of cultural designs is stunning!
Please see photos I posted:)
A beautiful place. Very beautiful and nice piece of the Hungarian history. If you do the walk up to the hill, you may feel exhausted but it's worth! Very nice place.

Beautiful colourful church. Situated in the castle district in front of the fishermans bastion, this is a beautiful church, lovely stained glass windows with an amazing ceiling. A small entrance fee well worth paying.
Beautiful. Gorgeous inside and out this is more than worth the entrance fee. The fishermens bastion outside is also like something from a fairytale.

Take time to absorb the Church & its environment .... A very, very pleasant surprise. Not only is the church, and its interior, beautiful, it is also set in a magical environment, with sweeping, panoramic views across the city. For those on a short stay, I would suggest that this as a 'must see'.
Glorious. You must see for yourself it's brilliance. One of the loveliest most decorated churches I have seen. In a fabulous setting.

Worth a visit. This is a very beautiful church and has an interesting museum, too. Hungarians paint things rather than do mosaics or in-laid marbles. They are quite good at it. Small admission charge. They are working on it, so there is some construction going on.

Amazing. Stunning. I knew right next to it was the fisherman's bastion, but I thought the fb was a building, but really it was a lookout point, like a giant arch you can stand on. The church is 1200 Hungarian for adults, 800 for students. Only took about 30min. But 30min to do the fisherman's as well. You can also fit the Buda castle and chain bridge into one day, no more than that though

Extraordinary interior!. This church was repaired in the early 1900s when Hungary had more resources to spend on monuments and buildings. The interior is very interesting because the painting from the 1900s is in the European Romantic period style and does not really match the exterior and architectural style of the building. It is still worth a visit because it is so different from most cathedrals of the time.
The loveliest church I have ever seen.. St. Matthias Church was the highpoint of my Prague and Budapest trip. It is lovely and full of beautiful art and sculpture without being ornate.

Stunning!. When in Budapest, a visit to Matthias Church is definitely in order. It is incredibly, stunningly ornate. While the venue is worth a visit on its own merits, my husband and I found that getting there was half the fun! From the banks of the Danube in Pest, we strolled across the beautiful Chain Bridge and bought round trip tickets for the funicular. Then walked past the impressive Presidential Palace, did a little bargaining at the quaint local shops, and took a few photos from the Fisherman's Bastion before finally entering the Church. It was a lovely way to spend the afternoon.

Interior paintings exceptional. The church architecture is very good. It is the decorations that make it exceptional. Christian statuary, stained glass, paintings and more. In addition, the Turks added some painted design during their rule. For a mid-sized church, one can spend quite a while here taking it in.

Gorgeous Church! . We ran into the church while touring the Palace and was absolutely amazing! Inside is gorgeous and the outside as well. We went at night, it was the best! Make sure you check it out after dark.
Very nice. If you're in castle district you might as well go into the church, it's very nice inside and there are stairways to explore...
Amazing. The view was gorgeous, the church marvelous, it should be visited by everyone, you will not be disappointed

amazing church. me and my husband visited the Matthias churh at mid december, the church is so beutiful from outside and inside, the admmision price is about 3 euro and the whole enviroment inside is very special, we went there when the christmas decoretions were inside and the church was more beutiful.
Beautiful--outside & inside. The tiled roof is amazing--especially if it's a sunny day. The inside is also beautifully and artfully restored. A must see
Beautiful. This king and his Italian wife led Hungarian to renaissance.the marvelous church is a symbol of modern art of that time embedded into the medieval tradition

The most beautiful church in Budapest. Some poeple prefer the Basilica in Pest, but this Church is definitely better, both on the inside and on the outside. Maybe the location helps a lot too...but it's worth a visit! Amazing architecture!
Recently renovated, just beautiful. The church has been fully restored just recently. Amazing inside and outside, with quite remarkable roof tiles, also visible from Pest.
Another old world beautiful church. It was beautiful although we only saw the outside. The architecture was old world and it is built on top of a hill overlooking Pesh. lots of photo ops
Wonderful. The Matthias church is in an area with good views and atmosphere. Fishermen's Bastion is also there which provides a brilliant view of the parliament.

A beautiful church inside and out.. Just a relatively small for access to this lovely church. Well worth the money beautiful architecture in these modern times perhaps a headphone tour such as you get in some churches would be helpful. Having said that allowing of importance have English explanations.
Amazing church. This ancient church is a riot of colours and carving. It is a must if you are in the Castle district of Budapest..

beautifull!. the church isn't huge but absolutly beautiful (inside and outside). you have to pay a small fee (worth it). the decorations of the church are magnificent and colorful, and if you can't find time to see the parlament you can see a replica of the crown jewels in the church. absolutly amazing.
Interesting. Small church, but in a great area. Worth going in while in the area but would not make detour for it.

Stunning!. We visited this church on a cool, but clear and sunny day in mid December and the brightly colored ceramic tile roof seemed to glow. The church has been destroyed and rebuilt a number of times over the 800 plus years since it was founded. The latest renovation took place in the late 19th century and was later restored after WW II. The exterior is gothic, but much of what is seen outside including the steeple were added for the 1896 celebrations (Hungary's 1,000 birthday). There is a fee for entering the church, but since this is Budapest's best church and photos are allowed, it was worthwhile. The interior is wallpapered with the history of different eras represented by a number of symbolic motifs. The beautiful stained glass windows are 170 years old and were removed and hidden during WW II to protect them from destruction. Truly an inspiring site to behold.
Gorgeous remodeled Church. Originally built in 1255 but extensively rebuilt after being ravaged in the Budapest liberation from the Turks in 1686. Beautiful sculptures and architecture.
What a cool place!. Amazing so cool!! loved walking around in this historical location. Feel like you have walked back in time. So beautiful!!!

Obligatory. Difficult to add to previous comments, other than to say if you have gone to Castle Hill (as all Budapest visitors should) then you should not miss this, a most wonderful piece of decorated architecture well worth the small admission fee. We were reminded of the Arts & Crafts style of ornamentation, incredibly detailed and painstakingly finished. Stairs take you up to a gallery presenting superb views of the church - no restrictions on photography. Well worth a visit.

Stunning place . This is s most beautiful church, quite different from any other I have visited. The walls are painted with the most beautiful frescos. And every spare inch of space on the walls and columns has been decorated. Also magnificent stained glass windows. Of great interest is a copy of the State Crown which has a fascinating history. Visit if you're on Castle Hill.

Spiritual and more. We were fortunate enough to attend high mass at St. Matthias. This is a beautiful physical building inside & out, spectacularly high on Castle Hill overlooking Budapest and the Danube. The music provided by a cantor, choir & orchestra plus organ are sublime. Even if you do not understand Hungarian, the service is moving. It is well worth the two hours to be still to experience & share this with someone you love.There is not a fee to attend services but one to tour the church. If you are not attending a service 45 minutes is probably sufficient.

Resemblance of Blue mosque. Beautiful church with painting that surprisingly resembles Blue Mosque in Istanbul. Over it's long history, this church was, indeed a mosque for some time, maybe that's why the decor is so unsusual for a catholic church.Very well organised inside, it is possible to get the information about the most important part of the church, as well as its history. Also, possible to get a guided tour.

Lovely visit. Called in here whilst visiting Budapest. Calming and peaceful. Well worth a visit. Spend some time just sitting and being open to your thoughts. If you like architecture etc you will also like this place
A must see!!. We went here as part of our city tour. The building is really beautiful and view is amazing. I suggest you go here if you ever in Budapest as it's one of the city's gems!!
Grand and Majestic. This church is so grand, leaves you in an awe with all its majesty. Comes out great in pictures and is a must see place.

Loved this church.. Matthias Church was on our Viking Cruise tour and was a highlight of the day. The ceramic tiled room is unbelievable. The architecture and building materials all complement each other. The statue of St. Matthias in the plaza outside is very impressive. Loved this church.
Beautiful. It is such a beautiful building and when you go inside the peace and tranquillity just hits you and the opulence just dazzles you a must go place too visit
Amazing. What a gem of a Church. Enjoyed a visit here and lots of history attached to it. Beautiful from outside too and lovely view of it from the Pest side of river.
Restoration. Restoration continues but a tremendous solace, so much detail undertaken it's a real presence. Just about toe too touristy and packed to really enjoy as a spiritual visit.

Beautiful Architecture. This church looks like it has poped out of fairy tales. You must see it at night under spot lights. I could only see it from outside. Me and my wife took our after wedding photos around this church. If you visit Budapest come and see this lovely church. It is on the Buda side of the city.

Fabulous church. The interior and exterior of this church is magnificient. The roof is built with multi colored tiles which really adds so much interesting detail to this elegant structure. The doors are beautiful with interesting carvings. There is a fee that is charged to see the interior which is very worth doing.

Decorated to within an inch!. Fully restored, this little church is well worth a visit - it has a fabulous interior, with motifs and decorations and paintings. Almost psychedelic! You do have to pay to go in (tickets from the booth opposite) but well worth it. Take time to read the info - English translations everywhere.

Simply Stunning. This Church is simply beautiful both inside and out and must NOT be missed. The outside has been recently renovated and some work is still going on inside but the overall beauty just has to be seen

Beautiful Church, Amazing View. Although Matthias Church itself is a remarkable piece of history its settings is even more impressive. You visit the Castle Hill (where it is located) and get one of the best view in Europe (if not the entire World).

Wow!! Wicked Good, too!. The interior of this Church is fabulous. Every inch is covered with awesome and unusual motifs some of which are actually Escher-like. I think I took about 100 pictures inside. There is an admission for this church but it is well worth it! An artistic treasure! Don't miss it!

Stunning church. Matthias Church sits on the top of Castle Hill right next to Fisherman's Bastion (also worth a visit).The church is stunning from the outside and the roof and steeple are very ornately decorated and carved.Admittance to the church is quite pricey and must be paid if you want to look around inside. However, even without going inside it is still a very attractive piece of architecture to see.

my fave church. I think that this is by far the most beautiful church in town and it is definitely worth a visit. Take your time with this one and hopefully, if you go in towards the end, it won't be that crowded and you can enjoy the silence and the interior.

So ornate it's almost oppressive!. From outside it is a very elegant building with a magnificent roof but go inside and every inch of plaster is covered in rich colours and decorations and the space seems to close in on you.
Beautiful 14th century Gothic church. Beautiful architecture, to bad there's no option of climbing the stairs to the top of the tower. The entry fee is 4 euros and tickets can be bought at the spot.

Beautiful church, worth a visit!. The church and the Buda area in which it is located are both incredibly beautiful. Do make sure you look up the hours the church is open because they vary and although the outside is wonderful, the inside of the church should not be missed!
Beautiful House of Worship. The interior of this church is incredible. The altar, the walls, the stain glass windows, the memorial/crypt for the rulers - all are breathtakingly beautiful.

Pretty Church. Worth a visit.. This church sits on Castle Hill and is worth a visit even though the entrance fee is pretty steep. . You will need to buy tickets to get inside. Look for the ticket booth across the courtyard from the church.
The interior is pretty standard for European churches but not as ornate as some of the bigger ones.

Definitely worth it!. This is a beautiful setting with fabulous views. BRING MONEY!!!
You will need to buy tickets to get into the church but it's an important piece of history for the area. Don't go in July or August OR BE PREPARED FOR LOTS OF TOURISTS !!! $$ for restrooms

Very unique. One of the most unusual, unique and beautiful churches I've ever seen. The interior boasts wonderful murals and stained glass but the majority of decoration is more geometric in style and pattern. I can't figure out if it is more Baroque, Gothic or Romanesque in style as there are certainly elements of all present. They are still actively restoring some areas, so that got a little noisy, but you can climb a set of stairs up to the gallery and take in the perspective from that location. Sometimes I would love to hear even piped in choir music in these venues because you just know the acoustics will be wonderful.
The Church of Our Lady. After the big renovation it's beautifuler as ever before. Monumental and wonderful church in the heart of the Castle district.

Simply Stunning. We arrived at our hotel and headed out to explore the immediate surroundings. The Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church were our first ports of call. It was dark and they were both beautifully illuminated and hardly anyone around. The church is really amazing from the outside and a small queue had formed outside the main door so we decided to investigate. Turns out there was a music recital about to start so we paid our 9800HUF and got to see the inside as well. If possible this is even more spectacular than the exterior. Sitting and listening to Bach's toccata and fugue on the church organ was a wonderful experience as was the rest of the programme which included opera as well as a string orchestra and the aforementioned organ.This church is worthy of a visit in it's own right but if you get the opportunity to go to one of the recitals we eould encourage you to do so. An experience neither of us will foget

A fabulous piece of architecture. We had a unique experience when we came to this amazing church. The architecture, inside and outside, is just fabulous. Outside, the main architectural style is gothic; inside there is an eclectic mixture of styles, from a type of romanesque, through gothic to some baroque. But what truly impresses are the amazing painted surfaces throughout, from the walls to right over the ceilings. Apart from the central nave, take time to look at the beautiful side chapels. This building has played a central part in Hungary's history, including as a place for the coronation of the country's sovereigns. As other visitors have noted, the little souvenir shop sells a range of items that you won't find elsewhere.

Stunning and beautiful church. Officially, this is known as the Church of Our Lady. It has a long and interesting history dating back to the 1200s. The walls of the interior are painted with unique patterns. The style is Baroque.There are some relics inside the church, such as the Matthias chalice and a replica of the Hungarian royal crown. The exterior of the church is just as stunning as the interior. Check out the amazing tile work that makes up the roof.

Extraordinary. I'm not usually a big fan of churches, but Matthias Church is on another level. It has recently been restored and looks fantastic, both inside and out. The museum is also excellent and informative given the limited space. The souvenir shop too offers a lot of things you don't find in the regular shops in the city - including real roof tiles from the church pre-restoration.It costs just 1200ft (£3, €4), which is undoubtedly value for money.

Unique Architecture. one of the nicest architectures i've seen in Churches.
beautiful from the inside and outside.
i really recommend it... + there are discounts for students.
Dor

the most amazing church I have ever seen. this church has a magical atmosphere, all the walls and ceilings are painted in harmonious geometrical patterns, it is a delight for the eye and the spirit. a visit to Matthias church is a must

Worth visiting.. Would have loved to make it up the steps to the museum. Beautiful church. Souvenir shop is nice too, and usually something I tend to avoid. Left with a few things, and staff were prepared for my question about the raven! Nice touch :)

Well worth a visit. This is a beautiful church next to the Fishermans Bastion. Two for One! When we visited (Nov 14) the piazza of the church was being relaid. You pay to get in the church. The Ruszwurm Cafe is close by.

Mathias Templom Budavar - Budapest. This is one of the 'must see's when visiting Budapest. The church is beautiful new Gothic in style and for me as a Budapest girl a bit 'touristy'. It was restored after the II WW and it is truly majestic. To get there, you need to take a bus or a taxi.There is always something to look at inside apart from the frescoes. If you are lucky, you will hear organ music and at Christmas time you can buy tickets for special evening concerts.It is an absolute must see. Approximately half an hour bus trip from the Chain Bridge Pest side.

Worth!. Matthias Church (Mátyás-templom) or in Budavár Coronation Church) is a church located in Budapest Trinity Square, in front of Buda Castle Fishermen's Bastion sector. It owes its name to the fact that this wedding took place the Hungarian king Matthias Corvinus. According to church tradition, it was originally built in Romanesque style in 1015. Matthias Church is one of the most important churches of Budapest. Many of the Hungarian kings were crowned here and the church is important and location of graves of ecclesiastical treasures. The present building is accomplished late Gothic in the second half of XIV century and was restored in the late nineteenth century.A place full of history and where you want to stay as long as possible.Entrance to the church or the museum, is the fee. When I visited it, the square in front of the Church was rebuilt. Definitely worth visiting!

A MUST VISIT IN BUDAPEST. A must visit if you go to Budapest. They have put so much hard work, time and money to get the church restored. Beautiful church and even with lots of guided tours, enough space to look around and see the exhibits.

Beautiful Church is the Castle Hill District. Matthias Church was located right next door to the Hilton Hotel where we spent two days, so we walked by it several times, and it continued to amaze. The roof looks more like a mosaic pattern and gives the building character that is different from the dozens of cathedrals/churches we saw in Europe. The inside is beautiful also. It is also located in front of Fisherman's Bastion which a great place from which to view the city of Budapest including the Danube River which separates the city.
Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful church. Also has a excellent exhibition of their conservation work upstairs making the entrance fee feel very worthwhile.
Perfect building. You have to pay for entrance but it is worth it. Interior looks great. And when weather is good, you can take excellent pictures (to support your memories).

Location, location, location.... The church is beautiful! Stunning roof tiles, steeples, architectural details, and more reward your eye and vie for your camera. The views outside a panoramic if you are lucky with the weather as we were. Take time to leisurely stroll through the area and into the shops. Great way to spend a morning!
Wonderful Architecture. Walk around this building so that you see everything from every angle. The entire area is picturesque.
Fairies land. my daugther refers to this as the fairies reign, we were at the hilton castle and we could see this from the hotel window, amazing! also stepping into is just great place to visit

Perched on a hillside. This beautiful building draws you in from afar. If you have never seen this in other cities like Vienna, you wonder how the roof is made, as it looks very unusual and colourful.I won't spoil it for you. It is best to approach it with fascination and be rewarded by the sight of it close-up.If you have difficulties with steps, you can take a bus up, they come every few minutes.Visiting it at night gives it a special atmosphere. You will have a wonderful view all round.

Beautiful Building and Stunning Views. This was my most favourite building in Budapest. The roof of the churhc was simply stunning. There are several view points from here over the City with lovely little cafes and restaurants to stop for a drink and food and take in these magnificient views. Would highly recommend.

Beautiful stenciled walls. Very impressive from the outside (take time to notice the tilework on the roof which is beautiful) but even better on the inside. Most of the church has been reconstructed with great care. The stencil work is fantastic. Take your time, visit every corner as there are a number of unique views perspectives. Don't miss the second floor gallery with views of the sanctuary as well as information on the most recent reconstruction. While there, check out the views of Pest from the Fisherman's Bastion. Not the best for young children (they'll be easily bored) and tough for those with difficulty walking.

Unique church. The church is quite different from the others in Budapest. I didn't have time to visit the inside, but if it is anything like the outside then it would also be impressive. It is right next to fisherman's bastion and the whole area is a must visit.

Beautiful, take a tour. We had a private tour with a lovely gal who worked for the Church. Made a big difference in understanding history, and she took us through the whole church. Buy tickets at the booth outside the church, it was across the street when we were there in Oct, because they were redoing the pavement outside. We were there during a school outing, so at first it was noisy (around 10:30-11am) but when the kids left, it was lovely and quiet. Beautiful inside and out, leave some time to just sit in the back and relax. So many beautiful details, worth a slow visit of maybe 1.5 hours. Nice items in gift shop.

A gem. For this church you need to take your time . After the first overall view to take in the ambience and architecture one needs to look at almost every corner, column ,nook, windows and most of all the ceilings of this church. The decorative painting is exquisite.

Impressive building. I didn't visit the inside of the church as we did not have time to do so on our walking tour. However I was able to have a good look at the outside which was very impressive. The combination of different architectural styles makes Matthias Church a must see.

Architecturally different. We did not go inside the church, but the outside is quite impressive. The roof in particular was something quite unique and really adds to the character of the building. Right next to the Fishermans Bastille so worth a visit.

Stunning. This is one of the most beautiful churches that I've seen, from the multi-coloured roof to the ornate carvings and paint on the interior. The church is not as large as you might think but if you go up to the 2nd level inside, you'll have a great view of the whole interior. It's a lovely building and worth visiting. When we visited, it was on a weekday and there was no line-up to visit. Inside, it wasn't crowded so there was opportunity to sit in a pew and just marvel at the workmanship that went into the building of this church. Spectacular!

The most beautiful church in Budapest. Gorgeous and unique, it stands tall on Buda Castle hill, combining Hungarian taste with Gothic classic style. The most unique thing about it, to my mind, was the unique and colourful roofing. Inside, the same motif continues. Make sure to get upstairs to the balcony, where you can properly admire the huge and ornate space.Also, note that the tickets are not sold at the entrance to the church itself, but at a nearby dedicated window.Also, make sure to visit the Fisherman's Bastion, which is just beside the church for a better view of the river facade, as well as of the river and Pest bank.

Extraordinary. Didn't have a chance to enter the church as there was something going on. From outside, the church didn't look like the other Roman Catholic churches. Motif of the roofing was so different with the diamond shaped roof tiles. Yet, it look so attractive.
A real delight. Quite the most beautiful church in Budapest. From the ceramic roof tiles, the gothic splendour of the steeple to the painted interior, a real delight. Well worth a visit.

Painted carnival. Every inch of every service sings with colour. My guidebook was somewhat disparaging but it is a lovely contrast to the sobriety of St Stephen's. Don't miss out on climbing the steps to the gallery to look down and across the nave and to stand opposite the angels.

A church not to be missed. I was on a hop off hop on bus and they were not going to let us go inside because it cost. I skipped out and went in anyway. What a fabulous church with wonderful stained glass windows. A group started to sing as I entered. It is a church worth exploring.

An Uplifting Experience. Many people have reviewed this church and I agree that its architecture is stunning. The external roof tiles were made by the Zsolnai factory in Pecs (which you must visit if you travel south). However, this is one of the few large churches/cathedrals I've visited that has a sense of being designed and built for people to use, rather than simply "show off" the wealth of the times. Although it's huge inside, there is something intimate about the colours and the traditional motives used that gives you a sense of comfort and peacefulness. It's awesome and really worth spending the money and time.

It's a little bit Gaudi. The architecture here is a little bit like Gaudi in Barcelona. What ever it is it is beautiful. A lovely place to visit and see these wonders. The Hop ON Hop Off Bus red route will take you near to here.

a beautiful building especially at night. Well worth the trip up the hill to see this beautiful church. We stayed nearby and walked by it each time we left the hotel but I never failed to be awestruck. The castle area feels like you have stepped back in time to mediaeval Hungary and in my opinion is the best part of the city by far!

Romantic architecture. The church is located within the Castle Hill, and I think that it's very romantic. Next to it you can find the Fisherman's Bastion with some of the most beautiful views of the Danube. A must see!

Breathtaking architecture. The church is located on the Castle Hill, on the main square. The architecture is breathtaking, with a great deal of attention to details. Don't miss the interior if possible, since we were not able to go inside.

Beautiful from the outside . The building is beautiful with an unusual tiled roof. It was closed to visitors on both the Saturday and Sunday on the weekend I was there. Seemed a bit strange to close a major attraction without a good explanation on a busy weekend. There might have been a good reason but the people on the entrance just said it was closed.

Well worth a visit. No trip to Budapest is complete without a visit to castle hill in Buda. We took the funicular to the hill and went first to the palace. By the time we were done with it, we were getting late for our next attraction and I was not too keen to walk nearly a kilometer to reach the church. I am glad my daughter prevailed on me, otherwise we would have missed something wonderful.The first thing that catches one's eye is the colorful roof with a basket-weave pattern. The interior, however, was even better. It was very colorful, yet the colors harmonized well with each other to create a soothing atmosphere. Despite our hurry to go to the next stop we lingered there for well over half an hour exploring the iconography.
amazing. make sure you see the inside of this interesting church...wish we had had a guide for it....not open on Sundays except for Mass

Historical and romantic. As we live in Budapest and we can go to the chuch whenever we want it's not so interesting for us, but for the foreign people I would recommend to visit as it's really close to the Fisherman's Bastille and to the Castle as well.

Beautiful Restoration. With so many beautiful churches and cathedrals to visit throughout Europe, it was nice to visit one that was not covered with staging and hidden behind tarps. Matthias church has been beautifully restored and is actually completed. The outside stonework has been nicely restored and inside the church is beautiful. We had an excellent tour who was very knowledgeable about all aspects of the church. This was one of the best churches I visited during my month long visit to Europe. definitely worth a visit

Beautiful Church. The outside of the church is lovely with the tiled roof. I thought I would just pop in for a quick look of the church. Once I stepped in, I was awestruck by the colors and ornate stencils covering every inch of the ceiling, arches and walls. Ended up staying for about an hour. I noticed that many people did not see the stairway up to the second level, and they certainly missed out. The stairway is hidden and marked as museum entrance. The second level has great views over the lower level of the church and information and photographs on the restoration of the church. As people mentioned, the church is not open late, so be sure to plan accordingly.

Good blend of beauty and architecture. It stands apart on the hill full of many historic monuments.The church is beautifully carved and its colourful tiles on the roof adds to its beauty. Just sat on the Szentharomsag Square and admired this church, it just awesome.

Lovely . Well worth the entrance fee (1200 huf each) and the hike up the hill. It is beautiful inside. Forget the Bastion though, it is classed as a folly as it has no purpose and really not worth the extra money to walk 100m 15 feet above the street.

Wonderful place. This is maybe the most beautiful place I've seen in Budapest and the one I remember most when looking back to my trip. And as I was told, Matthias Church is the favorite church of Budapesters. The church is very, very beautiful. You'd better save some time for it, in order to have an hour or maybe two just to sit there in peace and beauty. It's not hard to achieve as it wasn't crowded even in July. A must see.
Interesting and Historic. This is a beautiful church in a stunning location. While quite interesting inside, it is really the outside and the location that are most impressive.

Beautiful Church. Its a beautiful church and one of the many landmark buildings on the Buda hill in the Castle district. There is an entry fee to go in but its totally worth it as the interiors are done up very nicely.The other facade of the Church is quite impressive and ornately done as well. There are a number of concerts that happen at the church and they worth going to as well if you have the time and are interested in music of that kind.I would definitely recommend visiting the church when you are in the city.
Very Ornate Interior & Next to Fisherman's Bastion. Beautiful church, lights up great at night, next to another great attraction. Doesn’t stay open very late, check schedule.

Stunningly beautiful church.. The cost was around £3 to go in and well worth the money. The renovations were only completed in 2010 and it is very ornate. The little museum at the top shows how they stencilled the patterns back on to the renovated walls. It has beautiful stain glass windows. Regular classical music concerts are held in the evenings and although I wasn't able to attend I am sure it would have been wonderful. If churches aren't your thing it's magnificent from the outside too.

Beautiful architecture. We went here our first night in Budapest. We did not go in, but wow, it is worth it anyway. The outside renovation has just been completed, and it is beautiful. They light the church up so nicely at night too. On top of that, the church sits atop a hill, so the view down to Pest is amazing. You must go to this area of town and see. Lots of history!

Gothic church used for coronations of the Kings of Hungary. This church with its multi-coloured roof and spire sits next to Buda Castle. It is dark and eerie inside but evokes a true sense of history. It has recently been spruced up. Quite interesting - but not a must-see from the inside anyway

Stunning. What a wonderful church. You have to pay to go in, but well worth it. The inside is painted in such wonderful designs. The outside has the most amazing roof. If you like visiting churches then this one is very special.

Exquisite architecture, worth a visit, but high alert area for pickpockets due to all the tourists. Definitely worth the fee to go in this fabulous structure that recently had a gorgeous facelift! Be extremely aware of pickpockets in the area around the church and especially on Fisherman's Bastion where everyone is staring at the view and not paying attention to whom is next to them!!

Impressive. Although not a great fan of churches, I would not miss this one while in Budapest. It is well worth the visit, especially together with the Fisherman's Bastion located just next to it, from where there is a stunning view over the city.

Stunning!. It was a church, then became a mosque, and finally back to a church. The architecture was just stunning. It was not far from Royal Palace. The first impression I got was that if the top of the church were more rounded, it would have looked like those you could find in Russia. Worth your time to look around. Recommended!
beautiful. In a fabulous location close to the fishers bastion in the castle district, intricately designed and well lit at nighy. Often host to concerts. Well worth a visit.
Magnificent church. This is a spectacular church next to fisherman's bastion on the Buda side of the city. It is well worth the time to visit.

Beautiful church which is well worth seeing.. On a previous visit to the Buda side of Budapest we had hoped to see inside Matthias church, but it was being renovated and was not open. So it was good, on this trip, to be able to go in. It was well worth the 1200 HUFs entrance fee. The church is beautifully decorated and painted so ornately. It was also interesting to see how some of its features had been renovated.Got some great photos.

Magnificent 19th century cathedral, where East meets West.. We spent well over an hour inside this magnificent structure, with its mixed architectural styles from the West and the East. It’s worth a climb up the stairs to have a look at the displays depicting the renovation process and a closer look at the ornate ceiling and columns supporting the roof. It $20 million to restore the place, with its huge stained glass windows and tiled roof. Parts of the church—named because King Matthias married here in 1474—date back 500 years. But much of the church was built in the 19th century. That does not make it any less impressive, and we spent quite a bit of time here, admiring the paintings by Roman artists and taking photographs of the inside and outside. It was tough to take a photo of the entire building without wide-angled lenses, but we gave it an effort. This is worth a trip up the hill to see!

Beautiful but.... This church is absolutely beautiful, an amazing building in a stunning location, a true icon of Budapest. We decided to go there for a service, in fact the Sunday 10 am Mass. You would think that they did not want anyone to come, for having eventually ascertained the Mass times (which were certainly not displayed), we found that access to the Church was via a tiny 'door within a door' through which the occasional old lady would disappear like out of a scene from Harry Potter. On approaching this tiny door, we gingerly turned the handle and discovered a man in a suit, who greeted us with the words "Can I help you?" Luckily he could, and once we had explained we wanted to go the Mass, we were allowed in. Inside the church is as beautiful as you would expect, and an unseen choir produced some lovely music, but then again, it might have just been a tape recorder. The Liturgy was, to be kind, not half as inspiring as the building itself, there was no discernible attempt to welcome visitors, and we were not invited to hall afterwards for coffee, tea, or anything. Although the collection was diligently taken, the same diligence was not extended to providing the words for the songs - which explained why no one seemed to be singing very much. In fact, the only advantage in coming to Mass here rather than to the friendly parish church opposite our hotel was that we got to see inside for free. However, once we saw how high the entry fee was, we realised it had been an hour well spent!

Awesome Church beautifully appointed. Well Situated. THis church, located in an unbelievably beautiful venue high on the hills overlooks the entire city. This was chosen as a highly defensible position by founders and probably because it was closer to heaven. The church has amazing stain glass throughout and other golden riches abound including a lot of statuary. This is a major tour bus attraction but we took a taxi here and one back and it is a lot easier. There are guided tours in multiple languages as well as rest toom facilities and a large gift shop for those who need remebrances of this special spot.
A lovely church in the Buda part. The design of this church is impressive. Beautiful decor inside . Felt very peaceful . One of the places to visit on the Buda side .

Simply stunning. I've visited many churches and cathedrals over the years but this one, when I went inside, gave me a 'wow' moment. Stunning decor including exquisite painting. Gothic with touches of nouveau made it something special. It was rather crowded when I was there but I managed to get some nice photos.The roof, outside, has some lovely majolica tiles which are most unusual but which add to the beauty of the building. And the views from the area are brilliant looking over the city.One of my highlights during my visit to Budapest.
Interior was very attractive. When we entered inside was very colorful , and to admire the persons who made it . Everything was historical & beautiful , great to have memories of mutthias church

Subdued Grandeur. The gothic Church of St. Matthias at the Buda Castle Hill is the epitome of elegance. There are no baby angels (obnoxious or not), no baroque excrescences, no out-of-proportion statues, no histrionics at all. Instead of frescoes and lunettes and framed paintings, pastel mythological, historical, and evangelical art nouveau wall paintings cover a large portion of the nave. Every inch of the church pillars and buttresses has been delicately painted with earth-tone Moorish flowery arabesques sometimes in the shape of animals. This was not the first time we have encountered the Moorish decorative style. These designs are also lavishly displayed in the Hungarian Parliament and the Great Synagogue in Budapest.At the Budapest St. Matthias Cathedral, the tasteful art nouveau and Moorish décor are a counterpoint to the richly embossed stained-glass windows with representations of saints, Hungarian heroes, coats of arms, and arabesques. Because we came late in the afternoon on a cloudy day, the stained-glass windows gleamed but didn’t glare, an optimum time for photo pics. On the right side of the altar piece curved around the evocative statue of the Virgin Mary are openings that allow part of a stained-glass window to glow through them, one of many subtly resplendent touches in this cathedral.Nothing is out of place at St. Matthias; everything is where it ought to be. Oops! we forgot. There is one item that we strongly feel detracts from the lambent ambience of the church. A moderately large round nondescript light fixture poorly serves as the only chandelier in the cathedral. It looks like it belongs in a warehouse more than in a house of worship as tastefully outfitted as the St. Matthias Cathedral.
very beautiful. we liked it very much. the entrance fee is around 3/4 euro which is acceptable.recommended during trip to Budapest.

Take some time to visit the inside as well as photographing the outside!. I agree with a number of reviewers that the restoration work could have been undertaken a little more sympathetically. However, this does not spoil the end product which is an array of fabulous stenciling, murals and stained glass.If you have time, it is worth spending the 1200 HF.

Impressing church. The church is very impressing because it has a different architectural design, it's somewhat Gothic and it's for sure unforgettable. I was quite charmed by it although we did not enter to visit inside, I'm sure it would have been nice but we didn't have the time, next time we will do it for sure.

Restorations & replicas . Lovely church but as a lover of art and history i was greatly dissappointed with the array of replicas ( many of which were poorly made) and what they defined as restorations. They completley repainted the entire church! Yes its a lovely design but its obvious its not the original work. They even showcase the stencils they used in the museum..I have to admit was felt like a disney castle...not worth paying to see.

Unforgettable never to be missed site. I don't have words to express my feeling when I saw the Church glowing in the evening sun rays... I just couldn't stop clicking my camera.. Located on the hill top with a clear view of the sky..hmm it is breathtaking.. We were so fortunate to get this view late in the evening since we were staying in Hilton.. The roof tiles are so colourful..Must not miss the Eagle with the ring. A must see place. Oh the watch tower next to it is as attractive as the church
Impresive. Matthias Church is located inside the Buda Castle.With its colourful roof is easy to spot. Its architectural design worth a look.

Spectacularly Colorful, A Church Unlike All Others!. The exterior... colorful amazing tiled patterns. But the inside is even MORE beautiful and colorful!! Most photos of this church on the internet DO NOT do it justice because of the interior lighting turns all the photos amber/golden. So I posted one with my review that shows the multi-colored interior, with amazingly painted patterns on EVERY surface in EVERY color. You will see polka-dots and hearts and stripes and art-nouveau and deco, all with an almost Byzantine style. Your eyes won't know where to look first. Every alcove and grotto and altar are different! Even the floor is beautiful! Super charming and lovely, with nooks and crannies to explore. We spent over and hour JUST LOOKING and EXPLORING. Rivals the artistry of the beautiful Sainte Chapelle in Paris. DO NOT MISS the interior of this masterpiece!

Wonderfully decorated inside and out.. This church and the immediate surrounding area has been recently renovated and it all gleams in the sunshine. The church interior is highly decorated but they are not frescoes. Models of the crown jewels are displayed and there is an opportunity to climb more stairs for a good view.

Great location with a beautiful terraced area overlooking the Danube and the city. Our Sofitel Doorman recommended this visit and we are thankful to him. It was indeed something worth absorbing at our own pace. Beautiful surroundings, the church was not crowded with hordes of tourists. Walk up from the Chain Bridge to absorb the beauty of the setting.
